analyzed: vahni sva rūpa mātrasya prāk eva siddha tvāt  parvata saṃbandhi tvena asiddha tvāt tad rūpeṇa vahniḥ sādhyate iti ced tarhi yathā parvata
translated: Because the mere form of fire is already established.

original: saṃbandhitvena vahniḥ sādhyaḥ tathā parvatopyagnisaṃbandhitvena sādhya eva svarūpamātrasiddhāvapi
analyzed: saṃbandhi tvena vahniḥ sādhyaḥ tathā parvataḥ api agni saṃbandhi tvena sādhyaḥ eva svarūpa mātra siddhau api
translated: If it is argued that fire is established in the form of being related to the mountain because it is not established by itself, then just as fire is to be established as related to the mountain, so the mountain is also to be established as related to fire, even though its mere form is established,

analyzed: viśiṣṭa siddheḥ ubhayatra samāna tvāt
translated: because the establishment of the qualified is the same in both cases.

original: nanu nyāyamate sarakārisaṃpattirūpatvaṃ pakṣatālakṣaṇasaṃbhavatītyata āha tvanmata iti//
analyzed: nanu nyāya mate sara kāri saṃpatti rūpa tvam pakṣatā lakṣaṇa saṃbhavati iti atas āha tvad mate iti
translated: Now, in the Nyaya view, the definition of the subject as consisting of the presence of the property to be established is not possible. Therefore, it is said 'in your view'.

analyzed: uktam iti
translated: 'It has been said'

analyzed: pūrva bhaṅge
translated: in the previous section.

original: tathāca tava matepi pakṣatāyā na sahakāritvamiti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: tathāca tava mate pi pakṣatāyāḥ na sahakāri tvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, even in your view, the subject is not a contributory factor. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nanu evam iti
translated: 'If it is so'

analyzed: anumiti sahakāri saṃpatteḥ pakṣatā tve sati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: when there is the presence of the auxiliary factor of inference.🔽The word 'rūpa' is not a co-operative factor, because it is not a co-operative factor.

original: rūpapadaṃ na ga /ṭa /rā / /nā sahakāritvātga /ṭa /rā / /tehiga /rā / /siddhiṃ prati pratibandhikā ka /ga /ṭa /rā /
analyzed: rūpa padam na gaṭarā nā sahakāri tvāt gaṭarā tehigarā siddhim prati pratibandhikā kagaṭarā
translated: It is an impediment to the establishment of the substratum of that which is to be established.

analyzed: sva tepa laṇam
translated: The author's own view

analyzed: pakṣatā vādaḥ
translated: The theory of pakṣatā (the property of being a logical subject)

analyzed: kā atra katham tā
translated: What is the purpose here?

original: liṅgaparāmarśasya pakṣadharmatāviṣayakatvaṃ hi na svapūrvakāle svakāle ca vidyamānā yā pakṣatā tadāśraye vyāpyavatvaviṣayakatvam/
analyzed: liṅga parāmarśasya pakṣa dharmatā viṣayaka tvam hi na sva pūrva kāle sva kāle ca vidyamānā yā pakṣatā tad āśraye vyāpyavatva viṣayaka tvam
translated: For the inferential cognition to have the property of the subject as its object, it is not dependent on the pakṣatā that exists either before itself or at the same time as itself.🔽Rather, it is dependent on the pakṣatā that exists at the same time as itself.

original: kiṃ tu svakāle vastugatyā vidyamānā yā pakṣatā tadaśraye vyāpyavatvaviṣayakatvam/🔽liṅgaparāmarśakāle ca pakṣatāstyeva/
analyzed: kim tu sva kāle vastu gatyā vidyamānā yā pakṣatā tad āśraye vyāpyavatva viṣayaka tvam  liṅga parāmarśa kāle ca pakṣatā asti eva
translated: And at the time of the inferential cognition, pakṣatā does exist.

analyzed: pakṣatā jñānam tu tvad mate pi na anumiti hetuḥ iti kā atra anupapattiḥ  sapakṣa vipakṣau api ukta sahakāri saṃpatti daśāyām pakṣau eva
translated: But even according to your view, the knowledge of pakṣatā is not the cause of inference. So what is the inconsistency here?🔽In the state of the presence of the mentioned auxiliary factors, even the similar and dissimilar instances are the same as the subject.

analyzed: tad asaṃpatti daśāyām pakṣaḥ upi apakṣaḥ eva
translated: In the state of the absence of those, even the subject is not a subject.

analyzed: na hi pakṣa tvam jātiḥ
translated: For pakṣatā is not a universal.

original: etadevābhipretya mithyātvānumānakhaṇḍanaṭīkāyāṃsādhyadharmaviśiṣṭaḥ pakṣaiti mūlavyākhyāvasareyatpratītirliṅgena janayitavyā sa sādhyadharmaityuktam/
analyzed: etat eva abhipretya mithyātva anumāna khaṇḍana ṭīkāyām sādhya dharma viśiṣṭaḥ pakṣaḥ iti mūla vyākhyā avasarā iyat pratītiḥ liṅgena janayitavyā sa sādhya dharmaḥ iti uktam
translated: With this very idea, in the commentary on the refutation of inference of falsity, at the time of explaining the root text The subject qualified by the probandum, it is said That which is to be produced by the inferential mark, that is the probandum.

original: kathaṃ pakṣadharmatāviṣayaka iti/🔽pakṣatādhikaraṇavṛttiryo dharmaḥ ta dviṣayakatvasya pakṣadharmatāviṣayakatvena pakṣatāyāḥ parāmarśakālatāvaśyaṃ bhāvāditi bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: katham pakṣa dharmatā viṣayakaḥ iti  pakṣatā adhikaraṇa vṛttiḥ yaḥ dharmaḥ ta  dviṣayaka tvasya pakṣa dharmatā viṣayaka tvena pakṣatāyāḥ parāmarśa kālatā avaśyam bhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: How is it that it has the subject property as its object?🔽The meaning is that the presence of the property that exists in the locus of the subject is necessarily the time of the reflective awareness of the subject, because of having the subject property as its object.

original: nanvevaṃ pakṣatāyāḥ parāmarśakālīnatvena parāmarśasya tadaviṣayakatvāttasya caramakālatvena
analyzed: nanu evam pakṣatāyāḥ parāmarśa kālīna tvena parāmarśasya tad aviṣayaka tvāt tasya carama kāla tvena
translated: If it is so, then since the subject property is of the time of the reflective awareness, the reflective awareness does not have it as its object, and since that is of the last time,

analyzed: tad anantaram pakṣatā jñānasya aśakya śaṅka tvāt pakṣatā jñānam na hetuḥ iti syat iti atas āha
translated: after that, the knowledge of the subject property cannot be suspected, so the knowledge of the subject property would not be the reason. To this he says

analyzed: pakṣa tā jñānam tu iti
translated: But the knowledge of the subject property, etc.

analyzed: tvad mate pi iti
translated: Even according to your view, etc.

analyzed: na kevalam mad mataḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not only according to my view.

analyzed: pratibandhaka abhāva rūpa tvāt pratibandhaka abhāvasya ca svarūpa sataḥ eva hetu tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the absence of obstruction is of the nature of the absence of obstruction, and the absence of obstruction is the cause only as it exists in its own form.

original: nanvevaṃ sapakṣādāvapi kadāciduktasahakārisaṃpatteḥ saṃbhavātpakṣepi kadācittadasaṃbhavādativyāptyavyāptī syātāmityata āha sapakṣeti//
analyzed: nanu evam sapakṣa ādau api kadācid ukta sahakāri saṃpatteḥ saṃbhavāt pakṣe api kadācid tad asaṃbhavāt ativyāpti avyāptī syātām iti atas āha sapakṣa iti
translated: But it might be argued that in that case, since the presence of the requisite auxiliaries is possible in the similar instance also at some time, and since their absence is possible in the subject also at some time, there would be over-extension and non-extension. To this he says in the similar instance etc.🔽Thus. The mark. The great. The truth. The nature.

original: t/ ittham/ liṅga ga /rā / /tatvaviṭa /ṭha / /yaddharmatāviṭa / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ
analyzed: t ittham liṅga
translated: The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: sudhāyām api vastutas tu anumiti viṣayaḥ pakṣaḥ iti uktam
translated: In the Sudhā also, it is said that the subject is indeed the object of inference.

original: tatra hi tavyapratyayena viṣayaśabdena coktasahakārisaṃpattirūpānumitiviṣayatva yogyataivābhipretā//
analyzed: tatra hi tavya pratyayena viṣaya śabdena ca ukta sahakāri saṃpatti rūpa anumiti viṣaya tva yogyatā eva abhipretā
translated: There, by the tavy affix and by the word 'viṣaya' (object), only the fitness for being the object of inference in the form of the presence of the requisite auxiliaries is intended.

analyzed: yat vā grantha dvayoḥ api vyāpakavatvena anumiti viṣayatvam pakṣatvam
translated: Or, in both texts, being the object of inference by way of being the possessor of the pervader is intended as being the subject.

original: vyāpakavatvena viśeṣaṇe na tadanumitiviṣayorapi vyāpake vyāpakatāvacchedakādau ca nātivyāptiḥ/
analyzed: vyāpakavat tvena viśeṣaṇe na tad anumiti viṣayoḥ api vyāpake vyāpaka tā avacchedaka ādau ca na ativyāptiḥ
translated: By qualifying by way of being the possessor of the pervader, there is no over-extension even to the pervader which is the object of that inference, and to the differentia of the pervader etc.

analyzed: asmin ca pakṣe liṅga parāmarśa daśāyām api
translated: And in this view, even in the stage of the inferential cognition of the mark,

analyzed: na pakṣatā kim tu anumiti daśāyām eva
translated: there is no subject-ness, but only in the stage of inference.

original: tvanmatepyanumitidaśāyāṃ siddhivirahagarbhitā pakṣatā nāstyeva/🔽asminpakṣe liṅgaparāmarśasya pakṣadharmatāviṣayakatvaṃ tu svajanyaphalasamānakālīnapakṣatāśraye vyāpyavatvaviṣayakatvam// 🔽sādhyalakṣaṇe dhīpadena pramiteravivakṣitatvādvipakṣasyāpi grahaṇaṃ kṛtam/🔽sudhāyāmapīti//
analyzed: tvad mate pi anumiti daśāyām siddhi viraha garbhitā pakṣatā na asti eva  asmin pakṣe liṅga parāmarśasya pakṣa dharmatā viṣayaka tvam tu sva janya phala samāna kālīna pakṣatā āśraye vyāpyavatva viṣayaka tvam  sādhya lakṣaṇe dhī padena pramiteḥ avivakṣita tvāt vipakṣasya api grahaṇam kṛtam  sudhāyām api iti
translated: Even according to your view, in the state of inference, the pakṣatā which is pregnant with the absence of siddhi does not exist at all.

original: bhaktipāde sādhyāsiddheradoṣatvoktiprastāve sudhāyāmityarthaḥ/🔽svoktaṃ mūlārūḍhatayā darśayati tatra hīti//🔽udāhṛtavākyadvaye hītyarthaḥ/🔽saṃpattirūpā yogyataivetyanvayaḥ/🔽yogyatāpakṣamāśrityaikaṃ pakṣamuktvā phalopadhānamāśritya lakṣaṇāntaramāha yadveti//🔽nanūktapakṣadvaye kadācideva pakṣatā prāptā na tu parāmarśātpūrvaṃ paścāccetyatastvanmatepi tathaiva pratyutāvaśyakānumitivelāyāmeva nāstītyāha
analyzed: bhakti pāde sādhya asiddheḥ adoṣa tva ukti prastāve sudhāyām iti arthaḥ 🔽sva uktam mūla ārūḍha tayā darśayati tatra hi iti 🔽udāhṛta vākya dvaye hi iti arthaḥ 🔽saṃpatti rūpā yogyatā eva iti anvayaḥ 🔽yogyatā pakṣam āśritya ekam pakṣam uktvā phala upadhānam āśritya lakṣaṇa antaram āha yat vā iti 🔽nanu ukta pakṣa dvaye kadācid eva pakṣatā prāptā na tu parāmarśāt pūrvam paścāt ca iti atas tvad mate pi tathā eva pratyuta āvaśyaka anumiti velāyām eva na asti iti āha
translated: In this view, the subject-predicate relation of the inferential mark is the object of the subject-predicate relation, which is the object of the subject-predicate relation of the the

analyzed: sarvadā pakṣatā sattva prakāram āha kecid tu iti
translated: Some people say that the presence of pakṣatā is of two kinds.

analyzed: ya ka tvegarāḥ ṇa ā t anugarāḥ yepyaka yevya āgarā
translated: The first is the presence of the property of being the subject of inference, and the second is the presence of the property of being the subject of non-perception.

analyzed: sva tepa lakṣaṇ
translated: The definition of pakṣatā is given as follows:

analyzed: pakṣatā vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of pakṣatā.

analyzed: kecid tu granthaye pi anumiti viṣaya tva yogyatā eva pakṣatā abhipretā
translated: Some people think that pakṣatā is the fitness to be the object of inference.

original: yogyatā ca samānādhikaraṇāpramātvenābhimatā yā sādhyābhāvaviṣayā dhīstadabhāvaḥ/
analyzed: yogyatā ca samāna adhikaraṇa apramā tvena abhimatā yā sādhya abhāva viṣayā dhīḥ tad abhāvaḥ
translated: And fitness is the absence of the cognition of the absence of the probandum, which is considered to be a valid cognition having the same substratum.

original: evaṃ ca jagatyakṣaṇikatvavā dini vyadhikaraṇāyāṃ pramātvenābhimatāyāṃ kṣiṇikatva
analyzed: evam ca jagati akṣaṇika tva vā dini vyadhikaraṇāyām pramā tvena abhimatāyām
translated: Thus, even when there is a non-momentary cognition in the world, which is considered to be a valid cognition having a different substratum from the momentary cognition,

analyzed: vādini ca samāna adhikaraṇāyām pramā tvena anabhimatāyām pratyakṣāyām akṣaṇika tva pramāyām
translated: and even when there is a perception of non-momentary cognition having the same substratum as the momentary cognition, which is not considered to be a valid cognition,

original: ca satyāmapi kṣaṇika vādinaḥ kṣaṇikatvānumāne jagataḥ pakṣatā yuktā /
analyzed: ca satyām api kṣaṇika vādinaḥ kṣaṇika tva anumāne jagataḥ pakṣa tā yuktā
translated: the pakṣatā of the world in the inference of momentariness by the proponent of momentariness is proper.

analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇa iti
translated: Having the same substratum means

analyzed: yatra anumiti utpāda ras tad adhikaraṇa vṛttiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: existing in the same substratum as that in which the production of inference takes place.
The meaning is the absence of the cognition of the probandum having the same substratum as the one considered to be a valid cognition.

analyzed: buddhi abhāvaḥ iti ukte saṃbhavaḥ
translated: When the absence of cognition is stated, it is impossible.

analyzed: abhāva buddhi abhāvaḥ iti akta ipi saḥ eva doṣaḥ
translated: Even if it is said that the absence of the cognition of non-existence, the same fault arises.

original: ba satvāt/🔽pramārūpetyuktau vādiprativādiniṣṭhaparasparasādhyābhāvabuddheḥ pramārūpatvaniyamābhāvena tādṛśabuddhau satyāmapi pakṣatā syātsā mābhūdityabhimatetyuktam/
analyzed: ba sa tvāt  pramā rūpā iti uktau vādi prativādi niṣṭha paraspara sādhya abhāva buddheḥ pramā rūpa tva niyama abhāvena tādṛśa buddhau satyām api pakṣatā syāt sā mā bhūt iti abhimatā iti uktam
translated: Because of existence.🔽When it is said to be of the form of valid knowledge, since there is no rule that the cognition of the absence of what is to be established by the proponent and the opponent is of the form of valid knowledge, even when there is such a cognition, there would be the property of being the subject. To avoid that, it is said to be intended.

analyzed: pramā tvena abhimata tādṛśa buddhi abhāvaḥ iti ukte pi vyadhikaraṇa puruṣa antara prativādi buddhim ādāya asaṃbhavaḥ eva iti samāna adhikaraṇa ityādi sarvam arthavat
translated: Even if it is said that there is an absence of such a cognition intended to be of the form of valid knowledge, there is still impossibility by taking the cognition of another person, the opponent, as the locus. Therefore, all of it, starting from having the same locus, etc., is meaningful.
With regard to the definition of the property of being the subject in the case of an inference for the sake of another, he shows it as being based on the object to be defined.

analyzed: evam ca iti
translated: If it is like this (means).

original: kṣaṇikavādinaḥ yatsattatkṣaṇikaṃ yathā dīpādi saccedaṃ jagadityeva rūpakṣaṇikatvānumāne jagataḥ pakṣatāyuktetyanvayaḥ/
analyzed: kṣaṇika vādinaḥ yat sat tat kṣaṇikam yathā dīpa ādi sat ca idam jagat iti eva rūpa kṣaṇikatva anumāne jagataḥ pakṣatā yuktā iti anvayaḥ
translated: The one who advocates momentariness infers the momentariness of the world in the form what exists is momentary, like a lamp, etc., and this world exists, and the world has the property of being the subject. This is the forward-reasoning.

analyzed: pratyabhijñā rūpā jagati akṣaṇika tva dhīḥ tāvat kṣaṇika vādinaḥ kṣaṇika vādinaḥ ca asti
translated: The cognition of the non-momentariness of the world, which is in the form of recognition, exists for both the one who advocates momentariness and the one who advocates non-momentariness.

analyzed: tatra kṣaṇika vādinaḥ pramā tvena anabhimatā
translated: Among them, for the one who advocates momentariness, it is not intended to be of the form of valid knowledge.

original: ka vārā / /ka vā rā / /yāṃ kṣaṇiga /rā / /katva vāga /
analyzed: ka vārā ka vā rā yām
translated: What is the Vāra? What is the Rā? What is the Kṣaṇig Rā? What is the Ktvavāg?
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Section

original: dhūmānumāne mahānase sapakṣa vyavahārastu niścitavyāpakavattayā sapakṣatvasyāpi satvāt/
analyzed: dhūma anumāne mahānase sapakṣa vyavahāraḥ tu niścita vyāpakavattayā sapakṣa tvasya api satvāt
translated: As for the usage of the kitchen as a similar instance in the inference of smoke, it is because it has the property of having a certain pervasion.

analyzed: ukta rūpāyām pakṣa tāyām satyām api pakṣa tva avyavahāraḥ upi anumiti aviṣaya tvāt
translated: Even when there is the type of pakṣatā (as defined by Udayana), there is no usage of it as a pakṣa (subject) because it is not the object of inference.

original: tatra pakṣatāyāṃ satyāmapi kadācidanumityabhāvāśca tvanmate saṃśayottarapratyakṣasthala iva liṅgaparāmarśāditatsāmagryabhāvādityāhuḥ//
analyzed: tatra pakṣatāyām satyām api kadācid anumiti abhāvāḥ ca tvad mate saṃśaya uttara pratyakṣa sthale iva liṅga parāmarśa ādi tad sāmagrī abhāvāt iti āhuḥ
translated: Even when there is pakṣatā (in the kitchen), sometimes there is no inference, as in the case of perception after doubt, according to your view, due to the absence of the lingaparāmarśa (inferential judgment) and its conditions, so they say.

analyzed: iti sva mate pakṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus, the definition of pakṣa in one's own view.

analyzed: anyasya tu pramā tvena abhimatā  sā ca anumātari kṣaṇika vādini sattvāt samāna adhikaraṇā
translated: But for others, it is what is considered to be valid knowledge.🔽And that is coextensive with the inferring person who holds the doctrine of momentariness, because it exists there.

analyzed: akṣaṇika vādini sattvāt vyadhikaraṇā ca
translated: And it is not coextensive with the person who holds the doctrine of non-momentariness, because it exists there too.

analyzed: tathāca tādṛśa sādhya abhāva buddhau satyām api
translated: And so, even when there is the cognition of the absence of such a probandum,

analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇa pramā tva abhimata buddhi abhāvāt pakṣatā yuktā iti arthaḥ
translated: because there is no cognition that is considered to be valid knowledge and is coextensive with it, it is said to be endowed with pakṣatā.

analyzed: akṣaṇika vādini kṣaṇika vādini ca iti anantaram vidyamāna tvena iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The word having is to be supplied after the proponent of non-momentariness and the proponent of momentariness.

analyzed: pratyakṣāyām pratyabhijñāna ādi sākṣātkāra rūpāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in the case of direct perception, which is in the form of the cognition of recognition etc.

analyzed: nanu evam mahānasa ādau api ukta rūpa anumiti viṣaya tva yogya tva satvāt pakṣatā syāt
translated: If that is so, then in the case of a kitchen etc. also, there would be the state of being a subject of inference, because of the presence of the capacity to be the object of inference in the form stated.

analyzed: tathāca tad kāryāṇām sapakṣa tva avyavahāra pakṣa tva vyavahāra anumitīnām āpātaḥ iti atas āha dhūma iti
translated: And in that case, there would be the contingence of the state of being a similar instance and the state of being a subject of inference, which are the effects of that [capacity]. In order to meet this, he says: smoke etc.

analyzed: pakṣa tva avyavahāraḥ api iti atra hetuḥ anumiti aviṣaya tvāt iti            tatra yathā viśakalita vyāpti smaraṇa kara ādi rūpa liṅka darśanayoḥ bhāve pi vyāpti viśiṣṭa liṅ darśana rūpa parāmarśa abhāvāt vā
translated: The reason here is: because it is not the object of inference.🔽The meaning is: just as there is no inference even when there is the perception of the mark in the form of the recollection of the invariable concomitance, etc.,

analyzed: parāmarśa satve pi pratyakṣa sāmagrī balavat tvena vā yathā na anumitiḥ tathā iti arthaḥ
translated: or even when there is the reflection in the form of the perception of the mark qualified by the invariable concomitance, because of the strength of the material cause of perception, in the same way, there is no inference in the case of a kitchen etc. also.

analyzed: atra gauravam aruci bījam iti eke
translated: Some people say that the reason for this is the heaviness of the burden and the lack of interest [in the matter].

original: daivānmahānasādau satyapi parāmarśe pratyakṣasāmagryāmasatyāṃ cānumityāpatyā pakṣatvavyavahārādyāpāta ityanye//
analyzed: daivāt mahānasa ādau sati api parāmarśe pratyakṣa sāmagryām asatyām ca anumiti āpatyā pakṣa tva vyavahāra ādi āpātaḥ iti anye
translated: Others say that even when there is a general notion of the kitchen, if the conditions for perception are absent and inference is possible, there would be the undesirable consequence of the kitchen being treated as the subject.

analyzed: iti sva mate pakṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus, the definition of the subject in one's own view.🔽The end of the chapter on the definition of the subject.

analyzed: para mate
translated: For the opponent, the chapter on the relation.

analyzed: svāta upādhi sa anya laṇam  upādhi vādaḥ
translated: The general definition of the property to be proved.🔽The chapter on the property to be proved.

analyzed: atha upādhi vādaḥ
translated: Now, the chapter on the property to be proved.

analyzed: atha sva abhimata upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam
translated: Now, the general definition of the property to be proved, which is accepted by oneself.

analyzed: atha upādhi jñānasya vyāpti jñāna pratibandhaka tvāt upādhiḥ nirūpyate
translated: Now, the property to be proved is being defined, because the knowledge of the property to be proved is an impediment to the knowledge of the pervasion.

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka tve sati sādhana avyāpakaḥ upādhiḥ
translated: A property to be proved is that which is not pervaded by the reason, while being pervaded by the probandum.

analyzed: atha upādhi vādaḥ
translated: Now, the chapter on the property to be proved.

analyzed: atha sva abhimata upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam  upādhi nirūpaṇe kā pūrva saṅgatiḥ iti āha atha upādhi iti
translated: Now, the general definition of the property to be proved, which is accepted by oneself.🔽In the definition of the property to be proved, what is the connection with the previous? He says: Now, the property to be proved.

analyzed: evam anumāna upayukta vyāpti ādi nirūpaṇa anantaram avasaprāptam pratibandhaka svarūpam nirūpyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that after defining the pervasion etc. useful for inference, the nature of the impediment, which is to be reached, is being defined.

original: etena yanmaṇau pakṣatokteḥ prāgevopādhainirūpaṇaṃ tadanavasaradusthamityuktaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: etena yat maṇau pakṣatā ukteḥ prāk eva upādhaiḥ nirūpaṇam tat anavasara dustham iti uktam bhavati
translated: By this it is said that the determination of the fallacy before the statement of the reason in the inference is untimely and improper.

analyzed: upādhi jñānam hi dvedhā vyāpti grahaṇa kālīnam vyāpti grahaṇa anantaram anumāna prayoga kālīnam ca iti
translated: The knowledge of the fallacy is twofold: occurring at the time of grasping the pervasion and occurring after the grasping of the pervasion, at the time of the statement of the inference.

analyzed: tatra ādya abhiprāyeṇa uktam vyāpti jñāna pratibandhaka tvāt iti
translated: With regard to the first intention, it is said that it is because it obstructs the knowledge of the pervasion.

analyzed: dvitīya sya pratipakṣatayā doṣa tvena anumiti pratibandhaka tvāt
translated: If it is a fallacy by being a counter-example, it is because it obstructs the inference.

analyzed: vyāpti jñāna pratibandhaka tva prakāraḥ ca sādhya vyāpakam parityajataḥ hetoḥ sādhya parityāgasya āvaśyaka tva ādinā upādheḥ dūṣaka tā bījokti vāde vyaktaḥ
translated: And the way it obstructs the knowledge of the pervasion is clear in the statement of the seed of refutation of the fallacy, namely that when the reason abandons what is pervaded by the probandum, it necessarily abandons the probandum.

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka vailobhma vyāptiḥ sādhanasya tu
translated: The pervasion of the reason is by the non-co-existence of what pervades the probandum.

analyzed: iti yuktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhā ādi uktim hṛdi kṛtvā upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam āha sādhya iti
translated: Keeping in mind the reasoning in the commentary on the Yuktidipika, he states the general definition of the fallacy as follows:

original: atra sādhyapadena pūrvoktadiśā na liṅgajanyadhīviṣayatvaṃ vivakṣitam/
analyzed: atra sādhya padena pūrvokta diśā na liṅga janya dhī viṣayatvam vivakṣitam
translated: Here, the word probandum is not intended to mean being the object of cognition produced by the reason, as stated earlier.🔽k-su g.ra

analyzed: katvasu garā yam prati sat prati ṭha
translated: yaṃ prati satpratiṭha.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyavāpā.

original: nanu vāyuḥ spārśanaḥ anudbhūtarūpānadhikaraṇatve sati pratyakṣasparśāśrayatvāt
analyzed: nanu vāyuḥ spārśanaḥ anudbhūta rūpa anadhikaraṇa tve sati pratyakṣa sparśa āśraya tvāt
translated: But in the case of air is tangible, because it is the substratum of perceptible touch, while not being the substratum of unmanifest form,

analyzed: ghaṭa vat ityādau pakṣa dharmeṇa dravya tvena avacchinna sādhya vyāpake cākṣuṣa tva ādi upādau
translated: and in pot, etc., where the property of the subject is restricted by substantiality, and the pervasion of the probandum is by visibility, etc., which are the probans,

original: samavāyaḥ samavetaḥ saṃbandhatvāt saṃyogavat ityādau sādhanena saṃbandhatvenāvacchinna
analyzed: samavāyaḥ samavetaḥ saṃbandha tvāt saṃyoga vat ityādau sādhanena saṃbandha tvena avacchinna
translated: in inherence is inhered in, because it is a relation, like conjunction, and so on, where the probans restricts

analyzed: yena vyāpti graha daśāyām mahānasīya dhūma ādeḥ tādṛśa tva abhāvena tad upādhi ārdra indhana ādau avyāptiḥ syāt
translated: by the nature of being a relation, there would be non-pervasion of that in the limiting conditions such as wet fuel, since smoke from a great fire, etc. would not have that nature at the time of grasping the pervasion.

analyzed: kintu vyāpaka tā avacchedaka dharmavat tva mātram iti agre vyaktam  dhūma ādi anumāne vyañjanavat tva ādeḥ upādhi tā vyāvṛti artham satī antam tatra eva
translated: But it is clear that it is merely the nature of having the property that restricts the pervasion.🔽The word true is used to exclude the status of limiting condition of such things as having a vowel in the case of inference of smoke, etc.
The expression not pervaded by the probans is used to exclude the status of limiting condition of such things as being an object of knowledge in that very case.

analyzed: sādhana iti sādhana tva abhimatam ucyate
translated: Probans refers to what is considered to be the probans.

analyzed: evam sādhya padena api
translated: Similarly, the word probandum also refers to that.

analyzed: atra avinābhāvasya eva vyāpti tva upagamena anaupādhika tva rūpa vyāpteḥ anādarāt na anyonyāśrayaḥ
translated: Here, by accepting the very invariable concomitance as pervasion, and disregarding the pervasion in the form of non-accidental nature, there is no mutual dependence.

analyzed: ukta lakṣaṇasya avyāpta tva śaṅkā uttare sudhā ukte vivaritum ākṣipati nanu iti
translated: In order to explain the objection and answer stated in the Sudha commentary regarding the incompleteness of the definition stated, he raises the question with But...

analyzed: spārśanam tvij indriya vedyaḥ  tapta vāri stha vahnau avyabhicārāya sati antam
translated: Tangible is that which is known by the tactile sense.🔽The word 'sat' (true) is used to avoid the fallacy of the hot water being the substance and the fire being the attribute.

analyzed: cākṣuṣa tva ādi upādhau avyāptiḥ iti anvayaḥ
translated: The word 'mātra' (only) is used to avoid the fallacy of the sky being the substance and the color being the attribute.🔽The conclusion is that the definition is incomplete because it does not apply to the upādhi (limiting adjunct) such as 'being perceptible by the eye' etc.

original: yatra spārśanatvaṃ tatra cākṣuṣatvamiti sparśaguṇa eva vyabhicāreṇa śuddhasādhyavyāpakatvasyā
analyzed: yatra spārśana tvam tatra cākṣuṣa tvam iti sparśa guṇe eva vyabhicāreṇa śuddha sādhya vyāpaka tvasya
translated: Where there is tangibility, there is perceptibility by the eye. This is a fallacy in the case of the quality of touch itself. The pure conclusion is pervaded by the fallacy.

original: bhāvepi dravyatve sati spārśanatvaṃ yatra tatra cākṣuṣatvamiti ghaṭādau vyāptidarśanena
analyzed: bhāve api dravya tve sati spārśana tvam yatra tatra cākṣuṣa tvam iti ghaṭa ādau vyāpti darśanena
translated: Even though it does not exist, the pervasion is seen in the pot etc. as 'wherever there is tangibility in a substance, there is perceptibility by the eye'.

analyzed: pakṣa dharma avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka tva satvāt tatra avyāptiḥ
translated: Therefore, the definition is incomplete because it does not apply to the conclusion qualified by the property of the subject.

analyzed: garā ghaṭa ādeḥ upādhi tā tu ābhā  svāta upādhi sa anya laṇam
translated: This is not so. The pot etc. are the upādhi (limiting adjunct). The reason is that the upādhi does not exist.🔽The definition of upādhi (limiting adjunct) is given.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of upādhi (limiting adjunct).

analyzed: sādhya vyāpake kṛtaka tva ādi upādhau ca avyāptiḥ
translated: And there is over-extension in the reason, such as being produced, which pervades the probandum.

analyzed: tatra spārśana tva ādeḥ eva sādhya tvāt
translated: Because there, only the property of being tangible, etc. is to be proved.

analyzed: sādhya padena
translated: By the word probandum

original: tathā yatra samavetatvaṃ tatra kṛtakatvamityasya jātyādau vyabhicāreṇa kṛtakatvasya🔽śuddhasādhyāvyāpakatvepi saṃbandhatve sati samavetatvaṃ yatra tatra kṛtakatvamiti
analyzed: tathā yatra samaveta tvam tatra kṛtaka tvam iti asya jāti ādau vyabhicāreṇa kṛtaka tvasya  śuddha sādhya avyāpaka tve api saṃbandha tve sati samaveta tvam yatra tatra kṛtaka tvam iti
translated: Similarly, where there is inherence, there is being produced, this is contradicted in the universal, etc. by the property of being produced.🔽Even though the property of being produced is not a mere pervader of the probandum, the pervasion is seen in conjunction that where there is inherence, there is being produced.

analyzed: vyāptyāḥ saṃyoge darśanena sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka upādhau ca avyāptiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is over-extension in the reason that is qualified by the probandum and pervades the reason.

analyzed: atra avacchinna tvam samāna adhikaraṇa tvam dhyeyam
translated: Here, the being qualified should be understood as being in the same substratum.

analyzed: avyāptim vyanakti tatra iti
translated: He explains the over-extension by saying there.

analyzed: yena ukta lakṣaṇa sattvāt avyāptiḥ na syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: In the two stated inferences, the property of being tangible, etc. is not qualified.🔽The idea is that because the stated definition is present, there should not be over-extension.

analyzed: nanu etau upādhi catvena asaṃgrāhyau
translated: If it is argued that these two are not included as reasons due to being over-extensive,

analyzed: kim tu śuddha sādhya vyāpakaḥ evā iti ced na
translated: but are only the mere pervader of the probandum, it is not so.

analyzed: vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām yadā āptiḥ anukūla tā
translated: The favorable acquisition of the speaker, hearer, and their interests,

analyzed: ityādā atha atas brahma jijñāsā ityādi śāstram pramāṇam anukūla vaktra ādima tvāt itya tanumāne  vākya tva ādi avacchinna sādhāya vyāpakasya āpta vākya tva ādeḥ upādhi tva svīkārāt vakṣyamāṇa dūṣakatā bījasya avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka upādhi sādhāraṇyāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The scriptures beginning with Now, therefore, the inquiry into Brahman are the means of valid knowledge, because they have a favorable speaker and so on. Thus, in the inference🔽because of accepting the qualification of the probandum by the qualification of the reason, such as being the statement of a trustworthy person, which is the common property of the qualification that is not pervaded by the probandum that is qualified by the property of being a statement and so on, and because of the seed of the fault that will be stated, which is common to the qualification that pervades the probandum that is qualified. This is the idea.

original: yadyapi samavāyasyāprāmāṇikatvena tatra sādhyahetvorbādhā dinaiva tadanumānasya duṣṭatayā tatropādheranaṅgīkārepi na kṣatiḥ/
analyzed: yadi api samavāyasya aprāmāṇika tvena tatra sādhya hetvoḥ bādhā dinā eva tad anumānasya duṣṭa tayā tatra upādheḥ anaṅgīkāre api na kṣatiḥ
translated: Although there is no harm even if the qualification is not accepted in that inference, because the superimposition of the probandum and the reason on inherence is contradicted by the fact that inherence is not a means of valid knowledge,

original: tathāpi nodāharaṇamādaraṇīyamiti nyāyena dhvaṃso vināśī janyatvādityādau sādhanāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakasya🔽kṛtakatvāde rupādhitvenodāharaṇāntarasaṃbhavena ca sādhanāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakopādhipradarśana eva tātparyāt /
analyzed: tathā api na udāharaṇam ādaraṇīyam iti nyāyena dhvaṃsaḥ vināśī janya tvāt ityādau sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpakasya  kṛtaka tva ādeḥ rupādhi tvena udāharaṇa antara saṃbhavena ca sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka upādhi pradarśane eva tātparyāt
translated: nevertheless, according to the principle that an example should not be accepted, in the case of destruction is perishable because it is produced, etc., the qualification of the reason that pervades the probandum that is qualified by the reason,🔽such as being produced, is shown to be the qualification that pervades the probandum that is qualified by the reason, and the purpose is to show that there is another example.

analyzed: para mate prasiddha tvāt sudhāyām asya eva anuvādāt samavāya pakṣakaḥ eva prayogaḥ darśitaḥ iti adoṣaḥ
translated: In the Sudha commentary, it is shown that the argument is only in terms of inherence, because it is well-known in the opponent's view and because it is only restated. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: dhenaivaṭa /ṭha / /atyantābhāvovināśī janyatvādityādau sādhanāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakasya bhāvatvasya ityadhikamṭa / syābhāvasya ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: atyanta abhāvaḥ vināśī janya tvāt ityādau sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpakasya bhāva tvasya iti adhikam ṭa sya abhāvasya
translated: In the argument Sound is non-eternal because it is produced, the property of being a positive entity, which is a pervader of the conclusion qualified by the reason, is redundant. The absence of the pervader is not the absence of the pervaded.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: pakṣadharmādyavacchinnasādhyavivakṣāyāṃ tu vimato dhūmavān vahnimatvādityādau śuddhasādhyavyāpake
analyzed: tu
translated: But if the intention is to take the conclusion as qualified by the property of being a property of the subject, then in an argument like The subject is smoky because it is fiery, the super-fluity of the property of being wet fuel etc. as a qualifier of the pervader of the pure conclusion,

original: ārdrendhanādyupādhau vaidhī hiṃsā adharmasādhanaṃ hiṃsātvādityādau niṣiddhatvādyupādhau
analyzed: ārdra indhana ādi upādhau vaidhī hiṃsā adharma sādhanam hiṃsā tvāt ityādau niṣiddha tva ādi upādhau
translated: and in an argument like Sacrificial killing is a means of attaining adharma because it is killing, the super-fluity of the property of being prohibited etc. as a qualifier,

analyzed: ca avyāptiḥ iti ced na
translated: is not a fallacy.

original: sādhyapadena hi vyāpakatāvacchedakadharmādhikaraṇatvamātre vivakṣitam na tu tadatiriktadharmā vacchinnatvamapi/
analyzed: sādhya padena hi vyāpaka tā avacchedaka dharma adhikaraṇa tva mātre vivakṣitam na tu tad atirikta dharma avacchinna tvam api
translated: For by the word conclusion, only the property of being the substratum of the property that determines the pervasion is intended, not even the property of being qualified by anything else.

analyzed: evam ca yathā śuddha sādhyam dhūma ādikam vyāpaka tā avacchedaka dhūma tva ādi dharma adhikaraṇam
translated: And just as the pure conclusion, such as smoke, is the substratum of the property that determines the pervasion, such as being smoky,

analyzed: tathā dravya tva samāna adhikaraṇam spārśana tva rūpam api sādhyam vyāpaka tā avacchedaka spārśana tva tva adhikaraṇam eva iti
translated: in the same way, the conclusion in the form of being tangible, which is co-extensive with substantiality, is also the substratum of the property that determines the pervasion, which is being tangible.

analyzed: na kutra api avyāptiḥ na hi
translated: There is no over-extension anywhere.

analyzed: dhavala tva samāna adhikaraṇam go tvam a go tvam bhavati
translated: For cowhood, which is co-extensive with whiteness, is not non-cowhood.

analyzed: etat eva abhipretya uktam sudhāyām sādhya padena asādhya padena avacchinnā na avacchinna sādhya abhidhānāt iti
translated: With this very thing in mind, it is said in the Sudha: Because of the mention of the non-excluded probandum by the word probandum, which is excluded or not excluded.

analyzed: sādhya iti sāmānya lakṣaṇa gata sādhya padena iti arthaḥ  pakṣa dharma iti
translated: Probandum - the meaning is by the word probandum in the general definition.🔽Paksadharma - the meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: pakṣa dharma avacchinna iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: yasmin prayoge yat dyāpakatā avacchedakam tad dharma avacchinna sādhya vyāpakaḥ upādhiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: uktam sudhāyām iti
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam iti etad vyākhyāna sudhāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: nakāra pūraṇena dhyam dhūrā
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.🔽The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: tathā dravya tva samāna adhikaraṇam iti adhikamgarā janya tva sāvayava tva anyataratvena
translated: The meaning is by the word pakṣadharma.

analyzed: kṛtaka tvam sāvayava tvam mayā upādhiḥ udbhāvitaḥ
translated: Artifice and having parts have been stated by me as the reason.

analyzed: prāgabhāvaḥ janyaḥ vināśi tvāt iti atra sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka bhāva tvam upādhiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: In the argument The prior non-existence of an effect is produced, because it is destroyed, the meaning is that the property of being the pervader of the conclusion qualified by the reason is the reason.

analyzed: iti astiṭha
translated: This is so.

analyzed: svāta upādhi sa anya laṇam
translated: The general definition of the reason in the form of a counter-example.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ pu  yadi api avacchinna sādhya vyāpakaḥ vacchinna sādhyaḥ eva upādhiḥ
translated: The section on the reason.🔽Although the pervader of the conclusion qualified by the qualifier is the reason qualified by the qualifier itself,🔽nevertheless, in order to avoid the impossibility of the exclusion of the qualifier when excluding the conclusion qualified by its own exclusion,

analyzed: tathā api sva vyāvṛtya avacchinna sādhyam vyāvartayan avacchedaka vyāvṛtteḥ asaṃbhavāt avacchedya śuddha sādhya vyāvṛttau
translated: it ends up in the exclusion of the pure conclusion to be established.

analyzed: paryavasyan bhikṣu pāda prasaraṇa nyāyena śuddha sādhya sādhaka anumāne pi doṣaḥ bhavati
translated: By the principle of the spreading of the feet of a monk, it becomes a fault in the inference that establishes the pure conclusion to be established.

original: yathā viśeṣaṇāsiddho viśiṣṭahetvasiddhau paryavasyanhetudoṣo bhavati tatheti nārthāntarādikaṃ
analyzed: yathā viśeṣaṇa asiddhaḥ viśiṣṭa hetu asiddhau paryavasyan hetu doṣaḥ bhavati tathā iti na artha antara ādikam
translated: Just as a reason that ends up in the non-establishment of the qualified reason becomes a fault of the reason by the non-establishment of the qualifier, so it is not a different meaning.

analyzed: vyañjanava tva ādi api mahānasa tva ādi avacchinna vahni rūpa sādhya vyāpaka tvāt tatra upādhiḥ eva
translated: Even though the property of being a compound word etc. is a pervader of the conclusion in the form of the kitchen etc., it is a reason in that case because it is a pervader of the conclusion in the form of the kitchen etc.

analyzed: kintu dhūma anumānasya anukūla tarka sanādha tvena avacchedya vahni vyāvṛtteḥ asaṃbhavāt avacchedaka mahānasa tva vyāvṛtteḥ eva
translated: But in the case of the inference of smoke, since the exclusion of the qualified fire is impossible due to the fact that the inference of smoke is established by the favorable reasoning,

original: ca saṃbhavādvahnimātrasādhakadhūmānumānadūṣaṇe na śakta iti na tatra doṣa iti bhedaḥ // 🔽nanu śuddhasādhyaprayoge 'vacchinnasādhyavyāpakopādhyuktau prakṛtanupayuktānvitoktirūpārthāntaratādoṣaḥ
analyzed: ca saṃbhavāt vahni mātra sādhaka dhūma anumāna dūṣaṇe na śaktaḥ iti na tatra doṣaḥ iti bhedaḥ  nanu śuddha sādhya prayoge avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka upādhi uktau prakṛta anupayukta anvita ukti rūpa artha antara tā doṣaḥ
translated: and since the exclusion of the qualifier, the kitchen, is possible, one is not able to criticize the inference of smoke which proves fire alone. Therefore, there is no fault in that case. This is the difference.🔽If in a syllogism with a pure probandum, a qualifier that pervades the qualified probandum is stated, there would be the fault of irrelevance in the form of stating what is not connected to the subject.

original: syādityāśaṅkāmanūdya śuddhasādhyaprayogadūṣakatvasyāpi satvānnadoṣa iti bhāvena pariharati // yadyapīti //
analyzed: syāt iti āśaṅkām anūdya śuddha sādhya prayoga dūṣaka tvasya api satvāt na doṣaḥ iti bhāvena pariharati yadi api iti
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he answers with the idea that there is no fault because there is also the fault of criticizing a syllogism with a pure probandum.

analyzed: nanu evam parvataḥ ugnimān dhūmavatvāt ityādi sat anumāna bhaṅga prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If so, there would be the consequence of refuting a correct inference like The mountain has fire because it has smoke.

analyzed: tatra api ukta diśā avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka upādhi saṃbhavāt iti atas āha vyañjanavat tva ādikam iti
translated: Even there, a qualifier that pervades the qualified probandum in the stated manner is possible. Therefore, he says having the property of being an adjective, etc.

analyzed: na śaktaḥ iti vibhāgaḥ
translated: One is not able to criticize. This is the division.

analyzed: evam yathāśrutam sudhā uktam samarthya
translated: Having thus supported the statement in the Sudha commentary as it is heard,

original: ko vahnirasādhya evo ityastirā / /nnaṃ saḥ ṭa /rā / /dirapika / ga /ṭa /rā / /sādyava rā /
analyzed: kaḥ vahniḥ asādhyaḥ saḥ ga ṭa rā
translated: What is the fire that is indeed incapable of being accomplished? There is the fire. That is the fire. The fire of the sun. The fire of the sun. The fire of the sun.
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: athavā yo yaddharmāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakatve sati sādhanāvyāpakaḥ sa tatropādhiḥ/
analyzed: athavā yaḥ yad dharma avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka tve sati sādhana avyāpakaḥ sa tatra upādhiḥ
translated: Or, that which is the pervader of the probandum qualified by a property, and yet is not a pervader of the probans, is an upādhi (a counter-argument).

original: sādhyavyāpakatvesati sādhanāvyāpaka upādhiriti sudhāyāmapi sādhyavyāpakapadenedameva vivakṣitam/
analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka tve sati sādhana avyāpakaḥ upādhiḥ iti sudhāyām api sādhya vyāpaka padena idam eva vivakṣitam
translated: In the Sudhā also, this alone is intended by the phrase pervader of the probandum in the statement an upādhi is that which is a pervader of the probandum and yet is not a pervader of the probans.

analyzed: evam ca avacchinna sādhya sādhya vyāpake na avyāpti śaṅkā api
translated: And thus, there is no fear of over-extension even in the case of the probandum qualified by the property.

analyzed: nā api śuddha sādhya vyāpake ārdra indhana ādau tasya api dhūma tva ādi dharma avacchinna dhūma rūpa sādhya vyāpaka tvāt
translated: Nor is there over-extension in the case of the pure probandum, such as wet fuel, because that also is a pervader of the probandum in the form of smoke qualified by the property of smokiness, etc.

analyzed: evam ca sarvaḥ api upādhiḥ avacchinna sādhya vyāpakaḥ eva
translated: And thus, all upādhis are indeed pervaders of the probandum qualified by a property.

analyzed: sudhāyām anavacchinna padam tu vyāpaka tā avacchedaka dharma anya dharmeṇa anavacchinna tva abhiprāyam
translated: But the phrase unqualified in the Sudhā is intended to mean not being qualified by a property other than the property that is the qualifier of the pervasion.

original: yadvā sādhya padasthāne yatpadaprakṣepeṇa yo yavdyāpakatve sati yadavyāpakaḥ sa svāvyāpye tasminhetāvupādhirityastu/
analyzed: yat vā sādhya pada sthāne yad pada prakṣepeṇa yaḥ sati yad avyāpakaḥ sa sva avyāpye tasmin hetau upādhiḥ iti astu
translated: Or, let it be that when the word 'yat' is substituted for the word 'sādhya' (in the definition of upādhi), an upādhi is that which is pervaded by a certain thing (i.e., the sādhya) and yet does not pervade that (sādhya), in the hetu which is not pervaded by itself (i.e., the upādhi).

original: evaṃ ca dravyatvāvacchinnaspārśanatvasya dūṣyānumānasādhyatvābhāvepi tatra cākṣuṣa tvopādhitāsiddhiḥ/
analyzed: evam ca dravya tva avacchinna spārśana tvasya dūṣya anumāna sādhya tva abhāve pi tatra cākṣuṣa tva upādhi tā asiddhiḥ
translated: And thus, even though the tangibility qualified by substantiality is not the sādhya of the fallacious inference, the tangibility of the eye is established as an upādhi there.

analyzed: sudhāyām sādhya padam tu prāyika abhiprāyam
translated: But the word 'sādhya' in the Sudhā is intended for the most part.

original: ata eva sudhāyāṃ vastutastu yo dharmo yavdyāpakāvyā pakastasya tenāvyāptiriti sādhyapadasthāne yatpadameva prayuktam//
analyzed: atas eva sudhāyām vastutas tu yaḥ dharmaḥ tasya tena avyāptiḥ iti sādhya pada sthāne yad padam eva prayuktam
translated: For this very reason, in the Sudhā, the word 'yat' itself is used in place of the word 'sādhya', saying In reality, that which is pervaded by a certain property and yet does not pervade that (property), that is the non-pervasion by that (property).

analyzed: atra dvitīya tṛtīya pakṣayoḥ api a vacchinna sādhya vyāpaka īrtha antara nirāsaḥ ādya pakṣa vat draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Here, the exclusion of the other thing which pervades the sādhya qualified by the second and third alternatives should be seen as in the first alternative.

analyzed: praka antareṇa pakṣa dvayam āha athavā iti
translated: In another way, two alternatives are stated with or.

analyzed: yat vā iti ca
translated: And with or.🔽As in the first alternative.

original: ādyapakṣavaditi// 🔽apipadaṃ naka /ga /ṭa /rā / /dhyādipaga /ṭa /rā / /tvasyoga /ṭa /rā / /pyaḥ tasyaka /ga /ṭa /rā / /apipadaṃ naga /ṭa /rā / /kṣa eva draga /rā /
analyzed: ādya pakṣa vat iti  apipadam nakagaṭarā tvasyogaṭarā pyaḥ tasyakagaṭarā apipadam nagaṭarā kṣaḥ eva dragarā
translated: The word 'api' (even) is not a conjunction.

analyzed: svāta upādhi sa anya laṇam
translated: The word 'api' (even) is not a disjunction.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ
translated: The discussion on the property of being an upādhi.

analyzed: atra ca ādye pakṣe avacchinna sādhyam api sādhyam eva
translated: And here, in the first case, even the limited conclusion is the conclusion.

analyzed: dvitīye śuddha sādhyam api avacchinna sādhyam eva
translated: In the second, even the pure conclusion is only the limited conclusion.

analyzed: tṛtīye vacchinna sādhyasya asādhya tve pi cākṣuṣa tvasya tatra upādhi tvam iti bhedaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: In the third, even though the limited conclusion is not to be proved, tacchutva is its upādhi. The difference should be seen thus.

original: kecittu spārśanatvādirūpaśuddhasādhya eva dravyatvādiviśi ṣṭacākṣuṣatvābhāvasyābhāva upādhiḥ/
analyzed: kecid tu spārśana tva ādi rūpa śuddha sādhye eva dravya tva ādi viśi ṣṭa cākṣuṣa tva abhāvasya abhāvaḥ upādhiḥ
translated: But some say that in the pure conclusion in the form of being tangible, etc., the absence of the qualified tacchutva is the upādhi.

original: ayaṃ ca viśiṣṭābhāvarūpa upādhiḥ sadhyavati sparśādau dravyatvarūpaviśeṣaṇasyābhāvena ghaṭādau
analyzed: ayam ca viśiṣṭa abhāva rūpaḥ upādhiḥ sadhyavati sparśa ādau dravya tva rūpa viśeṣaṇasya abhāvena ghaṭa ādau
translated: And this upādhi in the form of the absence of the qualified is present in the tangible, etc. where the conclusion is present, by the absence of the qualifier dravya-tva, and

analyzed: cākṣuṣa tva abhāva rūpa viśeṣyasya abhāvena anugataḥ iti śuddha sādhya vyāpakaḥ tat uktam
translated: in the pot, etc. by the absence of the qualificand in the form of the absence of tacchutva, and is thus pervasive of the pure conclusion. This is stated

analyzed: yaḥ upādhiḥ lālagīti sādhye vai yad viśeṣaṇe
translated: The upādhi which is mentioned in the conclusion, in the qualifier of that,

analyzed: sva vyāvṛttyā avacchinnam sādhyam vyāvartayan ityādinā ukta diśā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: by the exclusion of its own, excludes the conclusion limited by that. The idea is that it is in the manner stated by the beginning of the statement by the exclusion of its own, excludes the conclusion limited by that.

original: pakṣāṇāṃ viveka svayamevāha atra cādya iti//
analyzed: pakṣāṇām svayam eva āha atra ca ādyaḥ iti
translated: And he himself states the distinction of the positions, And here, the first, etc.

analyzed: sādhyam eva iti
translated: Is the conclusion itself.

analyzed: vyāpaka tā avacchedaka dharma adhikaraṇa mātrasya sādhya padena vivakṣita tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that only the substratum of the pervader-determining property is intended by the word 'to be proved'.

analyzed: udayana ādi matam āha kecitu iti
translated: Some, like Udayana, say 'some'.

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka tvam vyanakti ayam ca iti
translated: He explains the pervasiveness in the probandum with 'this' and so on.

analyzed: yaḥ iti
translated: 'That' means

analyzed: yaḥ upādhiḥ cākṣuṣa tva abhāvasya abhāva rūpaḥ upādhiḥ
translated: that which is the absence-form of the non-audibility,

original: sādhye spārśanatvarūpasādhye dravyatvarūpayadviṣaṇayuktai tasya dravyatvaviśiṣṭacākṣuṣatvābhāvasyābhāvaḥ kevale sādhye vyāpaka eva sa upādhirbhavatītyarthaḥ/
analyzed: sādhye spārśana tva rūpa sādhye tasya dravya tva viśiṣṭa cākṣuṣa tva abhāvasya abhāvaḥ kevale sādhye vyāpakaḥ eva saḥ upādhiḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: the absence of that which is qualified by substantiality, which is the probandum, is only pervasive in the mere probandum. The meaning is that such is the qualifier.

original: evaṃ tarhi śāsre śuddha sādhyavyāpakarūpaikarūpopādhimanuktvāvacchinnasādhyavyāpako ktiḥ kimarthetyata āha śāstre tviti//
analyzed: evam tarhi śāsre śuddha sādhya vyāpaka rūpa eka rūpa upādhim anuktvā avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka uktiḥ kimarthā iti atas āha śāstre tu iti
translated: If so, then in the treatise, why is the qualifier stated as pervasive in the qualified probandum without stating the qualifier which is only pervasive in the mere probandum? To this he says 'but in the treatise' and so on.

analyzed: tad ākṣepa arthā tad uktiḥ iti vākyaśeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder of the sentence is 'that statement is for the purpose of implying that'.🔽The absence of that which is qualified by the qualifier substantiality is present. Thus,

original: ṣṭasya ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /'tu' ityadhikamka /ga /ṭa / /dabhāvābhūḥ dravyatvaviśeṣaṇaviśiṣṭa ityastiṭha / /evaṃ hiṭha / /kopādhyuktiḥṭha /
analyzed: tu iti adhikam kagaṭa dravya tva viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭaḥ iti astiṭha evam
translated: the statement of the qualifier is like this.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: tad viśeṣaṇa yuktā etad abhāvā bhūḥ tu kevala
translated: But the absence of this along with its qualifications is only the substratum.

original: iti/ śāstre tu vyatirekavyāptyādinānvayavyāptyādi mivāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakopādhinokta śuddhasādhyavyāpakopādhirākṣipyata ityāhuḥ//
analyzed: iti śāstre tu vyatireka vyāpti ādinā anvaya vyāpti ādi  śuddha sādhya vyāpaka upādhiḥ ākṣipyate iti āhuḥ
translated: In the treatise, they say that the pure pervasion of the probandum, which is stated by the pervasion of the vyatireka (negative concomitance), etc., is implied by the pervasion of the anvaya (positive concomitance), etc., which is restricted by the upādhi that pervades the restricted probandum.

original: ayaṃ prakāro vāyuḥ spārśanaḥ sparśatvāditya siddhisaṃkīrṇe dravyatvāvacchinnasādhyavyāpake cākṣuṣatvopādhau na saṃbhavatītyasārvatrikaḥ/
analyzed: ayam prakāraḥ vāyuḥ spārśanaḥ sparśa tvāt iti a siddhi saṃkīrṇe dravya tva avacchinna sādhya vyāpake cākṣuṣa tva upādhau na saṃbhavati iti asārvatrikaḥ
translated: This type is not possible in the upādhi of audibility, which pervades the probandum restricted by substantiality, in the case of the inconclusive reason Air is tangible because of tangibility, because it is not universal.

original: tatra dravyatvāvacchinnacākṣuṣatvābhāvā bhāvarūpopādhāvuktarītyā spārśanatvarūpasādhyavyāpakatvepi🔽sparśatvarūpasādhanāvyāpakatvasyābhāvātsādhanavati sparśe dravyatvābhāvena dravyatvaviśiṣṭasya
analyzed: tatra dravya tva avacchinna cākṣuṣa tva abhāvāḥ bhāva rūpa upādhau ukta rītyā spārśana tva rūpa sādhya vyāpaka tve api  sparśa tva rūpa sādhana avyāpaka tvasya abhāvāt sādhanavati sparśe dravya tva abhāvena dravya tva viśiṣṭasya
translated: There, in the upādhi in the form of the absence of the absence of audibility restricted by substantiality, as stated, although there is pervasion by the probandum in the form of tangibility,

analyzed: cākṣuṣa tva abhāvasya abhāvena upādheḥ sādhana vyāpaka tvāt
translated: because of the absence of the non-pervasion of the probans in the form of tangibility, the upādhi is pervaded by the probans, because of the absence of the absence of audibility restricted by substantiality in the tangible, due to the absence of substantiality.

original: ata eva sudhāyāṃkvicitsādhyāvacchedakāvacchinnasyopādhyabhāvasya hetutvādyathā vāyuḥ spārśano na dravyatve satyacākṣuṣatvāditi kvacitpadaṃ
analyzed: atas eva sudhāyām kvicid sādhya avacchedaka avacchinnasya upādhi abhāvasya hetu tvāt yathā vāyuḥ spārśanaḥ na dravya tve sati acākṣuṣa tvāt iti kvacid padam
translated: For this very reason, in the Sudhā, the absence of the upādhi, which is sometimes restricted by the qualifier of the probandum, is the reason, as in Air is tangible because of tangibility, not because of audibility, when there is substantiality, the word sometimes

analyzed: pratyuktam

translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

original: yattu sādhanavyāpakopi kvacidupādhiryatra pakṣāvṛttirhetuḥ yathā karakā pṛthivī kaṭhinasaṃyogava tvādityādāvanuṣṇāśītasparśavatvamiti/ tanna/
analyzed: yat tu sādhana vyāpakaḥ api kvacid upādhiḥ yatra pakṣa āvṛttiḥ hetuḥ yathā karakā pṛthivī kaṭhina saṃyogava tvāt ityādau anuṣṇa aśīta sparśava tvam iti tat na
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

analyzed: sparśa tva rūpa sādhanavatī iti arthaḥ
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

analyzed: atas eva asārvatrika tvāt eva sudhāyām sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam ityādeḥ vyākhyāna sudhāyām iti arthaḥ  kvacid padam prayuktam iti
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

analyzed: dravya tva viśiṣṭasya cākṣuṣa tvasya abhāvaḥ upādhiḥ iti hi prāk aktam
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.🔽In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

original: etadabhāvaśca pratipakṣaprayoge hetūkṛtya kvacitpadaṃ prayuktaṃ cetprāguktaviśiṣṭābhāvarūpopādhiprakāraśca kvacidevetyaktaṃ bhavatīti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: etad abhāvaḥ ca pratipakṣa prayoge hetūkṛtya kvacid padam prayuktam ced prāgukta viśiṣṭa abhāva rūpa upādhi prakāraḥ ca kvacid eva iti aktam bhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: In the example, the reason is not contradicted, but in the probandum, it is contradicted.

analyzed: etena sudhā vākyam kecitu iti upanyasta pakṣa abhiprāyeṇa iti uktam bhavati
translated: By this it is said that the statement of Sudha is with reference to the opinion of the party who has put forward the view.

analyzed: kvacid sādhana vyāpakaḥ api upādhiḥ yatra pakṣa āvṛttiḥ hetuḥ īti ādinā maṇi ukteḥ sādhana vyāpaka yāpi upādhi tvāt katham sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam
translated: In some cases, even an upādhi which is pervaded by the reason is said to be an upādhi because it is also an upādhi which pervades the probandum, although it pervades the probans. How then is there the reverse pervasion of what is pervaded by the probandum?

analyzed: sādhanasya iti anuvyākhyāna ādau lakṣaṇa uktiḥ iti atas tam pakṣam anūdya nirāha yatu ityādinā
translated: It is said in the Anuvṛkṣṇānuvṛtti (Anuvṛkṣṇānuvṛtti) that the definition is stated in the Anuvṛkṣṇānuvṛtti (Anuvṛkṣṇānuvṛtti). In order to refute that view, he says yat etc.

analyzed: karaka iti pakṣaḥ pṛthivī iti sādhyam
translated: The subject is karaṇa (pot), the probandum is pṛthivī (earth).

original: kaṭhinasaṃyogavatvaṃ pāṣāṇādeva na tu karakakāyāṃ alpakāla eva dravībhāvadarśanāt/
analyzed: kaṭhina saṃyogava tvam pāṣāṇāt eva na tu alpa kāle eva dravībhāva darśanāt
translated: The property of being a combination of hardness exists only in stone, not in the body of the pot, because fluidity is seen even for a short time.

original: pakṣāvṛttiścāyaṃ hetuḥ/🔽hetoḥ pakṣavṛttitve tavdyāpakasyopādherapi pakṣavṛttitayā tavdyatirekasya svarūpāsiddhatvena
analyzed: pakṣa āvṛttiḥ ca ayam hetuḥ  hetoḥ pakṣa vṛtti tve tad vyāpakasya upādheḥ api pakṣa vṛtti tayā tad vyatirekasya svarūpa asiddha tvena
translated: And this reason is present in the subject.🔽If the reason is present in the subject, then even the upādhi which pervades it would be present in the subject, and its vyatireka (absence in dissimilar instances) would be self-contradictory.

analyzed: sva vyāvṛtti balena pakṣāt sādhya vyāvṛtti saṃpādanasya aśakya tayā dūṣaka tvam upādheḥ na syāt
translated: Therefore, the upādhi could not be a fault, because it is impossible to accomplish the exclusion of the probandum from the subject by the power of its own exclusion.

analyzed: iti yatra pakṣa āvṛttiḥ hetuḥ iti uktam
translated: Thus it is said that the reason is present in the subject.

analyzed: anuṣṇā iti
translated: Anuṣṇa etc.

original: yatra pṛthivītvaṃ ghaṭādau tatrānuṣṇāśītasparśavatvamiti sādhyāvyāpakam/🔽yatra kaṭhinasaṃyogavatvaṃ ghaṭādāveva tatrānuṣṇāśītasparśavatvamiti sādhyāvyāpakam/
analyzed: yatra pṛthivī tvam ghaṭa ādau tatra anuṣṇa aśīta sparśava tvam iti sādhya avyāpakam  yatra kaṭhina saṃyogavat tvam ghaṭa ādau eva tatra anuṣṇa aśīta sparśava tvam iti sādhya avyāpakam
translated: Where there is earthness in a pot, there is the absence of the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold, so it is not pervaded by the conclusion.🔽Where there is the quality of being a combination with the hard in a pot, there is the absence of the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold, so it is not pervaded by the conclusion.

analyzed: yatra kaṭhina saṃyogavatvam ghaṭa ādau eva tatra anuṣṇa aśīta sparśavatvam iti api
translated: Where there is the quality of being a combination with the hard in a pot, there is the absence of the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold, so it is

analyzed: niyamāt sādhana vyāpakam ca
translated: pervaded by the means of knowledge.

analyzed: pṛthivī vayvoḥ anuṣṇa aśīta sparśava tva upagamāt iti bhāvaḥ  śava tva rūṭhaḍa vasādhyaṭaṭhaḍa tra pṛthivī tvam iti api ṭaṭhaḍa
translated: The idea is that earth and air are accepted as having the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold.🔽The quality of being a combination with the hard is not an upādhi in the proof of the earth as having the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold.

analyzed: asya upādhi tve ghaṭaḥ pṛthivī kaṭhina saṃyogavat tvāt iti atra api upādhi tva āpātāt
translated: If it were an upādhi, then in the proof of the pot as earth because of having the quality of being a combination with the hard, it would also be an upādhi.

original: na hi sa eva dharmastasminneva sādhye pakṣabhedamātreṇopādhiranupādhiśca bhavati/
analyzed: na hi saḥ eva dharmaḥ tasmin eva sādhye pakṣa bheda mātreṇa upādhiḥ anupādhiḥ ca bhavati
translated: For that very quality, in that very probandum, does not become an upādhi or non-upādhi merely by the difference of the subject.

analyzed: anuṣṇa aśīta sparśa abhāvasya sādhya abhāva sādhaka tvam tu na upādhi abhāva tvāt
translated: The absence of the touch of neither-hot-nor-cold being a prover of the absence of the probandum is not due to the absence of being an upādhi.

analyzed: sādhana vyāpakasya api upādhi tve tiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because if that which is pervaded by the reason were also a counter-example, there would be an overextension.

analyzed: kintu pratipakṣa antaravat svatas eva sādhya abhāva vyāpta tvāt
translated: But because it is pervaded by the absence of the probandum by itself, like another counter-example.

analyzed: na hi sarvaḥ api pratipakṣaḥ upādhi abhāva rūpaḥ
translated: For not all counter-examples are in the form of the absence of a counter-example.

analyzed: iti sva abhimata upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus, the general definition of an upādhi is accepted.

original: nanvekatropādhitve 'nyatrāpi kuta ityata āha na hīti//
analyzed: nanu ekatra upādhi tve nyatra api kutas iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: If something is an upādhi in one case, why not in another? To this he says: For if it is not so in one case, it cannot be so in another.

original: nanu bhavatyaṃ pakṣavṛttihetāvapyupādhiḥ anukūlatarkeṇa tannirāso bhaviṣyatīti cettarhi karakā pṛthivītyādāvapi tathāstu/
analyzed: nanu bhavatyam pakṣa vṛtti hetau api upādhiḥ anukūla tarkeṇa tad nirāsaḥ bhaviṣyati iti ced tarhi karakā pṛthivī ityādau api tathā astu
translated: If it is argued that although the reason is present in the subject, it is an upādhi, and its refutation will be by a favorable argument, then let it be so even in the case of karkā is earth and so on.

analyzed: na ca tatra anukūla tarkaḥ na asti iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that there is no favorable argument in that case.

original: tarhi tata eva tasya duṣṭatve kimanenālaukikena sadanumānaduṣṭatāpādakena sādanavyāpakasyāpyupādhitvakalpanena /
analyzed: tarhi tatas eva tasya duṣṭa tve kim anena alaukikena sat anumāna duṣṭa tā āpādakena sādana vyāpakasya api upādhi tva kalpanena
translated: Then, if it is faulty just because of that, what is the use of postulating that which is pervaded by the reason as an upādhi, which brings about the fault of being a bad inference, which is not accepted in the world?

original: nanvasya pakṣavṛttihetāvapyupādhitve ghaṭo na pṛthivī anuṣṇāśītasparśavatvābhāvājjalavaditi svābhāvena sādhyābhāvasādhanaṃ na syādityata
analyzed: nanu asya pakṣa vṛtti hetau api upādhi tve ghaṭaḥ na pṛthivī anuṣṇa aśīta sparśava tva abhāvāt jala vat iti sva abhāvena sādhya abhāva sādhanam na syāt iti atas
translated: If it is argued that if it is an upādhi even in the reason present in the subject, then the inference the pot is not earth, because it does not have the property of having a touch that is neither hot nor cold, like water would not establish the absence of the probandum,

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: [he says] because of overextension.

analyzed: dhūma ādi anumāne prameya tva ādeḥ api upādhi tā āpātāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that in the inference of smoke etc., the property of being an object of knowledge etc. would also be a counter-example.

analyzed: iti sva abhimata upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus, the general definition of a counter-example accepted by us is stated.

original: svamate ṭha /ṭa / /tatrāpyuṭha /ḍa / /syānupādhitve karakā na pṛthivī anuṣṇāśī ityasti ṭa /ṭha /
analyzed: sva mate ṭhaṭa tatra api uṭhaḍa sya an upādhi tve karakāḥ na pṛthivī an uṣṇa āśī iti asti ṭaṭha
translated: In our opinion, the definition of a counter-example is as follows: In the inference Sound is non-eternal because it is produced, like a pot, the property of being produced is a counter-example, because it is not a counter-example in the inference Sound is non-eternal because it is produced, like a pot, but is a counter-example in the inference Sound is eternal because it is incorporeal, like the universal.

analyzed: udan ādi uktaḥ ūdhi laṇaṅgaḥ
translated: The limbs of the definition of a counter-example stated by Udayana etc.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ
translated: The discussion on counter-examples.

analyzed: atha udayana ādi ukta upādhi lakṣaṇa bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the definition of a counter-example stated by Udayana etc.

analyzed: udayana ādayaḥ tu sādhyasama vyāpta tve sati sādhana avyāpakaḥ upādhiḥ iti āhuḥ tat na
translated: Udayana and others say that a counter-example is that which is co-extensive with the probandum but is not pervaded by the probans. That is not so.

analyzed: atha udayana ādi ukta upādhi lakṣaṇa bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the definition of a counter-example stated by Udayana etc.

original: anuvyākhyāne sādhyavyāpakavailomyaṃ sādhanasyetyupādhilakṣaṇoktiḥ sādhyasamavyāpakatva lakṣaṇanirāsāyetyuktvā sudhāyāṃ dūṣitam/
analyzed: anuvyākhyāne sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam sādhanasya iti upādhi lakṣaṇa uktiḥ sādhyasama vyāpaka tva lakṣaṇa nirāsāya iti uktvā sudhāyām dūṣitam
translated: In the Anvīkṣāṇī, the definition of a counter-example is stated as the absence of the probans where there is the probandum. This is stated to exclude the definition of being co-extensive with the probandum. It is refuted in the Sudhā.

analyzed: tat vi śadīkurvan āha udayana ādayaḥ tu iti
translated: Elaborating on that, he says Udayana and others.

analyzed: yadi api etat matam maṇau eva pūrvapakṣe nirastam
translated: Although this view has been refuted in the Tattvaṭīkā itself,

analyzed: tathā api adhika doṣa vivakṣayā sudhā vākya vivaraṇa cikīrṣayā ca atra punir upanyāsaḥ
translated: still, with the intention of stating more faults and with the desire to explain the statement of the Sudhā, it is presented again here.

analyzed: sama vyāpta tvam kim viṣama vyāptasya upādhi tvena śāsra kāraiḥ anupādānāt upādīyate
translated: Is the sameness of pervasion accepted as the definition of the pādhya on the ground that the authors of the śāstras have not accepted the heterogeneous pervasion as the pādhya,

original: uta dūṣakatābījasya samavyāpta eva saṃbhavena viṣamavyāptopādherabhāvāt/ atha
analyzed: uta dūṣaka tā bījasya sama vyāptaḥ eva saṃbhavena viṣama vyāpta upādheḥ abhāvāt atha
translated: or because the seed of the fault lies only in the sameness of pervasion, and there is no heterogeneous pervasion pādhya, or

analyzed: sva saṃbandhena yaḥ svīyam dharmam anyatra darśayet
translated: he who, by his own connection, shows his own property elsewhere,

analyzed: saḥ upādhiḥ yathā loke japa ādiḥ sphaṭika ādiṣu
translated: he is the pādhya, just as the muttering of mantras etc. is in the case of crystal etc. in the world.

analyzed: tva bhrama hetu tā
translated: Here also, the pādhya of the hetu would be the cause of the confusion of pervasion with the meaning of the word anya.

analyzed: upādheḥ syāt
translated: The pādhya would be...

analyzed: ityādi uktyā yaḥ samīpa sthite hetau svadharmam vyāpya tvam ādadhāti iti upādhi padasya anvartha tva iddhi artham
translated: In this way, the word pādhya is meaningful in the sense that it places its own property, which is pervasion, in the hetu that is nearby.

analyzed: yat vā pakṣa itaratva sya upādhi tva nivṛti artham iti
translated: Or, in order to remove the pādhyatva of being other than the pakṣa.

analyzed: ādyam nirāha śāstre iti
translated: He rejects the first by saying in the śāstra.

analyzed: tva pakṣāṇām ṭha dvi vṛṇvan āhaṭha kyam vivṛṇvan vikīrṇa vācā atraṭha vyāpya tva ṭha vikalpya iti
translated: of the opponents. That is the fault. He explains it. He explains the doubt here with scattered words. The pervasion of the pakṣa. He explains the doubt. It is to be imagined.

analyzed: pūritamṭha
translated: It is filled.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: śāsre pārthiva paramāṇu rūpa ādayaḥ nityāḥ paramāṇu viśeṣa guṇa tvāt āpya paramāṇu rūpa vat ityādau pṛthivī viśeṣaṇa guṇa tva abhāva ādeḥ viṣama vyāptasya api upādhi tva svīkārāt
translated: In the treatise, earth, atoms, form, etc. are eternal because they are qualities of atoms, like the form of water atoms, etc., because even the dissimilar pervasion of the absence of being a quality that qualifies earth is accepted as a reason.

analyzed: sama vyāpti abhāve api vakṣyamāṇa rītyā sādhya vyāpaka tva ādi mātreṇa pratipakṣa ādi unnāyaka tva saṃbhavena dūṣaka tā bīja sāmyāt ca
translated: Even in the absence of similar pervasion, because it is possible to raise counter-arguments etc. by mere pervasion of the conclusion etc. in the manner to be stated, and because of the similarity of the seed of fault.

original: sādhyavyāpyatvarūpasvadharmasya sādhane pratibimbajanakatvarūpāvayavārthābhāvepi lābhādyupādhinā kṛtamityādāviva rūḍhyopādhipadaprayogopatteśca//
analyzed: sādhya vyāpya tva rūpa svadharmasya sādhane pratibimba janaka tva rūpa avayavārtha abhāve pi lābha ādi upādhinā kṛtam ityādau iva rūḍhyā upādhi pada prayoga upatteḥ ca
translated: And because it is possible to use the word reason figuratively, as in it is done by the reason of gain etc. even in the absence of the meaning of the component parts in the form of the ability to produce a reflection in the proof of one's own property in the form of being pervaded by the conclusion.

original: kiñca na śāstre lokavyāvahārārthamupādhivyutpādanam/🔽kintvanumādūṣaṇārthamiti viṣamavyāptike upādhiśabdaḥ pāribhāṣikostu/
analyzed: kiñca na śāstre loka vyāvahāra artham upādhi vyutpādanam  kintu anumā dūṣaṇa artham iti viṣama vyāptike upādhi śabdaḥ pāribhāṣikaḥ ustu
translated: Moreover, the reason is not taught in the treatise for the sake of worldly usage.🔽But for the sake of refuting inference. Let the word reason be technical in the case of dissimilar pervasion.

analyzed: niścita sādhyaka ādau sapakṣa ādi śabda vat sama vyāpte vayava arthasya satvena anyatra gauṇaḥ vā astu
translated: Like the words similar and dissimilar in the case of what is certain to have the conclusion etc., let it be secondary elsewhere, because the meaning of the component parts exists in the case of similar pervasion.

analyzed: viṣama vyāptasya iti
translated: Of the dissimilar pervasion.

original: yatra nityatvaṃ tatra pārthivaviśeṣaṇaguṇatvābhāvo jalaparamāṇvādāveti sādhyavyāpakatvamiva yatra pārthivaviśeṣaṇaguṇatvābhāvastatra nityatvamiti
analyzed: yatra nitya tvam tatra pārthiva viśeṣaṇa guṇa tva abhāvaḥ jala paramāṇu ādau eti sādhya vyāpaka tvam iva yatra pārthiva viśeṣaṇa guṇa tva abhāvaḥ tatra nitya tvam iti
translated: Where there is permanence, there is the absence of being a quality of a particular earth substance, as in the case of water atoms. Thus, there is pervasion by the probandum. Where there is the absence of being a quality of a particular earth substance, there is permanence.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādau vyabhicārāt atas viṣama vyāptasya iti uktam
translated: But this is fallacious, as there is deviation in the case of a pot, etc. Therefore, it is said to have unequal pervasion.

analyzed: dvitīye nirāha sama iti  vakṣyamāṇā iti
translated: In the second case, he says same etc.🔽To be stated etc.

analyzed: dūṣaka tā bīja ukti prastāvaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is the occasion for stating the seed of refutation.

analyzed: tṛtīyam pratyāha sādhyā iti
translated: In response to the third, he says probandum etc.

analyzed: nanu
translated: But

analyzed: bhavetām yadi vṛkṣasya vāji karṇau kathañcana
translated: let them be, if the horse's ears are somehow of the tree.

original: adṛṣṭāṃ samudāyasya kaḥ śaktiṃ jātu kalpayet//
analyzed: adṛṣṭām samudāyasya kaḥ śaktim jātu kalpayet
translated: Who would ever imagine an unseen power of the whole?

original: iti nyāyenāvayavārthasaṃbhave rūḍhikalpanā na yuktetyataḥ maṇyuktadoṣāntaraṃ cāha kiñceti//
analyzed: iti nyāyena avayava artha saṃbhave rūḍhi kalpanā na yuktā iti atas maṇi ukta doṣa antaram ca āha kiñca iti
translated: Thus, it is not proper to assume a conventional meaning when the literal meaning is possible. Therefore, he states another fault mentioned in the Mīmāṃsā Sūtras, beginning with Moreover etc.

analyzed: sudhā uktam āha sama vyāptaḥ iti
translated: He says what is stated in the Pūrva Mīmāṃsā Śāstra, beginning with equally pervaded etc.

analyzed: caturtham śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He raises the fourth doubt with But etc.

analyzed: udan ādi uktaḥ ūdhi laṇaṅgaḥ
translated: The argument stated by Udayana is a limb of the argument.

analyzed: upādhi vādaḥ
translated: The discussion on the qualifier.

analyzed: viṣama vyāptikasya dūṣaṇa tve eva hi mama abhiniveśaḥ
translated: Indeed, my insistence is only on the faultiness of that which has unequal pervasion.

analyzed: na tu tatra upādhi śabdasya mukhya tve pi
translated: Not even if the word upādhi is primary there.

original: nanu viṣamavyāpta syopādhitve bādhānunnītapakṣetaropyupādhiḥ syāditi cenna/
analyzed: nanu viṣamavyāpta sya upādhi tve bādhā anunnīta pakṣa itaraḥ api upādhiḥ syāt iti ced na
translated: If it be said that if there be the character of being concomitant with the dissimilar, then even the dissimilar instance would be an upādhi, because of the annulment of the similar instance, (we say) no.

analyzed: anumāne anukūla tarka satve iṣṭa āpatteḥ
translated: Because in an inference, if there be a reason which is favourable, the undesirable contingency is admitted.

analyzed: tad sattve upādhiḥ sādhya avyāpaka tva niścayāt
translated: Because in that case, the upādhi is ascertained to be non-pervading the probandum.

original: anyathā tavāpi śabdobhidheyaḥ prameyatvādityādāvaśabdatvādeḥ samavyāpta pakṣetarasya nirāso na syāt/
analyzed: anyathā tava api śabdaḥ abhidheyaḥ prameya tvāt ityādau aśabda tva ādeḥ sama vyāpta pakṣa itarasya nirāsaḥ na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even for you, in the case of the inference that sound is expressible because it is an object of knowledge, etc., the dissimilar instance, non-soundness, etc., which are equally pervasive, could not be excluded.

original: ata evānuvyākhyāne sādhya vyāpakatvamevoktam na tu samavyāptiḥ//
analyzed: atas eva anuvyākhyāne sādhya vyāpaka tvam eva uktam na tu sama vyāptiḥ
translated: For this very reason, in the Anuvṛtti, it is said that the upādhi is that which pervades the probandum, but not that which is equally pervasive.

analyzed: kecid tu vyatireki dharma tvam upādhi sāmānya lakṣaṇam
translated: But some say that the general definition of upādhi is that it is a property which is absent in the dissimilar instances.

analyzed: śuddha sādhya vyāpaka tva avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka tva ādīni tu viśeṣa lakṣaṇāḥ ni iti āhuḥ
translated: And the specific definitions are that it is that which pervades the pure probandum, that which pervades the probandum qualified by the absence of the probans, etc.

original: tanna/🔽vyatirekidharmatvasyātrāyamupādhiriti vyavahārāhetutvāt/ 🔽bādhasthale sarvaṃ tejo 'nuṣṇaṃ padārthatvādityādau atejastvādirūpasya pakṣetara
analyzed: tat na  vyatireki dharma tvasya atra ayam upādhiḥ iti vyavahāra ahetutvāt
translated: That is not correct.🔽Because the property of being absent in the dissimilar instances is not the reason for the usage this is an upādhi here.

analyzed: tvasya upādhi tva svīkārāt bādhā anunnītā iti uktam
translated: Because in the case of annulment, in the case of the inference all that is luminous is not hot, because it is a substance, etc., the property of being non-luminous, etc., which is the property of the dissimilar instance, is accepted as an upādhi, it is said because of the annulment of the similar instance.

analyzed: anuvyākhyāne iti
translated: In the Anuvṛtti means

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam iti anuvyākhyāne
translated: in the Anuvṛtti, in the passage being the reverse of what pervades the probandum.

analyzed: vyatireki dharma tvam iti
translated: The property of being different from the absence of the probandum.
The meaning is: the property which is the counter-correlate of the absence.

analyzed: dharma tva mātrasya prameya tva ādau api satvāt vyatireki iti uktam
translated: Since the mere property is present even in the probandum of inference like 'cognisability', 'different' is said.

original: śuddheti//🔽śuddha vyāpakatvavyāpakatāvacchedakāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakatvasādhanāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakatvaghaṭitānītyarthaḥ / 🔽hipadaṃ na ga /ṭa /rā / /ptakasyoka /ga /ṭa /rā / /ptatve paga /rā / /dhyāvyārā /🔽ṇādīniga /rā / /rasyoṭa /ḍa / /śuddheti iti nāsti ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / /sādhyetyadhikam
analyzed: śuddhā iti                                    hi padam na gaṭarā ptakasya ukagaṭarā pta tve pagarā  ṇa ādi nigarāḥ śuddha iti iti na asti sādhyā iti adhikam
