translated: And thus, according to your view, the greater strength of the perceptual means of knowledge in this case should not be imagined from the powerful means of knowledge.

original: tvadaṅgīkṛtavyāptijñānakaraṇatvabalādapi viśiṣṭajñānaṃ madhye kāraṇatvenopeyamityāha kiñca viśiṣṭajñānābhāva iti//
analyzed: tvad aṅgīkṛta vyāpti jñāna karaṇa tva balāt api viśiṣṭa jñānam madhye kāraṇa tvena upeyam iti āha kiñca viśiṣṭa jñāna abhāve iti
translated: He says that the knowledge of the qualified should be accepted as the middle cause by the power of being the cause of the knowledge of pervasion accepted by you. And he says: Moreover, in the absence of the knowledge of the qualified...

analyzed: asārvatrika tvāt iti
translated: Because it is not universal.

analyzed: saṃśa sthale eva tarka avatārasya ukta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the entry of reasoning is stated only in the case of doubt.

analyzed: vyāpti jñāna janya tvāt iti
translated: Because it is produced by the knowledge of pervasion.

original: tajjanyajanakatve sati tajjanyasyaivavyāpāratvāditi bhāvaḥ/🔽anvayavyabhicārācca na jñānadvayasya hetutvam/
analyzed: tad janya janaka tve sati tad janyasya eva vyāpāra tvāt iti bhāvaḥ  anvaya vyabhicārāt ca na jñāna dvayasya hetu tvam
translated: The idea is that only what is produced by that which produces it is an operation.🔽And because there is deviation in the positive example, the two cognitions cannot be the cause.

original: viśiṣṭajñānasya hetutve tu na vyābhicāra iti bhāvenāha api ceti//
analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñānasya hetu tve tu na vyābhicāraḥ iti bhāvena āha api ca iti
translated: But if the knowledge of the qualified is the cause, there is no deviation. With this idea, he says Moreover, etc.

original: viśiṣṭajñānahetutvāṅgīkāre 'nvayadapyanukūlitamityāha evaṃ ceti// 🔽kāraka /ṭa / /na ja ga /ṭa / / manma ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /ptamanumiti sā ka /ga / anyatrākḷptamanuṭa /rā /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñāna hetutva aṅgīkāre evam ca iti  kāra kaṭa na ja ga ṭa manma kaga ṭarā ptam anumiti sā kaga anyatra akḷptam anuṭarā
translated: When the knowledge of the qualified is accepted as the cause, the positive example is also favored. With this idea, he says Thus etc.

analyzed: prāk ta jñāt va hetu aṅgaḥ  parāmarśa vādaḥ
translated: The cause is not the effect of the cognition of the object to be inferred.🔽The doctrine of inference.

analyzed: etat api uktam viśakalitaḥ iti
translated: This is also said to be in the unseparated form.

analyzed: i kta sthale nu mitim vinā api sthite iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even without inference, it remains in the stated case.

original: kiṃ ca tvadukte jñānadvaye satyapi pakṣaniṣṭhadhūmo vahnivyāpto neti viparyaye
analyzed: kim ca tvad ukte jñāna dvaye sati api pakṣa niṣṭha dhūmaḥ vahni vyāptaḥ na iti viparyaye
translated: Moreover, even when the two cognitions stated by you are present, when there is doubt or error that the smoke located in the subject is pervaded by fire, but is not,

analyzed: saṃśaye vā sati anumiti adarśanāt tayoḥ anumiti pratibandhataka tā tāvat vaktavyā
translated: it must be said that those two are the obstacles to inference.

analyzed: jñānasya ca jñāna pratibandhaka tvam virodhi viṣaya tvena eva
translated: And the cognition's being an obstacle to cognition is only by having a contradictory object.

analyzed: tat ca dvedhā
translated: And that is twofold.

analyzed: sākṣāt anumiti viṣaya virodhi viṣa tvena vā
translated: Or by being the object of contradiction of the object of direct inference.

analyzed: tad janaka jñāna viṣaya virodhi viṣaya tvena vā
translated: Or by being the object of contradiction of the object of the knowledge that produces it.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ prakṛte na saṃbhavati
translated: Of these, the first is not possible in the present case.

analyzed: vyāpya bheda bhramasya bādha vat anumiti grāhya vahni abhāva aviṣaya tvāt  tathāca vyabhicāra jñānasya anumiti hetu vyāpti vighaṭanena iva vyāpya bheda bhramasya api anumiti hetu vyāpya abheda jñāna vighaṭanena eva anumiti pratibandhaka tvam
translated: Because the error of difference in the pervaded is not the object of the absence of fire that is to be grasped by inference, like contradiction.🔽And thus, just as the knowledge of the fallacy is the counteragent to inference by destroying the pervasion that is the cause of inference, in the same way, the error of difference in the pervaded is also the counteragent to inference by destroying the knowledge of the non-difference in the pervaded that is the cause of inference.

analyzed: vācyam iti siddham vyāpya abheda jñānasya anumiti hetu tvam
translated: Therefore, it is established that the knowledge of the non-difference in the pervaded is the cause of inference.

analyzed: sthite iti arthaḥ iti
translated: The meaning is that it is established.

original: tathā ca tādṛśe vyāptismṛtipakṣadharmatājñāne bhāvayato nānumitiriti samagravākyārtha iti bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: tathā ca tādṛśe vyāpti smṛti pakṣa dharma tā jñāne bhāvayataḥ na anumitiḥ iti samagra vākya arthaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, for one who cultivates such recollection of pervasion and knowledge of the property of the subject, there is no inference. This is the meaning of the entire sentence.

original: vyāpyabhedaviṣayakaviparyayādeḥ pratibandhakatvānyathānupapatyāpi viśiṣṭajñānahetutvasiddhiri tyāha kiṃ ca tvadukte iti//
analyzed: vyāpya bheda viṣayaka viparyaya ādeḥ pratibandhaka tva anyathā anupapatyā api viśiṣṭa jñāna hetu tva siddhiḥ iti āha kim ca tvad ukte iti
translated: Even by the non-apprehension of the counteragent of the error etc. that has the difference in the pervaded as its object, the establishment of the cause of the knowledge of the qualified is shown by saying Moreover, in what is said by you etc.

analyzed: jñānasya ca iti
translated: And of knowledge etc.

analyzed: vyāpya bheda gocara viparyaya ādi rūpa jñānasya ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that of the knowledge in the form of error etc. that has the difference in the pervaded as its object.

analyzed: vyāpya bheda iti
translated: 'Due to the difference in the pervaded' means

original: vyāpye dhūme vyāpyo neti vyāpyo vā na vetīti vyāpyabhedabhramasyetyarthaḥ/
analyzed: vyāpye dhūme vyāpyaḥ na iti vyāpyaḥ vā na vā iti iti vyāpya bheda bhramasya iti arthaḥ
translated: the error of difference in the pervaded, such as 'smoke is pervaded by fire' or 'smoke is not pervaded by fire', or 'smoke is pervaded or not pervaded' - this is the meaning.

original: dharmo vihnivyāpyo ne ga /ṭa /rā / /yakatvāṭa /rā / /jñānapadamadhikam ṭa /rā / /tyata ā ṭa /ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: dharmaḥ vihni vyāpyaḥ ne ga ṭarā ya ka tvāt ṭarā jñāna padam adhikam ṭarā tyataḥ ā
translated: The property is that fire is pervaded by smoke. The word 'jñāna' (knowledge) is added.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽yadi ca virodhyaviṣayakamapi jñānaṃ maṇyādivadvirodhi tarhyupādhinā vyabhicāro nonnīyate/
analyzed: yadi ca virodhya viṣayakam api jñānam maṇi ādi vat virodhi tarhi upādhinā vyabhicāraḥ nā unnīyate
translated: The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava (The Dance of Logic, with the Illumination of Reasoning).🔽If knowledge, even when not about a contradictory object, is contradictory like a gem, then the counter-example due to the qualifier is not inferred.

original: kintu maṇyādyabhāvo dāha iva upādhijñānābhāva evānumito hetuḥ syāt//🔽na cānumitisāmagryā balavatvājjñānadvaye satyanumitirevotpadya te/
analyzed: kintu maṇi ādi abhāvaḥ dāhaḥ iva upādhi jñāna abhāvaḥ eva anumitaḥ hetuḥ syāt  na ca anumiti sāmagryāḥ balavat tvāt jñāna dvaye sati anumitiḥ eva utpadya te
translated: But the absence of the gem, etc., like the absence of burning, would be the reason inferred as the absence of the knowledge of the qualifier.🔽And it cannot be said that because the assemblage for inference is stronger, when there is both knowledge, only inference arises,

original: na tu pratyakṣo vyapyabhedabhrama iti vācyam/
analyzed: na tu pratyakṣaḥ vyapi abheda bhramaḥ iti vācyam
translated: and not the perception of the error of difference in the pervaded.

analyzed: tasyāḥ balavat tva a saṃmateḥ
translated: Because its strength is not accepted.

analyzed: kiñca yatra tvad ukta jñāna dvaya anantaram bheda bhramaḥ tatra evam astu
translated: Moreover, where there is the error of difference immediately after the two knowledges stated by you, let it be so.

original: yatra dhūmo vahnivyāpyaḥ parvatīyadhūmaśca vahnyavyāpya iti pakṣadharmatājñānameva bhedaviṣayaṃ tvanmate vyāptyavyāptyorbhinna viṣayatvenāvirodhāt
analyzed: yatra dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ parvatīya dhūmaḥ ca vahni a vyāpyaḥ iti pakṣa dharma tā jñānam eva bheda viṣayam tvad mate vyāpti avyāptyoḥ bhinna viṣaya tvena avirodhāt
translated: Where smoke is pervaded by fire, and the mountain smoke is not pervaded by fire, the knowledge of the property of the subject itself is about the difference. But according to your view, since pervasion and non-pervasion have different objects, there is no contradiction.

analyzed: tatra bheda jñānāt pūrvam
translated: There, before the knowledge of difference,

analyzed: anumiti sāmagrī abhāvena tayā
translated: due to the absence of the complete cause for inference,

original: prakā rāntarema pratibandhakatvacodyamanūdya nirāha yadi ceti//
analyzed: prakā pratibandhaka tva codyam anūdya nirāha yadi ca iti
translated: he raises the objection of being a hindrance in a different way and refutes it, saying If it is so.

original: nanu vyāpyabhedabhrama eva nāsti yasya pratibandhakatvabalena viśiṣṭajñānahetutvasiddhirityāśaṅkāṃ nirāha na cānumitīti//
analyzed: nanu vyāpya bheda bhramaḥ eva na asti yasya pratibandhaka tva balena viśiṣṭa jñāna hetutva siddhiḥ iti āśaṅkām nirāha na ca anumiti iti
translated: Now, there is no delusion about the difference of the pervaded at all, by the power of which the cause of the knowledge of the qualified is established. He refutes this doubt, saying And also, the inference...

analyzed: abhyupetya api balavatvam anumiti sāmagrī abhāva sthale viparyaya ādi balāt viśiṣṭa jñāna hetutva siddhiḥ iti āha kiñca yatra iti
translated: Even accepting the strength, the establishment of being the cause of the knowledge of the qualified is by the power of error etc. in the case of the absence of the complete cause for inference. He says Moreover, where...

analyzed: evam astu iti
translated: Let it be so.

analyzed: anumiti samāgrī balavat tvena vyāpya bheda bhrama anutpādaḥ ustu iti arthaḥ
translated: Let the non-production of the delusion about the difference of the pervaded be due to the strength of the complete cause for inference. This is the meaning.

analyzed: dhūmaḥ iti
translated: Smoke...

analyzed: vyāpti grahaṇa sthalīyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that which is in the place of grasping pervasion.

original: virodhātkathamevaṃ bhrama ityata āha tvanmata iti//
analyzed: virodhāt katham evam bhramaḥ iti atas āha tvad mate iti
translated: How can there be such a delusion due to contradiction? Therefore he says According to your view...

original: sāmānyapratyāsatteranaṅgīkāreṇa parvataniṣṭhadhūme vyāptegraheṇa tatra vyāpye bhedabhrame bādhakābhāvāt//
analyzed: sāmānya pratyāsatteḥ anaṅgīkāreṇa parvata niṣṭha dhūme vyāpteḥ graheṇa tatra vyāpye bheda bhrame bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because of not accepting the general relation, there is no contradiction in the error of difference in the pervaded there by the apprehension of pervasion in the smoke located in the mountain.

original: tarhe ṭa /rā / /dyeta ga /rā / /trasu dhūrā /ka / /jñānapadamadhikam rā / /nna niṣṭhatvenā ṭa /rā / /pramāṇānta ḍa / /pyabhe ṭa /ḍa /
analyzed: tarhe ṭarā dyeta garā trasu dhūrāka jñāna padam adhikam rā nna niṣṭha tvena ṭarā pramāṇa anta ḍa pya bhe ṭaḍa
translated: Then, in the knowledge of smoke, the word fire would be redundant. If it is not based on the knowledge, there would be another means of knowledge.

analyzed: prāk ta jñāt va hetu aṅgaḥ
translated: The prior knowledge is the cause.

analyzed: parāmarśa vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of inference.

analyzed: na pratibandhaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: The relation is not proper.

original: na ca dhūmatvajñānarūpasya vā dhūmo vahnivyāpya iti jñānarūpasya vā viśeṣadarśanasya satvānna vyāpyabhedabhrama iti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca dhūma tva jñāna rūpasya vā dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ iti jñāna rūpasya vā viśeṣa darśanasya satvāt na vyāpya bheda bhramaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that there is no error of difference in the pervaded due to the existence of the knowledge in the form of smoke-ness or the knowledge in the form smoke is pervaded by fire is the special observation.

analyzed: svarūpeṇa dhūma tva jñānasya avirodhi tvāt
translated: Because the knowledge of smoke-ness in its own form is not contradictory.

original: vyāptivyāpyatvena jñānasya tu virodhitve tasyāyaṃ dhūmavāniti pakṣadharmatājñāne 'bhāvāt/
analyzed: vyāpti vyāpya tvena jñānasya tu virodhi tve tasya ayam dhūmavān iti pakṣa dharma tā jñāne bhāvāt
translated: But if the knowledge in the form of pervasion and pervaded is contradictory, then it does not exist in the knowledge of the subject of this smoke as having fire.

original: dhūmo vahnivyāpya iti jñānasya ca tvanmate bhinnaviṣayakatvenāpratibandhakatvāt/
analyzed: dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ iti jñānasya ca tvad mate bhinna viṣayaka tvena apratibandhaka tvāt
translated: And the knowledge in the form smoke is pervaded by fire is not a counteragent according to your view, because it has a different object.

analyzed: na ca bhinna viṣayaka tve pi samāna prakāraka tva mātreṇa pratibandhaka tvam
translated: And even if it has a different object, it is not a counteragent merely by having the same form.

original: prameyaṃ ghaṭavaditi jñānena prameye gṛhe ghaṭo neti dhīpratibandhāpātāt//
analyzed: prameyam ghaṭa vat iti jñānena prameye gṛhe ghaṭaḥ na iti dhī pratibandha āpātāt
translated: Because in the cognition the object of knowledge is like a pot, there would be an obstruction to the cognition there is no pot in the house with respect to the object of knowledge.

analyzed: etat api uktam viśakitaḥ iti
translated: This is also said to be doubtful.

analyzed: vyāpya bhrameṇa pratibaddhe iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is obstructed by a false cognition of what is pervaded.

original: sāmagryabhāvepi viśeṣadarśanameva bhramapratibandhakamityāśaṅkya nirāha na ca dhūmatveti//
analyzed: sāmagrī abhāve api viśeṣa darśanam eva bhrama pratibandhakam iti āśaṅkya nirāha na ca dhūma tva iti
translated: Even in the absence of the complete set of conditions, the perception of a particular is itself the obstruction to error. Fearing this, he denies it, saying Nor is the cognition of smoke and so on.

analyzed: samāna prakāraka tva iti  dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ iti jñānasya
translated: Having the same form.🔽The cognition smoke is pervaded by fire and the cognition the smoke on the mountain is not pervaded both have the form of smoke. Thus, there is the relation of what is obstructed and what obstructs.

analyzed: vyāpyaḥ na iti asya ca dhūma tva prakāraka tvāt pratibadhya pratibandhaka bhāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: mātra padena ca samāna viśeṣyaka tvam vyāvartyate
translated: And by the word mere, having the same qualifier is excluded.

analyzed: iti arthaḥ iti
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: samaga vākya arthaḥ pūrvavat draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The meaning of the entire sentence should be seen as before.

original: kvacidviśiṣṭajñānasya hetutāyāḥ kḷptatvādanyatrāpi tathetibhāvena tasya kviciddhetutvamāha api ceti//
analyzed: kvacid viśiṣṭa jñānasya hetutāyāḥ kḷpta tvāt anyatra api tathā iti bhāvena tasya kvicid hetutvam āha api ca iti
translated: In some cases, the knowledge of what is qualified is established as the cause, so it is in other cases also. With this idea, he states its causality in some cases, saying Moreover.

analyzed: na padam yukta padāt prāk astikagaṭarā tvepita gaṭarā te iti gaṭarāya bheda padam adhikam kagaṭarā dhūma tva jñāna rūpasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The knowledge in the form of smoke-ness is the meaning.

analyzed: iti adhikam ṭha
translated: Iti (thus) is additional.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: api ca yatra dhūmadarśanaṃ vināpi śabdādinā vyaptismṛtimataḥ puṃsaḥ smṛtavyāptisannikṛṣṭadhūmatva🔽yorvaiśiṣṭyaṃ pratyakṣajñānena vahnivyāpyadhūmavānayamiti śābdajñānena ca yugapadeva
analyzed: api ca yatra dhūma darśanam vinā api śabda ādinā vyapti smṛtimataḥ puṃsaḥ smṛta vyāpti sannikṛṣṭa dhūma tva
translated: Moreover, where a person remembers the pervasion by means of words etc. even without seeing smoke, and the specific nature of the smoke near the remembered pervasion

analyzed: gṛhyate tatra api anumitiḥ tāvat dṛśyate
translated: is grasped simultaneously by the perception of the knowledge This has smoke pervaded by fire and by the verbal knowledge, even there, inference is indeed seen.

analyzed: tatra ca vyāpya tva prakāraka pakṣa dharma tā jñāna tvena eva hetutā vācyā  lāghavāt
translated: And there, the reason should be stated only as the knowledge of the subject having the form of pervasion, due to simplicity.

analyzed: vyāpya tā avacchedaka tvasya vyāpya tā garbhita tvena vyāpya tāyāḥ āvaśyaka tvāt ca
translated: Because the delimitor of pervasion is included in pervasion, and pervasion is necessary.

analyzed: na tu vyāpya tā avacchedaka prakāraka pakṣa dhma tā jñāna tvena
translated: But not as the knowledge of the subject having the form of the delimitor of pervasion.

analyzed: gauravāt
translated: Because of complexity.

analyzed: an āvaśka tvāt ca
translated: And because it is not necessary.

analyzed: jñāna dvaya rūpa anumiti sāmagrī para abhimatā vaktum dhūma darśanam vinā api iti uktam
translated: The collection of two cognitions in the form of inference, accepted by the opponent, is said to be possible even without seeing smoke.

analyzed: smṛtā iti
translated: By 'recollection'

analyzed: smṛta vyāptiḥ ca sannikṛṣṭa dhūmaḥ ca tayoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: it means the remembered pervasion and the proximate smoke, that is, those two.

original: nanu tatrāpyanumitidhaśāyāṃ tāvatā viśiṣṭajñānatvena na hetutā kintu
analyzed: nanu tatra api anumiti dhaśāyām tāvatā viśiṣṭa jñāna tvena na hetutā kintu
translated: But even there, in the state of inference, the specific knowledge is not the reason by that much, but

analyzed: vyāpya tā avacchedaka prakāraka pakṣa dhma tā jñāna tvena eva
translated: only by the knowledge of the subject qualified by the determiner of the pervaded.

original: tathāca jñānadvayasthala ivāsmadabhimatakāraṇatāvacchedakaṃ tatrāpyakṣatamevetyata āha tatra ceti//
analyzed: tathāca jñāna dvaya sthale iva asmad abhimata kāraṇatā avacchedakam tatra api akṣatam eva iti atas āha tatra ca iti
translated: And thus, just as in the case of two cognitions, the determiner of the cause accepted by us is intact there also. Therefore, it is said 'and there'.

original: bhavatpakṣepi vyāpyatvajñānamāvaśyakamityāha vyāpyateti//🔽avacchedakatvaṃ hi vyāpyatveneha vyāptiranyasyānupayogādityuktadiśā vyāpyatāgarbhitatvanetyarthaḥ/
analyzed: bhavat pakṣe api vyāpya tva jñānam āvaśyakam iti āha vyāpya tā iti  avacchedaka tvam hi vyāpya tvena iha vyāptiḥ anyasya anupayogāt iti ukta diśā vyāpya tā garbhita tvanā iti arthaḥ
translated: Even in your view, the knowledge of the pervaded is necessary. It is said 'by the pervaded'🔽The determiner is here pervaded by the pervaded, because anything else is not useful. The meaning is that it is included in the pervaded.

analyzed: evakāra vyāvartyam āha na tu iti
translated: The excluded by the word 'only' is said 'not'.

analyzed: anāvaśyaka tvāt ca iti
translated: And because it is not necessary.

analyzed: yathā vyāpya tā avacchedaka tva jñāne vyāpya tva jñānam āvaśyakam
translated: Just as in the knowledge of the determiner of the pervaded, the knowledge of the pervaded is necessary,🔽we have a doubt.

analyzed: yathā
translated: As the determiner is pervaded by the pervaded,

analyzed: prāk ta jñāt va hetu aṅgaḥ
translated: the prior knowledge of the two is a part of the reason.

original: parāmarśavādaḥ pu / 🔽nanu vyāptāvapi vyāptirahitāvṛttitvarūpaṃ vyāpyatāvacchedakatmastīti vyāpyatāvacchedakaṃ
analyzed: parāmarśa vādaḥ  nanu vyāptau api vyāpti rahita vṛtti tva rūpam vyāpya tā avacchedaka tma asti iti vyāpya tā avacchedakam
translated: The theory of superimposition is next.🔽But even in the case of pervasion, there is the nature of the determiner of the pervaded, which is in the form of non-occurrence in the absence of pervasion, so the determiner of pervasion

original: tvaprakārakatvaṃ sāmānyaṃ vyāptayāprakārakatvaṃ tu viśeṣaḥ na ca sāmānyasya prayojakatvasambhave
analyzed: tu aprakāraka tvam sāmānyam vyāptayā aprakāraka tvam tu viśeṣaḥ na ca sāmānyasya prayojaka tva sambhave
translated: is the universal of having the form of that, but having pervasion without having the form of that is the particular. And if the universal can be the cause,

analyzed: viśeṣasya tat yuktam iti ced na
translated: it is not proper for the particular to be so. If this is argued, it is not so.

original: vyāpyau tu tvaduktasya vyāpyatāvacchedakatvasya satvepi vyāptitvena jñānamātreṇānimitidarśanena vyāpyatāvacchedakatvena vyāptijñānasyānumityahetutvāt/
analyzed: vyāpyau tu tvad uktasya vyāpya tā avacchedaka tvasya satve pi vyāpti tvena jñāna mātreṇa animiti darśanena vyāpya tā avacchedaka tvena vyāpti jñānasya anumiti ahetu tvāt
translated: Even though there is the determiner of pervasion as stated by you in the pervaded, because of the observation that there is no inference by mere knowledge of pervasion as pervasion, the knowledge of pervasion as the determiner of pervasion is not the cause of inference.

original: tvayau pādhikadharma rūpasya vyāpāratvasya sāmānyatvepi tadvihāya lāghavena jātirūpakṛtitvasyaivākhyātaśakyatāvacchedakatvasvīkārācca//
analyzed: rūpasya vyāpāra tvasya sāmānya tve pi tat vihāya lāghavena jāti rūpa kṛti tvasya eva ākhyāta śakya tā avacchedaka tva svīkārāt ca
translated: And even though the nature of the operation in the form of the additional property stated by you is a universal, the relation of being denoted by the verb is accepted as the determiner of the object denoted by the verb, by setting it aside and by the simplicity of the nature of the universal.

analyzed: etat api uktam sudhāyām yadā tu gṛhīta vyāpteḥ vinā api
translated: This is also stated in Sudha: When for one who has grasped the pervasion, even without the knowledge of the determiner of the pervaded,

analyzed: vyāpya tā avacchedaka prakāraka tva jñānam āvaśyakam
translated: it is necessary to have the knowledge of the determiner of the pervaded.

analyzed: dhūma tvena dhūmasya rūpa viśeṣyaka vyāpya tva prakāraka jñāna viṣaye tad anupraveśa abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that smoke is not included in the cognition of the form the particular form of smoke is pervaded by the form of the property to be inferred.

analyzed: tad anupraveśām āśaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He suspects the inclusion of that in the cognition of the form the particular form of smoke is pervaded by the form of the property to be inferred, saying But is it not so?

analyzed: vyāpti rahite pāṣāṇa ādau avṛtti tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it does not occur in a stone which lacks pervasion.

analyzed: sāmānyam iti
translated: General means

analyzed: vyāpya tva prakāraka jñāna viṣaye vyāptau api satvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the property to be inferred. The idea is that it exists in pervasion, which is the object of the cognition that has the form of the property to be inferred.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ iti
translated: Particular means

analyzed: ayam dhūmavān ityādi vyāpya tā avacchedaka dhūma tva prakārake jñāne vyāpya tva prakāraka tva abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the cognition that has the form of smoke, which is the differentia of the property to be inferred, in the cognition this has smoke, etc. The idea is that it does not have the form of the property to be inferred.

original: sāmānyaviśeṣābhāve satyapi lāghavādviśeṣasyaiva prayojakatvaṃ vācyamiti bhāvenāha tvayeti//
analyzed: sāmānya viśeṣa abhāve sati api lāghavāt viśeṣasya eva prayojaka tvam vācyam iti bhāvena āha tvayā iti
translated: With the idea that even in the absence of the general and the particular, the particular alone should be stated as the cause due to its being less, he says by you

analyzed: etat api uktam iti
translated: This is also said

original: yuktipāda evāpicetyādinoktaṃprameyamuktamityarthaḥ// 🔽kapra ka /ṭa /rā / /tu itinaga /ṭa /rā / /pyatvenaka / ptatvenarā / /yāsau ka /gar / /masya vyāpyatvasyaga /rā / /kajñānatvamityastiṭha /
analyzed: yuktipādaḥ eva api ca ityādinā uktam prameyam uktam iti arthaḥ  tu tu iti naga ṭarā yā asau ka ga masya
translated: The meaning is that the proposition stated by the words but it is also said in the chapter on reasoning is stated.🔽The knowledge of the pervasion of that which is to be inferred is the knowledge of the pervasion of the property to be inferred.🔽The word knowledge is not used,

analyzed: jñāna padam naṭa yañcadhū ḍa
translated: and the word smoke is not used.
The Nyāyavārttika of Uddyotakara, with the commentary Nyāyakandalī of Śrīdhara.

analyzed: liṅga darśanāt vai hni ādinā eva vyāpti smṛtiḥ iti
translated: The pervasion is remembered only through the inferential mark such as smoke.

original: nana yatra liṅgapakṣādikamasannikṛṣṭamatīndriyaṃ vā tatra kathaṃ parāmarśaḥ /
analyzed: yatra liṅga pakṣa ādikam asannikṛṣṭam atīndriyam vā tatra katham parāmarśaḥ
translated: If it is asked how there can be a judgment in the case where the inferential mark, the subject, etc. are not in contact or are beyond the senses,

original: pratyakṣasyāsambhavāt ānumānikatve cānavasthānāditi cettavāpi kathaṃ tatra pakṣatājñānam/
analyzed: pratyakṣasya asambhavāt ānumānika tve ca anavasthānāt iti ced tava api katham tatra pakṣa tā jñānam
translated: because perception is impossible and if it were inferential, there would be an infinite regress, then how can there be the knowledge of the subject in your case also?

original: kathaṃ ca sa parvato vahnivyāpyadhūmavān paramāṇurnityatvavyāpyaniravayavadravyatvavāniti jñānaṃ tathā vyavahāraśca//
analyzed: katham ca sa parvataḥ vahni vyāpya dhūmavān paramāṇuḥ nitya tva vyāpya niravayava dravya tvavān iti jñānam tathā vyavahāraḥ ca
translated: And how can there be the knowledge and usage that that mountain has smoke pervaded by fire, and that the atom has indivisibility pervaded by permanence?

analyzed: nanu tatra kavi kāvya ādi nirmāṇa hetu bhūta jñāna vat mānasam eva pakṣa dharmatā jñānam
translated: If it is said that there the knowledge of the subject having the property is mental only, like the knowledge that is the cause of the composition of a poet's poem,

analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñāna hetutā vāde kvacid sāmagrī abhāvena tad utpatti bādhakam āśaṅkya pratibandya uttarayati  nanu ityādinā
translated: suspecting the absence of the collection as an impediment to the arising of that in the doctrine of the cause of a qualified knowledge, he answers with a counter-question beginning with how etc.

analyzed: tava api iti
translated: In your case also means

analyzed: jñāna dvaya hetutā vādinā api iti arthaḥ
translated: in the case of one who advocates the cause of two knowledges.

analyzed: nyāyamata āśayena āha kathañca iti
translated: With the intention of the Nyāya doctrine, he says how etc.

analyzed: yat vā tad mate api kvacid viśiṣṭa jñāna sattvasya ukta diśā aṅgīkārāt tad āśayena iyam uktiḥ
translated: Or, even according to that view, this statement is made with that intention, because the existence of a qualified cognition somewhere is accepted in the stated manner.

analyzed: paramāṇuḥ iti
translated: As for the atom, etc.,

analyzed: kathañca iti anukarṣaḥ
translated: and how? is a continuation.

analyzed: tathā iti
translated: As for that, etc.,

analyzed: vyāpya dhūmavān ityādi vyavahāraḥ ca iti arthaḥ
translated: means the usage such as having the pervaded smoke, etc.

analyzed: tādṛśa jñāna sādhya tvāt vyavahārasya iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that this usage is accomplished by such knowledge.

analyzed: maṇi ukta diśā para mukhena uttaram vācayitvā samam iti āha nanu iti
translated: Following the statement of the opponent as stated by the jewel, he says But, etc.

original: kaveḥ kāvyanirmāṇahetubhūtajñānaṃ yathā mānasaṃ tathā mānāntaropanīte parvate mānāntaropanītadhūmasaṃsargarūpapakṣadharmatājñānaṃ
analyzed: kaveḥ kāvya nirmāṇa hetu bhūta jñānam yathā mānasam tathā māna antara upanīte parvate māna antara upanīta dhūma saṃsarga rūpa pakṣa dharma tā jñānam
translated: Just as the poet's knowledge which is the cause of composing poetry is mental, similarly, the knowledge of the relation of the property of the subject in the form of the connection of smoke brought by another means of knowledge in the mountain brought by another means of knowledge,

analyzed: mānasam vyāpti smaraṇa dhūmavatva jñānābhyām sahakṛtena manasā ca
translated: along with the mental knowledge of the pervasion remembered by the knowledge of having smoke,

original: vyāpyadhūmavānitijñānaṃ nityatvasmṛtimato niravayavatvopanāyakena tadupanaye ca paramāṇūpanāyakena paramāṇau copanīte manasā nityatvavyāpyaniravayavatvavānitijñānamastvityarthaḥ//
analyzed: vyāpya dhūmavān iti jñānam nitya tva smṛtimataḥ niravayavatva upanāyakena tad upanaye ca paramāṇu upanāyakena paramāṇau ca upanīte manasā nitya tva vyāpya niravayavatvavān iti jñānam astu iti arthaḥ
translated: the knowledge that it has the pervaded smoke should exist in the mind when the atom is brought by the one who brings the knowledge of being eternal and the one who brings the knowledge of being partless, and when the atom is brought. The meaning is that the knowledge that it has the pervaded partlessness should exist in the mind when the atom is brought by the one who brings the knowledge of being eternal and the one who brings the knowledge of being partless.

analyzed: dvi cana ādinaiḥ raḥ ādi padam naga ṭa rā
translated: By two statements, etc. The word etc. includes mountain, tree, river, etc.

analyzed: prāk tad jñātva hetu aṅgaḥ
translated: The section on the cause of prior knowledge.

analyzed: parāmarśa vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of inference.

original: yadvānumānikatvepi kvacit smṛtau kvacicchabde kvacitpratyakṣe paryavasānānnānavastheti cetsamaṃ parāmarśopi/
analyzed: yat vā ānumānika tve api kvacid smṛtau kvacid śabde kvacid pratyakṣe paryavasānāt na anavasthā iti ced samam parāmarśaḥ api
translated: If it is argued that even though inference is based on anumana, there is no infinite regress because it terminates in memory in some cases, in verbal testimony in some cases, and in perception in some cases, the same applies to inference also.

analyzed: tasmāt viśiṣṭa jñānam eva anumiti hetuḥ
translated: Therefore, only the knowledge of the specific object is the cause of inference.

original: iti prābhākaroktajñānadvayahetutvabhaṅgaḥ // // 🔽nanvevaṃ manaso bahirthapramāhetutve tadupanāyakajñānasya pramāṇāntaratvaṃ syāt/
analyzed: iti prābhākara ukta jñāna dvaya hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ  nanu evam manasaḥ bahirtha pramā hetu tve tad upanāyaka jñānasya pramāṇa antara tvam syāt
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the Prabhakaras' view that two types of knowledge are the cause of inference.🔽If the mind is the cause of external valid knowledge in this way, the knowledge that brings it about would be a separate means of valid knowledge.

original: yadasādhāraṇaṃ kāraṇamāsādya mano bahirgocarapramāṃ janayati tatpramāṇāntaramiti niyamāditi cenna/🔽indriyādeḥ sannikarṣādivadupa nayasya niyatavyāpārābhāvena pramāyāmakāraṇatvādityāhuḥ/
analyzed: yat asādhāraṇam kāraṇam āsādya manaḥ bahis gocara pramām janayati tat pramāṇa antaram iti niyamāt iti ced na  indriya ādeḥ sannikarṣa ādi vat upa nayasya niyata vyāpāra abhāvena pramāyām akāraṇa tvāt iti āhuḥ
translated: Because it is a rule that the mind, obtaining an uncommon cause, generates external object valid knowledge, that is a separate means of valid knowledge. If this is argued, it is not so.🔽They say that because proximity etc. of the sense organ etc. do not have a definite operation, they are not the cause of valid knowledge.

analyzed: anumānena vā astu pakṣa dharma tā jñāna ādi tāvatā
translated: Let it be that in inference, the knowledge of the property of the subject etc. is by inference. Even so,

analyzed: na anavasthā
translated: there is no infinite regress.

original: tajjanakānumāne pakṣadharmatādijñānasya smṛtirūpatvena vāptavākyarūpaśabdajanyatvena vā pratyakṣajanyatvena vopapatterityāha ānumānikatvepīti//
analyzed: tad janaka anumāne pakṣa dharma tā ādi jñānasya smṛti rūpa tvena vāpta vākya rūpa śabda janya tvena vā pratyakṣa janya tvena vā upapatteḥ iti āha ānumānika tve api iti
translated: Because the knowledge of the property of the subject etc. in the inference that produces that is logically possible as being in the form of memory, or as being produced by verbal testimony in the form of a statement, or as being produced by perception. Thus he says that even though it is based on anumana, etc.

analyzed: pakṣa dharmatā ādi jñānasya iti anukarṣaḥ
translated: The continuation is of the knowledge of the property of the subject and so on.

original: ata evapaddhatau na ca tathāpyanumānasya vyāptyapekṣayānavasthā/
analyzed: atas eva paddhatau na ca tathā api anumānasya vyāpti apekṣayā anavasthā
translated: For this very reason, it is said in the Paddhati: And even so, there is no infinite regress for inference due to its dependence on pervasion,

analyzed: antatas pratyakṣa āgama mūla tvāt iti uktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: because ultimately it has perception and scripture as its basis. This is the idea.

analyzed: iti prābhākara ukta jñāna dvaya hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ  tat iti nāyakasya nāyakasya vā iti na ca etasya api a ṭha na ca tasya api a ṭa ḍa             atha maṇi ukta parāmarśa prakriyā bhaṅgaḥ  maṇau tvaṃyama ālokaḥ dhūmaḥ vā ubhayathā api vahni vyāpyaḥ iti jñānāt tāvat anumitiḥ dṛśyate  tatra vyāpya tā avacchedaka prakārakam pakṣa dharma tā jñānam na saṃbhavati  avacchedakayoḥ dhūma tva āloka tvayoḥ aniścayāt  niścitasya tad anya anya tvasya gauraveṇa vyabhicāra āvāraka viśeṣaṇa tvena ca anavacchedaka tvāt

Because what is intended by the word 'pervasion-determining' is a property that is invariably pervaded.

original: anyataratve ca gauravādau satyapi vyāptirnaiyatyarūpasya vyāptyavacchedakatvasyānapāyāt/
analyzed: anyatara tve ca gaurava ādau sati api vyāptiḥ naiyatya rūpasya vyāpti avacchedaka tvasya anapāyāt
translated: And even when there is heaviness etc. in one or the other, the pervasion is not lost, because the pervasion-determining nature in the form of invariable concomitance remains.

analyzed: na hi guru iti etāvatā niyatam api aniyatam bhavati
translated: For something that is heavy does not become non-invariable merely by being so.

analyzed: atha maṇi ukta parāmarśa prakriyā bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the process of inference stated in the Mīmāṃsā.
In the Mīmāṃsā, he repeats the method of refuting the Prabhākara view stated in the conclusion of the theory of inference.

analyzed: iti uktam iti anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is stated thus.

analyzed: tad anya anyatvasya iti
translated: Of that which is different from that.

analyzed: dhūma ālokābhyām yat anyat tad anya tvasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of the difference from that which is different from smoke and light.

analyzed: vyabhicāra iti
translated: In case of contradiction.

analyzed: dhūma āloka anya anyavatvāt iti atra dhūmavatvāt ālokavatvāt iti ekaika hetu uktau vyabhicāra abhāvāt vyabhicāra vārakasya eva sārthakyāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the statement because of being different from smoke and light, when each of the reasons because of being smoky and because of being bright is stated, there is no contradiction, so only the statement that excludes contradiction is meaningful.🔽The word or is redundant.🔽The process of inference.

analyzed: vā iti adhikam gaṭarā  makta parśa prayā aṅgaḥ  parāmarśa vādaḥ
translated: The theory of inference.

original: nīladhūmādau dhūmānyā nyādau ca vaiyarthyameva doṣaḥ/
analyzed: nīladhūma ādau ca vaiyarthyam eva doṣaḥ
translated: In the case of blue smoke etc. and in the case of what is different from smoke etc., uselessness itself is the fault.

analyzed: prakṛte tu saṃdigdha asiddhi vāraka tvāt na vaiyarthyam api
translated: But in the present case, since it prevents the fallacy of doubtful absence, it is not useless.

analyzed: kiñca anyatara tva jñānasya tvayā api vyāpti grāhaka pratyakṣa sahakāri tvam svīkṛtam
translated: Moreover, you also accept that the knowledge of either-ness assists the perception that grasps the pervasion.

analyzed: sahakāri tvam ca na bhūyas darśana ādi vat svarūpeṇa
translated: And the assistance is not by the form of either-ness itself, like the repeated observation,

original: kiṃ tvanyataratvasya vyāptivyāpyatayā taddarśanatvenaiveti kathamanyataratvasya vyāptivyāpyatvāgrahaḥ//
analyzed: kim tu anyatara tvasya vyāpti vyāpya tayā tad darśana tvena eva iti katham anyatara tvasya vyāpti vyāpya tva agrahaḥ
translated: but only by the fact of seeing either-ness as pervaded and pervader. So how can there be non-apprehension of either-ness as pervaded and pervader?

analyzed: guru dharmatayā vyāpti graha anupayukta viśeṣaṇa tvena ca iti arthaḥ iti api āhuḥ
translated: Others say that the meaning is that it is not a qualifier that is not useful for grasping the pervasion by being a heavy property.

analyzed: anya anya tve iti asya artha anuvādaḥ nyatara tve ca iti  nanu evam parvataḥ agnimān nīla dhūmavat tvāt dhūma anyava tvāt ityādi prayogaḥ api sādhuḥ syāt
translated: The meaning of 'being different from another' is restated as 'in either-ness'.🔽But in that case, the use of 'because of having blue smoke' and 'because of being different from smoke' etc. would also be correct.

analyzed: nīla dhūma tva ādeḥ guru tve pi vyāpti niyata tvena vyāpya tā avacchedaka tva anapāyāt iti atas āha nīla iti
translated: Even though 'blue smoke-ness' etc. are heavy, they do not fail to be the determiner of the pervaded because they are ascertained as pervasion. To this he says 'blue' etc.

analyzed: saṃdigdhā iti
translated: 'In doubt' etc.

analyzed: dhūmavatvāt iti vā ālokavatvāt iti vā uktau anyatara satvasya aniścayāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when 'because of having smoke' or 'because of having light' is stated, the existence of either is uncertain.

analyzed: tvayā api iti
translated: 'By you also' etc.

original: gurorapyanyānyatvajñānasya viśeṣadarśanatvena pratyakṣasahakāritvādanyānyatvajñānaṃ tatra vyāpyatājñānopakṣīṇamiti maṇāvukteti bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: guroḥ api anya anya tva jñānasya viśeṣa darśana tvena pratyakṣa sahakāri tvāt anya anya tva jñānam tatra vyāpya tā jñāna upakṣīṇam iti maṇau uktā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that in the jewel (commentary), it is said that the knowledge of difference is exhausted by the knowledge of pervasion there, because the knowledge of difference, being the perception of a particular, assists perception.

original: ata eva maṇāvetadarucyāpicetyādinā prāgasmaduktapakṣa eva kiñca vahnivyāpyavānayamiti śābdajñāna ityādinopanyastaiti dhyeyam/
analyzed: atas eva maṇau etat arucyā api ca ityādinā prāk asmad ukta pakṣe eva kiñca vahni vyāpyavān ayam iti śābda jñāne ityādinā upanyastā eti dhyeyam
translated: It is to be understood that this was stated earlier by us in the view that even though not accepted in the jewel, it is stated by saying and so on and so on, and that it was stated earlier by us in the view that even though not accepted in the jewel, it is stated by saying and so on and so on.

analyzed: yat api saṃśaya sthale vyāpya tva jñāna upakṣīṇa tva vacanam
translated: And what was said about the exhaustion of the knowledge of pervasion in the case of doubt, accepting the certainty of difference,

analyzed: nya tva ādau ka ga ṭa rā
translated: in the case of difference and so on, K.G.T.R.🔽P.
The Lamp of Logic together with the Tarkatandava, Third Chapter

original: kecittu dhūma tvālokatvābhyāṃ sandhigdhe vastuni dhūmālokānyebhyonyatvameva durgraham/
analyzed: kecid tu dhūma tva āloka tvābhyām sandhigdhe vastuni dhūma āloka anyebhyaḥ nyatvam eva durgraham
translated: But some say that in a doubtful object with smoke and light, the difference from other things than smoke and light is difficult to grasp.

original: na hi sādhanāśrayayoranyataratvamityādau sādhanāśrayayoḥ sādhanatvāśrayatvā jñāne tadanyebhyonyatvaṃ gṛhyata ityāhuḥ/
analyzed: na hi sādhana āśrayayoḥ anyatara tvam ityādau sādhana āśrayayoḥ sādhana tva āśraya tvā jñāne tad anyebhyaḥ nyatvam gṛhyate iti āhuḥ
translated: For, in the case of being different from either the locus of the reason or the reason itself and so on, when the locus of the reason and the reason itself are not known, the difference from other things is not grasped.

analyzed: tasmāt na maṇi uktam yuktam
translated: Therefore, what is said in the jewel is not correct.

analyzed: iti maṇi ukta parāmarśa prakriyā bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the process of reflection stated in the jewel.

analyzed: tat api uktam iti āha kecid tu iti
translated: That also has been stated, he says: some say.

analyzed: pratiyogitā avacchedaka prakāreṇa tad anyonya abhāvasya tad anyonya abhāvasya tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the cognition of the mutual absence of the counter-correlate is due to the ascertainment of the counter-correlate in the manner of the delimitor of the counter-correlate.

analyzed: iti maṇi ukta parāmarśa hetu tva prakriyā bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the process of the cause of the reflection stated in the jewel.

analyzed: atha vyāpaka tva parāmarśasya anumiti hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now begins the refutation of the cause of inference being the reflection of the pervasion.
But the co-presence of the counter-correlate with the object to be inferred, of the absolute absence which has the same substratum as the reason, is the pervadedness.

original: tacca vyāpakatvagarbhitamiti lāghavātparvatavṛttidhūmavyāpako vahniriti vyāpakatvaparāmarśa evānumitihetuḥ/
analyzed: tat ca vyāpakatva garbhitam iti lāghavāt parvata vṛtti dhūma vyāpakaḥ vahniḥ iti vyāpaka tva parāmarśaḥ eva anumiti hetuḥ
translated: And that is contained in the pervasion, so by the principle of parsimony, the reflection that fire is pervaded by the smoke which is present in the mountain is itself the cause of inference.

analyzed: atha vyāpaka tva parāmarśasya anumiti hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now begins the refutation of the cause of inference being the reflection of the pervasion.

analyzed: maṇau parāmarśa vāda ante anye tu ityādinā upanyastam ekadeśi matam api āśaṅkya nirāha nanu ityādinā
translated: At the end of the chapter on reflection in the jewel, the view of a sectarian, stated beginning with others say, is also suspected and refuted by But, etc.

analyzed: vyāpaka tva iti  tasmāt ityādi
translated: Pervasion.

analyzed: li par śasya ka tvam 🔽parāmarśa vādaḥ
translated: The chapter on reflection.

original: na tu vahnivyāpyadhūmavānaparvata iti vyāpya tva parāmarśa iti cenna/
analyzed: na tu vahni vyāpya dhūmavān aparvataḥ iti vyāpya tva parāmarśaḥ iti ced na
translated: But it is not the case that there is an inference of the form 'the mountain is not possessed of smoke which is pervaded by fire'.

original: manmate sādhyarahitāvṛttitvarūpāyā anyathānupapattirūpāyā vā vyāptervyāpakatvāgarbhitatvena gauravābhāvāt//
analyzed: mad mate sādhya rahita avṛtti tva rūpāyāḥ anyathā anupapatti rūpāyāḥ vā vyāpteḥ vyāpaka tva agarbhita tvena gaurava abhāvāt
translated: This is not so, because in our view, the pervasion in the form of being present only where the probandum is present or in the form of non-apprehension of the probandum is not heavy, as it is included in the pervasion consisting of the probandum being a property of the pervader.

original: yadyapi sādhyarahitāvṛttitvajñānaṃ sādhyaṃ vinānupapattijñānaṃ vā sādhyatvarūpavyāpakatvena jñānaṃ vinānupapannam/
analyzed: yadi api sādhya rahita avṛtti tva jñānam sādhyam vinā anupapatti jñānam vā sādhya tva rūpa vyāpaka tvena jñānam vinā anupapannam
translated: Although the knowledge of being present only where the probandum is present or the knowledge in the form of non-apprehension without the probandum is not possible without the knowledge of the probandum being a property of the pervader,

original: tathāpi dhūmajātīyasya vahnijātīyarahitāvṛttitvajñānaṃ ca vahnijātīyaṃ vinānupapattijñānaṃ ca vahnitvena vahnijñānamevāpekṣate/
analyzed: tathā api dhūma jātīyasya vahni jātīya rahita avṛtti tva jñānam ca vahni jātīyam vinā anupapatti jñānam ca vahni tvena vahni jñānam eva apekṣate
translated: still, the knowledge of the class of smoke being present only where the class of fire is absent and the knowledge of non-apprehension without the class of fire require only the knowledge of fire by its own nature, not by its being a property of the pervader.

analyzed: na tu vyāpaka tvena iti na gauravam
translated: Thus there is no heaviness.

analyzed: iti vyāpaka tva parāmarśasya anumiti hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the view that the inference of the pervasion is the cause of inference.

analyzed: ukta rūpa abhāva apratiyogitvasya vyāpaka tvāt tad garbhitam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is included because the absence of being a non-counterpart of the stated form is pervaded by it.

analyzed: sādhya rahitā iti
translated: Free from the probandum.

analyzed: sādhya rahite vṛtti tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: being present only where the probandum is absent.

analyzed: anyathā iti
translated: Otherwise.

analyzed: sādhyena vinā asaṃbhava rūpāyāḥ vā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: or in the form of being impossible without the probandum.

analyzed: iti vyāpaka tva parāmarśasya anumiti hetu tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the universalized inference as the cause of inference.

analyzed: atha liṅga parāmarśasya karaṇa tvam
translated: Now, the author's view that the inferential cognition is the instrument.

analyzed: liṅga jñānam eva karaṇam
translated: The inferential cognition itself is the instrument.

analyzed: na tu liṅgam
translated: Not the inferential mark.

analyzed: atha liṅga parāmarśasya karaṇa tvam
translated: Now, the author's view that the inferential cognition is the instrument.

original: yattu maṇau liṅgakaraṇatāvāde liṅgaparāmarśaḥ karaṇaṃ na tu parāmṛśyamānaṃ liṅgamityuktam/
analyzed: yat tu maṇau liṅga karaṇa tā vāde liṅga parāmarśaḥ karaṇam na tu parāmṛśyamānam liṅgam iti uktam
translated: But in the commentary, when the inferential mark is said to be the instrument, it is said that the inferential cognition is the instrument, not the inferential mark that is referred to.

analyzed: tat asmākam anumatam eva
translated: That is acceptable to us.

original: kiṃ tu parāmarśa ityatra tṛtīyajñānatvameva nābhimatamiti bhāvenāha liṅgajñānameveti //
analyzed: kim tu parāmarśaḥ iti atra tṛtīya jñāna tvam eva na abhimatam iti bhāvena āha liṅga jñānam eva iti
translated: But the meaning is that the author does not accept the third cognition to be the inferential cognition. Hence he says that the inferential cognition itself is the instrument.

original: liṅgapadena vyāpyamucyate/ 🔽ptatvaga /rā / /naṃ ca sādhyajñānaṃ vinānupaga /ṭa /rā / /capadaṃ naṭa /rā /
analyzed: liṅga padena vyāpyam ucyate  ca sādhya jñānam ca padam
translated: By the word 'inferential mark', the pervaded is meant.🔽And it is not accepted without the cognition of the probandum. The word 'itself' is used to exclude the inferential mark.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyadyoti.

original: sa tadā vahnimān tadā dhūmavatvādityādau dhūmābhāve 'pi tajjñānenaivānumatidarśanāt/
analyzed: sa tadā vahnimān tadā dhūmava tvāt ityādau dhūma abhāve tad jñānena eva anumati darśanāt
translated: For example, in the inference That hill has fire, because it has smoke, even in the absence of smoke, the cognition of smoke alone leads to the conclusion.

original: na ca tatra dhūmadhvaṃsādikaṃ liṅgāntaramastīti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca tatra dhūma dhvaṃsa ādikam liṅga antaram asti iti vācyam
translated: It cannot be said that in that case, the destruction of smoke is another inferential mark.

analyzed: tasya a parāmarśāt
translated: Because that is not referred to in the inference.

analyzed: aparāmṛśyamānasya hetu tve ca māna abhāvāt
translated: And because there is no evidence for the cause being something not in contact.

original: ata evoktaṃ sudhāyāmna ca dhūmādikamevānumitirna kiṃ nāma tajjñānamiti//
analyzed: atas eva uktam sudhāyām na ca dhūma ādikam eva anumitiḥ na kim nāma tad jñānam iti
translated: For this very reason it is said in the Sudha commentary: And it is not that only smoke etc. are the inference, but what else is the knowledge of that?

original: iti liṅgaparāmarśasya karaṇatvam// ā // 🔽pratyakṣeṇānumānena śabdena vā jātaṃ yalliṅgajñānaṃ tadityarthaḥ/
analyzed: iti liṅga parāmarśasya karaṇa tvam  pratyakṣeṇa anumānena śabdena vā jātam yat liṅga jñānam tat iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus the inferential mark is the instrument.🔽The meaning is: the knowledge of the inferential mark that arises through perception, inference, or verbal testimony.

analyzed: vyapti viśiṣṭa liṅga jñānam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: only the knowledge of the inferential mark qualified by pervasion.

analyzed: saḥ iti
translated: That means

analyzed: parvata ādiḥ
translated: the mountain etc.

analyzed: atas eva uktam sudhāyām iti
translated: For this very reason it is said in the Sudha commentary.

analyzed: pratyakṣa vat ca prāmāṇyam iti etad vyākhyāna sudhāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in the commentary on the statement And the validity is like that of perception in the Sudha.

analyzed: upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: This is a mere illustration.

analyzed: anyathākhyātivādi siddhānte karaṇatayā abhyupagata tvāt iti sudhā uktiḥ api grāhyā
translated: The statement in the Sudha commentary should also be understood as follows: Because the knowledge of the inferential mark is accepted as the instrument in the doctrine of the proponents of erroneous cognition.

original: yattu paddhatau liṅgasya samyagjñānaṃ vā samyagjñānataṃ vā liṅgamityuktam/
analyzed: yat tu paddhatau liṅgasya samyak jñānam vā vā liṅgam iti uktam
translated: However, in the Padarthadharmasangraha it is said: The inferential mark is either the correct knowledge or the correct knowledge of the inferential mark.

analyzed: tatu abhyupagama vādena vā liṅga satva sthala abhiprāyeṇa vā nā iyam
translated: This should be understood either as a statement of acceptance or with the intention of the locus of the existence of the inferential mark.

analyzed: vastutas tu vyāpti prakāram anusṛtya anumitim
translated: But in reality, following the mode of pervasion, the inference is produced.

original: janayatītyatraiva tātparyādanā sthayaktāvapi sudhānurodhā lliṅgajñāna eva tātparyamiti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: janayati iti atra eva sudhā anurodhāt liṅga jñāne eva tātparyam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the intention is only in the production, so even in the non-eternal, the intention is only in the knowledge of the inferential mark, due to the restriction of nectar.

analyzed: asmin pakṣe kriyā yoga vyavacchinna tvam eva karaṇa tvam na sa vyāpāra tvam iti eke
translated: In this view, some say that instrumentality is only the exclusion of connection with action, not the state of having operation.

analyzed: liṅga jñānam karaṇam tad janya avyāpti smṛtiḥ yā vyāpāraḥ
translated: Others say that the knowledge of the inferential mark is the instrument, the memory of pervasion produced by it is the operation.

analyzed: śābda jñāne śakti smṛti vat iti anye
translated: Like the memory of potency in verbal cognition.

analyzed: manaḥ eva karaṇam vyāpya jñānam vyāpāraḥ
translated: Still others say that the mind itself is the instrument, the knowledge of the pervaded is the operation.

original: na cānumitermānasapratyakṣatvāpattiḥ saṃskāravyāpārakatva eva tathātvāt vyāpāraprādhānyavivakṣayā liṅgajñānaṃ karaṇamityuktirityapare//
analyzed: na ca anumiteḥ mānasa pratyakṣa tva āpattiḥ saṃskāra vyāpāraka tve eva tathātvāt vyāpāra prādhānya vivakṣayā liṅga jñānam karaṇam iti uktiḥ iti apare
translated: And it is not the case that inference becomes mental perception, because it is so only when it operates on impressions. The statement that the knowledge of the inferential mark is the instrument is made with the intention of emphasizing the operation.

analyzed: iti liṅga parāmarśaḥ karaṇa tvam
translated: Thus, the reflection on the inferential mark is the instrument.

original: tathā dhūga /ṭa /rā / /ti yuktiraḍa / /navasthayobhayoktā ṭa / /dholiṃ ṭa / dhena liṃ ṭha / /naṃ e ṭa /
analyzed: tathā navasthayā ubhaya uktā
translated: Similarly, smoke, mountain, etc. are the reasons. The nine-foldness is mentioned in both the views. The mountain is heavy, the cow is heavy, the mountain is heavy, the cow is heavy.

analyzed: atha tarkasya anumāna antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Now, the inclusion of reasoning within inference.

original: anumānaṃ dvividhaṃ sādhanānumānaṃ dūṣaṇānumānaṃ dūṣaṇānumānaṃ ceti/
analyzed: anumānam dvividham sādhana anumānam dūṣaṇa anumānam dūṣaṇa anumānam ca iti
translated: Inference is of two kinds: affirmative inference and negative inference.

analyzed: tatra ādyam adriḥ agnimān dhūmava tvāt ityādi
translated: The first is like The mountain has fire because it has smoke.

analyzed: dvitīyam api dvedhā duṣṭa tva pramiti sādhanam tarkaḥ ca iti
translated: The second is also twofold: the means of knowing the fault, and reasoning.

analyzed: tatra ādyam na idam sva sādhya sādhakam asiddha tvāt ityādi dvitīyam
translated: The first is like This is not a means of establishing its own conclusion because it is unestablished. The second is

original: yadi niragnikaḥ syāt tarhi nirdhūmaḥ syāditatyādi/
analyzed: yadi niragnikaḥ syāt tarhi nirdhūmaḥ syāt itatyādi
translated: like If it were without fire, then it would be without smoke.

analyzed: asya dūṣaṇa anumāna tvam ca para ukta niragnika tva ādi pratikṣepa rūpa tvāt
translated: And the fact that this is a reasoning based on refutation is because it takes the form of countering the other's statement of being without fire, etc.

analyzed: atha tarkasya anumāna antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Now, the inclusion of reasoning within inference is indicated in the Brahmasutra...

analyzed: tarka apratiṣṭhānāt api anyathā anumeyam iti brahmasūtre sūcitam tarkasya anumāna antarbhāvam
translated: In order to state the inclusion of reasoning within inference, which is indicated in the Brahmasutra as because reasoning is not established, it is to be inferred in another way,

original: vaktuṃ punardvividhaṃ sādhanānumānaṃ dūṣaṇānumānaṃ cetyādipaddhatyuktaṃ vivṛṇvāna
analyzed: vaktum punar dvividham sādhana anumānam dūṣaṇa anumānam ca ityādi paddhati uktam vivṛṇvāna
translated: he explains again what is stated in the Padarthadarsanasamgraha as inference is twofold: means of establishing and refuting, etc.

analyzed: āha anumānam iti
translated: He says inference and so on.

original: nanu paroktanirāsakasyaiva dūṣaṇānumānatvena tarkasya kathaṃ tathātvamityata āha asyeti//
analyzed: nanu para ukta nirāsakasya eva dūṣaṇa anumāna tvena tarkasya katham tathātvam iti atas āha asya iti
translated: But since only that which refutes the other's statement is an inference that refutes, how can reasoning be like that? Therefore he says this and so on.

analyzed: sva mate tarka svarūpam agre lilakṣayiṣuḥ para ukta tarka lakṣaṇāni anūdya nirāha
translated: Desiring to define the nature of reasoning in his own view later, he criticizes the definitions of reasoning stated by others, saying:

analyzed: ṣ ṭi pra ka ga ṭa rā na pramāṇa anta ṭa ṭha ḍa
translated: ṣṭipr k. g. ṭ. rā. .n prameyantaṭ. ṭha. ḍ.
pu. Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, 3rd Pariśeṣa

analyzed: tatra kecid vyāpya āropeṇa vyāpaka āropaḥ tarkaḥ
translated: There, some say that inference is the superimposition of the pervader by the superimposition of the pervaded.

analyzed: sa ca pramāṇa anugrāhakaḥ eva
translated: And that is only a helper of the means of knowledge.

analyzed: na tu pramāṇam iti āhuḥ
translated: But it is not a means of knowledge, they say.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: bāṣpe dhūma bhrama janya bhrama rūpa anumitau ativyāpteḥ
translated: Because there is over-extension in the inference in the form of a bee generated by the illusion of smoke in the form of smoke.

analyzed: nā api vyāpya ārope vyāpaka prasañjanam tarkaḥ
translated: Nor is the superimposition of the pervader by the superimposition of the pervaded an inference.

analyzed: prasañjanasya tarka tve ātma āśrayāt
translated: Because of the fallacy of circular reasoning if the superimposition is an inference.

analyzed: āropa tve ukta doṣāt
translated: And because of the stated fallacy if it is a superimposition.

original: na ca vyāpakābhāvavavattayā jñāte vyāpyāro pādvyāpakāropastarkaḥ/
analyzed: na ca vyāpaka abhāvavavat tayā jñāte vyāpya āropāt vyāpaka āropaḥ tarkaḥ
translated: And the superimposition of the pervader by the superimposition of the pervaded is not an inference when known as having the absence of the pervader.

analyzed: evam ca anumiti ābhāse na ativyāptiḥ  vyāpaka abhāvavat tayā jñāte numiti anudayāt
translated: And thus there is no over-extension in the illusion of inference.🔽Because there is no inference when known as having the absence of the pervader.

original: tarkasya vyāpakībhūtanirdhūmatvābhāvavattayā jñāta eva bhavatīti vācyam/
analyzed: tarkasya vyāpakībhūta nirdhūma tva abhāvavat tayā jñātaḥ eva bhavati iti vācyam
translated: It must be said that it is known only as having the absence of the pervader which is the pervader in the inference.

analyzed: atra kecid ityādinā  tārkika ādayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: With And in this regard, some... and so on.🔽The meaning is logicians and others.

analyzed: vyāpya āropaḥ iti nimitta saptamīyam
translated: By the superimposition of the pervaded is the instrumental case of the reason.

original: tatra kiṃ vyāpya bhramajanya vyāpakabhrama starka ityabhimataṃ /
analyzed: tatra kim vyāpya bhrama janya vyāpaka bhramaḥ
translated: There, is it accepted that Tarka is the error of the pervaded due to the error of the pervader generated by it?

original: tannimittaka vyāpakaprasañjanaṃ vā /🔽vyāpakābhāvavattayā jñāte vyāpyāropanimittakavyāpakabhramo vā /
analyzed: vyāpaka abhāvavat tayā jñāte vyāpya āropa nimittaka vyāpaka bhramaḥ vā
translated: Or is it the implication of the pervader caused by that?🔽Or is it the error of the pervader caused by the superimposition of the pervaded on what is known to possess the absence of the pervader?

analyzed: vyāpaka abhāvavat tayā avadhṛte vyāpya āropa nimittaka vyāpaka āropaḥ vā
translated: Or is it the superimposition of the pervader caused by the superimposition of the pervaded on what is ascertained to possess the absence of the pervader?

analyzed: tādṛśa vyāpaka āhārya āropaḥ vā
translated: Or is it the superimposition of the pervader that is to be removed by such a pervader?

original: avya vasthitābhyupagamyamānako ṭhyupādhikaniṣṭatvapratisaṃdhānaṃ veti ṣaṭkalpān krameṇa maṇikaṇṭhoktadiśā nirāha bāṣpa ityādinā /
translated: Or is it the combination of the six alternatives stated by Maṇikaṇṭha in the order of the six alternatives, which is accepted without any restriction, and which is based on the superimposition of the pervader? Bāṣpa says etc. to refute this.

analyzed: śaṅkha tva liṅga janya anumiteḥ vyāpya jñānasya ca āropa tva siddhi artham āha aśaṅkham śaṅkhatayā avagamyate
translated: In order to establish the superimposition of the inference generated by the mark of conchs and the knowledge of the pervaded, he says The non-conch is cognized as a conch.🔽etc.🔽The pervasion is not known.

original: pe vyāpa ga /ṭa /rā / / ca nānu ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /na iti naka /ga /ṭa /rā / /tatra🔽ṭha / /nanvatraṭha / /vyāptibhra ṭa / /janyapadamadhikaṭa / /ttavyā ṭa /ṭha /ḍa /🔽vahitāṭha / pyāptapupādhiḍa / / ṣaḍviṭha / 🔽tasyā nunāntarbhāvaḥ
analyzed: pe vyāpa gaṭarā ca na anu kagaṭarā naḥ iti na kagaṭarā tatra  vyāpti bhra janya padam adhika ṭa ttavya  vahitāṭha ṣaḍviṭha  tasyāḥ nunā antarbhāvaḥ

original: yatrāśaṅkhaṃ śaṅkhatayāvagamya pītoyaṃ śaṅkho na śukla iti pratyakṣabhramānantaraṃ śaṅkhatvācchukla ityanuminoti tasyāmanumitāvativyāpteḥ//
analyzed: yatra aśaṅkham śaṅkhatayā avagamya pītaḥ yam śaṅkhaḥ na śuklaḥ iti pratyakṣa bhrama anantaram śaṅkha tvāt śuklaḥ iti anuminoti tasyām anumitau ativyāpteḥ
translated: Where, after the perception of the conch as yellow, one infers that the conch is white because it is a conch, there is over-extension in that inference.

analyzed: atha jñātaḥ iti asya avadhṛtaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: If it is argued that the meaning of 'known' is 'ascertained',

analyzed: śakla tva anumitau tu na śukla tva abhāvya avadhāraṇam  śukla tva abhāva grāhaka pratyakṣasya anyathā asiddham upajīvya eva anu miti pravṛttiḥ iti ced na
translated: then in the inference of whiteness, there is no ascertainment of the absence of whiteness.🔽If it is argued that the occurrence of inference is based on the other-wised-ness of the perception grasping the absence of whiteness, that is not so.

analyzed: tarke api nirdhūma tva rūpa vyāpaka abhāvasya avadhṛta tvena
translated: Even in reasoning, the absence of the pervader in the form of being without smoke is ascertained,

analyzed: nirdhūma tva āropasya asaṃbhavāt
translated: and the superimposition of being without smoke is impossible.

analyzed: āhāryaḥ yam āropaḥ
translated: This superimposition is to be removed.

analyzed: sa ca bādhitā ipi bhavati iti ced na
translated: And it is argued that it occurs even when contradicted, that is not so.

analyzed: puruṣa tva abhāva niścaya anantaram pratyakṣāt āhārya vyāpya kara caraṇa ādi āropāt janye pratyakṣe āhārya puruṣa āropa iti vyāpteḥ
translated: After the ascertainment of the absence of humanity, due to the superimposition of the pervaded by the non-human, such as having cloven hoofs, etc., arising from perception, there is over-extension in the superimposition of the human being.

analyzed: nā api vardhamāna ukta rītyā avyavasthita abhyupagamyamāna koṭi upādhika aniṣṭa satva pratisandhānam tarkaḥ
translated: Nor is reasoning the recollection of the presence of the undesirable having the property of the unestablished position as stated by Vardhamāna.

original: niragnikatvasyāvyavasthitatvaṃ hi saṃśayo viparyayo vā na dvayamapi/
analyzed: niragnika tvasya avyavasthita tvam hi saṃśayaḥ viparyayaḥ vā na dvayam api
translated: For the uncertainty of being without fire is either doubt or error, but not both.
If the knowledge of being without fire with the head of the object is valid knowledge,

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: because it will be said later.

analyzed: vyāpaka abhāvavat tayā avagataḥ iti aṃśa upapādanāya pīta uyam ityādi
translated: To explain the part perceived as having the absence of the pervader, it is said it is yellow water and so on.

analyzed: anyathā asiddhim aupādhika bhrama tvam
translated: Other-wiseness is the accidental nature of error.

analyzed: nirdhūma tva iti
translated: As for the absence of smoke,

analyzed: nirdhūma tva rūpam yat vahni abhāva vyāpakam tad abhāvasya dhūma satvasya avadhṛta tvena iti arthaḥ
translated: it means that the absence of that which is pervaded by the absence of fire, which is in the form of the absence of smoke, is ascertained to exist, i.e., the existence of smoke.

analyzed: tathā ca asaṃbhavi lakṣaṇam iti bhāvaḥ  māna pra tarā
translated: And thus the definition is impossible, this is the meaning.
The lamp of logic, along with the Tarkatandava, third chapter.

original: evaṃ pratisandhānamapi saṃśayo viparyayo vā na dvayamapi/
analyzed: evam pratisandhānam api saṃśayaḥ viparyayaḥ vā na dvayam api
translated: Thus, recollection is also either doubt or error, but not both.

analyzed: tarhi syāt iti artha śiraska nirdhūma tva jñānam pramā iti vakṣyamāṇatvāt
translated: Then it would be valid knowledge, because it will be said that the knowledge of being without smoke with the head of the object is valid knowledge.

analyzed: tasmāt tarkaḥ numāna viśeṣaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, reasoning is just a particular kind of inference.

analyzed: vyāpti balena gamaka tvāt
translated: Because it is an indicator by the power of pervasion.

analyzed: saṃśaya uttara pratyakṣam vyāpta balena gamakam api na vyāpti jñāna karaṇakam
translated: Even though the perception that arises after doubt is an indicator by the power of pervasion, it is not produced by the knowledge of pervasion.

original: manmate tvaṅgīkṛtena sādhyābhāvena sahānaṅgīkṛtasya sādhanābhāvasya vyāpakatvapramā vā sādhyābhāvāṅgīkāranimittakā sādhanābhāvasyāṅgīkartavyatvapramā
analyzed: mad mate tu aṅgīkṛtena sādhya abhāvena saha anaṅgīkṛtasya sādhana abhāvasya vyāpaka tva pramā vā sādhya abhāva aṅgīkāra nimittakā sādhana abhāvasya aṅgīkartavya tva pramā
translated: But in my view, there is either the cognition of the pervasion of the unaccepted absence of reason by the accepted absence of the probandum, or the cognition that the absence of reason should be accepted due to the acceptance of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: vā
translated: But according to my view, either the cognition of the pervasion of the unaccepted absence of the reason by the accepted absence of the probandum, or the cognition of the necessity to accept the absence of the reason caused by the acceptance of the absence of the probandum,🔽is the inference.

analyzed: āhāryaḥ buddhi yūrvakaḥ
translated: It is to be supplied by the intellect.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa tvāt iti  nanu tarkasya ityādinā
translated: Because it will be stated later.🔽By the text beginning with But how can that be a means of valid knowledge?

analyzed: katham tasya prāmāṇyam ityādinā vā
translated: Or by the text beginning with How can that be a means of valid knowledge?

analyzed: granthena iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the text.

analyzed: vyāpti balena iti
translated: By the power of pervasion.

analyzed: āpādya āpādakayaḥ vyāpti balena sādhya sādhanayoḥ avinābhāva gamaka tvāt anumāna viśeṣaḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is a particular kind of inference because it makes known the invariable concomitance of the probandum and probans by the power of the pervasion between what is to be inferred and the inferential mark.

analyzed: vilakṣaṇa prakāra tvāt viśeṣa pada prayogaḥ
translated: The word 'particular' is used because it is a different kind.

original: nanvevaṃ yatra sthāṇurvā puruṣo veti saṃśayānantaraṃ puruṣatvavyāpyakarādimānayamiti
analyzed: nanu evam yatra sthāṇuḥ vā puruṣaḥ vā iti saṃśaya anantaram puruṣa tva vyāpya kara ādimān ayam iti
translated: But in that case, when after doubt as to whether it is a post or a man, there is the perception of the particular as 'this has a hand, which is pervaded by being a man',

original: viśeṣadarśane sati puruṣa eveti pratyakṣaṃ tadapyanumānaṃ prasajyate ityata āha saṃśayeti//
analyzed: viśeṣa darśane sati puruṣaḥ eva iti pratyakṣam tat api anumānam prasajyate iti atas āha saṃśaya iti
translated: and then the perception 'it is a man', that too would be an inference. To this he says 'doubt' etc.

original: atra pratyakṣapadena vyāpyadarśanaṃ puruṣa eveti phalūbhūtaṃ pratyakṣaṃ ca gṛhyate /
analyzed: atra pratyakṣa padena vyāpya darśanam puruṣaḥ eva iti phalūbhūtam pratyakṣam ca gṛhyate
translated: Here, by the word 'perception', the perception that is the result, 'it is a man', and the perception that is the cause, the perception of the hand pervaded by being a man, are included.

original: tatrādyaṃ yatra karādi tatra puruṣatvamiti vyāptibalena puruṣatvagamakamapi puruṣatvapratyakṣaṃ🔽na vyāptijñānakaraṇakaṃ kiṃ tu cakṣurādikaraṇakameva ato na tasyānumāna tvamiti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ādyam yatra kara ādi tatra puruṣa tvam iti vyāpti balena puruṣa tva gamakam api puruṣa tva pratyakṣam  na vyāpti jñāna karaṇakam kim tu cakṣuḥ ādi karaṇakam eva atas na tasya anumāna tvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The first is where the knowledge of the presence of a person, which is an indicator of the presence of a person, is based on the invariable concomitance that wherever there are hands etc., there is the presence of a person.

original: sādhyābhāvena niragnikatvādirūpeṇa nirdhūmatvādirūpasādhanābhāvasya vyāpakatvapramā tarka ityucyate/ 🔽itaḥ 'tarkyate' iti paryantaṃ nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / /yat ityādhikam ṭha / /grāhyamṭha / / phalapadamadhikam ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / 🔽tasyānunāntarbhāvaḥ🔽tarkavādaḥ pu / 🔽tatkaraṇikā sādhanasya sādhyena saha vyāptyanumitistu tarkaṇa miti vyutpatyā tarkaḥ//🔽etadevābhipretya paddhatau kasyacidarthasyāṅgīkārer'thāntarāpādanaṃ tarka iti pramāṇalakṣaṇaṭīkāyāṃ ca vyāpyāṅgīkāre 'niṣṭavyāpakaprasañjanaṃ
analyzed: sādhya abhāvena niragnika tva ādi rūpeṇa nirdhūma tva ādi rūpa sādhana abhāvasya vyāpaka tva pramā tarkaḥ iti ucyate  itas tarkyate iti paryantam na asti gaṭarā yat grāhyam ṭha phala padam adhikam  tasya anunā antarbhāvaḥ  tarkavādaḥ pu  tad karaṇikā sādhanasya sādhyena saha vyāpti anumitiḥ tu tarkaṇa miti vyutpatyā tarkaḥ  etat eva abhipretya paddhatau kasyacid arthasya aṅgīkāra irtha antara āpādanam tarkaḥ iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇa ṭīkāyām ca vyāpya aṅgīkāre niṣṭa vyāpaka prasañjanam
translated: But it is not produced by the knowledge of the invariable concomitance, but rather by the sense organs such as the eyes etc. Therefore, it is not an inference. This is the idea.🔽The knowledge of the pervasion of the absence of the means of proof, in the form of the absence of smoke etc., by the absence of the probandum, in the form of the absence of fire etc., is called reasoning.

analyzed: tarkaḥ iti uktam
translated: Up to is reasoned is not found in G.T.R.A. That is in excess in T.H. Grahya is in excess in T.H.D.

analyzed: spaṣṭayiṣyate ca etat anupadam eva
translated: And this will be clarified immediately after this.

analyzed: karaṇa vyutpatyā eva iti āha tarkyatena inā iti iti  āpādakasya asiddhi nirāsāya uktam aṅgīkṛtena iti
translated: He says that it is by the derivation of the word 'tarka' itself that it is so.🔽In order to remove the fallacy of the reason being unestablished, it is said that it should be accepted.

analyzed: iṣṭa āpatti nivṛti artham anaṅgīkṛtasya iti uktam
translated: In order to avoid the fallacy of the conclusion being already established, it is said that it should not be accepted.

original: yadi ghaṭa upe yate tarhi paṭopyaṅgīkārya ityādāvativyāptivāraṇāya sādhyābhāvasādhanābhāvapadoktiḥ/
analyzed: yadi ghaṭaḥ tarhi paṭaḥ api aṅgīkāryaḥ ityādau ativyāpti vāraṇāya sādhya abhāva sādhana abhāva pada uktiḥ
translated: In order to avoid over-extension in cases like If a pot is accepted, then a cloth should also be accepted, the words 'absence of the probandum' and 'absence of the probans' are used.

original: sa kiṃ prati karaṇamityata āha tatkaraṇiketi//
analyzed: sa kim prati karaṇam iti atas āha tad karaṇikā iti
translated: What is the instrument of that? To this he says that it is the instrument of that.
By the derivation of 'tarka' as 'that by which one reasons'.

analyzed: bhāva vyutpatyā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the derivation of the verbal root.

analyzed: etat eva iti
translated: This alone.

original: paddhatāvāpādanamityasya lakṣaṇaṭīkāyāṃ prasañjanamityasya ca sādhanābhāvasya vyāpakatvapramai vetyarthaḥ iti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: paddhatau āpādanam ityasya lakṣaṇa ṭīkāyām prasañjanam ityasya ca sādhana abhāvasya vyāpaka tva pramai vā iti arthaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning of 'āpādanam' in the Paddhati and 'prasajjanam' in the Lakṣaṇatīkā is that it is the ascertainment of the pervasion of the absence of the probans. This is the idea.

analyzed: etat ca upalakṣaṇam
translated: And this is a mere illustration.

analyzed: vyāpya aṅgīkāre niṣṭha vyāpaka prasañjanam iti tatvanirṇaye ca iti api dhyeyam
translated: It should also be understood that in the case of accepting the pervaded, it is the urging of the non-pervasion of the probans, and in the Tattva-niścaya-ṭīkā, it is the urging of the non-pervasion of the probans.

original: kathaṃ vyāptyanumitijanakatvamasya tarkasyetyato vā kathaṃ vyāpyāṅgīkāreṇāniṣṭasya vyāpakatvapramā prakāra ityato vāha spaṣṭayiṣyata
analyzed: katham vyāpti anumiti janaka tvam asya tarkasya iti atas vā katham vyāpya aṅgīkāreṇa aniṣṭasya vyāpaka tva pramā prakāraḥ iti atas vā āha spaṣṭayiṣyata
translated: How does this reasoning generate the inference of pervasion? Or how, by accepting the pervaded, does it make known the pervasion of the undesirable? To explain this, he says

analyzed: katham tasya prāmāṇyam ityādi granthe na
translated: How is its validity? etc. in the text.

analyzed: kṛta śaṅkā nivṛti artham upoddhā uta ukti anantaram atra ca
translated: In order to remove the doubt raised, after stating the introduction, here

analyzed: upagamyate ṭhaḍa pramāṇa padam adhikam ṭaḍa mā iti etat iti bhāvaḥ mā iti arthaḥ iti etat eva iti
translated: titag.ṭ.rā. kya.mī.g.rā. upagamyateṭ.ḍ. pramaṇa-padamadhikaṭ.ḍ. metya-etaditi bhāvaṭ. metya-artha iti bhāḍ. etadeveti

analyzed: etāvān granthaḥ
translated: This much is the text.🔽Spष्टयिष्यत इति after this, there is ड. Even there, the meaning is the same. This is additional ट.ठ.

original: 'spaṣṭayiṣyata iti' ityataḥ paramasti ḍa / tatrāpyevamevārthaḥ ityadhikam ṭa /ṭha / /mākāraṭha /ḍa / /netyarthaḥ ṭha /
analyzed: spaṣṭayiṣyate iti iti atas param asti tatra api evam eva arthaḥ iti adhikam mākāra ṭhaḍa na iti arthaḥ
translated: mā-ākāraṭ.ḍ. neti-arthaṭ.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽nanu tarkasyānumānatve āpādakaṃ niragnikatvaṃ liṅgam āpādyaṃ nardhūmatvaṃ liṅgīti vācyam/
analyzed: nanu tarkasya anumāna tve āpādakam niragnika tvam liṅgam āpādyam na rdhūma tvam liṅgi iti vācyam
translated: Nyāyadyuti along with Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter🔽If reasoning is a form of inference, then the reason (hetu) must be the presence of non-fire, and the conclusion (sādhya) must be the absence of smoke.

analyzed: tathā ca hetoḥ asidadhiḥ bādho prasiddhāntaḥ ca
translated: If so, then the reason is either unestablished or contradicted, and there is the fallacy of unestablished conclusion.

analyzed: siddhāntinā pakṣe niragnika tva nirdhūma tvayoḥ asvīkārāt
translated: Because the proponent of the conclusion does not accept the absence of fire and the absence of smoke in the subject.

analyzed: dhūmasya pratīta tvāt ca iti ced na
translated: And because smoke is well-known. If this is said, it is not so.

analyzed: sādhana rūpasya eva liṅgasya asiddhiḥ na tu āpādaka rūpasya
translated: The non-establishment of the logical mark which is in the form of a proof is a fault, but not of that which is in the form of an implication.

analyzed: āpādaka tva vyāghātāt
translated: Because of the contradiction of being an implication.

analyzed: yat vyāpādakam tat para abhyupagatam eva bhavati
translated: What is an implication is only what is accepted by the opponent.

analyzed: atas eva vyāpyasya pakṣa niṣṭha tve parā
translated: For this very reason, in the case of the pervaded being in the subject, the implication is the state of being destroyed by the knowledge of the vyatireka which has as its cause the non-acceptance by the opponent.

analyzed: kulīrasya iva a pādākasya su apra sūta
translated: Like the young of a kuṇīra, the implied is born from its own mother.
The meaning is by the text beginning with the knowledge of the absence of fire.

original: prasaṅgārthatayā proktā na siddhāntasya dūṣakāḥ/🔽ityādibhaktipādīyānuvyākhyānasudhayoruktaṃ vivṛṇvāna ākṣipati nanviti//
analyzed: prasaṅga artha tayā proktāḥ na siddhāntasya dūṣakāḥ  ityādi bhaktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhayoḥ uktam vivṛṇvānaḥ ākṣipati nanu iti
translated: They are not fault-finders of the conclusion, as stated with the meaning of implication.🔽Thus, explaining what is stated in the Anuvṛttyādi and the Sudhā of Bhāmati, he objects with But...

analyzed: asiddhi apasiddhāntau vyanakti siddhāntinā iti
translated: He explains the non-establishment and the contrary conclusion with Because the proponent of the conclusion...

analyzed: anumāna prayoktrā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is the user of inference.

analyzed: bādham vyanakti dhūmasya iti
translated: He explains the contradiction with Because of smoke...

analyzed: atas eva iti
translated: For this very reason means

analyzed: para abhyupagatasya āpādaka tvāt epa iti arthaḥ
translated: because what is accepted by the opponent is what is implied.

original: vyāpyasya niragnikatvādirūpavyāpyasya parvatādiniṣṭhatvena yaḥ parābhyupagamaḥ tannimittakaṃ🔽yajjñānaṃ nirdhūmatvajñānaṃ tadviṣaya tvasya nirdhūmatvāderyo vyatirekaḥ dhūmavatvaṃ
analyzed: vyāpyasya niragnika tva ādi rūpa vyāpyasya parvata ādi niṣṭhatvena yaḥ para abhyupagamaḥ tad nimittakam  yat jñānam nirdhūma tva jñānam tad viṣaya tvasya nirdhūma tva ādeḥ yaḥ vyatirekaḥ dhūmavatvam
translated: is the object of the cognition of the absence of smoke. The exclusion of that absence of smoke, which is the presence of smoke,

analyzed: tad jñānena bhañjanīya tvam yat tat eva āpādaka tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: is what is to be destroyed by the cognition of that. This is the meaning of being the reductio.

analyzed: kutas iti atas āha kulīrasya iva iti
translated: Why is it so? He says: like the eyes of a partridge.

analyzed: kulīrasya jala jantu viśeṣasya yathā sva utpanna apatya hatvam tathā eva āpādakasya api sva utpanna nirdhūma tva abhyupagama rūpa yukti pratihata tvāt iti arthaḥ  siddhāntinā iti svasūgarā pramā padam naṭa ṭha vyāpyasya iti adhikam  tasya aṃnunā antarbhāvaḥ  tarkavādaḥ pu

original: bhajyate hi niragnikatvaṃ svābhyupagamanimittakajñānaṃ prati viṣayasya nirdhūmatvasya vyatirekarūpasadhūmatvasya jñānena/
analyzed: bhajyate hi niragnika tvam sva abhyupagama nimittaka jñānam prati viṣayasya nirdhūma tvasya vyatireka rūpa sa dhūma tvasya jñānena
translated: For the absence of smoke in the object is contradicted by the knowledge of the presence of smoke in the form of the absence of the absence of fire, which is caused by one's own acceptance.

original: kathamanyathā na cāyaṃ nirdhūmaḥ tasmānna niragnika iti viṣaya viparyavasānam/
analyzed: katham anyathā na ca ayam nirdhūmaḥ tasmāt na niragnikaḥ iti viṣaya viparyavasānam
translated: Otherwise, how could there be the reversal of the object as This is not without smoke, therefore it is not without fire?

analyzed: tad abhāve tarkaḥ eva ābhāsaḥ syāt
translated: In its absence, the reasoning itself would be fallacious.

analyzed: na ca atra niragnika tvam sādhanatvena upāttam
translated: And here, the absence of fire is not stated as the reason.

original: tathātve hi yadīti syāditi ca na syāt/
analyzed: tathātve hi yadi iti syāt iti ca na syāt
translated: For if it were so, then if and would would not be there.

analyzed: kim tu niragnika tvāt iti syāt
translated: But it would be because of the absence of fire.

analyzed: evam sādhya rūpasya eva liṅginaḥ bādhaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Thus, the contradiction of the inferable property which is to be established is a fault.

analyzed: na tu āpādya rūpasya āpādya tva vyāghātāt
translated: But not of the property to be deduced, because of the contradiction of the deducibility.
