analyzed: virodhi viṣayaka tva mātreṇa katham nivartaka tā iti atas āha tarkasya iti
translated: How can it be a remover merely by having a contradictory object? To this he says: of reasoning.

analyzed: tarkasya śaṅkā paryanta tvāt śaṅkāyāḥ vyāghāta paryanta tvāt dyāghāta paryantayā iti uktam
translated: Because reasoning ends in doubt, and doubt ends in contradiction, it is said that it ends in contradiction.

analyzed: piśaṅkā gaṭarā gaṭarā śaṅkā padam na
translated: The word doubt is not found in the editions of the Nyāyakusumāñjali by G., T., and R.

analyzed: svatā itasya upayogaḥ  tarkavādaḥ pu
translated: The use of that by itself🔽The doctrine of reasoning

analyzed: nivartya bhedāt nivartakaḥ tarkaḥ api dvedhā
translated: Reasoning, which is to be removed, is also twofold due to the difference in what is to be removed.

original: tatrādyo 'numitikaraṇaniṣpādako dvitīyastu niṣpannena karaṇena pratipramāṇaśaṅkānirāsārthamapekṣitatvena phalopakārakatvādanumānānugrāhakaḥ//
analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ numiti karaṇa niṣpādakaḥ dvitīyaḥ tu niṣpannena karaṇena prati pramāṇa śaṅkā nirāsa artham apekṣita tvena phala upakāraka tvāt anumāna anugrāhakaḥ
translated: Among them, the first is the producer of the instrument of inference, and the second is the helper of inference because it is required to remove the doubt about the instrument that has been produced, by being useful to the result.

original: etadevābhipretyoktaṃ paddhatau soyaṃ kvacidviparītaśaṅkānirāsanadvāreṇa karaṇasyānugrāhakopi bhavatīti/
analyzed: etat eva abhipretya uktam paddhatau saḥ oyam kvacid viparīta śaṅkā nirāsana dvāreṇa karaṇasya anugrāhakaḥ api bhavati iti
translated: With this in mind, it is said in the Paddhati: This sometimes becomes a helper of the instrument by removing the doubt about the opposite.

original: kvaciddaśāviśeṣe karaṇaniṣpatterarvāk pratipramāṇaśaṅkānirasanadvāreṇa karaṇaśa rīraniṣpādakaśca bhavatītyarthaḥ//
analyzed: kvacid daśā viśeṣe karaṇa niṣpatteḥ arvāk prati pramāṇa śaṅkā nirasana dvāreṇa karaṇa śa rīra niṣpādakaḥ ca bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: In some cases, before the completion of the means of knowledge, it becomes the producer of the means of knowledge by removing doubts about the counter-evidence.

analyzed: śaṅkā ca tābhyām iti arthaḥ
translated: And doubt and the absence of counter-evidence are the two means of removing that.

analyzed: anumiti karaṇa iti
translated: The means of inference.

analyzed: vyāpti viśiṣṭa liṅga jñāna rūpa karaṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The means in the form of the knowledge of the reason qualified by pervasion.

analyzed: vyabhicāra śaṅkā nivṛttau vyāpti niścaya saṃbhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the ascertainment of pervasion is possible when the doubt of deviation is removed.

analyzed: phala iti
translated: The result.

analyzed: anumiti rūpa phala upakāraka tvāt
translated: Because it helps the result in the form of inference.
The help consists in removing the obstruction.

analyzed: etat eva iti
translated: This alone.

analyzed: ukta pakṣa dvayam eva  pramāṇa antara iti
translated: The two alternatives stated above.🔽By another means of knowledge.
The meaning is by another means of knowledge in the form of the apprehension of the reason.

original: nanvatra vākye dvitīyapakṣe dvitīyapakṣa eva pratibhāti na tvādya ityata āha apīti//
analyzed: nanu atra vākye dvitīya pakṣe dvitīya pakṣe eva pratibhāti na tu ādyaḥ iti atas āha api iti
translated: But in this sentence, the second alternative appears as the second alternative, not the first. To this he says 'api' (even).

original: pramāṇāntaretyasya pratyakṣādi kamarthamupetyāha yadveti// 🔽pramāṇāntarānu ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /'apiśabdāt kvacit' iti /
analyzed: pramāṇa antara ityasya pratyakṣa ādi  kam artham upetya āha yat vā iti 🔽pramāṇa antara anu kagaṭarāḥ api śabdāt kvacid iti
translated: Taking the meaning of 'by another means of knowledge' as perception etc., he says 'yat' (if).🔽'Api' (even) from the word 'api' (even).

original: tataḥ 'karaṇaśarīra' ityādikañcāsta ka /ṭa /rā / /ṇasyānugrāhako bhavatiapiśabdāttataḥprāk vyabhicāra śaṅkānirasanadvāreṇa śarīraniṣpadakaścana
analyzed: tatas karaṇa śarīre ityādikaḥ ca āsta kaṭarā bhavati api śabdāt tatas prāk vyabhicāra śaṅkā nirasana dvāreṇa śarīra niṣpadakaḥ cana
translated: Then, the word 'body of instruments' etc. becomes the benefactor of the cognition, and by the word 'also', it becomes the producer of the body prior to that, by the way of removing the doubt of deviation.

analyzed: bhavati iti artha
translated: The meaning is that it becomes so.

original: ka / /ṅgadarśanarūpapramā ḍa / /viparyayapakṣa iti nāstiṭa /ṭha /ḍa / /kṣaśabdarūpa pramāṇadvayamarthamupe ṭa / kṣamarthamu ṭha /
analyzed: viparyaya pakṣaḥ iti kṣa śabda rūpa pramā kṣa śabda rūpa
translated: The two means of valid knowledge in the form of perception and inference do not have a subject in the form of the body, and the two means of valid knowledge in the form of verbal testimony and comparison do not have a subject in the form of the self, so they are not means of valid knowledge.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

analyzed: yat vā kvacid pratyakṣa ādau anugrāhakaḥ bhavati
translated: Or, in some cases, it becomes the benefactor in perception etc.

analyzed: tatra karaṇa niṣpādaka tva asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because there it is not possible to be the producer of the instrument.

analyzed: api śabda anumāne ukta rītyā ubhaya ātmakaḥ ca bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: By the word 'also', it becomes both in inference, in the stated manner. This is the meaning.

original: yadvā kvacivdyabhicārasya pratipramāṇasya vā śaṅkāyāmanugrāhakaḥ karaṇaniṣpādanena vā niṣpannasya karaṇasya sarakāritayā vopakārako bhavati/
analyzed: yat vā kvacid vyabhicārasya pratipramāṇasya vā śaṅkāyām anugrāhakaḥ karaṇa niṣpādanena vā niṣpannasya karaṇasya vā upakārakaḥ bhavati
translated: Or, in some cases, when there is doubt of deviation or of a counter-proof, it becomes the benefactor by producing the instrument, or by assisting the produced instrument.

analyzed: api śabdāt śaṅkāyāḥ abhāvena tad nivartakasya tarkasya anapekṣita tvāt anugrāhakaḥ ca bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: By the word 'also', it becomes the benefactor because, in the absence of doubt, the reasoning that removes it is not required. This is the meaning.

analyzed: yat vā kvacid adriḥ agnimān dhūmavat tvāt iti prayogaḥ ukta rītyā anugrāhakaḥ bhavati
translated: Or, in some cases, the argument where there is a mountain, there is fire, because there is smoke becomes a corroborator in the manner stated.

analyzed: apiśabdāt kvacid svatantraḥ api bhavati
translated: By the word api (also), it is sometimes independent also.

analyzed: kvacid iti anuvādaḥ
translated: Kvacit (in some cases) is a restatement.

analyzed: pratyakṣa dau iti vyākhyā
translated: Pratyakṣādau (in perception etc.) is the explanation.

analyzed: anugrāhaka padam asmin pakṣe yuktam iti āha tatra iti
translated: He says tatra (in that case) that the word anugrahaka (corroborator) is appropriate in this case.

analyzed: pratyakṣa śabdayoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of the words 'pratyakṣa' (perception) and 'śabda' (word).

analyzed: pramāṇa antara padasya a numānasya iti artham upetya prakāra antareṇa paddhati artham āha yat vā
translated: Taking the meaning of the word prāmāṇāntara (another means of knowledge) as inference, he states the meaning of the text in a different way: Or, in some cases, of the doubt of non-concomitance.

analyzed: kvacid vdyabhicārasya iti  kvacid iti asya śaṅkāyām iti anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning of kvacit (in some cases) is in a doubt.

analyzed: sa dhūmaḥ vyabhicāra śaṅkāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is in the doubt of non-concomitance, such as 'let there be a smokeless fire'.

analyzed: dvitīya pakṣa anurodhena āha prati pramāṇasya vā iti
translated: In accordance with the second view, he says or of the counter-evidence.

analyzed: kvacid iti asya artham uktvā anugrāhakaḥ itagyasya artham āha karaṇa iti
translated: Having stated the meaning of kvacit (in some cases), he states the meaning of anugrahaka (corroborator): Karane (in the instrument).

analyzed: parāmarśa karaṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is in the instrument of remembrance.

analyzed: sahakāri tayā pratibandhaka nivartaka tayā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the function of removing the obstruction as an auxiliary.

analyzed: ukta rītyā iti
translated: Uktā (stated) means

analyzed: karaṇa niṣpādanena vā ityādinā ukta rītyā iti arthaḥ
translated: by the production of the instrument and so on. This is the meaning of uktā (stated).

original: ṇānika / ṇaśarīraniga /ṭa /rā / /vāniṣpādanena vā niṣpaka / /nnaka ga /ṭa /rā / /vetaga /ṭa /rā / /pakṣasyānuvādasyānumānasyevārthamupe ṭa / 🔽syaiveṭa /ṭha / 🔽svatetasyopayogaḥ

analyzed: svātantryam vyanakti adriḥ iti
translated: He explains the independence with The mountain...

analyzed: sādhana iti
translated: The means...

analyzed: adriḥ agnimān dhūmavatvāt ityādi prakāram vinā eva iti arthaḥ
translated: It means without the form The mountain has fire because it has smoke, etc.

original: nanvagnimāndhūmavatvāditi vidhimukhenāsādhayitvā kataṃ niṣedhamukhenaiva sādhanamityata āha na hīti//
analyzed: nanu agnimān dhūmavatvāt iti vidhi mukhena a sādhayitvā katam niṣedha mukhena eva sādhanam iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: But how can it be a proof by the method of negation alone, without establishing by the method of affirmation as 'It has fire because it has smoke'? To this he says For...

analyzed: iti arthaḥ iti
translated: This is the meaning...

analyzed: api śabdāt paddhati vākya sya ityādi vākya vyākhyā avasaraḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The word api (also) indicates that this is the occasion for explaining the sentence of the path etc.

analyzed: uktam ca iti
translated: And this has been said...

analyzed: pramāṇa lakṣaṇa ṭīkāyāḥ mā ātma āśraye yojyam
translated: This should be connected with the commentary on the definition of means of knowledge.

analyzed: anugrāhakaḥ bhavati iti
translated: It becomes a helper...
The meaning is by the way of removing doubt.
With the intention of the first and last alternatives mentioned earlier, he says in order in the case of the cognition of pervasion...

original: iti pramāyāṃ veti// 🔽ādau 'vyāptipramāyāṃ vā' ityastika /ga /ṭa /rā / /kyasyetiyojyam uktaṃ ce ṭa /ṭha / syeti bhāvaḥ ḍa / /'yāṃ' iti /
analyzed: iti pramāyām vā iti  ādau vyāpti pramāyām vā iti astika gaṭarā kyasya iti yojyam uktam ce bhāvaḥ iti
translated: Or in the case of the cognition...🔽Or in the case of the cognition of pervasion at the beginning is added. It should be connected as 'it should be accepted'. This is the meaning. In the case of... is added.

original: tataḥ anugrāhaka ityādikamevāsti ṭha / /yetyādivākyavyākhyāvasare ṭa / śraya ityādivāḍa / /'aṅgīkartavya iti' ityasti ṭha /
analyzed: tatas anugrāhakaḥ ityādikam eva asti aṅgīkartavyaḥ iti iti asti
translated: Then only 'it is a helper' etc. is added. In the case of explaining the sentence 'it should be accepted' etc. The word 'aśraya' etc. is added. It should be accepted is added.
The Nyāyakośa, a compendium of logic, by the great scholar Śrī Vācaspati Miśra, is completed.

analyzed: tasmāt yathā pramāṇa saṃplave dvitīyam pramāṇa bhūtam eva prathama pramāṇa dārḍhya hetu tvena prathama anugrāhakam
translated: Therefore, just as in the case of the combination of two means of knowledge, the second one, which is itself a means of knowledge, is a helper of the first one by being the cause of the firmness of the first means of knowledge,

analyzed: tathā tarkaḥ api svayam pramāṇam eva pramāṇasya anugrāhakaḥ
translated: in the same way, reasoning too, which is itself a means of knowledge, is a helper of the means of knowledge.

original: sādhakaṃ bādhakaṃ vā pramāṇameva hi śaṅkānivartakam/
analyzed: sādhakam bādhakam vā pramāṇam eva hi śaṅkā nivartakam
translated: For, only a means of knowledge, whether establishing or refuting, can remove doubt.

analyzed: na tu apramāṇam
translated: Not a non-means of knowledge.

analyzed: tarka jñānasya bhrama tve
translated: If the knowledge of reasoning were erroneous,

original: hi vyāptiyogyatādibhramajanyānumitiśābdajñānadiriva dhārāvāhikabhrame dvitīyānugṛhītasya prathamasyeva vā pramāṇatarkānugṛhītānumiterevāpramātvaṃ
analyzed: hi vyāpti yogyatā ādi bhrama janya anumiti śābda jñāna diḥ iva dhārāvāhika bhrame dvitīya anugṛhītasya prathamasya iva vā pramāṇa tarka anugṛhīta anumiteḥ eva apramā tvam
translated: then, like the inferential knowledge or verbal knowledge generated by the error of the relation of pervasion and fitness, or like the first one aided by the second in the case of a series of errors, the inferential knowledge aided by the means of knowledge and reasoning would be non-valid knowledge.

analyzed: apramāṇa tarka bādhitasya ca prāmāṇyam syāt
translated: And the validity would belong only to the counter-inference refuted by the non-means of knowledge and reasoning.

analyzed: iti sva mate tarkasya upayogaḥ
translated: Thus, the use of reasoning in one's own view.

original: nanu dhūmavatvādisādhanāphalabhūtāgnimatvādipramāmeva paryavasānamukhena janayastarkasya kathaṃ prāmāṇyamityāśaṅkāṃ sadṛṣṭāntaṃ pariharannupasaṃharati
analyzed: nanu dhūmavatva ādi sādhana a phala bhūta agnimatva ādi pramām eva paryavasāna mukhena janayaḥ tarkasya katham prāmāṇyam iti āśaṅkām sa dṛṣṭāntam pariharan upasaṃharati  /
translated: Now, how can reasoning be a means of valid knowledge by generating the valid knowledge of the presence of fire, etc., which is the result of the proof of the presence of smoke, etc., by the method of conclusion? To remove this doubt along with an example, he concludes:

analyzed: tasmāt iti
translated: Therefore, thus.

analyzed: yat vā ukta diśā pramāṇa anugrāhakasya katham prāmāṇyam
translated: Or, how can that which supports the means of valid knowledge be a means of valid knowledge, according to the stated method?

original: tathātve 'nugrāhakatvameva na syādityāśaṅkāṃ sadṛṣṭāntaṃ nirasyannupasaṃharati tasmāditi//
analyzed: tathātve nugrāhaka tvam eva na syāt iti āśaṅkām sa dṛṣṭāntam nirasyan upasaṃharati tasmāt iti
translated: If it were so, it would not be a supporter at all. Thus, dispelling this doubt along with an example, he concludes with Therefore, thus.

original: uktarītyā pramājanakatvādityarthaḥ/🔽śaṅkānivartakatvānyathānupapatyā ca tarkasya prāmāṇyamityāha sādhakaṃ hīti//
analyzed: ukta rītyā pramā janaka tvāt iti arthaḥ  śaṅkā nivartaka tva anyathā anupapatyā ca tarkasya prāmāṇyam iti āha sādhakam hi iti
translated: The meaning is: because it generates valid knowledge in the stated way.🔽And by the non-applicability of the removal of doubt, reasoning is a means of valid knowledge. Thus he says For, that which establishes...

analyzed: aprāmāṇye bādhakam ca āha tarka jñānasya iti
translated: And he states the contradiction in invalidity with The knowledge of reasoning...

analyzed: iti sva mate tarkasya upayogaḥ
translated: Thus, the use of reasoning in one's own view.🔽And the non-applicability of reasoning in the view of others.

analyzed: kaṭarā pariharan upa ḍa ṇyabādha ṭa ṭha  pateta ṛk oga asaṃbhavaḥ
translated: The impossibility of reasoning.

analyzed: tarkavādaḥ pu
translated: The doctrine of reasoning.

analyzed: atha para mate tarka upayoga asaṃbhavaḥ
translated: Now, the impossibility of the use of reasoning in the view of others.

original: kiñca paramate tarkasya kiṃ viṣaya viśodhana upayogaḥ kiṃ vā vyāptigrahe /
analyzed: kiñca para mate tarkasya kim viṣaya viśodhana upayogaḥ kim vā vyāpti grahe
translated: Moreover, in the view of others, what is the use of reasoning? Is it for the purification of the object, or for the apprehension of the pervasion?

analyzed: ādye api kim udayana rītyā aniṣṭa prasañjana tva mātreṇa upayogaḥ
translated: If it is the first, then is the use by the method of Udayana, merely by the implication of the undesirable?

original: kiṃ vā vardhamānarītyā sādhyābhāvasaṃdehanivartanena yadvā tajjanyasādhyābhāvajijñāsānivartanena /
analyzed: kim vā vardhamāna rītyā sādhya abhāva saṃdeha nivartanena yat vā tad janya sādhya abhāva jijñāsā nivartanena
translated: Or, by removing the doubt about the absence of the probandum in accordance with the Vardhamāna method, or by removing the desire to know the absence of the probandum produced by that?

analyzed: athavā tad janya sādhya jijñāsā ujjīvanena
translated: Or, by reviving the desire to know the probandum produced by that?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: aniṣṭa prasañjana tva mātreṇa tarka upayoge śaṅgā abhāve api tarka apekṣā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if the use of reasoning were merely by way of undesirable consequence, then even in the absence of doubt, there would be the undesirable consequence of the need for reasoning.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

original: sandehasya tajjanyajijñāsayaiva nivṛtteḥ/🔽nirdhūmatvajñānasya niragnikatvasandehena saha viṣayakṛtavirodhābhāvena tadanivartakatvācca/
analyzed: sandehasya tad janya jijñāsayā eva nivṛtteḥ  nirdhūma tva jñānasya niragnika tva sandehena saha viṣaya kṛta virodha abhāvena tad anivartaka tvāt ca
translated: Because doubt is removed only by the desire to know produced by that.🔽And because the knowledge of being without smoke does not remove that, since there is no contradiction created by the object with the doubt about being without fire.

analyzed: pratyuta nirdhūma tvasya sāgnika tva niragnika tva rūpa koṭi dvaya sādhāraṇyena tat jñānam sandeha upodbalakam eva
translated: On the contrary, the knowledge of that, by the commonality of being without smoke with both alternatives in the form of being with fire and being without fire, is only a reinforcement of doubt.

original: manmate tu viṣayakṛtavirodhaḥ prāgevoktaḥ// 🔽atha paramate tarkopayogāsaṃbhavaḥ // //
analyzed: mad mate tu viṣaya kṛta virodhaḥ prāk eva uktaḥ  atha para mate tarka upayoga asaṃbhavaḥ
translated: But in our view, the contradiction created by the object has already been stated earlier.🔽Now, the impossibility of the use of reasoning in the view of the opponent.

analyzed: nanu astu bhavat ukta rītyā tarkasya upayoge sati pramāṇa tvam
translated: Well then, let there be the validity of reasoning when there is use according to your stated method.

analyzed: na tu evam
translated: But it is not so.

analyzed: kim tu anyathā eva upayogaḥ
translated: Rather, the use is in another way.

original: tatra ca tarkasyāprāmāṇyepi na doṣa ityatastaduktopayogaṃ khaṇḍayitumāha kiṃñceti//
analyzed: tatra ca tarkasya aprāmāṇye api na doṣaḥ iti atas tad ukta upayogam khaṇḍayitum āha kiṃñca iti
translated: And even if reasoning is not a means of valid knowledge in that case, there is no fault. Therefore, in order to refute the use stated by him, he says 'What is more'.

original: vyāptigrāhakasya viṣayapariśodhakasya veti parāmarśavādānte maṇyukterāha kiṃ viṣayeti//
analyzed: vyāpti grāhakasya viṣaya pariśodhakasya vā iti parāmarśa vāda ante maṇi ukteḥ āha kim viṣaya iti
translated: He says 'What is the object?' because it is stated in the commentary on the chapter on reflection that the ascertainer of the object, which is the apprehender of pervasion.

analyzed: tad janya iti
translated: 'Which is produced by that' means

analyzed: sādhya abhāva sandeha janya iti arthaḥ
translated: which is produced by doubt regarding the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: tad janya jijñāsā eva iti  ya pariśodhane u kagarā
translated: 'The desire to know which is produced by that' means🔽which is produced by doubt regarding the absence of the probandum.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

original: kiñca vahnivyapte dhūme dṛṣṭe kathaṃ vahnyāvasaṃdehaḥ/
analyzed: kiñca vahni vyapte dhūme dṛṣṭe katham vahnyau asaṃdehaḥ
translated: Moreover, when smoke pervaded by fire is seen, how can there be doubt regarding fire?

original: na ca viśeṣadarśane sati svārasikasya vahnyabhāvasaṃdehasyāsaṃbhavepi pratipramāṇāhitā tacchaṅkā yakteti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca viśeṣa darśane sati svārasikasya vahni abhāva saṃdehasya asaṃbhave pi prati pramāṇa āhitā tad śaṅkā yaktā iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even if the natural doubt regarding the absence of fire is impossible when a specific perception is present, that doubt caused by a counter-evidence is appropriate.

analyzed: prati pramāṇe na anyathā asiddhe jāgrati tarka sahasreṇa api tad āhita śaṅkā anuvṛti ayogāt
translated: Because even with a thousand reasonings present, it is not possible for the doubt caused by that to continue, when the counter-evidence is not otherwise established.

analyzed: na ca tarkāt eva prati pramāṇasya anyathā asiddhiḥ
translated: And the establishment of the counter-evidence is not by reasoning itself.

analyzed: tvad mate viṣa kṛta virodha abhāvāt iti ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been said that according to your view, there is no contradiction due to poison.

analyzed: uttara ātma viśeṣaṇa guṇānām pūrva guṇa nivartaka tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the qualities which are the attributes of the supreme self remove the qualities that come before.

analyzed: koṭi dvaya sādhāraṇyena iti
translated: By the commonness of the two alternatives.

original: nirdhūmatvasyāyogolakādāviva sāgnikatvepi hṛdādāviva niragnikatvepi sambhavāt sādhāraṇyenetyuktam/
analyzed: nirdhūma tvasya ayaḥ golaka ādau iva sāgnika tve pi hṛd ādau iva niragnika tve pi sambhavāt sādhāraṇyena iti uktam
translated: It is said to be common because the absence of smoke can exist even in the presence of fire, like in a ball of iron, and even in the absence of fire, like in the heart.

original: bhavanmatepi tarhi nirdhūmatvajñānācchaṅkānivṛttirna syādityata āha manmatetviti//
analyzed: bhavat mate api tarhi nirdhūma tva jñānāt śaṅkā nivṛttiḥ na syāt iti atas āha mad mate tu iti
translated: Even in our view, the doubt would not cease due to the knowledge of the absence of smoke. To this he says: But in our view.

analyzed: anyathā upapatya anyathā anupapatti rūpa viṣa kṛta virodhasya saṃdeha tarkayoḥ pūrva vāde pratipādita tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the contradiction in the form of doubt and reasoning, which is in the form of other possibility and non-possibility, has been explained in the previous statement.

analyzed: nanu anyathā upapannatva śaṅkāyāḥ dhūma ādi viṣayāyāḥ tarkeṇa nirdhūma tva apādāna rūpeṇa nirāse api
translated: Even if the doubt regarding the other possibility, which has smoke etc. as its object, is removed by reasoning in the form of the consequence of the absence of smoke,

analyzed: bhinna viṣayaka sādhya sandehasya katham nivṛttiḥ iti atas hetoḥ anyathā upapatti śaṅkā nivṛtyā eva
translated: how can the doubt regarding the probandum, which has a different object, be removed? To this, the absence of doubt regarding the other possibility of the reason itself

analyzed: tad āhitaḥ sādhya saṃderaḥ nivartate eva
translated: removes the doubt regarding the probandum that it has caused.

original: pratyuta tvanmata eva tannivṛttirayukteti bhāvenāha kiñceti//
analyzed: pratyuta tvad mate eva tad nivṛttiḥ ayuktā iti bhāvena āha kiñca iti
translated: With the idea that in your view, the removal of that is unreasonable, he says: Moreover.

analyzed: yat vā tarka janya nirdhūma tva jñānam kim svārasika sādhya saṃdeha nivartanena upayujyate atha āhita saṃdeha nivartanena na ādyaḥ
translated: Or, is the knowledge of non-smokiness produced by reasoning useful in removing the natural doubt about the probandum, or in removing the doubt caused by the fallacy? Not the first,

analyzed: tasya eva anudayāt na antyaḥ
translated: because that itself does not arise. Not the latter,

analyzed: virodhi viṣaya tva abhāvāt
translated: because it does not have an object that is contradictory.

analyzed: iti āha kiñca iti  ukta tvāt iti
translated: Thus he says and also...🔽Because it has been stated means

analyzed: pratyuta ityādi granthena uktatvāt iti arthaḥ  pya dhū ṭa rā  pateta ṛkogāsaṃvaḥ  tarkavādaḥ pu
translated: because it has been stated in the text beginning with rather...🔽is not🔽the third, because the knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.

original: na tṛtīyaḥ/ jñānasya hīcchānivartakatvamaniṣṭatāvacchedakadhmaprakārakatvenaiva/🔽anyathā prameyatvādiprakārakamapi viṣā dijñānaṃ tannivartakaṃ syāt/
analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ jñānasya hi icchā nivartaka tvam aniṣṭa tā avacchedaka dhma prakāraka tvena eva  anyathā prameya tva ādi prakārakam api viṣā ādi jñānam tad nivartakam syāt
translated: The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.

original: na ca nirdhūmatvajñānaṃ tvanmate nirdhūmatāṃ tadāpādakatvenāniṣṭaṃ niragnitāṃ vāniṣṭa prāmāṇyāpātāt/🔽kiṃ tu pakṣaniṣṭhatayaiveti kathaṃ tarkeṇa niragnikatvajijñānasānivṛttiḥ//
analyzed: na ca nirdhūma tva jñānam tvad mate nirdhūma tām tad āpādaka tvena aniṣṭam niragni tām vā aniṣṭa prāmāṇya āpātāt 🔽kim tu pakṣa niṣṭhatayā eva iti katham tarkeṇa niragnika tva jijñāna sā anivṛttiḥ
translated: The knowledge of non-smokiness is not produced by reasoning.🔽The knowledge of non

original: pratipramāṇaṃ sādhyābhāvaviṣayaṃ tarkajñānaṃ tu nirdhūmatvaviṣayamiti virodhiviṣayakatvaṃ neti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: prati pramāṇam sādhya abhāva viṣayam tarka jñānam tu nirdhūma tva viṣayam iti virodhi viṣayaka tvam na iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The knowledge of reasoning, which is the means of counter-evidence, has the absence of the probandum as its object, but the knowledge of non-smokiness has non-smokiness as its object, so it does not have a contradictory object, this is the idea.

original: sādhyābhāvajijñāsānivartaneneti pakṣaṃ nirāha na tṛtīya iti//
analyzed: sādhya abhāva jijñāsā nivartanena iti pakṣam nirāha na tṛtīyaḥ iti
translated: He rejects the view that it is by removing the desire to know the absence of the probandum, saying The third is not so.

analyzed: jijñāsā hi jñāna icchā
translated: For desire to know is the desire for knowledge.

original: nirdhūmatvajñānena jijñāsānivṛttau nivṛttiprayojakadharmābhāvānna sāmarthyamiti sāmānyanyāyoktipūrvamāha jñānasya hīti//
analyzed: nirdhūma tva jñānena jijñāsā nivṛttau nivṛtti prayojaka dharma abhāvāt na sāmarthyam iti sāmānya nyāya ukti pūrvam āha jñānasya hi iti
translated: When the desire to know is removed by the knowledge of non-smokiness, there is no capacity due to the absence of the property that causes cessation, this is the general rule. He says For knowledge is... before stating it.

analyzed: aniṣṭa tāyām yat avacchedakam ahi tva viṣa tva kaṇṭaka tva ādikam tad prakāraka tve na eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that it is of the form of that which is the qualifier in undesirability, such as being harmful, being poisonous, being a thorn, etc.

original: astvetadapi jñānaṃ tathetyata āha na ceti//
analyzed: astu etat api jñānam tathā iti atas āha na ca iti
translated: Let this knowledge also be so, thus he says But it is not...

analyzed: nirdhūma tām iti atra api aniṣṭām iti anveti
translated: Here also undesirability is to be supplied in non-smokiness.

analyzed: na ca ullikhati iti
translated: And it does not manifest.
The idea is that the manifestation of the qualifier of undesirability, such as being contrary to valid knowledge, etc., is not experienced.

analyzed: vipakṣe ca āha tathātve iti
translated: He states the counter-argument in the contrary, saying If it were so...

original: aniṣṭamaniṣṭatā vacchedakenollekhe sati vahnitvādinā vahnyādyullekhijñānasyeva prāmāṇyaṃ syādityarthaḥ//
analyzed: aniṣṭam aniṣṭa tā vacchedakena ullekhe sati vahni tva ādinā vahni ādi ullekhi jñānasya iva prāmāṇyam syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when there is a superimposition by the property of being undesirable, like the knowledge that superimposes fire etc. by the property of being fire etc., there would be validity.

original: nanu dhūmaṃ paśyataḥ kathaṃ nirdhūmatvādijñāne pramāṇaviruddhatvādikaṃ na bhāyāt/
analyzed: nanu dhūmam paśyataḥ katham nirdhūma tva ādi jñāne pramāṇa viruddha tva ādikam na bhāyāt
translated: But how can the property of being contradicted by valid knowledge etc. not appear in the knowledge of being without smoke etc. of one who sees smoke?

original: na caivaṃ prāmāṇyāpātaḥ avidyamānapakṣaniṣṭhatvabhānādaprāmāṇyamastviti 🔽ṣayādijñā ga /ṭa /rā / /tvāvacchedaka dharmavattayā ga /rā / /netya ṭa /ḍa / /dyaniṣṭaṭha / /katvasphu ṭha / /tvāva ṭa /ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: na ca evam prāmāṇya āpātaḥ avidyamāna pakṣa niṣṭha tva bhānāt aprāmāṇyam astu iti  ṣaya ādi jñā dharmavat tayā
translated: And thus there is no contradiction of validity. Let there be invalidity due to the appearance of the property of belonging to a non-existent subject.🔽The meaning is that it is not due to the property of being qualified by the property that distinguishes it.
The Nyāyakośa, a treatise on logic, third chapter

original: kiñca pramāṇaviruddhanirdhūmatvāpādakatayā niragnikatvamevāniṣṭaṃ na tu tajjñānam/
analyzed: kiñca pramāṇa viruddha nirdhūma tva āpādaka tayā niragnika tvam eva aniṣṭam na tu tat jñānam
translated: Moreover, the undesirable is only the property of being fireless, which entails the property of being without smoke, which is contradicted by valid knowledge, not the knowledge of that.

analyzed: tasya āropa rūpa tvena tad anāpādaka tvāt
translated: Because that, being of the nature of superimposition, does not entail that.

original: tathā ca niragnikatvaviṣayecchāyā eva nivṛttiḥ syāt/
analyzed: tathā ca niragnika tva viṣaya icchāyāḥ eva nivṛttiḥ syāt
translated: And thus there would be only the cessation of the desire for the property of being fireless.

analyzed: na tu tad jñāna viṣa icchā rūpa jijñāna sāyāḥ
translated: But not of the desire for knowledge in the form of the desire to know which has the knowledge of that as its object.

analyzed: kiñca icchā vicchedakam aniṣṭa tvam duḥkha tad sādhana anyatara tva rūpam natu aprāmāṇika tad āpaka anayatara tva rūpam
translated: Moreover, the form of undesirability that cuts off desire is being either pain or the means of pain, not being either of the non-authoritative causes of that.

original: āptavākyādinā svasya dāridrayaṃ niścitavatopi dhena autkaṇṭhyadarśanāt/
analyzed: āpta vākya ādinā svasya dāridrayam niścitavataḥ api autkaṇṭhya darśanāt
translated: Even one who has ascertained his own poverty through the words of a trustworthy person and so on still shows eagerness for a cow.

analyzed: tathāca aprāmāṇika nirdhūma tva āpādake
translated: Thus, if there is a non-authoritative cause of non-smokiness,

original: cedevamapi nirdhūmanatvajñānena niragnikatvecchaiva nivartyā natu tajjñānecchārūpā jijñāsetyāha kiñceti//
analyzed: ced evam api nirdhūmana tva jñānena niragnika tva icchā eva nivartyā na tu tad jñāna icchā rūpā jijñāsā iti āha kiñca iti
translated: even so, the desire for non-fire alone is to be stopped by the knowledge of non-smokiness, not the desire in the form of the knowledge of that, which is inquiry. He says Moreover and so on.

analyzed: aniṣṭa tā avacchedaka prakārakam jñānam aniṣṭa viṣaya icchām nivartayati
translated: The knowledge that has the form of the defining characteristic of undesirability stops the desire that has undesirability as its object.

analyzed: sā ca niragnika tva icchā eva
translated: And that is the desire for non-fire alone.

analyzed: tasyāḥ aniṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because that is undesirable.

analyzed: na tu tad jñāna icchā rūpā  jijñāsya jñānasya aniṣṭa tva abhāvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But not in the form of the desire for the knowledge of that.🔽The meaning is that the knowledge of what is to be inquired into is not undesirable.

analyzed: nanu aniṣṭa viṣayaka tvāt niragnika tva jñānam api aniṣṭam eva iti atas viṣayasya api aniṣṭa tvam abhyupetya uktam
translated: But the knowledge of non-fire is also undesirable because it has an undesirable object. Therefore, having accepted that the object is also undesirable, it is said.

analyzed: vastutas tat api na iti āha kiñca icchā iti
translated: But in reality, that is also not so. He says Moreover, desire and so on.

analyzed: na ca ā prāmāṇikā iti
translated: And it is not non-authoritative.

analyzed: aprāmāṇika tvam vā
translated: Or non-authoritativeness.

analyzed: tad āpādaka tvam vā
translated: Or being the cause of that.

original: yena nirdhūmatvamaprāmāṇikamiti niragnikatvaṃ ca tadāpādakamityubhayamaniṣṭaṃ syādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: yena nirdhūma tvam aprāmāṇikam iti niragnika tvam ca tad āpādakam iti ubhayam aniṣṭam syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that both the lack of smoke being unestablished and the consequence of being fireless would be undesirable.

analyzed: dhane iti
translated: In the case of wealth,

analyzed: tasya svasmin aprāmāṇika tva niścaye pi aniṣṭa tva abhāvāt pratyuta autkaṇṭhya rūpa icchā viṣayena iṣṭatvasya eva darśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that even when there is the ascertainment of unestablishedness in oneself, there is no undesirability, but rather the manifestation of desire in the form of longing is seen to be desirable.

analyzed: na tva prāḥ ṭhaḍa
translated: But not unestablished.

analyzed: pateta ṛkogāsaṃvaḥ
translated: The chapter on reasoning.

analyzed: tarkavādaḥ pu
translated: The chapter on reasoning.

analyzed: niragnika tve katham śabda sāmya mātreṇa icchā vicchedam brūṣe
translated: How can you speak of the cessation of desire merely through similarity of words in the absence of fire?

analyzed: kiñca sādhya abhāva jijñāsā na sādhya anumiti pratibandhikā
translated: Moreover, the desire to know the absence of the probandum does not obstruct the inference of the probandum.

analyzed: yena tad nivṛttaye tarkā upekṣyata
translated: By which the reasoning is required for its cessation.

analyzed: sā hi sādhya abhāva viṣayaka jñāna viṣayiṇī
translated: For that is the object of the knowledge having the absence of the probandum as its object.

original: na ca sādhyābhāvaviṣayaviṣayakamapi sādhyajñānavirodhi/🔽tathātve hi pakṣe sādhyābhāva
analyzed: na ca sādhya abhāva viṣaya viṣayakam api sādhya jñāna virodhi  tathātve hi pakṣe sādhya abhāva
translated: And even that which has the object of the knowledge having the absence of the probandum as its object is not contradictory to the knowledge of the probandum.

analyzed: jñānam iti jñānena api anumitiḥ pratibadhyeta
translated: For if it were so, then the inference would be obstructed even by the knowledge that there is the knowledge that there is the absence of the probandum in the subject.

analyzed: śabda sāmya mātreṇa iti
translated: Merely through similarity of words.

original: duḥkhaṃ tatsādhanaṃ vā yathāniṣṭamucyate tathā prāmāṇike tadāpadake vāṅgīkārānarhatvamātreṇāniṣṭapadamastīti śabdasāmyamātreṇetyarthaḥ/
analyzed: duḥkham tad sādhanam vā yathā aniṣṭam ucyate tathā prāmāṇike tad āpadake vā aṅgīkāra anarha tva mātreṇa aniṣṭa padam asti iti śabda sāmya mātreṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is the word 'undesirable' only by the mere similarity of sound, as it is said that what is undesirable is that which is painful or its means, or that which is not fit to be accepted as authoritative or as removing that pain.

analyzed: nirdhūma tva ādi jñānena hi anumiti pratibandhakam nirasyam
translated: For, by the knowledge of being without smoke etc., what is to be excluded is that which obstructs inference.

original: sādhyābhāvajijñāsā tu na pratibandhaketi tannirāsāyāso vyartha evetyāha kiñceti//
analyzed: sādhya abhāva jijñāsā tu na pratibandhakā iti tad nirāsa āyāsaḥ vyarthaḥ eva iti āha kiñca iti
translated: But the desire to know the absence of the probandum is not an obstruction. Therefore, the effort to exclude it is futile. He says 'and what is more' etc.

analyzed: iti jñānena api iti
translated: By the knowledge 'it is not so' etc.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva jñāna viṣayaka jñānasya api sva viṣaya jñāna dvārā sādhya abhāva viṣayaka tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the knowledge which has the knowledge of the absence of the probandum as its object also has the absence of the probandum as its object through its own object being the knowledge of the absence of the probandum.
But in Maṇikaṇṭha, the desire to know the mere absence of the probandum is an obstruction to inference.

analyzed: na tu sādhya tad abhāva ubhaya viṣayā
translated: But not the desire to know both the probandum and its absence.

analyzed: saṃśayena ca ubhaya koṭikā eva jijñāsā janyate
translated: And by doubt, only the desire to know both alternatives is produced.

analyzed: na tu sādhya abhāva mātra koṭikā jijñāsā
translated: But not the desire to know the mere absence of the probandum.

analyzed: tasmin kāle sādhya abhāva mātra jijñāsā utpattau kāraṇa abhāvāt kim tad nivartaka tarkeṇa iti uktam
translated: Because at that time there is no cause for the arising of the mere desire to know the absence of the probandum, what is the use of the argument that excludes it? It is said.

analyzed: tatra sādhya abhāva mātra jijñāsāyāḥ api ukta diśā pratibandhaka tva abhāvaḥ dhyeyaḥ
translated: There, even in the case of mere desire to know the absence of the probandum, the absence of being a counteragent in the manner stated should be contemplated.🔽In the knowledge of the object, by the knowledge that it is known, it is known.

original: va viṣayajñānenāpi ṭa / be jñānamiti jñānenārā / /thā a ḍa / /ata evetyadhikam ṭha /
analyzed: viṣaya jñānena api
translated: Therefore, it is excessive.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

analyzed: na api caturthaḥ
translated: Nor the fourth.

analyzed: nirdhūma tva viṣayasya tarkasya bhinna viṣaya tvena agni viṣayaka jijñāsā ujjīvaka tva ayogāt
translated: Because the reasoning having the absence of smoke as its object cannot be the reviver of the desire to know having fire as its object, since it has a different object.

original: etena vyāptigrahe upayoga iti dvitīyopi nirastaḥ/
analyzed: etena vyāpti grahe upayogaḥ iti dvitīyaḥ api nirastaḥ
translated: By this, the second view that it is useful in the apprehension of pervasion is also refuted.

original: nirdhūmatvajñānasya viṣayakṛtavirodhābhāvādāropa tvena jñātatvācca niragnikostviti śaṅkāṃ pratyavirodhitvāditi dik//
analyzed: nirdhūma tva jñānasya viṣaya kṛta virodha abhāvāt āropa tvena jñāta tvāt ca śaṅkām prati avirodhi tvāt iti diś
translated: And because the knowledge of the absence of smoke is not contradictory due to its being the object, and because it is known as superimposition, it is not contradictory to the doubt whether there is no fire. This is the direction.

analyzed: etat eva abhipretya uktam paddhatau viparīta śaṅkā nirasana dvāreṇa iti  na tu udayana ādi rītyā aniṣṭa prasañjaka tva ādinā iti arthaḥ
translated: With this in mind, it is said in the Paddhati: By the door of refuting the contrary doubt.🔽But not in the manner of Udayana and others by being the cause of undesirable consequences and so on. This is the meaning.

original: sādhyābhāvasaṃśayajanyasādhyajijñāsojjīvakatvena tarkasyopayoga iti pakṣaṃ nirāha nāpi caturtha iti//
analyzed: sādhya abhāva saṃśaya janya sādhya jijñāsā ujjīvaka tvena tarkasya upayogaḥ iti pakṣam nirāha nā api caturthaḥ iti
translated: He rejects the view that reasoning is useful by reviving the desire to know the probandum which is produced by the doubt about the absence of the probandum, saying Nor the fourth.

analyzed: dvitīyā upa nirastaḥ iti  dhūma tva jñānam hi dhūmasya niragnika tva rūpa sādhya abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyabhicāra jñāna nivṛtti dvārā avyabhicā
translated: The second is refuted.

For it must be said that the knowledge of being smoke is useful for the understanding of pervasion, which is the co-presence of the probans and probandum without the fallacy of the probans being present in the absence of the probandum, through the cessation of the knowledge of the fallacy of the probans being present in the absence of the probandum.
And the knowledge of the probans is the cause of the cessation of the knowledge of the fallacy only by having an object which is contrary to that.

original: na ca nirdhūmatvajñānaṃ sādhyābhāvasāmānādhikaraṇyavirodhiviṣayakaṃ yena vyāptigrahopayogi syāditi bhāvenāha nirdhūmatvajñānasyeti//
analyzed: na ca nirdhūma tva jñānam sādhya abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇya virodhi viṣayakam yena vyāpti graha upayogi syāt iti bhāvena āha nirdhūma tva jñānasya iti
translated: And the knowledge of the absence of smoke is not the cause of the cessation of the knowledge of the co-presence of the absence of the probandum, by which it could be useful for the understanding of pervasion. With this idea he says: The knowledge of the absence of smoke, etc.

original: kiñca tvanmate kevalānvayisādhyakahetuprayogasthale sādhyābhāvāprasiddhyā māstu prameyatvamityādiśaṅkānudayena tatra tannivartanāsaṃbhavātkathaṃ
analyzed: kiñca tvad mate kevala anvayi sādhyaka hetu prayoga sthale sādhya abhāva aprasiddhyā mā astu prameya tvam ityādi śaṅkā anudayena tatra tad nivartana asaṃbhavāt katham
translated: Moreover, in a syllogism where the probans is only concomitant with the probandum, according to your view, the non-apprehension of the probandum is not possible, and hence the doubt let it not be an object of knowledge etc. does not arise, and therefore its cessation is not possible there. How then

analyzed: tatra tarkasya upayogaḥ
translated: is the use of reasoning there?

original: api ca tarkasyāpi vyāptisāpekṣatvena tarkāṅgavyāptijñānepi tarkāpekṣāyāmanavasthāpātena na vyāptigrahopayogitvaṃ tarkasya syāt/
analyzed: api ca tarkasya api vyāpti sāpekṣa tvena tarka aṅga vyāpti jñāne api tarka apekṣāyām anavasthā pātena na vyāpti graha upayogi tvam tarkasya syāt
translated: Moreover, since reasoning also depends on pervasion, and in the knowledge of the pervasion which is a part of reasoning, if reasoning were required again, there would be an infinite regress, and reasoning would not be useful for the understanding of pervasion.

original: yadi kvacittarkeṇa vināpi vyāptigrahastarhi vyabhicārātkathaṃ tarkasya tadupayogitvam/
analyzed: yadi kvacid tarkeṇa vinā api vyāpti grahaḥ tarhi vyabhicārāt katham tarkasya tad upayogi tvam
translated: If, somewhere, the relation of invariable concomitance is apprehended even without reasoning, then, how can reasoning be of use in that matter, because of the contradiction?

analyzed: siddhānte tu svatantra pramāṇa tvāt na vyāpti grahe eva upayogaḥ
translated: But in the Siddhānta, because of being an independent means of knowledge, the relation of invariable concomitance is not the only use.

analyzed: upayogaḥ api bahu prakāreṇa prāk eva upapāditaḥ ityādi anusandhāya āha diś iti
translated: And the use is of many kinds, as has been explained before. Having thought of this first, he says 'direction' etc.

analyzed: pita tvena gaṭarā
translated: As the father, G. T. R.

analyzed: paktakelāyilaṇaṅgaḥ  vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The chapter on the analysis of the argument.

original: atra viparītaśabdena paramate svamata iva nivartyāyāḥ śaṅkāyā nivartakena tarkeṇa saha viṣayakṛto virodho neti darśitam//
analyzed: atra viparīta śabdena para mate sva mate iva nivartyāyāḥ śaṅkāyāḥ nivartakena tarkeṇa saha viṣaya kṛtaḥ virodhaḥ na iti darśitam
translated: Here, by the word 'contrary', it is shown that there is no contradiction due to the object with the reasoning that removes the doubt to be removed, as in one's own view, in the view of the opponent.

analyzed: iti para mate tarka upayoga asaṃbhavaḥ
translated: Thus, the impossibility of the use of reasoning in the view of the opponent.

analyzed: sva mate iva iti
translated: As in one's own view.

original: anyathopapatyanyathānupapattirūpaviruddhaviṣayakatvaṃ yathā svamate tathā na paramata ityarthaḥ//
analyzed: anyathā upapati anyathā anupapatti rūpa viruddha viṣayaka tvam yathā sva mate tathā na para mate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the contradictory object, in the form of being otherwise possible and not being otherwise possible, is not as in one's own view, so in the view of the opponent.

analyzed: iti para mate tarka upayoga asaṃbhavaḥ  atha para ukta kevala anvayi tva lakṣaṇa bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus, the impossibility of the use of reasoning in the view of the opponent.🔽Now, the refutation of the definition of being a reason based only on positive concomitance, as stated by others.

analyzed: yat ca maṇau vyāptiḥ dve dhā anvaya vyatireka bhedāt
translated: And in the Mīmāṃsā, the relation of invariable concomitance is twofold, due to the difference between positive and negative concomitance.

analyzed: tatas ca anumānam api kevala anvayi kevala vyatireki anvaya vyatireki bhedāt trividham
translated: And hence inference also is of three kinds, as being of the positive, negative, and positive-negative types.🔽Among them, being the counter-correlate of the non-existence of what is present is the positive type.
The word 'what is present' is for the purpose of the positive type of the absolute non-existence of the sky. That is not so.

original: yattu paddhatau kevalānvayikevalavyatirekītyādinā paroktānumānatraividhyamanūdya nirastaṃ tadvivaritukāmaḥ taccānumānaṃ trividhamityādināmaṇyuktaṃ 🔽nirasitumāha yacceti//
analyzed: yat tu paddhatau kevala anvayi kevala vyatireki ityādinā para ukta anumāna traividhyam anūdya nirastam tad vivaritu kāmaḥ tat ca anumānam trividham iti ādinā amaṇi uktam  nirasitum āha yat ca iti
translated: But in the Paddhati, having mentioned the threefoldness of inference stated by others, beginning with 'positive, negative, etc.', and having refuted it, he who desires to explain that, having stated 'that inference is threefold', etc.,

analyzed: vṛttimat iti
translated: in order to refute it, he says 'and that' etc.🔽And what is present.

analyzed: vṛttimān yaḥ yam atyanta abhāvaḥ tad apratiyogitvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: being the counter-correlate of the non-existence of what is present.

analyzed: atra vṛttimān iti anena sva māna adhikaraṇa avirodhinīm yā vṛttiḥ tadvān vivakṣitaḥ
translated: Here, by 'what is present', it is intended to be that which has the occurrence that is not contradictory with its own substratum.

analyzed: r dvividhāḥ ṭa ṭha
translated: The two kinds are G, T, R, and the other is T, T, D.
The Lamp of Logic together with the Tarkatandava, Third Chapter
If the sky were the counter-correlate of the positive-only absolute non-existence, it would follow that it is a non-entity.

analyzed: na hi śaśa śruṅga ādeḥ api itas nyat asattvam asti
translated: For the non-existence of the hare's horn and others is not something other than itself.

analyzed: vistṛtam ca etat nyāyāmṛte
translated: And this has been elaborated in the Nyāyamṛta.

analyzed: iti para ukta kevala anvayi tva lakṣaṇa bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the definition of mere positive concomitance stated by others.

analyzed: tena saṃyoga atyanta abhāve na avyāptiḥ  saṃyoga vṛtteḥ tad atyanta abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇya avirodhi tvāt iti āhuḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no over-extension in the case of the absolute absence of conjunction.🔽They say that this is because the co-existence of that absolute absence with what inheres in conjunction is not contradictory.

analyzed: etat ca prameya tva abhidheya tva ādau asti
translated: And this exists in the case of being-an-object-of-cognition, being-an-object-of-denotation, and so on.

analyzed: tad atyanta abhāvasya vyāghāta bhayena kvāpi aṅgīkartum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because it is impossible to accept anywhere, out of fear of contradiction, the absolute absence of that.

analyzed: sarvasya api anyonya abhāva pratiyogitvāt asaṃbhava vāraṇāya atyanta padam
translated: The word 'absolute' is used to exclude the impossibility, since everything is the counter-correlate of mutual absence.

analyzed: tarhi tāvat eva astu iti atas dūṣaṇa saukaryāya viśeṣaṇa kṛtyam āha gagana iti
translated: Then let it be just that. For the sake of ease in refuting, he states the purpose of the qualification, beginning with 'space'.

original: bhāvābhāvayoranyonyaviraharūpatayā gaganātyantābhāvopi gaganarūpātyantābhāvapratiyogīti tatrāvyāptaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ syādato vṛttimaditi/
analyzed: bhāva abhāvayoḥ anyonya viraha rūpa tayā gagana atyanta abhāvaḥ api gagana rūpa atyanta abhāva pratiyogī iti tatra avyāptam lakṣaṇam syāt atas vṛttimat iti
translated: Since existence and non-existence are of the nature of mutual absence, the absolute absence of space is also the counter-correlate of the absolute absence of the form of space. Therefore, the definition would be too narrow in that case. Therefore, it is said to be 'inherent'.

original: gaganaṃ cāvṛttipadārthastanmata iti vṛttimadatyantābhāvo na gaganarūpaḥ/
analyzed: gaganam ca avṛtti padārthaḥ tad mataḥ iti vṛttimat atyanta abhāvaḥ na gagana rūpaḥ
translated: Space is a non-inherent object according to their view. Therefore, the absolute absence of what inheres is not of the form of space.

analyzed: kim tu ghaṭa atyanta abhāvaḥ eva
translated: But it is only the absolute absence of the pot.

analyzed: tathā ca tad apratiyogi tvam gagana atyanta abhāve sti iti na avyāptiḥ iti
translated: And thus, the non-existence of that [non-apprehension] exists in the absolute non-existence of space, so there is no over-extension.

analyzed: tasya api kevala anvayi tva siddhi artham vṛttimat padam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the word 'existing' is used to establish the purely positive nature of that [non-apprehension] as well.

analyzed: nyāyāmṛte iti
translated: In the 'Amṛta of Logic' [it is said]:

analyzed: mithyātva nirukti bhaṅge pratipanna upādhau traikālika niṣedha pratiyogitva khaṇḍana prastāve tathā
translated: In the refutation of the definition of falsity, in the context of refuting the property of being the counter-correlate of negation at all times in the accepted superimposition, thus:
The non-counter-correlativity with negation existing in all times and places,

analyzed: sattā ucyate dhyasta tucche tam pratiyoginī
translated: Is said to be existence in the superimposed void. That [non-existence] is the counter-correlate.

analyzed: iti sattva nirukti prastāve
translated: In the context of the definition of existence.

analyzed: asataḥ tyanta abhāva pratiyogitva samarthana prastāve ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And in the context of establishing the counter-correlativity of absolute non-existence of the non-existent. This is the meaning.

analyzed: iti para ukta kevala anvayi lakṣaṇa bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the definition of purely positive inference stated by others.

analyzed: ma pi garā yi la ṭa rā va vya āṭaḍa yi tva la ṭa ṭha  keli vyatiḥ bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Also by Ga. Ra. Ya.🔽The refutation of purely negative inference.

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The section on division.

analyzed: atha kevala vyatireki bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of purely negative inference.

analyzed: kevala vyatireki anumānam ca na yuktam
translated: And purely negative inference is also not correct.

original: tvanmate vyāptigrahārthaṃ pratijñāvākyasyābodhakatvaparihārārthaṃ ca viśiṣṭajñānaṃ viśeṣaṇajñānapūrvakamiti niyamārthaṃ sādhyaprasiddherāvaśyakatvāt/
analyzed: tvad mate vyāpti graha artham pratijñā vākyasya abodhaka tva parihāra artham ca viśiṣṭa jñānam viśeṣaṇa jñāna pūrvakam iti niyama artham sādhya prasiddheḥ āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: Because in your view, for the purpose of grasping the pervasion and for the purpose of avoiding the non-informing nature of the proposition statement, the necessity of the establishment of the probandum is essential for the purpose of the rule that the knowledge of the qualified is preceded by the knowledge of the qualifier.

analyzed: kevala vyatirekiṇi ca tasyāḥ abhāvāt
translated: And because it does not exist in the case of a purely negative inference.

analyzed: atha kevala vyatireki bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of purely negative inference.

analyzed: kevala anvayi dharma lakṣaṇa khaṇḍanena eva kevala anvayi sādhyakam anumānam nirastam matvā āha kevala vyatireki iti
translated: Considering that an inference with a purely positive probandum is refuted merely by the refutation of the definition of a purely positive property, he says purely negative etc.

original: yasya dharmasya kevalaṃ vyatireko abhāva eva prasiddhaḥ na tu bhāvaḥ sa dharmaḥ kevalavyatirekīti tādṛśadharmasādhyakamanumānamapi kevalavyatirekyanumānamityarthaḥ/
analyzed: yasya dharmasya kevalam vyatirekaḥ abhāvaḥ eva prasiddhaḥ na tu bhāvaḥ sa dharmaḥ kevala vyatirekī iti tādṛśa dharma sādhyakam anumānam api kevala vyatireki anumānam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that an inference with a probandum that is a property whose mere absence, i.e., non-existence, is well-known, but not its existence, is also an inference with a purely negative probandum.

analyzed: vyāpti iti
translated: Pervasion etc.

analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhau tad nirūpi tad sāmānādhikaraṇya ā ādi rūpa vyāpti graha asambhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that in the absence of the establishment of the probandum, the pervasion in the form of co-reference with it cannot be grasped.

analyzed: a bodhaka tva iti
translated: Non-informing nature etc.

analyzed: sādhya dharmasya aprasiddhau tatra śabdasya śakti graha ayogena avyutpanna sādhya pada ghaṭita pratijñā vākyasya bodhaka tva ayogāt iti bhāvaḥ  viśiṣṭa iti
translated: The idea is that when the property to be established is not well-known, then due to the impossibility of grasping the power of the word, the proposition sentence consisting of the not well-known property to be established is incapable of conveying the meaning.🔽The word viśiṣṭe (in the compound viśiṣṭajñāna in the commentary) is not found in the printed text. original: vyatirekihetunotpannasādhyaviśeṣaṇa kapakṣaviśeṣyakaviśiṣṭajñānamanumiteḥ pūrvaṃ sādhyāprasiddhau viśeṣaṇajñānapūrvakaṃ na syāt/
analyzed: vyatireki hetunā utpanna sādhya viśeṣaṇa ka pakṣa viśeṣyaka viśiṣṭa jñānam anumiteḥ pūrvam sādhya aprasiddhau viśeṣaṇa jñāna pūrvakam na syāt
translated: The meaning is that in the case of an inference with a negative vyāpti, the knowledge of the qualified, which is the property to be established as the qualifier of the subject, cannot be preceded by the knowledge of the qualifier, if the property to be established is not well-known before the inference.

original: tathā ca tatpūrvakatvaniyamaśca nirvikalpakajñānavādinā tvayāṅgīkṛta iti tadrakṣārthaṃ sādhyaprasiddhirāvaśyakītyarthaḥ// 🔽ca iti nāsti ṭa /rā / /ca ityadhikamṭa /rā / /kyapītiṭa / kyanumānamapīti ṭha / /ṇyarū ḍa / / ṇapa ṭa /ḍa / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽tatra sādhyāprasiddhir natāvatpakṣe kevalavyatirekivaiyarthyāt/
analyzed: tathā ca tad pūrvakatva niyamaḥ ca nirvikalpaka jñāna vādinā tvayā aṅgīkṛtaḥ iti tad rakṣā artham sādhya prasiddhiḥ āvaśyakī iti arthaḥ  ca iti na asti ca iti adhikam ṭarā ki api iti ṭa ki anumānam api iti ṭha             tatra sādhya aprasiddhiḥ na tāvat pakṣe kevala vyatireki vaiyarthyāt
translated: And since you, who accept indeterminate knowledge, accept the rule that it is preceded by that, the well-knownness of the property to be established is necessary in order to protect that.

original: nāpi pakṣaikadeśe tena nāsādhāraṇyam pakṣādanyatra tadaprasiddheḥ /
analyzed: nā api pakṣa eka deśe tena nā asādhāraṇyam pakṣāt anyatra tad aprasiddheḥ
translated: Nor is it in a part of the subject, so it is not inconclusive because not found elsewhere than in the subject.

original: nāpi kevalavyatirekavaiyarthyam tasya kṛtsne pakṣe sādhyapratītyarthatvāditi vācyam/
analyzed: nā api kevala vyatireka vaiyarthyam tasya kṛtsne pakṣe sādhya pratīti artha tvāt iti vācyam
translated: Nor should it be said that the mere negative is useless, because it serves the purpose of understanding the probandum in the entire subject.

original: pṛthivītarabhinne tyādau pakṣasyaikadeśasatvepi gaganamitara bhinnamityādau tadabhāvāt/
analyzed: pṛthivī itara bhinne tyādau pakṣasya eka deśa satve pi gaganam itara bhinnam ityādau tad abhāvāt
translated: Because even when a part of the subject exists in different from non-earth, etc., it is absent in the sky is different from other, etc.

analyzed: aṃśe siddha sādhanāt ca
translated: And because it would be establishing what is already established in part.

analyzed: abheda anumāne iva pakṣa eka deśasya niścita sādhyaka tayā anvaya dṛṣṭānta tva sambhavena kevala vyatireki tva bhaṅgāt ca
translated: And because, like in the inference of non-difference, when a part of the subject is ascertained to have the probandum, it can be the positive example, so the mere negative is contradicted.

analyzed: pakṣa bhinna tvena viśeṣaṇam ca gauravam
translated: And the qualification by different from the subject is cumbersome.

original: kathamabhāva ityato bhaktipāde sādhyāprasiddhajheradoṣatvoktiprastāve sudhoktarītyāha tatreti//
analyzed: katham abhāvaḥ iti atas bhakti pāde sādhya aprasiddha jheḥ adoṣa tva ukti prastāve sudhā uktari iti āha tatra iti
translated: How is it an absence? Therefore, in the Bhāktīpāda, at the time of stating the fault of the probandum not being established, he says there etc., in the manner stated in the Sudha.

analyzed: kevala vyatirekiṇī iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is having only a negative example.

original: vyatirekavāde maṇau siddhānte kathitaṃ nirāha nāpīti//
analyzed: vyatireka vāde maṇau siddhānte kathitam nirāha nā api iti
translated: In the Mīmāṃsā, he states the established view in the negative statement and refutes it.

analyzed: itarā iti
translated: Other means

analyzed: jala ādī nyaṣṭa dravyāṇi guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣa samavāyāḥ pañca iti trayodaśa apadārthāḥ itara padārthāḥ
translated: the eight substances such as water, the five universals, particulars, and inherence, the thirteen categories other than substance,

analyzed: tad abhāvāt iti
translated: Because of the absence of that.

analyzed: tasya akhaṇḍa tva upagamāt tārkikaiḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the logicians accept that as indivisible.

analyzed: abheda iti
translated: In the case of non-difference.

original: ayamata dbhinna etadvṛkṣatvādetadvṛkṣavadityanumāna ivetyarthaḥ//🔽nanu pakṣādanyatra niścitasādhyakatvameva dṛṣṭāntatve prayojakamityata āha pakṣeti//
analyzed: ayam atas dbhinnaḥ etad vṛkṣa tvāt etad vṛkṣa vat iti anumāne iva iti arthaḥ  nanu pakṣāt anyatra niścita sādhyaka tvam eva dṛṣṭānta tve prayojakam iti atas āha pakṣa iti
translated: The meaning is that it is like an inference where this is not different from that because it has the nature of a tree, like that tree.🔽But certainty of the probandum only in what is other than the subject is the reason for being an example. To this he says the subject, etc.

original: nanvastūktadiśā vyatirekiṇonvayitvaṃ tathāpi na kevalavyatirekitvabhaṅga ityāśaṅkya pratyāhahaha na cānvayeti// 🔽ddhirhinatā ga /ṭa /rā / / ttau cāsāga /ga / /syapā ṭa /ga / /nnetyatra pa ga /ṭa /rā / /rebhyobhi ka / /syaivaka /ga /ṭa /rā / /dayoṣṭa ṭa /dyaṣṭa
analyzed: nanu astu ukta diśā vyatirekiṇaḥ unvayi tvam tathā api na kevala vyatireki tva bhaṅgaḥ iti āśaṅkya pratyāha ha ha na ca anvaya iti  ddhiḥ hinatā gaṭarā ttau sya pā ṭaga na iti atra gaṭarā
translated: But even if the negative-only is positive-negative in the way stated, there is no breaking of the negative-only. Fearing this objection, he replies: But it is not positive-negative, etc.

original: ṭha / /tadabhi ṭha /ḍa / 🔽kelavyatibhaṅgaḥ🔽vibhāgavādaḥ pu / 🔽na cānvayāpratisandhānadaśāyāṃ kevalavyatirekitvamiti vācyam/🔽tathātve 'nvavyatireki ṇyapi tatprasaṅgāt/

analyzed: sva nirūpita vyāpti jñāna abhāvena anumitiḥ eva na asti iti vakṣyamāṇa tvāt ca
translated: And because it will be said that there is no inference at all due to the absence of the knowledge of the pervasion determined by itself.

original: naca yatrānitye vāṅmanase ityādau pakṣatāvacchedakanānātvaṃ tatraivāṃśe siddhasādhanam/
analyzed: naca yatra anitye vāc manase ityādau pakṣa tā avacchedaka nānātvam tatra eva aṃśe siddhasādhanam
translated: And it should not be said that in cases like where the verbal and mental are non-eternal, where there is diversity in the delimitor of the subject, there is the fallacy of proving what is already established in part.

analyzed: iha tu pṛthivī tvam ekam eva iti vācyam
translated: Here, however, the delimitor is only one, namely earthness.

analyzed: uddeśya pratīti siddhi asiddhyoḥ eva siddha sādhana tad abhāvau prati tantra tayā asya paribhāṣā mātra tvāt
translated: Because this is merely a rule, with the success and non-success of the cognition of the object to be specified being the determining factors for the presence and absence of the fallacy of proving what is already established.

analyzed: na ca tarhi uddeśyāyāḥ pṛthivī tva avacchedena itara bheda buddheḥ aṃśa īṣya bhāvāt na aṃśe siddhasādhanam iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that then, due to the absence of the object to be specified, the cognition of difference from other things delimited by earthness, there is no fallacy of proving what is already established in part.

analyzed: iṣṭa āpattim manvānam pratyāha anvaya iti
translated: To one who thinks that the objection is acceptable, it is said in the positive example etc.

analyzed: svā iti
translated: One's own means

analyzed: sādhya nirūpita iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is determined by the probandum.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa tvāt itas
translated: Because it will be said means

original: atraivottaratra kiñcābhāvagatayā vyatirekavyāptyā kathaṃ bhāvasya gamakatvamityādineti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: atra eva uttaratra kiñca abhāva gatayā vyatireka vyāptyā katham bhāvasya gamaka tvam ityādinā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the idea is that this will be said later in the same context, Moreover, how can the positive entity be the indicator by means of the negative pervasion belonging to the negative entity? etc.

original: maṇyādyuktamevāṃśataḥ siddhasādhanatādoṣoddhāramāśaṅkya nirāha na ca yatreti//
analyzed: maṇi ādi uktam eva aṃśataḥ siddhasādhanatā doṣa uddhāram āśaṅkya nirāha na ca yatra iti
translated: Fearing that the objection is acceptable, he raises the doubt and refutes it, saying And it should not be said that in cases like...

analyzed: tatra eva iti
translated: There itself means

analyzed: pakṣa tā avacchedaka sāmānādhikaraṇyena sādhya siddhiḥ hi anumāna phalam
translated: For the result of inference is the establishment of the probandum in accordance with the common property of the substratum of the relation of the probandum and the probans.

analyzed: nānātva sthale ca eka avacchedena sādhya siddhau api anumāna phalasya jāta tvāt punar anya avacchedena api anumiti utpādana ārtam anumāna apravṛtteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And in the case of plurality, even though the probandum is established under one substratum, since the result of inference has already arisen, there is no operation of inference again for the production of inference under another substratum. This is the idea.

analyzed: ekam iti
translated: One.

analyzed: tathāca ghaṭa ādi aṃśe ghaṭa tva ādi avacchedena sādhya siddhau api pṛthivī tva rūpa pakṣatā avacchedaka sāmānādhikaraṇyena itara bheda rūpa sādhya asiddhyā
translated: And thus, even though the probandum is established under the substratum of the pot etc. by the property of being a pot etc., since the probandum, which is the difference from other things, is not established in accordance with the common property of the substratum of the probandum, which is the earthness,

original: tatrānumityudayārthamanumānapravṛttisambhavānna tatra doṣa iti bhāvaḥ / 🔽kiṇopi ṭa / rā / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ🔽niścitasādhyakatvena saṃdehasiṣādhayiṣayorabhāvenaikadeśasya tvanmate pakṣatvāyogāt//
analyzed: tatra anumiti udaya artham anumāna pravṛtti sambhavāt na tatra doṣaḥ iti bhāvaḥ  kiṇa upi ṭa rā             niścita sādhyaka tvena saṃdeha siṣādhayiṣayoḥ abhāvena eka deśasya tvanmate pakṣa tva ayogāt
translated: the operation of inference is possible for the production of inference there. Therefore, there is no fault there. This is the idea.

original: na ca ghaṭasya ghaṭatvenetarabhedaniścayepi pṛthivītvena tatsaṃdehādikamiti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca ghaṭasya ghaṭa tvena itara bheda niścaye pi pṛthivī tvena tad saṃdeha ādikam iti vācyam
translated: Even though the pot is ascertained as different from other things by its potness, there is doubt etc. about it as earthness. This should not be said.

analyzed: viśeṣa ākāreṇa itara bheda niścaye sati sāmānya ākāreṇa tad saṃdehasya tad viśeṣa itara viśeṣa viṣaya tva niyamāt
translated: Because, when there is ascertainment of difference from others by means of a particular form, there is necessarily doubt about it in the form of a universal with regard to that particular and other particulars.

original: anyathaitatparvatatvena vahnimattayā niścaye pi parvate parvatatvena tatsaṃdehāpatyā tatra vahnyarthino niṣkampapravṛttirna syāt//
analyzed: anyathā etad parvata tvena vahnimat tayā niścaye parvate parvata tvena tad saṃdeha āpatyā tatra vahni arthinaḥ niṣkampa pravṛttiḥ na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even when there is ascertainment of this mountain as having fire by means of mountainness, there would be doubt about it as mountain by mountainness, and hence one desiring fire there would not engage in activity without hesitation.

analyzed: nā api pakṣe eva saṃdeha rūpā sādhya aprasiddhiḥ
translated: Nor is the non-establishment of the probandum in the form of doubt itself in the subject,

analyzed: pakṣa tva ayogāt iti
translated: because it is not fit to be the subject.

analyzed: tathāca kevala vyatirekiṇaḥ nvayi tvam eva prāptam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, it is the implication that the negative-only inference has only the positive concomitance.

analyzed: saṃdeha siṣādhayiṣayoḥ abhāvena iti ayuktam iti āśaṅkya nirāha na ca iti
translated: Fearing that it is not proper to say that there is no doubt and desire to know, he refutes it, saying not so.

analyzed: yajñapati uktam eva doṣam āha viśeṣa iti
translated: He states the fault mentioned by Yajnadatta, saying by means of a particular.

analyzed: tad viśeṣa itarā iti
translated: That particular and other means
the restriction to having as its object earth that is other than the particular, such as a pot, etc.

original: jñānayoḥ samānaprakārakatvenaiva nivartyanivartakabhāva iti nyāyasya sāmānyaviśeṣaprakārānyaparatvamiti bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: jñānayoḥ samāna prakāraka tvena eva nivartya nivartaka bhāvaḥ iti nyāyasya sāmānya viśeṣa prakāra anya paratvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the relation of what is to be removed and what removes it is only by means of the two cognitions having the same form, and the principle is not different in the case of the universal and the particular.

analyzed: evam maṇikṛt abhimatam pakṣa eka deśa sādhya prasiddhi pakṣam nirasya udayana ādi abhimatam
translated: Having thus refuted the view of the author of the Mīmāṃsāśloka, which is the view that one part of the thesis is to be established,

original: maṇāvanūdya nirastamapi maṇyuktadoṣe tavdyākhyātṛṇāṃ vivādabhāvātsvayaṃ dṛḍhadoṣavivakṣayā
analyzed: maṇau anūdya nirastam api maṇi ukta doṣe tad vyākhyātṛṇām vivāda bhāvāt svayam dṛḍha doṣa vivakṣayā
translated: and having refuted the view of Udayana and others, which is stated in the Mīmāṃsāśloka, even though it has been refuted, because there is disagreement among the commentators on the Mīmāṃsāśloka regarding the faults stated in the Mīmāṃsāśloka, with the intention of firmly stating the faults,

analyzed: saṃśaya rūpa sādhya prasiddhi pakṣam āśaṅkya nirāha nā api iti
translated: he raises the doubt in the form of the view that the thesis is established and refutes it, saying not even.

analyzed: jala ādi trayodaśa padārtha anyonya abhāvānām ekatra prasiddhyā
translated: Since the mutual absences of the thirteen categories such as water are established in one place,

analyzed: kam asti iti ka ga ṭarāḥ pṛthivī iti adhikam ga  kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: what is the use of this? K. G. T. R.🔽The section on the refutation of the atom.

original: vibhāgavādaḥ pu / 🔽evaṃ ca nānvayitvādikam pakṣaikadeśepi sādhyāniścayāt nāpyasādhāraṇyam sapakṣābhāvāt nāpi vyatirekivaiyarthyam tasya niścayārthatvāditi vācyam/
analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ  evam ca na anvayi tva ādikam pakṣa eka deśe api sādhya aniścayāt nā api asādhāraṇyam sapakṣa abhāvāt nā api vyatireki vaiyarthyam tasya niścaya artha tvāt iti vācyam
translated: The section on the doctrine of differentiation.🔽And thus, it cannot be said that because of being a reason based on a part of the thesis, there is no ascertainment of the probandum, nor is it unestablished, because there is no similar instance, nor is the reason based on the negative pervasion useless, because it is for the purpose of ascertainment.

analyzed: sādhya koṭeḥ aprasiddhyā saṃdehasya eva ayogāt
translated: Because the class of the probandum is not well-known, doubt is not possible at all.

original: na ca tejobhinnā pṛthivī jalādidvādaśabhinnā na veti tejobhinnadharmikajalādidvādaśabhinnatvakoṭikasaṃśayenārthāstrayodaśābhinnatvarūpasādhyaprasi
analyzed: na ca tejaḥ bhinnā pṛthivī jala ādi dvādaśa bhinnā na vā iti tejaḥ bhinna dharmika jala ādi dvādaśa bhinna tva koṭika saṃśayena arthāḥ trayodaśa abhinna tva rūpa sādhya prasiddhi
translated: And there is no doubt whether earth is different from fire, or water is different from the twelve, or not, so there is no doubt in the form of earth being different from fire, and water being different from the twelve, which would establish the probandum in the form of being different from thirteen.

analyzed: dhiḥ yuktā iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that there is no establishment of the probandum, which is the form of non-difference from thirteen, by the doubt in the form Is earth different from fire, or different from water, etc., up to twelve?

analyzed: saṃśayasya a sārvatrika tvāt
translated: because the doubt is not universal.

analyzed: saṃśaya rūpa sādhya prasiddheḥ mayā api svīta ākārāt ca
translated: And because the establishment of the probandum in the form of doubt is accepted by me also.

original: śaśīyakarṇādau śaśīyamidaṃ śṛṅgaṃ na veti saṃdehena śaśaśraṅgasyāpi prasiddhiprasaṅgācca/
analyzed: śaśīya karṇa ādau śaśīyam idam śṛṅgam na vā iti saṃdehena śaśa śraṅgasya api prasiddhi prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because there would be the undesirable consequence of the establishment of the horn of a rabbit also by the doubt Is this horn of the rabbit, or not? in the case of the horn of a rabbit.

analyzed: teṣu abhāveṣu ekaḥ tejaḥ nyonya abhāvaḥ jale prasiddhaḥ
translated: Even the impossibility of doubt is established in those non-existences. One mutual absence of fire is established in water.

original: pṛthivī tejobhinnā na veti saṃśayena pṛthivyāmeva vā prasiddhaḥ/
analyzed: pṛthivī tejaḥ bhinnā na vā iti saṃśayena pṛthivyām eva vā prasiddhaḥ
translated: Or it is established in earth itself by the doubt Is earth different from fire, or not?

analyzed: jala ādi tejaḥ nya dvādaśa padārtha anyonya abhāvāḥ tejasi prasiddhāḥ
translated: The mutual absences of the twelve categories other than water, etc., and fire are established in fire.

original: evaṃ ca tatraikaṃ pakṣabhūtadharmiviśeṣaṇaṃ kṛtvānyakoṭikasaṃśayotpādi kimapi na bādhakamityāśaṅkya nirāha na ca tejobhinneti//
analyzed: evam ca tatra ekam pakṣa bhūta dharmi viśeṣaṇam kṛtvā anya koṭika saṃśaya utpādi kim api na bādhakam iti āśaṅkya nirāha na ca tejaḥ bhinna iti
translated: And thus, having made one particular of the subject which is the hypothesis, nothing that produces doubt in another alternative is a fallacy. Fearing this, he says And it cannot be said that earth, different from fire, is different from water, etc., up to twelve.

analyzed: asārvatrika tvāt iti
translated: Because the doubt is not universal.

original: tathā ca yatra na saṃdehastatrāprasiddhirdurvāroti bhāvaḥ//🔽nanu saṃdigdhe nyāyapravṛtteḥ saṃśayaḥ sārvatrika iti cet/
analyzed: tathā ca yatra na saṃdehaḥ tatra aprasiddhiḥ durvārā iti bhāvaḥ  nanu saṃdigdhe nyāya pravṛtteḥ saṃśayaḥ sārvatrikaḥ iti ced
translated: And hence, where there is no doubt, there the non-establishment is irresistible, this is the idea.🔽If it be said that since reasoning operates only where there is doubt, doubt is universal,

analyzed: siddhe pi siṣādhayiṣayā anumāna pravṛtteḥ
translated: [then the answer is that] reasoning operates even when the thing is established, through the desire to establish it.

analyzed: evam api tvad ukta rītyā saṃśayasya sātmaka tva ādi akhaṇḍana sādhye yogāt ca
translated: Even so, doubt, according to your statement, is not to be refuted, because it is of the nature of the soul, and because of yoga.

analyzed: ghana gharjita ādi sthale saṃdeha abhāve pi anumiti darśanāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And because inference is seen even in the absence of doubt in the case of the rumbling of clouds, etc., this is the idea.

analyzed: mayā api iti  vyatirekī na iti vadatā api iti arthaḥ
translated: By me also🔽means by one who says the negative-only is not.

analyzed: yat vā vyatirekiṇi sādhya prasiddhi vādinā api iti arthaḥ
translated: Or, it means by one who asserts the establishment of the probandum in the negative-only.

original: tathā ca tādṛśaṃ prati niścayarūpasādhyaprasiddhireva vācyeti bhāvaḥ/ 🔽kṛtatvācca ka /ṭa /rā / /vañcatvaṭa / /vantva ṭha / /dhyetadayo ṭha / /le asaṃdehe ṭha /
analyzed: tathā ca tādṛśam prati niścaya rūpa sādhya prasiddhiḥ eva vācyā iti bhāvaḥ  kṛta tvāt ca ṭha asaṃdehe
translated: And hence, to such a person, the establishment of the probandum in the form of certainty alone is to be stated, this is the idea.
