analyzed: viśeṣaṇa niścaya janya viśiṣṭa niścaya rūpa anumiti aṅga bhūtāyāḥ sādhya tā avacchedaka trayodaśa bhinna tva prakārikāyāḥ niścaya rūpa prasiddheḥ abhāvāt ca
translated: And because there is no well-known cognition in the form of the determination of the thirteen different types of the property to be established, which is a part of inference in the form of the determination of the qualified by the determination of the qualifier.

original: na ca tarhi pakṣādanyatraiva trayodaśasu trayodaṣabhedānāṃ viśakalitānāṃ niścayarūpā prasiddhirastīti nāprasaddhaviśeṣaṇatvādīti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca tarhi pakṣāt anyatra eva trayodaśasu trayodaṣa bhedānām viśakalitānām niścaya rūpā prasiddhiḥ asti iti na aprasaddha viśeṣaṇa tva ādi iti vācyam
translated: And in that case, there is no well-known cognition in the form of the determination of the thirteen different types separately in the thirteen other than the subject, so it cannot be said that the qualifier is not well-known, etc.

analyzed: jīvat śarīra jātam sātmakam ityādau akhaṇḍa sādhyakaḥ ukta prakāra asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because in the case of the probandum being undivided, such as the class of living bodies is endowed with self, etc., the said type is not possible.

analyzed: trayodhaśasu sādhya prasiddhau tatra sādhya abhāvasya asatvena vyatirekavyāpti graha asaṃbhavāt ca
translated: And because when the probandum is established in the thirteen, the absence of the probandum there is not existent, so the universal concomitance of the negative vyatireka is not possible.

analyzed: śaśaśraṅgasya api iti
translated: Even of the horn of a hare.

analyzed: bhū talam śaśa śraṅga vat iti api anumānam syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even the inference that the ground is like the horn of a hare would be (possible).

analyzed: sādhya tā iti
translated: That which is to be established.

analyzed: sādhya tā avacchedakam yaḥ trayodaśa bhinna tvam tad prakārikāyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is in the form of the property to be established, which is different from the thirteen.

original: athavetyādinā maṇyuktaṃ pakṣāntaramāśaṅkya nirāha na catarhīti//
analyzed: athavā ityādinā maṇi uktam pakṣa antaram āśaṅkya nirāha na catarhi iti
translated: Or, suspecting another view stated in the Mīmāṃsā, he refutes it with And in that case, etc.

analyzed: trayodaśasu jala ādi samavāya anteṣu trayodaśasu iti arthaḥ
translated: In the thirteen, beginning with water and ending with conjunction, it means in the thirteen.

analyzed: viśakalitānām iti  jale tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādeśa anyonya abhāvāḥ prasiddhāḥ
translated: It means of the indivisible.🔽In water, the absences of the other twelve, beginning with fire, are well-known.

analyzed: jala anyonya abhāvaḥ ca tejaḥ prabhṛtiṣu
translated: And the absence of water in fire, etc.

analyzed: tathā jala ādi dvādaśa anyonya abhāvaḥ teja jasi
translated: Similarly, the absence of the other twelve, beginning with water, in fire.

analyzed: tejaḥ nyonya abhāvaḥ nyatra iti evaṃrūpeṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The absence of fire elsewhere, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: yadvā trayodasapadārthānāmanyonyābhāvānāṃ jalabhedastejasi tejobhedo jale ityevaṃrūpeṇa prasiddhirityarthaḥ/
analyzed: yat vā trayodasa padārthānām anyonya abhāvānām jala bhedaḥ tejasi tejaḥ bhedaḥ jale iti evaṃrūpeṇa prasiddhiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Or else, the absence of the other thirteen categories, the absence of water in fire, the absence of fire in water, and so on. This is the meaning of the well-known.

analyzed: ādi padena vyāpya graha ādi grahaḥ
translated: The word 'etc.' includes the apprehension of the pervaded and the apprehender.

analyzed: tatra sādhya abhāvasya asatvena iti
translated: There, by the non-existence of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: śaśa śraṅga ullikhitau api ityādau api viśakalitānām śaśa ādīnām prasiddha tvāt ca
translated: Even in the case of 'the earth is scratched by the horn of a rabbit', etc., the indivisible rabbit, etc. are well-known.🔽Therefore, it is redundant. Because it is easy to say that even in 'the earth is scratched by the horn of a rabbit', etc., the indivisible are well-known.

original: ityadhikamga / 'śaśaśṛṅgollikhitā bhūrityādāvapi viśakalitānāṃ prasiddheḥ suvacatvāt' ityasti ṭa / / sādhyateti iti na ṭa /ṭha /
analyzed: iti adhikam ga śaśa śṛṅga ullikhitā bhūḥ ityādau api viśakalitānām prasiddheḥ suvaca tvāt iti asti sādhya tā iti iti na
translated: The refutation of the Kālāyas

analyzed: kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ 🔽vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The debate on division

original: kiñcaikenaiva liṅgenaikadā sādhyamānā api trayodaśabhedāḥ pratyekanirūpitatrayogaśavyāptibhireva sādhanīyāḥ/
analyzed: kiñca ekena eva liṅgena ekadā sādhyamānāḥ api trayodaśa bhedāḥ pratyeka nirūpita trayaḥ gaśa vyāptibhiḥ eva sādhanīyāḥ
translated: Moreover, even when being proved at one time by one and the same probans, the thirteen varieties are to be proved only by the pervasion determined by each individual,

analyzed: na tu milita nirūpita eka vyāptyā
translated: but not by a single pervasion determined by the combination.

analyzed: milita aprasiddhau tad ajñānam
translated: If the combination is not well known, there is ignorance of it.

original: yatra trayodaśānāmanyonyābhāvanāmabhāvastatra pṛthivītvābhāva iti hi vyatirekavyāptirjalādau pradarśanīyā/
analyzed: yatra trayodaśānām anyonya abhāvanām abhāvaḥ tatra pṛthivī tva abhāvaḥ iti hi vyatireka vyāptiḥ jala ādau pradarśanīyā
translated: For instance, the negative pervasion should be shown in water etc. that wherever there is the absence of mutual absence of the thirteen, there is the absence of earthness.

original: tatra jale jalānyonyābhāvābhāvasya satveti tejaḥpṛbhṛtipratiyogikānāṃ dvādaśabhedānāmabhāvasyāsatvena sādhyābhāvasyābhāvāt/
analyzed: tatra jale jala anyonya abhāva abhāvasya satva iti tejaḥ pṛbhṛti pratiyogikānām dvādaśa bhedānām abhāvasya asatvena sādhya abhāvasya abhāvāt
translated: There, in water, the absence of the absence of mutual absence of water being present, and the absence of the twelve varieties having fire etc. as their counter-correlates being absent, there is the absence of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: evam tejaḥ prabhṛthiṣu api iti vyatireka vyāpti grahaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, in fire etc. also. How then is the negative pervasion grasped? This is the meaning.

analyzed: nanu eka sattve api dvayam iha na asti iti pratītyā dvi tva avacchinna pratiyogitāka abhāvavat trayodaśa tva avacchinna jaladi anyonya abhāva niṣṭha pratiyogitāka abhāvaḥ
translated: If it is argued that by the cognition Here, when one is present, the other two are absent, there will be the absence of the absence of the thirteen-ness qualified by duality, and the absence of the absence qualified by the mutual absence of water etc.

analyzed: jala ādau bhaviṣyati iti na anupapattiḥ ita ced na
translated: in water etc., so there is no inconsistency, it is not so.

analyzed: pratīteḥ anyatara abhāva viṣaya tvena upapattau atirikta abhāva kalpanā yogāt ca
translated: Because, according to the opinion of the author of the Mīmāṃsā-śloka-vārttika, there is no such thing as the absence of the relation of inherence, which has been refuted by the author of the Mīmāṃsā-śloka-vārttika in his doctrine of pervasion.🔽And because it is not proper to assume an additional absence when the cognition is accounted for by having for its object either of the two absences.

original: nanu yanmate tādṛśābhāvasvīkārastanmatarītyāyaṃ pakṣe maṇavukta iti cenna/
analyzed: nanu yad mate tādṛśa abhāva svīkāraḥ tad mata rītyā ayam pakṣe maṇau uktaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that this is urged on the supposition of the opinion of him who admits such an absence, we say—not so;

analyzed: tad matasya eva gauraveṇa dūṣya tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: because that opinion is itself to be refuted on the ground of its being too cumbrous.

analyzed: abhyupetya api doṣam āha kiñca iti
translated: Even granting (for the sake of argument) (the existence of such an absence), he (Śrīdhara) points out the defect (in the doctrine of the Naiyāyikas), saying—and moreover, etc.

analyzed: pratyeka pratiyogika abhāva nirūpita iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is—as determined by the absence of each of the counter-correlates.

analyzed: vyatirekiṇī anvayavyāpteḥ abhāvāt milita nirūpitā iti
translated: Because there is no pervasion of the positive concomitance in the case of the negative premiss, (the pervasion is said to be) as determined by the combined (absence).

analyzed: yatra trayodaśa anyonyābhāvānām abhāvaḥ tatra pṛthivī tva abhāvaḥ iti evam rūpeṇa milita pratiyogika abhāva nirūpita eka vyāptyā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is—there is one pervasion as determined by the absence of the combined counter-correlates, in the form that wherever there is the absence of the thirteen mutual absences, there is the absence of earthness.

analyzed: tad ajñānāt iti
translated: On account of the ignorance of that (pervasion).

analyzed: milita aprasiddhau milita pratiyogika abhāva vyāpya ti ajñānāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is—on account of the ignorance of the pervasion as determined by the absence of the combined counter-correlates, when the combined (absence) is not well known.

analyzed: pihitra taṭarā
translated: (The word) 'pi' (even) is superfluous.
Nyāyadyuti, Tarka-tāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: tathā ca pratyekameva sādhyatā viśrāntetyekaikabhedarūpasādhyavato jalādereva sapakṣatvena tato vyāvṛttatvena hetorasādhāraṇyatādavasthyam//
analyzed: tathā ca pratyekam eva sādhya tā viśrāntā iti ekaika bheda rūpa sādhyavataḥ jala ādeḥ eva sapakṣa tvena tatas vyāvṛtta tvena hetoḥ asādhāraṇya tādavasthyam
translated: And so, the conclusion being in each case with the probandum, only such things as water, which have the probandum in the form of each individual difference, are the similar instances, and so the reason remains non-universal, because it is excluded from them.

analyzed: nanu pratyeka vyāpyyā pratyeka bheda sādhane pi na asādhāraṇyam
translated: But even if each individual pervasion proves each individual difference, there is no non-universality.

original: anumitiviṣayasādhyavavdyāvṛtyā hi tadbhavati/🔽anyathā dūṣyānumityavirodhitvenāsādhāraṇyasya pratipakṣonnāyakatvaṃ na syāt/
analyzed: anumiti viṣaya sādhya vavdyā āvṛtyā hi tat bhavati  anyathā dūṣya anumiti avirodhi tvena asādhāraṇyasya pratipakṣa unnāyaka tvam na syāt
translated: For that occurs by the exclusion of what has the probandum as the content of the inference.🔽Otherwise, if it were not contradictory to the inferable cognition, non-universality would not be the promoter of the counter-instance.

analyzed: na ca prakṛte numiti viṣaya milita bheda rūpa sādhyavān anyaḥ asti
translated: And in the present case, there is no other [similar instance] which has the combined form of the differences as the probandum,

analyzed: yena syāt iti ced na
translated: by the exclusion of which there would be non-universality. If it is argued that this is not so,

analyzed: sva sādhita pratyeka bheda abhāva dvāreṇa bheda melana vighaṭaka tayā dūṣya anumiti viruddha tvāt
translated: because the exclusion of what has each individual difference excludes the combination of differences by way of the absence of the individually established individual differences, [the reason] is contradictory to the inferable cognition.

analyzed: yat vā vyatireka vyāptiḥ etādṛśa sthale na vācyā
translated: Or, in such a case, the negative pervasion should not be stated.

analyzed: kim tu anvayavyāptiḥ eva
translated: But only the positive pervasion.

analyzed: na ca milita sādhya aprasiddhyā tad nirūpita eka vyāpti ajñānam iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the knowledge of the single pervasion determined by that [positive pervasion] is not possible due to the non-establishment of the combined probandum.

original: pratyekābhāvānāṃ pratyekanirūpitānvayavyāptibhireva tāvatāṃ bhedānāṃ sādhyatvāditi bhāvenāyaṃ granthaḥ pṛtta iti yathānyāsa eva granthaḥ sādhuriti
analyzed: pratyeka abhāvānām pratyeka nirūpita anvaya vyāptibhiḥ eva tāvatām bhedānām sādhya tvāt iti bhāvena ayam granthaḥ pṛttaḥ iti yathā nyāsaḥ eva granthaḥ sādhuḥ iti
translated: The text is quoted with the idea that the individual existences are to be proved by the positive and negative concomitance determined for each of the individual existences. Thus, the text as it stands is correct.

analyzed: jñeyam
translated: The meaning is that this text is quoted with the idea that the individual absences are to be established as many as there are by the positive and negative concomitance determined for each. Thus, it should be understood that the text as it stands is correct.

analyzed: pakṣadhara matam āśaṅkate nanu iti  anyathā iti
translated: The opinion of Pakṣadhara is suspected with But is it not so?

analyzed: anumiti viṣaya eka deśa vavdyā vṛtti mātreṇa sādhāraṇye numiti viṣaya abhāva viṣayaka tvāt satpratipakṣatayā doṣa tvam na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Otherwise means that if something is common by merely excluding a part of the object of inference, it would not be a fault due to being a counterexample because it has the object of inference as its object.

original: anumitiviṣayavato vyāvṛttatvameva pṛthivītvahetorastvityata āha na ca prakṛta iti//
analyzed: anumiti viṣayavataḥ vyāvṛtta tvam eva pṛthivī tva hetoḥ astu iti atas āha na ca prakṛte iti
translated: Let the reason earthness be just the exclusion of what has the object of inference. To this he says And it is not the case that in the present case...

analyzed: narahari ādi ukta doṣeṇa nirāha pratyeka iti
translated: He refutes with the fault stated by Nara Hariya and others with Each...

analyzed: sādhya tā avacchedakam vyāsajya vṛtti dharmam ādāya asādhāraṇya abhāvam āśaṅkya aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvena nirāha atha ityādinā
translated: Suspecting the absence of over-exclusiveness by taking the pervading property that defines the property to be proved, he refutes with the property being unknown with If it is said... and so on.

original: ttasya he ga /ṭa /rā / /yabhe ga /ṭa / /'pratyakṣabhedavacanapravṛtterapi svasā' ityasti ga /rā / /dhyeyam ḍa / /ṇāsā ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: he he pratyakṣa bheda vacana pravṛtteḥ api svasā iti asti dhyeyam
translated: The difference of perception is also due to the difference of its own object. This is found in Ga. Ra. It should be contemplated.

analyzed: kala vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The refutation of Kalpa

original: vibhāgavādaḥ pu / 🔽kiñcāsminpakṣe bhedamelanaṃ pakṣadharmatābalalabhyamam/ na ca
analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ  kiñca asmin pakṣe bheda melanam na ca
translated: The discussion on the distinction is over.🔽Moreover, in this view, the combination of differences is obtained by the power of the property of the subject. But
it is not proper for the uncommonness to be obtained by the exclusion of the probandum obtained by that power.

analyzed: tathātve numāna phalasya niṣpanna tayā  sādhāraṇyasya akiñcitkara tva āpātāt
translated: If it were so, then the result of inference would be accomplished,🔽and the uncommonness would become useless.

analyzed: atha sādhya tā avacchedaka avacchinna sādhya vat vyāvṛtya eva asādhāraṇyam
translated: If, on the other hand, the uncommonness is by the exclusion of the probandum qualified by the differentia of the probandum,

analyzed: prakṛte ca sādhya tā avacchedakam bhada gatam vyāsajya vṛtti trayodaśa tvam
translated: and in the present case, the differentia of the probandum is the thirteen-ness which is pervasive and not restricted to each individual,

analyzed: tat ca na pratyeka parisamāptam
translated: and that is not completed in each individual.

analyzed: tatas pratyeka bheda vat vyāvṛttau api sā anādhāraṇyam iti ced na 🔽evam asādhāraṇya parihāre pi trayodaśa tva paryāpti adhikaraṇa tva rūpa sādhyatā avacchedaka avacchinna sādhya aprasiddheḥ aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tva tādavasthyāt
translated: Therefore, even in the exclusion of the probandum restricted to each individual, there is uncommonness. If it is argued thus, it is not so.🔽Even though the uncommonness is avoided in this way, the probandum qualified by the differentia of the probandum in the form of being the substratum of the complete thirteen-ness is not well-known, and hence the fault of the qualifier being unknown remains.

original: jalādau svasmādbhedābhāvepi teja ādidvādaśabhedānāṃ satvena trayodaśabhedābhāvarūpasādhyavyatirekagābhāvena vyatirekavyāptigrahānupapatteśca//
analyzed: jala ādau svasmāt bheda abhāve api tejaḥ ādi dvādaśa bhedānām satvena trayodaśa bheda abhāva rūpa sādhya vyatireka ga abhāvena vyatireka vyāpti graha anupapatteḥ ca
translated: Even when there is no difference of water from itself, the non-existence of the thirteenth difference in the form of the absence of the existence of the twelve differences beginning with fire is not established, because the apprehension of the vyāpti in the vyatireka is not possible due to the absence of the vyatireka.

original: nanu ghaṭasya satvepipaṭābhāvena ghaṭapaṭau na sta itivajjale dvādaśabhedeṣu satsvapi jalādbhedābhāvena vyāsajyavṛttipratiyogitākatrayodaśabhedābhāvostīti
analyzed: nanu ghaṭasya sattve pi paṭa abhāvena ghaṭa paṭau na staḥ iti vat jale dvādaśa bhedeṣu satsu api jalāt bheda abhāvena vyāsajya vṛtti pratiyogitāka trayodaśa bheda abhāvaḥ usti iti
translated: If it is argued that even when the pot exists, the absence of the cloth by the absence of the pot and cloth is like this, similarly, even when the twelve differences exist in water, the absence of the thirteenth difference which is the pervader of the absence of the difference of water from itself exists,

analyzed: ced na
translated: then it is not so.

analyzed: vyāsajya vṛtti pratiyogika abhāvaḥ anyaḥ na iti upetya vyāpti abhāva doṣam ca āha jala ādau iti
translated: He states the fallacy of the absence of vyāpti by assuming that the absence which is the pervader of another is different from the absence of the pervader of another.

analyzed: vyāsajya vṛtti dharma avacchinna pratoyogitāka abhāvaḥ nyosti iti vādī śaṅkate  nanu iti
translated: The one who argues that there is another absence which is the pervader of the absence qualified by the pervader of another raises the doubt that even when the pot exists, the absence of the cloth by the absence of the pot and cloth is like this, similarly, even when the twelve differences exist in water, the absence of the thirteenth difference which is the pervader of the absence of the difference of water from itself exists,

analyzed: vyāsajya iti
translated: then it is not so.

original: tayā a ṭa / / paryāptamiti śodhitamasti ṭa /
analyzed: tayā a ṭa paryāptam iti śodhitam asti ṭa
translated: By that, it is purified that there is enough.

analyzed: nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ paricachedaḥ
translated: Nyāyadyuti along with Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: pṛthivyā jalātmakatve satyapi teja ādyanātmakatvamātreṇa trayodaśānyonyābhāvopapattyārthāntarāt/
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ jala ātmaka tve sati api tejaḥ ādi anātmaka tva mātreṇa trayodaśa anyonya abhāva upapattyā artha antarāt
translated: Even when earth is of the nature of water, the absence of the thirteenth mutual difference is possible merely by the absence of the nature of fire etc., because it is irrelevant.

original: laghavena pratiyogisatvamātramabhāvavirodhī ti vadatā tvayaiva vyāsajyavṛtti pratiyogikābhāvānaṅgīkārācca/
analyzed: laghavena pratiyogi satva mātram abhāva virodhī ti vadatā tvayā eva vyāsajya vṛtti pratiyogika abhāva anaṅgīkārāt ca
translated: And by you saying that mere existence of the counter-correlate is the counter-correlate of absence, the acceptance of absence with pervasion as the counter-correlate is not accepted.

original: ghaṭe satyapi ghaṭapaṭau nasta iti dhīstu ghaṭe paṭasāhityābhāvaviṣayeti tvayevaiktam//
analyzed: ghaṭe sati api ghaṭa paṭau nastas iti dhīḥ tu ghaṭe paṭa sāhitya abhāva viṣayā iti tvayā iva ektam
translated: And the cognition even when there is a pot, the pot and cloth are not is said by you to be about the absence of cloth in the pot.

analyzed: tasmāt aprasaddha viśeṣaṇa tva aṃśe siddhasādhanatva a nvayi tva asādhāraṇyānām anyatarat durvāram
translated: Therefore, in the part of being a non-established qualifier, either the reason being established, the reason being the same as the inferable property, or the reason being uncommon cannot be avoided.

original: vyāsajyavṛttiḥ anugatavṛttimānyaḥ tādṛśadharmāvacchinnā pratiyogitā yasya tādṛśo yastrayodaśabhedānāmabhāva ityarthaḥ//
analyzed: vyāsajya vṛttiḥ anugata vṛttimān yaḥ tādṛśa dharma avacchinnā pratiyogitā yasya tādṛśaḥ yaḥ trayodaśa bhedānām abhāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: That which has pervasion, which is the possessor of pervasive property, the absence of such a property, the absence of the thirteen types is meant.

analyzed: jala ātmaka tve sati api iti  pṛthivyām jala ādi troya daśa padārtha tādātmya abhāva rūpāḥ trayodaśā abhedāḥ sādhyante tad siddhiḥ na syāt
translated: Even though it is of the nature of water,🔽the thirteen absences in the form of earth, which are the absence of identity with the thirteen categories such as water, would not be established.

analyzed: jala tādātmye sati api tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādaśa padārtha tādātmyānām abhāva mātreṇa trayodaśa tva rūpa vyāsajya vṛtti dharma avacchinna pratiyogitāka trayodaśa tādātyamyānām abhāva siddhyā api
translated: Even though there is identity with water, by the establishment of the absence of identity with the twelve categories such as fire, etc., the absence of identity with the thirteen categories, which is pervaded by the property of having thirteen as the counter-correlate,

original: sādhyaparyavasānasaṃbhavena jalabhedāsiddhyār'thāntaradoṣaḥ syāt /🔽ato na tādṛśo 'bhāvo 'ṅgīkartṛṃ śakya iti prāguktavyāptigrahānupapattiḥ sustheti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sādhya paryavasāna saṃbhavena jalabheda asiddhyā artha antara doṣaḥ syāt  atas na tādṛśaḥ bhāvaḥ ṅgīkartṛm śakyaḥ iti prāc ukta vyāpti graha anupapattiḥ susthā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: If it were possible to conclude with the probandum, there would be the fault of irrelevance due to the non-establishment of the difference of water.🔽Therefore, such an absence cannot be accepted, so the previously stated impossibility of grasping the pervasion is well-established. This is the point.

original: kiñca pratayogisatvasthale tādṛśābhāvo virodhānnāṅgīkāryaḥ/🔽na ca yāvatpratiyogisatvamabhāvavirodhi /
analyzed: kiñca prata yogi satva sthale tādṛśa abhāvaḥ virodhāt na aṅgīkāryaḥ  na ca yāvat pratiyogi sattvam abhāva virodhi
translated: Moreover, in the case of the existence of the counter-correlate, such an absence cannot be accepted due to contradiction.🔽And the absence is not contradictory to the existence of the counter-correlate as long as it exists.

analyzed: na tu eka pratiyogi satvam  vyāsajya vṛtti sthale ca eka pratiyogi satvam eva iti vācyam
translated: But not the existence of a single counter-correlate.🔽And in the case of a pervasive property, it must be said that there is only the existence of a single counter-correlate.

analyzed: tasya guru tvāt iti bhāvena āha lāghavena iti
translated: With this in mind, he says due to simplicity.

analyzed: iti vadata iti
translated: Thus he says

analyzed: vyāpti vāde
translated: in the doctrine of pervasion.

analyzed: tvayā maṇi kṛtā
translated: By you, the author of the Mīmāṃsā.

analyzed: anyatarat iti
translated: One of the two

original: ghaṭe satyapi ghaṭapaṭau nasta iti dhīstu ghaṭapaṭasāhityabhāva viṣayeti vadatātvayaiva🔽vyāsajyapratiyogitākābhāvānaṅgīkārācca tasmādapra ityastu ga /rā /ka / /dharmetyadhikam
analyzed: ghaṭe sati api ghaṭa paṭau nastas iti dhīḥ tu ghaṭa paṭa sāhitya bhāva viṣayā iti vadatā tvayā eva  vyāsajya pratiyogitāka abhāva anaṅgīkārāt ca tasmāt apraḥ iti astu garāka dharma iti adhikam
translated: But the cognition even when the pot exists, the pot and cloth do not exist is about the absence of the combination of pot and cloth, so by you🔽And because the absence with pervasion as its counter-correlate is not accepted, therefore let it be ap (not). G.R.A. The word dharma is superfluous.🔽G.R.A. The word anvayatva (concomitance) is missing in G.T.R.

analyzed: na asti gaṭarā  kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The refutation of the opponent's view

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The section on the doctrine of differentiation.

original: na cāsādhāraṇyasya satpratipakṣavadvipakṣe bādhakābhāvadaśāyāmeva doṣatvātprakṛte ca vipakṣe bādhakasya satvā ttasyādoṣatvamiti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca asādhāraṇyasya sat pratipakṣa vat vipakṣe bādhaka abhāva daśāyām eva doṣa tvāt prakṛte ca vipakṣe bādhakasya satvāt tasya adoṣa tvam iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the uncommonness is a fallacy only when there is absence of a counter-argument in the case of a counter-example, like the case of a counter-argument, and that it is not a fallacy in the present case because there is a counter-argument in the counter-example.

analyzed: tathā api sapakṣa satvena avidyamāna sapakṣa tva rūpa kevala vyatireki tva bhaṅgāt
translated: Even so, the uncommonness is broken by the presence of a similar instance.

original: etena jalatvāditrayodaśadhmasaṃsargātyantābhāvāḥ sādhyāḥ/🔽te ca pakṣaikadeśe ghaṭādau militā vā pakṣādanyatra🔽viśakalitā vā ghaṭādau jalatvaṃ netyādipratyakṣeṇa siddhā iti nistam/
analyzed: te ca pakṣa eka deśe ghaṭa ādau militāḥ vā pakṣāt anyatra  viśakalitāḥ vā ghaṭa ādau jala tvam na ityādi pratyakṣeṇa siddhāḥ iti nistam
translated: By this, the absences of the thirteen types of substances such as water etc. are to be proved.🔽And those are established by perception in the form waterness is not in the pot etc., either combined in the part of the subject like the pot, or separate from the subject.
This is rejected, because the occurrence of either the universal or the uncommonness cannot be avoided in the manner stated.

analyzed: yadi api anyatamam ita vaktavyam
translated: Although either one should be stated,

analyzed: dvayoḥ evam ḍa ta rayoḥ vidhānāt  anyatara anyatama śabdayoḥ khaṇḍa tve pi dvi bahu viṣaya tvena vyavasthita tvasya
translated: because of the injunction of two or more in this way.

analyzed: kaiyyaṭe bhidhānāt
translated: Because it has been stated in the Kaiyyata's commentary on the Nyāyasūtra that although the words either one and any one have the meaning of a part, they are established as having two or many objects.

original: tathāpi trayāṇāṃ madhye dvayame kīkṛtya dvitvasaṃpādanenānyataraditi sādhviti dhyeyam//
analyzed: tathā api trayāṇām madhye dvayame kīkṛtya dvitva saṃpādanena anyatarat iti sādhu iti dhyeyam
translated: Even so, it should be understood that it is good to take two out of three and form duality, and then say either one.

analyzed: asādhāraṇya doṣa uddhāram āśaṅkya doṣa antaram āha na ca iti
translated: Anticipating the removal of the fault of non-universality, he states another fault with the words 'not so' etc.

analyzed: prakṛte ca iti
translated: 'In the present case' etc.

analyzed: itara bheda sādhyaka pṛthivī tva hetau hetu ucchiti ādi vipakṣa bādhakasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the case of the reason 'earthness', which is to be established by the difference from other things, there is the refutation of the counter-example by the absence of the reason etc.

analyzed: sapakṣasya iti
translated: 'Of the similar instance' etc.

original: pratyekaṃ trayodaśābhāvānāṃ sādhyatvenābhimatānāṃ jalāditrayodaśasu prasiddhatvena teṣāmeva sapakṣatvāditi bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: pratyekam trayodaśa abhāvānām sādhya tvena abhimatānām jala ādi trayodaśasu prasiddha tvena teṣām eva sapakṣa tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that since the thirteen absences, which are intended to be established individually, are well-known among the thirteen such as water etc., they alone are the similar instances.

original: yopi maṇāvanyotvityādinā tattadasādhāraṇadharmātyantābhāvāḥ sādhyā ityantābhāvasādhyakapakṣa uktaḥ tamapi nirāha eteneti/
analyzed: maṇau anyotu ityādinā tad tad asādhāraṇa dharma atyanta abhāvāḥ sādhyāḥ iti anta abhāva sādhyaka pakṣaḥ uktaḥ tam api nirāha etena iti
translated: Even he who, in the Mimamsa, has stated the case of the probandum being the absolute absence of the particular uncommon properties, that also is refuted by the words 'by this' etc.

analyzed: siddhāḥ iti
translated: 'Are established' etc.

analyzed: atona aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that therefore there is no fault of the qualifier being unknown.

analyzed: ukta rītyā iti
translated: 'In the said manner' etc.

original: tvānna tasya doṣatvabhika /ga /ṭa /rā / /kṣasya sa ṭa /rā / /tvādiṭa / /mekarāśī ṭha /ḍa / /prakṛte ceti iti na ṭha /
analyzed: tvāt na tasya kṣasya prakṛte ca iti iti na
translated: Therefore, it is not a fault of that.
The Nyaya-Tandava, along with the Nyaya-Dipika, Third Chapter

analyzed: nanu tarhi jalam tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādaśa bhinna niṣṭha bheda pratayogi dravya tvāt tejaḥ vat iti anumānena
translated: Then, in the inference Water is different from the thirteen, because it is a substance, like fire, etc.,

original: vā vyāghātadaṇḍabhayena vā sāmānyataḥ prasiddhaṃ trayodaśabhinnatvaṃ pṛthivyāṃ sādhyate /
analyzed: vā vyāghāta daṇḍa bhayena vā sāmānyatas prasiddham trayodaśa bhinna tvam pṛthivyām sādhyate
translated: or out of fear of the punishment of contradiction, the generally established difference from the thirteen is proved in earth.

analyzed: tatas na anvayi tva sādhāraṇyam vā
translated: Then, there is neither the fault of non-pervasion nor the fault of being over-exclusive.

analyzed: pakṣa eka deśasya ghaṭa ateḥ niścita sādhyaka tayā anu alaya dṛṣṭānta tva saṃbhavena ityādinā ukta rītyā anvayi tvasya
translated: Because a part of the subject, a pot, can be the example by being seen to have the property to be proved, according to the method stated earlier.

analyzed: tathā kiñca ekena eva liṅgena ityādinā ukta rītyā asādhāraṇyasya ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that non-pervasion and over-exclusiveness are possible, according to the method stated earlier by But by just one reason, etc.

original: pratyekamevātyantābhāvānāṃ sādhyatvātteṣāṃ ca pratyekaṃ jalādāveva prasiddhestatra ca hetoravṛtteḥ/
analyzed: pratyekam eva atyanta abhāvānām sādhya tvāt teṣām ca pratyekam jala ādau eva prasiddheḥ tatra ca hetoḥ avṛtteḥ
translated: Because each of the absolute absences is to be proved, and they are each established only in water, etc., and because the reason does not occur there.

analyzed: anumiti viṣaya sādhya vat vyāvṛttyā āhya sādhāraṇyam iti jayadeva pakṣasya ca nirāsāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: For over-exclusiveness is when there is exclusion of what has the property to be proved in the conclusion, according to the view of Jayadeva.

original: yadapi maṇauyadvā jalaṃ tejaḥ prabhṛtidvādaśabhinnapratiyogikānyonyābhāvavadityādinā sāmānyataḥ prasaddhisaṃpādakamanumuktam tadapyāśaṅkya
analyzed: yat api maṇauyat vā jalam tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādaśa bhinna pratiyogika anyonya abhāvavat ityādinā sāmānyatas prasaddhi saṃpādakam anumuktam tat api āśaṅkya
translated: As for the inference stated in the Maṇḍana, which establishes the general cognition by saying that which is different from water, fire, etc., the twelve, etc., that is also suspected

analyzed: nirāha nanu tarhi ityādinā
translated: and refuted by saying but if so, etc.

original: yadyapi maṇāvanyathaiva sādhyanirdeṣaḥ kṛtaḥ tathāpi tatra yathāśrute tejaḥprabhṛtidvādaśanirūpitabhedādhikaraṇe
analyzed: yadi api maṇau anyathā eva sādhya nirdeṣaḥ kṛtaḥ tathā api tatra yathāśrute tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādaśa nirūpita bheda adhikaraṇe
translated: Although the definition of the probandum is given differently in the Maṇḍana, even so, as it is heard there, in the substratum of difference as qualified by fire, etc., the twelve,

analyzed: jala bheda asiddhyā siṣādhayiṣita trayodaśa padārtha nirūpita bhedānām ekatra aprasiddhā iddhiḥ eva
translated: the difference of water is not established. Therefore, the difference as qualified by the thirteen intended objects of inference is not well-known in any one place.

original: atastadvyākhyātṛbhirvyatyāsena yojitasya sādhyanirdeśasyāyamanuvāda ityadoṣaḥ/🔽tejaḥprabhṛtayo ye dvādaśapadārthāstadvibhinnaṃ yadvastu tanniṣṭho yo bhedastatpratiyogīti sādhyārthaḥ/
analyzed: atas tad vyākhyātṛbhiḥ vyatyāsena yojitasya sādhya nirdeśasya ayam anuvādaḥ iti adoṣaḥ  tejaḥ prabhṛtayaḥ ye dvādaśa padārthāḥ tad vibhinnam yat vastu tad niṣṭhaḥ yaḥ bhedaḥ tad pratiyogi iti sādhyārthaḥ
translated: Hence, this is a restatement of the definition of the probandum, which is connected by the commentators of that [Maṇḍana] in reverse order. There is no fault in this.🔽The meaning of the probandum is: that which is different from the twelve categories beginning with fire, that which is based on that, that which is difference, that which is the counter-correlate of that.

original: tathā ca jalabhedastejaḥprabhṛtidvādaśapadārthabhedāścaikatraiva sāmānyataḥ siddhā iti anumānena vā siddhaṃ trayodaśabhinnatvamityanvayaḥ/
analyzed: tathā ca jala bhedaḥ tejaḥ prabhṛti dvādaśa padārtha bhedāḥ ca ekatra eva sāmānyatas siddhāḥ iti anumānena vā siddham trayodaśa bhinna tvam iti anvayaḥ
translated: And thus, the difference of water and the differences of the twelve categories beginning with fire are established in one place in a general way. Therefore, the difference from the thirteen is established either by inference or by [the Maṇḍana]. This is the logical relation.

original: prāmāṇyavāde prāmāṇyānumitisiddhyarthaṃ prāmāṇyaprasiddhisaṃpādakatayā maṇyādyuktaṃ tulyanyāyatvādihāpyāśaṅkate vyāghāteti//
analyzed: prāmāṇya vāde prāmāṇya anumiti siddhi artham prāmāṇya prasiddhi saṃpādaka tayā maṇi ādi uktam tulya nyāyatvāt iha api āśaṅkate vyāghāta iti
translated: In the doctrine of validity, in order to establish the inference of validity, he raises the doubt here also due to the same reasoning stated by Man etc. as accomplishing the establishment of the well-known nature of validity, with the word vyāghāta (contradiction).

analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhau trayodaśa anyonya abhāva rūpa sādhyam na prasiddham iti niṣedha ayogena niṣedha tā
translated: When the probandum is not well-known, the probandum consisting of thirteen mutual absences is not well-known, so it is not proper to negate it. By negating it,

original: puruṣeṇa sādhyaṃ sāmānyato 'vagatameveti na prasiddhamityuktāvidaṃ nābhidheyamityuktivahnyāghātarūpadaṇḍabhayenetyarthaḥ / 🔽lete ṭa /rā / /taḥ siga /ṭa /rā / /syetyarthaḥṭha / /nya pra ṭa /ḍa / 🔽kelavyatibhaṅgaḥ
analyzed: puruṣeṇa sādhyam sāmānyatas vagatam eva iti na prasiddham iti uktau idam na abhidheyam iti ukti vahni āghāta rūpa daṇḍa bhayena iti arthaḥ  la ite ṭarā taḥ sic aṭarā sya iti arthaḥ ṭha nya pra ṭaḍa  kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: the person has understood the probandum in general, so it is said to be not well-known. It is said that this is not to be expressed, out of fear of the punishment in the form of the striking of fire. The meaning is that it is like this.🔽The section on the refutation of the universal.

original: vibhāgavādaḥ pu / 🔽sāṃmugdhyena sādhyaprasiddhāvapi pakṣo vā pakṣādanyo vāyaṃ sādhyavāniti vyaktiviśeṣa niścayābhāvāditi cenna/
analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ  sāṃmugdhyena sādhya prasiddhau api pakṣaḥ vā pakṣāt anyaḥ vā ayam sādhyavān iti vyakti viśeṣa niścaya abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: The section on division.🔽Even if the probandum is well-known through direct perception, it is argued that there is no certainty about the specific individual that this is the subject or something other than the subject that possesses the probandum. If this is said, it is not so.

original: vyaktiviśeṣāniścayepi vyatirekipravṛtteḥ prā kkaścitsādhyavāniti niścaye tasyaiva sapakṣatvena vyatirekitvabhaṅgāt/
analyzed: vyakti viśeṣa aniścaye api vyatireki pravṛtteḥ prā kaścid sādhyavān iti niścaye tasya eva sapakṣa tvena vyatireki tva bhaṅgāt
translated: Even if there is no certainty about the specific individual, the negative concomitance is applicable. When there is certainty that someone possesses the probandum, that very [person] becomes the similar instance, and the negative concomitance is broken.

original: anyathopādhi nā kvacidvyāptibhaṅga iti niścayepi atreti vyāptibhaṅgasthalaviśeṣasyāniścayāt sopādhikopi saddhetuḥ syāt//
analyzed: anyathā upādhi nā kvacid vyāpti bhaṅgaḥ iti niścaye api atra iti vyāpti bhaṅga sthala viśeṣasya aniścayāt sopādhikaḥ api sat hetuḥ syāt
translated: Even if it is certain that there is no contradiction of pervasion anywhere due to some other condition, even a fallacious reason with a condition would be a valid reason, because the specific case of contradiction of pervasion here is uncertain.

analyzed: atha
translated: If it is argued that since it is a rule that what is accepted as undesirable when not accepted is authoritative, and since there is the occurrence of the undesirable when the subject to be proved is not accepted,

original: cāniṣṭaprasakteḥ satvāt sādhyasya sāmānyena prāmāṇikatve sidde pramāṇaviśeṣajijñāsāyāṃ
analyzed: ca aniṣṭa prasakteḥ satvāt sādhyasya sāmānyena prāmāṇika tve sidde pramāṇa viśeṣa jijñāsāyām
translated: and since the general authoritativeness of the probandum is established when the specific means of knowledge is being investigated,

original: vyatirekyupanyāsa iti nakopi doṣa iti cenna /
analyzed: vyatireki upanyāsaḥ iti na kaḥ api doṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: the statement of the negative example is not faulty in any way, it is not so.

analyzed: katham na anvayi tva ādikam iti atas maṇi ukta rītyā eva vyanakti sāṃmugdhena iti
translated: How is it not a reason based on non-apprehension etc.? In this way, he explains it in the same way as stated in the jewel.

analyzed: ayam pṛthivī ādiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this is earth etc.

original: anvayitvāsādhāraṇyayorabhāvepi yadasapakṣatvaṃ vyatirekyanumānasya lakṣaṇamuktaṃ tadbhagnamityāha vyaktiviśeṣeti//
analyzed: anvayi tva asādhāraṇyayoḥ abhāve api yat asapakṣa tvam vyatireki anumānasya lakṣaṇam uktam tat bhagnam iti āha vyakti viśeṣa iti
translated: Even though there is no positive concomitance or uniqueness, the definition of negative inference is stated as the absence of a dissimilar example, which is contradicted. He says that the individual is specific etc.

analyzed: aniṣṭa prasakteḥ iti  jala ādi vaidharmya gandha ādi upalambha hāni rūpa aniṣṭa prasakteḥ iti
translated: Due to the occurrence of the undesirable.🔽Due to the occurrence of the undesirable in the form of the loss of the perception of smell etc. which is the absence of similarity with water etc.

analyzed: pṛthivī rūpa vastu hāni rūpa aniṣṭa prasakteḥ iti vā arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the undesirable in the form of the loss of the object which is the form of earth occurs.

analyzed: evam maṇi ādi ukta sādhya prasiddhi prakāram vyatireki anumānam nirasya idānīm
translated: Having thus refuted the inference based on the vyatireka form of the probans, which is based on the well-known nature of the probandum stated by Manikantha and others,

original: vyatirekavyāpteḥ prakṛtasādhyasiddhau anupayogānna hi bhāvena bhāvasādhane abhāvenābhāvasya vyāptirūpayujyateityādi paddhatyā 🔽ṣāniścayādiga /ṭa /rā / /kvaciṭa /rā / /dherna ṭa /
analyzed: vyatireka vyāpteḥ prakṛta sādhya siddhau anupayogāt na hi bhāvena bhāva sādhane abhāvena abhāvasya vyāptiḥ upayujyate ityādi paddhatyā  ṣā a niścaya ādiga ṭarā kvaciṭarā dheḥ na ṭa
translated: now, in order to show that the vyatireka form of pervasion is of no use in establishing the probandum in question, because in the proof of an existent by an existent, the pervasion of a non-existent by a non-existent is not proper, etc., as stated in the Paddhati,🔽the author of the Tattvaṭīkā says: The vyatireka form of pervasion is not ascertained anywhere.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽prāmāṇikatvenaivārthe niścite pramāṇaviśeṣajijñāsāyāḥ viśeṣagataviśeṣajijñāsāyā iva vaiyarthyāt/
analyzed: prāmāṇika tvena eva arthe niścite pramāṇa viśeṣa jijñāsāyāḥ viśeṣa gata viśeṣa jijñāsāyāḥ iva vaiyarthyāt
translated: The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Section🔽When the object is ascertained as authoritative itself, the inquiry into the particular means of knowledge, like the inquiry into the particular of a general, is purposeless.

analyzed: pramāṇa sāmānyena sādhāyavat tayā niścitasya api sapakṣa tvena kevala vyatireki tva bhaṅgāt ca
translated: And because even what is ascertained as having the probandum by the general means of knowledge is a similar instance, the vyatireka form of inference is broken.

analyzed: tasmāt na vyatireki anumānam yuktam ā
translated: Therefore, the vyatireka form of inference is not proper.

analyzed: kiñca abhāva gatayā vyatireka vyāptyā katham bhāvasya gamaka tvam ā
translated: Moreover, how can the existence be the probans by the vyatireka form of pervasion belonging to the non-existence?

analyzed: nanu gamaka tve nvaya vyatireka vyāpti anugatam vyāpti tvam eva tantram
translated: If it is argued that when it is the probans, the universal pervasion of the probans and probandum is the only essential factor, whether it is an anvaya or vyatireka form of pervasion.

analyzed: na tu anvayavyāpti tvam
translated: And it is not the anvaya form of pervasion.

analyzed: gauravāt iti ced na
translated: Because it is cumbersome, it is not so.

original: tathātve dhūmagatayā vahnivyāptyā kṛtakatvasyānityatvagamakatvāpatyā svaniṣṭhavyāptitvaṃ tantramiti vaktavyatvenābhāvaniṣṭhavyāptyā bhāvasya
analyzed: tathātve dhūma gatayā vahni vyāptyā kṛtaka tvasya anitya tva gamaka tva āpatyā sva niṣṭha vyāpti tvam tantram iti vaktavya tvena abhāva niṣṭha vyāptyā bhāvasya
translated: If that were so, then the fact that the relation of pervasion subsisting in smoke makes the probandum 'non-eternal' would have to be stated as the condition of the probandum's being the probandum.🔽If the relation of pervasion subsisting in the probandum is the condition in the case of the positive concomitance,

analyzed: nanu anvini sva niṣṭhā vyāptiḥ tantram  vyatirekiṇi tu abhāva gatā
translated: then in the case of the negative concomitance, it is the relation of pervasion subsisting in the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: na ca atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: If it be said that there is no fallacy of over-extension,

original: pratiyogyanuyogibhāvasya niyāmakatvāditi cenna/🔽vyāpyaṃ liṅgamiti liṅgalakṣaṇasya vyatirekiṇya vyāptyāpātāt//
analyzed: pratiyogi anuyogi bhāvasya niyāmaka tvāt iti ced na  vyāpyam liṅgam iti liṅga lakṣaṇasya vyāpti āpātāt
translated: because the relation of the probandum and the probans is the determining factor, we say no.🔽Because the definition of the probans, viz., that it is the pervaded, would be violated in the case of the negative concomitance, if the relation of pervasion were to be admitted.

original: dyu ktaṃ hṛdikṛtvā prakāntareṇa vyatirekiṇaṃ nirāha kiṃ cābhāvagatayeti//
analyzed: ktam hṛdikṛtvā prakāntareṇa vyatirekiṇam nirāha kim ca abhāva gatayā iti
translated: Having thus stated the objection, the author sets aside the negative concomitance by another objection, viz., 'And further, if the relation of pervasion subsists in the absence of the probandum'.

analyzed: na ca atiprasaṅgaḥ iti
translated: If it be said that there is no fallacy of over-extension,

analyzed: dhūma niṣṭhayā vyāptyā kṛtaka tvasya anitya tva gamaka tva prasaṅgaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that there would be the fallacy of the probandum 'non-eternal' being the probans, because of the relation of pervasion subsisting in smoke.

analyzed: pratiyogi iti
translated: The relation of the probandum and the probans.

original: vyāpyavyāpakabhāvāpannābhāvayorhetusādhyayośca pratiyogyanuyogibhāvasyetyarthaḥ//🔽vyatirekiṇīti// 🔽niścite iti nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / /ṇyapyavyā ga / / dyuktiṃ ṭha /ḍa / 🔽kelavyatibhaṅgaḥ
analyzed: vyāpya vyāpaka bhāva āpanna abhāvayoḥ hetu sādhyayoḥ ca pratiyogi anuyogi bhāvasya iti arthaḥ 🔽vyatirekiṇī iti 🔽niścite iti na asti gaṭarā dyuktim ṭhaḍa 🔽kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the relation of the probandum and the probans subsisting in the absence of the two, viz., the pervaded and the pervader, which have come to be so.

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The discussion on the division is over.

original: na ca svanirūpitavyābhicāravirodhitvarūpaṃ vā svanirūpitavyabhicāradhīpratibandhakadhīviṣayatvarūpaṃ vā vyāptimatvamubhayānugatamiti vācyamā/
analyzed: na ca sva nirūpita vyābhicāra virodhi tva rūpam vā sva nirūpita vyabhicāra dhī pratibandhaka dhī viṣaya tva rūpam vā vyāptimat tvam ubhaya anugatam iti vācyam ā
translated: And it cannot be said that the absence of pervasion is of the form of being the opposite of what is determined by itself as non-deviating, or of the form of being the object of the cognition that obstructs the cognition of deviation determined by itself, and is common to both.

analyzed: sva nirūpita vyāpti apekṣayā asya guru tvāt
translated: Because this is heavy in comparison to the pervasion determined by itself.

analyzed: etad ajñāne api anumiti utpatteḥ anubhavāt ca
translated: And because experience shows that inference arises even without knowing this.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana sāmānādhikaraṇya garbhita tvena tvad mate sya vyāpti tva ayogāt ca
translated: And because, according to your view, this cannot be pervasion since it is contained in the co-presence of the probandum and the probans.

analyzed: kiñca vyāpti viśiṣṭa pakṣa dharma tā jñāna rūpa liṅga parāmarśaḥ numiti mātre hetuḥ
translated: Moreover, the determinate knowledge of the probans which is in the form of the property of the subject qualified by pervasion is the reason for mere inference.

analyzed: vyatirekiṇi ca sa na yuktaḥ
translated: And it is not proper in the case of negative concomitance.

analyzed: vyāpti pakṣa dharma tayoḥ vaiyadhikaraṇyāt
translated: Because pervasion and the property of the subject are in different subjects.

analyzed: kaivala vyatireki sādhya pṛthivī tva ādi hetau iti arthaḥ  sādhya abhāvasya aipavavyāpyatvāt hetutvena abhimata pṛthivī tva ādeḥ avyāpya tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the case of a negative concomitance alone, where the probans is the earthness etc. of the probandum.🔽The idea is that the absence of the probandum is pervaded by the absence of the probans, but the earthness etc. which is intended as the probans is not pervaded.

analyzed: vyāpti dvayasya api anugamakam āśaṅkya nirāha na ca sva iti
translated: Fearing that the two pervasions may not be followed, he says: And it cannot be said that it is of the form of being determined by itself etc.

analyzed: vyatirekaḥ nvayaḥ sva śabda arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word 'vyatireka' is positive concomitance.

original: vyatirekanirūpito vyabhicāro hetvabhāvavati sādhyāsatvaṃ taddvirodhitva vyatirekavyāpterastīti svanirūpitavyabhicāravirodhitvamubhayavyāpterastiḥ/
analyzed: vyatireka nirūpitaḥ vyabhicāraḥ hetu abhāvavati sādhya asatvam tad dvirodhi tva vyatireka vyāpteḥ asti iti sva nirūpita vyabhicāra virodhi tvam ubhaya vyāpteḥ astiḥ
translated: The counter-pervasion defined as the presence of the probandum in the absence of the probans is the counter-pervasion of the vyatireka-vyāpti. Thus, the counter-pervasion defined by itself is the pervasion of both.

original: evaṃ dhīpakṣepītyanugatavyāptijñānarūpaṃ karaṇamubhayatrāstīti tadviśiṣṭaparāmarśo vyatirekiṇyapi yukta iti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: evam dhī pakṣe pi iti anugata vyāpti jñāna rūpam karaṇam ubhayatra asti iti tad viśiṣṭa parāmarśaḥ vyatirekiṇī api yuktaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the case of the inference based on the cognition, the instrument in the form of the knowledge of the invariable concomitance that pervades both is present in both cases. Thus, the judgment qualified by that is proper even in the case of the vyatireki-type. This is the idea.

analyzed: tvad mataḥ iti  sāmānādhikaraṇya garbhita vyāpti vādinaḥ mataḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: In your view.🔽The meaning is: in the view of one who advocates the invariable concomitance that is pregnant with co-reference.

analyzed: kim ca vyāpti tva viśiṣṭa pakṣa dharma tā jñāna rūpa liṅga parāmarśaḥ anumiti mātra hetuḥ
translated: Moreover, the judgment of the probans in the form of the knowledge of the probans qualified by the invariable concomitance is the cause of mere inference.

analyzed: vyatirekiṇi ca san yuktaḥ
translated: And it is not proper in the case of the vyatireki-type.

analyzed: vyāpti pakṣa dharma tayoḥ vaiyadhikaraṇyāt
translated: Because the invariable concomitance and the property of the subject are in different subjects.

original: ityadhikam ga /ṭa /rā / /svanirūpitetyādi nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / /ca iti nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / / ṇi sādhyābhāvavyāptipakṣadharmatayo ka / /kiṇītaracedasā 🔽ṭha / / tatretyadhikam ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: iti adhikam gaṭarā sva nirūpita ityādi na asti gaṭarā ca iti na asti gaṭarā  tatra iti adhikam
translated: This is additional. The phrase defined by itself and so on is not found in G, T, and R. The phrase is not found is not found in G, T, R. In the vyatireki-type, the property of the subject pervading the absence of the probandum is the cause of the judgment.🔽The phrase there is additional in T and D.
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: na cānvayini liṅgaparāmarśo vyatirekiṇi sādhyābhāvavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvajñānaṃ anumitimātre tu pakṣadharmatādhīr heturiti vācyam/
analyzed: na ca anvayini liṅga parāmarśaḥ vyatirekiṇi sādhya abhāva vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tva jñānam anumiti mātre tu pakṣa dharma tā dhīḥ hetuḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that in the case of an anvaya (positive) inference, the reflection of the probans is the cause, and in the case of a vyatireka (negative) inference, the knowledge of the absence of the probandum being pervaded by the absence of the probans is the cause, and in the case of mere anumiti (inference), the cognition of the probans as a property of the subject is the cause.

analyzed: tṛṇa araṇi maṇi janya vahniṣu iva
translated: Because, as in the case of fires produced by grass, kindling wood, and a gem,🔽there is no experience of any specific difference in the inferences produced by the two causes mentioned, such as the reflection of the probans, etc.

analyzed: tad kalpanasya ca anyonya āśrayeṇa ca ayukta tvāt
translated: And because the postulation of that would lead to a mutual dependence, and the non-apprehension of what is fit is not proper.

analyzed: avāntara vaijātyasya iti
translated: The word avāntaravaiśiṣṭya (specific difference) is used in the sense of avāntarajāti (sub-class).

analyzed: tat avaśi aṅgīkartavyam  anyathā sāmagrī dvayasya paraspara vyatireka vyabhicāreṇa ānamitim prati hetutva asiddhi āpātāt tṛṇa araṇi maṇi janya vahniṣu api vahni tva vyāpya tad tad janya
translated: That must necessarily be accepted.

analyzed: tāvacchedaka avāntara jātiḥ na upeyā syāt
translated: Otherwise, because of the mutual exclusion and deviation of the two collections, there would be the undesirable consequence of the non-establishment of being a cause for anumiti, and therefore even in the case of fires produced by grass, kindling wood, and a gem, the sub-class that distinguishes each of those as being pervaded by the property of being fire would not be accepted.

analyzed: na ca asau jātiḥ anubhūyate
translated: And that class is not experienced.

original: ato naivaṃ kalpanā yukteti bhāvaḥ/🔽tṛṇāraṇimaṇijanyavahniṣvaveti pararītyā vyatirekadṛṣṭāntaḥ/
analyzed: atas nā evam kalpanā yuktā iti bhāvaḥ  tṛṇa araṇi maṇi janya vahniṣu ava iti para rītyā vyatireka dṛṣṭāntaḥ
translated: Therefore, such postulation is not proper - this is the idea.🔽The example of vyatireka (negative concomitance) is stated from the point of view of the opponent in the phrase in the case of fires produced by grass, kindling wood, and a gem.

analyzed: tatra api avāntara jāteḥ dvitīya paricchede nirāsāt
translated: Even there, the second chapter has refuted the sub-class.

analyzed: sva matena anvaya dṛṣṭāntaḥ eva ayam iti anye
translated: Others say that this is an example of positive concomitance according to their own view.

analyzed: ananubhūyamānā api sāmagrī vaijātyāt kalpanam sāmagrī dvaya siddhau vaijātya kalpanam iti anyonya āśrayeṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: Even though not experienced, the imagination due to the peculiarity of the collection is the imagination of the peculiarity upon the establishment of the two collections. This means that it is a mutual dependence.

analyzed: vyatirekiṇi tvad ukta gamaka tvasya adya api asiddheḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even now, the reasonability of being the cause of inference, as stated by you, is not established in the case of the negative example.

original: nanu vyatirekiṇopi śāstre tatratatra saṃvyavahārāttadanyathānupapatyā vyatirekavyapterapyanumitisāmagrītvaṃ kḷptamiti cenna/
analyzed: nanu vyatirekiṇaḥ api śāstre tatra tatra saṃvyavahārāt tad anyathā anupapatyā vyatireka vyapteḥ api anumiti sāmagrī tvam kḷptam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even in the case of the negative example, the collection of conditions for inference is established by the non-apprehension of the perceptible, because of the usage here and there in the scriptures, and by the non-apprehension of the pervader, then that is not so.

original: paraṃparayaivānumityupayogābhiprāyeṇa tatsaṃvyavahāra iti bhāvena sākṣādupayogaṃ nirāha kiñceti//
analyzed: paraṃparayā eva anumiti upayoga abhiprāyeṇa tad saṃvyavahāraḥ iti bhāvena sākṣāt upayogam nirāha kiñca iti
translated: The usage is with the intention of indirectly being useful for inference. With this meaning, he denies the direct usefulness with the words Moreover, etc.

original: kiñcetyādigrantho nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / /dhī padaṃ na ga /rā / /taraṇimaṇi ityasti ga / /ca iti na ga /ṭa /rā / /mātreṇetyadhikam ṭa / /nyavyapyatā
analyzed: kiñca ityādi granthaḥ na asti gaṭarā dhī padam na taraṇi maṇi iti asti ca iti na gaṭarā mātreṇa iti adhikam
translated: The text beginning with Moreover is not found in G, T, and R. The word dhi is not found in G and R. Taranimani is found in G. Cha is not found in G, T, and R. Matra is redundant in T. Nyavyapya

analyzed: ḍa ṇa iti bhāvena sā ṭha  kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: With the intention of Tha.🔽The section on the refutation of the negative example.

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The section on the division.

original: kiñca vyatirekavyāpteḥ sākṣādgamakatve vyarthaviśeṣaṇatvasya tvadabhimataṃ vyāptijñajñānapratibandhadvārānumitipratibandhakatvaṃ na syāt/🔽vaiyarthyenānvayavyāptivighaṭanepi vyatirekasyākhaṇḍābhāvatayā vaiyarthyābhāvena vyatirekavyāptyavighaṭanāt//
analyzed: kiñca vyatireka vyāpteḥ sākṣāt gamaka tve vyartha viśeṣaṇa tvasya tvad abhimatam vyāpti jña jñāna pratibandha dvārā anumiti pratibandhaka tvam na syāt  vaiyarthyena anvaya vyāpti vighaṭane api vyatirekasya akhaṇḍa abhāva tayā vaiyarthya abhāvena vyatireka vyāpti avighaṭanāt
translated: Moreover, if the vyatireka-vyāpti (negative concomitance) were the direct indicator, then the uselessness of the qualifier would not be the cause of the obstruction of inference through the obstruction of the knowledge of the vyāpti accepted by you.🔽Even if the anvayavyāpti (positive concomitance) is destroyed by uselessness, the vyatireka-vyāpti is not destroyed because the vyatireka (negative pervasion) is an indivisible absence and hence not useless.

original: api caivaṃ viruddhasya sādhyavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvaṃ dūṣakatābījamiti tvadabhimataṃ na sidhyet/
analyzed: api ca evam viruddhasya sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvam dūṣaka tā bījam iti tvad abhimatam na sidhyet
translated: Moreover, in this way, the seed of refutation of the contradictory (reason) would not be established as the object of knowledge of the absence of the counter-positive of the probandum, which is accepted by you.

analyzed: tathā hi ukta pratiyogitvasya jñānam
translated: To explain: Is the knowledge of the said counter-positiveness

analyzed: kim avyabhicāra jñāna pratibandha dvārā anumiti pratibandhakam
translated: the obstruction of inference through the obstruction of the knowledge of invariable concomitance?

analyzed: kim vā sahacāra jñāna pratibandha dvārā
translated: Or is it through the obstruction of the knowledge of co-existence?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ  viruddhasya sādhāraṇa antarbhāva āpātāt  gagamaka tve numiti janaka tve iti arthaḥ
translated: Not the first.🔽Because the contradictory (reason) would be included in the inconclusive (reason).🔽The meaning is: in the case of being a non-indicator, in the case of being a generator of inference.

analyzed: vyartha viśeṣaṇa tvasya iti
translated: Of the uselessness of the qualifier.

analyzed: parvataḥ agnimān nīla dhūmavat tvāt ityādau vyartha viśeṣaṇa tvasya vahni nirūpita dhūma niṣṭha vyāpti jñāna pratibandha dvārā anumiti pratibandhena anumitiḥ syāt eva
translated: In an inference like The mountain has fire because it has blue smoke, even though the qualification is useless, there would be inference through the obstruction of the knowledge of the pervasion of smoke in relation to fire by the obstruction of inference.
Because there is no uselessness of qualification when the absence in the form of blue smoke is pervaded.

analyzed: abhāvasya akhaṇḍa tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that absence is indivisible.

analyzed: nanu vyatireka vyāptiḥ kevala vyatirekiṇī eva sākṣāt gamikā
translated: Now, the negative pervasion is directly the probans only in the case of a negative inference.

original: anyatra tu vyabhicārajñānanivṛttidvāropayujyate na sākṣāditi vadantaṃ pratyāha api ceti//
analyzed: anyatra tu vyabhicāra jñāna nivṛtti dvārā upayujyate na sākṣāt iti vadantam pratyāha api ca iti
translated: But in other cases, it is useful through the removal of the knowledge of fallacy, not directly. In reply to one who says this, it is said Moreover, etc.

analyzed: evam iti
translated: In this way means

analyzed: vyatireka vyāpteḥ sākṣāt gamaka tve iti arthaḥ
translated: that the negative pervasion is directly the probans.

analyzed: tvad abhimatam iti
translated: What is accepted by you means

analyzed: hetvābhāvasagranthe tathā eva ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: that it is stated in the same way in the text on the absence of the reason.

analyzed: kim avyabhicāra iti  bādha pratipakṣau hi grāhya abhāva avagāhi tayā sākṣāt anumati pratibandhakau
translated: What is the invariable concomitance?🔽For, the contradictory and the counter-instance are directly obstructive to the cognition of non-apprehension by being immersed in the apprehension of the absence of the apprehensible.

analyzed: viruddha siddha vyabhicāraḥ trayaḥ numiti karaṇa parāmarśa vighaṭaka tvena anumiti pratibandhakāḥ
translated: The contradictory, the established, and the fallacious are obstructive to inference by being obstructive to the determinate knowledge which is the cause of inference.

analyzed: nu kevala ḍa
translated: Only the negative.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyadyot.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: sakala sādhyavati hetu abhāva jñānasya anvaya sahacāra jñāna vighaṭaka tve pi vyatireka sahacāra jñāna vighaṭakasya sakala sādhya abhāvavati sādhanam iti jñānasya abhāvena
translated: Even though the knowledge of the absence of the reason in the presence of the entire probandum is a hindrance to the knowledge of positive concomitance, the absence of the knowledge of the reason in the absence of the entire probandum is a hindrance to the knowledge of negative concomitance.

analyzed: tasmāt na vyatireki anumānam yuktam
translated: Therefore, negative inference is not proper.

original: parīkṣakāṇāṃ vyatirekavyāptyupanyāsastu yathopādhisiddhisādhyasādhanavaikalyāderanumānadūṣakavyabhicārādisādhana tayopanyāso na tu sākṣaddūṣakatayā/
analyzed: parīkṣakāṇām vyatireka vyāpti upanyāsaḥ tu yathā upādhi siddhi sādhya sādhana vaikalya ādeḥ anumāna dūṣaka vyabhicāra ādi sādhana tayā upanyāsaḥ na tu sākṣat dūṣaka tayā
translated: The statement of negative pervasion by the investigators is for the purpose of establishing the reason, the probandum, and the absence of the means of proof, etc., which are the means of refuting the fallacious inference, not for the purpose of direct refutation.

analyzed: ca
translated: And the hindrance to the reflective awareness is by way of having as content the knowledge of the absence of that object.

analyzed: tad viṣayaḥ ca vyāptiḥ pakṣa dharma tā ca iti dvayam
translated: And the object of that is the pervasion and the property of the subject.

analyzed: tatra asiddhiḥ pakṣa dharmatā virodhi tvena
translated: Among them, non-establishment is contradictory to the property of the subject.🔽The other two are contradictory to the pervasion.

analyzed: vyāptiḥ ca avyabhicāraḥ sahacāraḥ ca iti dala dvayam
translated: And the pervasion is the absence of deviation and the co-occurrence, which are two parts.

analyzed: tatra viruddha sthale sādhya vyāpakībhūta abhāva pratiyogitva jñānam kim avyabhicāra jñāna pratibandha dvārā atha sahacāra jñāna pratibandha dvārā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in the case of contradiction, is the knowledge of being the counter-correlate of the absence which pervades the probandum through the obstruction of the knowledge of invariable concomitance, or through the obstruction of the knowledge of co-existence?🔽Common

analyzed: sādhāraṇa iti  sādhāraṇā anekāntikā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: common inconclusive.

analyzed: viruddha tva jñānasya iti asya vivaraṇena nirdeṣaḥ sakala sādhyavati hetu abhāva jñānasya iti  anvaya sahacāra iti
translated: The explanation of the knowledge of contradiction is: the knowledge of the absence of the reason in everything that has the probandum, which is faultless.🔽Co-existence in the positive

analyzed: hetau sādhya sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa sahacāra iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: co-existence in the form of the probandum and the reason having the same substratum.

analyzed: tad avighaṭanāt iti
translated: Because that is not excluded

analyzed: tathāca tatra vyatireka sahacāra pratibandhena avyabhicāra jñāna saṃbhavena anumitiḥ syāt eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, the meaning is: there, because the knowledge of invariable concomitance is possible through the obstruction of co-existence in the negative, there would be inference only.

original: kathaṃ tarhi śāstre tadupanyāsastatatra kriyata ityata āha parīkṣakāṇāmiti //
analyzed: katham tarhi śāstre tad upanyāsaḥ tatatra kriyate iti atas āha parīkṣakāṇām iti
translated: How then is that mentioned in the treatise? For that reason, it is said: of the investigators.

original: upādhiśca siddhasādhanaṃ ca sādhyavaikalya ca tadāderityarthaḥ/ 🔽katayāka /ga /ṭa /rā / /kañca ṭa /ṭha / /vyāptīti vyatirekyāptītyarthaḥ/🔽ityadhikam ṭa /ṭha /
analyzed: upādhiḥ ca siddhasādhanam ca sādhya vaikalya ca tad ādeḥ iti arthaḥ  vyāpti iti vyatireki āpti iti arthaḥ  iti adhikam ṭa ṭha
translated: And the upādhi, the established, the probandum, and the deficiency of the probandum, etc. are the meaning.

analyzed: kela vyatibhaṅgaḥ
translated: By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what? By what

original: vibhāgavādaḥ pu / 🔽yathā vā dṛṣṭāntasyānumānāṅgavyāptipradarśakatayopanyāsaḥ na tu sākṣādaṅgatayā/🔽tathānumānāṅgānvayavyāptisādhakatayā na tu sākṣādaṅgatayeti draṣṭavyam//
analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ  yathā vā dṛṣṭāntasya anumāna aṅga vyāpti pradarśaka tayā upanyāsaḥ na tu sākṣāt aṅga tayā  tathā anumāna aṅga anvayavyāpti sādhaka tayā na tu sākṣāt aṅga tayā iti draṣṭavyam
translated: The discussion on the division of inference is over.🔽Or just as an example is cited to show the pervasion which is a part of inference, but not directly as a part,🔽similarly, it should be seen that [the example] is for the purpose of establishing the pervasion by positive concomitance which is a part of inference, but not directly as a part.

analyzed: yadi api anvaya vyatirekiṇi vyatireka vyāptiḥ na anvaya vyāpti sādhikā
translated: Even though in an inference based on positive and negative concomitance, the pervasion by negative concomitance does not establish the pervasion by positive concomitance,

analyzed: tatra anvaya vyāpteḥ anyatas eva siddheḥ
translated: because the pervasion by positive concomitance is established by something else in that case,

original: tathāpi spaṣṭavyabhicārepyanumāne upādhivanmūkībhūtā vā anvayavyāptereva vyabhicāraśaṅkāṃ nirākurvantī //
analyzed: tathā api spaṣṭa vyabhicāre pi anumāne upādhi vat mūkībhūtā vā anvayavyāpteḥ eva vyabhicāra śaṅkām nirākurvantī
translated: nevertheless, in an inference where there is clear contradiction, like an upādhi, the pervasion by positive concomitance remains silent, as if removing the doubt of contradiction.

analyzed: yat tu sudhāyām vyatirekinā anumānam pañca rūpa tā vaidhuryāt iti etat pariśeṣa ādi rūpa anumāneṣu anaikāntikam iti
translated: As for what is said in the Sudhā [commentary], that the inference based on negative concomitance is inconclusive with regard to inferences based on paryāpti and other [types of inference],🔽the refutation of the non-inferential nature of the inference based on negative concomitance by the doubters who stand aside, that is,

analyzed: vyatirekiṇaḥ taṭastha āśaṅkita ananumāna tva nirākaraṇam tat aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvasya doṣa tve
translated: if the property of being an unestablished qualifier is a fault,

original: vyatirekipramāṇaṃ na syāditi paraṃpratyāpādanasya tatra prastu
analyzed: vyatireki pramāṇam na syāt iti paraṃprati āpādanasya tatra
translated: the argument that the means of valid knowledge based on negative concomitance would not be possible, that is presented to the opponent there,

analyzed: vyabhicāra ādi iti adi padena siddhasādhanam āśraya asiddheḥ sādhakatayā sādhya vaikalyam vyāpya tva asiddhi sādhakatayā iti evam grāhyam
translated: The word 'ādi' (etc.) in 'vyabhicārādi' should be understood to include 'siddhasādhana' (proving what is already established), 'āśrayāsiddhi' (the basis being unestablished), 'sādhakābhāva' (absence of proof), 'sādhyāviśeṣa' (lack of distinction in the probandum), 'vyāpyatvasiddhi' (non-establishment of being pervaded), and so on as the means of proving.

original: evaṃ hi dhūmādāvanvayavyatirekiṇi vyatirekopanyāso vyartha iti śaṅkāmanūdyānvayavyatirekiṇi tu
analyzed: evam hi dhūma ādau anvaya vyatirekiṇi vyatireka upanyāsaḥ vyarthaḥ iti śaṅkām anūdya anvaya vyatirekiṇi tu
translated: Thus, the statement of vyatireka (negative concomitance) in the case of anvaya-vyatireki (having both positive and negative concomitance) is useless. Having raised this doubt, it is said that in the case of anvaya-vyatireki,

analyzed: vyatireka vyāptiḥ anupayuktā evā ityādi paddhati vākyam hṛdi kṛtvā parihāram āha yadi api iti
translated: the vyatireka-vyāpti (negative concomitance) is indeed useless. Keeping this statement of the Paddhati in mind, the answer is given by saying 'yatpi' (although).

analyzed: bhaktipādīya sudhā virodham āśaṅkya tridhā tātparyoktyā nirāha yātu iti
translated: Fearing contradiction with the Bhaktipradīya-sudhā, it is denied by stating the three-fold purport with 'yatpi' (although).

analyzed: iti kevala vyatireki bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Thus ends the section on kevala-vyatireki (negative-only inference).

analyzed: tiṣṭhati gaṭarā tredhā ṭa ṭha ḍa yatu iti iti syāt
translated: G.T.R. stand. T.T.D. stand. Yatpi should be.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽tatvātpararītimāśritya vā vyatirekivyāptisādhakatayopayujyata ityabhipretya vā /
analyzed: tatvāt para rītim āśritya vā vyatireki vyāpti sādhaka tayā upayujyate iti abhipretya vā
translated: Nyāyadyuti along with Tarka-tāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: pañcarūpatāvaidhuryādananumānatvaṃ na kiṃ tu vyāptipakṣadharmatayovaiyadhikaraṇyādevetyabhipretya veti draṣṭavyam//
analyzed: pañca rūpatā vaidhuryāt ananumāna tvam na kim tu vyāpti pakṣa dharmatayoḥ vaiyadhikaraṇyāt eva iti abhipretya vā iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Or, it is to be seen that it is not because of the absence of the five forms that it is not an inference, but rather because of the non-co-extensiveness of the pervasion and the property of the subject itself. analyzed: anyathā vyatireka vyāptiḥ anumāna aṅga tvāt ityādi tad vākya virodhāt

analyzed: tasmāt vyāpteḥ dvaividhyam anumānasya traividhyam ca ayuktam iti

analyzed: iti kevala vyatireki bhaṅgaḥ

Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, third chapter

analyzed: atha pañca avayava ādi niyama bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the rule of the five-membered argument, etc.

analyzed: punar api anumānam dvividham

analyzed: sa artham para artham ca

analyzed: tatra para upadeśa anapakṣam svārtham
translated: Among them, inference for oneself is independent of the instruction of others.

analyzed: tad sāpekṣam para artham
translated: Inference for others depends on that.

analyzed: atha pañca avayava ādi niyama bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the rule of the five-membered argument, etc.

original: punaranumānaṃ dvividham sārthaṃ parārthaṃ cetyādinā paddhatyuktaṃ vivṛṇvāna āha punariti//
analyzed: punar anumānam dvividham sārtham parārtham ca ityādinā paddhati uktam vivṛṇvānaḥ āha punar iti
translated: Explaining what is said in the Padarthadarpana beginning with inference is of two kinds: for oneself and for others, he says again, etc.

analyzed: prāk ukta vibhāga apekṣayā punar śabdaḥ
translated: The word again is in relation to the division stated earlier.

analyzed: vyāpti viśiṣṭa liṅga jñāna rūpam anumānam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that inference is the knowledge of the reason qualified by pervasion.

analyzed: tatra tayoḥ madhye
translated: Among them, in the middle of those two.

analyzed: para upadeśam vahni vyāpya dhūmavān ayam ityādi rūpa para kṛta upadeśam na apekṣate iti para upadeśa anapekṣam
translated: It does not depend on the instruction of others, which is in the form of This has smoke which is pervaded by fire and so on, given by another person. Thus, it is independent of the instruction of others.

analyzed: vyāpti viśiṣṭa liṅga jñānam iti viśeṣyam atra uttaratra ca yojyam
translated: The qualification having the inferential mark qualified by pervasion should be connected here and later.

analyzed: ca iti ṭa rā
translated: And is by T.R.

analyzed: pañcau avani bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The section on the five-fold division.

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The debate on division.

analyzed: sa sāmarthya liṅga patipādaka vākya ātmakaḥ para upadeśaḥ api para artha anumānam iti upacaryate iti sthite
translated: Even the instruction of others, which consists of statements that convey the inferential mark along with its capacity, is figuratively called inference for others. This being the case,

analyzed: tasya para upadeśasya jijñāsā saṃśaya śakya prāpti prayojana saṃśaya nirāsa pratijñā hotu udāharaṇa upanaya tā

analyzed: ni iti daśa avayavāḥ iti jarat naiyāyikāḥ
translated: say the ancient Naiyāyikas.

original: pratijñādayo dāharaṇādayo vā traya iti mīmāṃsakāḥ/

analyzed: udāharaṇa upanayau dvau eva iti saugatāḥ
translated: The Buddhists say there are only two parts, the example and the application.

analyzed: para upadeśa svarūpasya paddhatau anukteḥ anumā yuktiḥ eva uktā iti yuktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam āha sa sāmarthya iti
translated: Since the nature of the instruction of others is not mentioned in the Paddhati, and since inference is said to be reasoning only, he says along with its capacity in the Anuvṛttyādhikāra of the Pūrva Mīmāṃsā, as stated in the Suddī of Yukti Dīpikā.

analyzed: vyāpti samucita deśa vṛtti tva rūpa sāmarthya sahitam
translated: Along with the capacity, which is the existence in a place suitable for pervasion.

analyzed: yat vā vyāptiḥ eva sāmarthyam

original: tatsahitaṃ yalliṅkaṃ dhūmādi tatpratipattijanakaṃ vākyaṃ paropadeśa ityarthaḥ/
analyzed: tad sahitam yat liṅkam dhūma ādi tad pratipatti janakam vākyam para upadeśaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The statement that generates the understanding of that inferential mark accompanied by that, such as smoke, is the instruction of another. This is the meaning.

analyzed: sa ca vahni vyāpya dhūma vana ayam ityādi rūpaḥ
translated: And that is in the form This has smoke which is pervaded by fire and so on.
In order to exclude the mere statement from being the instruction of another, the word teacher is used.
In order to exclude over-extension to the mind-contact etc. which are the general causes of the understanding of the inferential mark accompanied by the capacity, the word statement is used.

analyzed: dhūmaḥ asti iti vākye tivyāpti nirāsāya sāmarthya iti
translated: In order to exclude over-extension to the statement There is smoke, the word capacity is used.

analyzed: paddhatau tad janaka tvāt para upadeśaḥ api parārtha anumānam iti kvacid upacaryate iti ukteḥ āha parārtha iti
translated: In the Pañjikā, it is said The instruction of another is also figuratively called inference for the sake of another because it generates that. Therefore, it is said for the sake of another.

analyzed: iti upacaryate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is is figuratively called.

original: yattu sasāmarthyaliṅgapratipādakavākyaṃ na paropadeśaḥ tasminneva vākye 'tivyāpteriti tanna/
analyzed: yat tu sa sāmarthya liṅga pratipādaka vākyam na para upadeśaḥ tasmin eva vākye tivyāpteḥ iti tat na
translated: As for the statement that the statement which expresses the inferential mark accompanied by the capacity is not the instruction of another because of over-extension to that very statement, that is not so.

analyzed: sa sāmarthya liṅga pratipādakam vākyam iti
translated: The statement which expresses the inferential mark accompanied by the capacity

analyzed: nigamanāni iti kagaṭarā kāḥ āhuḥ kagaṭarā vā kaṭarā yaḥ eva iti dvau iti gaṭarā sasā ṭa ḍa

analyzed: tat na ādya pañcakasya aśabda ātmaka tayā vākya avayava tvasya eva abhāvāt ukta niyameṣu hetu abhāvāt ca

analyzed: nanu

translated: as long as there is the cognition of the probans qualified by pervasion, property of the subject, etc., to that extent, the expressible is in the order of expectancy, otherwise there would be incompleteness.

original: tatra sādhyānupasthitau hetvākāṅkṣaiva nodetīti tadupasthityarthaṃ pratijñā /
analyzed: tatra sādhya anupasthitau hetu ākāṅkṣā eva na udeti iti tad upasthiti artham pratijñā

analyzed: vākyasya tādṛśa varṇa mālā rūpa vākya pratipādaka tvena tādṛśa liṅga a pratipādaka tvāt

analyzed: anyathā ghaṭa abhāva jñānam api

analyzed: ghaṭa jñānam ghaṭa abhāva vyavahāraḥ api ghaṭa vyavahārāḥ iti āpātāt

analyzed: anya anavacchedena ghaṭa avagāhi ghaṭa jñānam iti ced anya anavacchedena tādṛśa liṅga pratipādakam para upadeśaḥ

analyzed: na ca evam iti prasaṅgaḥ asti
