analyzed: pṛthivī tva ādi saṃbandhāt pṛthivī ityādi sva bhāṣya viruddham ca
translated: And it contradicts the self-commentary which says earth etc. due to the relation of earthness etc.

original: yaccoktaṃ pratijñāyāmagniśabde hetau dhūmaśabde ca tajjñāne lakṣaṇā/
analyzed: yat ca uktam pratijñāyām agni śabde hetau dhūma śabde ca tad jñāne lakṣaṇā
translated: And what was said, that in the proposition the word fire is figurative for the reason, and the word smoke is figurative for the knowledge of that,

analyzed: anyathā dhūmasya agnim prati akāraṇa tvena pañcamyāḥ ayogāt iti
translated: otherwise, since smoke is not a cause in relation to fire, the fifth case would be inappropriate.

original: nanu giriragnimān giriranagnika iti vivāda eva svaparapakṣa pratijñārūpa iti vadantaṃ prati prakārāntareṇa tadanaiyatyamāha parvatasyeti//
analyzed: nanu giriḥ agnimān giriḥ anagnikaḥ iti vivādaḥ eva sva para pakṣa pratijñā rūpaḥ iti vadantam prati prakāra antareṇa tad anaiyatyam āha parvatasya iti
translated: Now, when one says that the dispute itself, the mountain is fiery and the mountain is not fiery, is in the form of a proposition for oneself and others, in response to him, in a different way, he says the non-necessity of that with of the mountain etc.

analyzed: atas eva iti
translated: For this very reason means

analyzed: hetuvacana prāthamyasya pradarśita tvāt eva iti arthaḥ
translated: the reason why the statement of the reason is placed first has been shown.

original: yattu maṇyādau kathāyāṃ dhūmādityeva prayoktavyaṃ na tu dhūmavatvāditi/
analyzed: yat tu maṇi ādau kathāyām dhūmāt iti eva prayoktavyam na tu dhūmavat tvāt iti
translated: But in a discussion like in the jewel, only from smoke should be used, not because of having smoke.

analyzed: matubaḥ vyartha tvāt  pakṣa dharma tā tu upanaya bhyā iti uktam tat nirāha upayanasya iti
translated: Because the optative ending is useless.🔽But it was said that the property of the subject is by the application. That is refuted with of the application.

analyzed: udāharaṇa sārthakya artham udāharaṇa sārthakya artham tad grahaḥ
translated: The word etc. in optative ending etc. includes the mention of the purpose of the example, if pervasion is stated.

analyzed: vahni vyāpya dhūmavat tvāt iti prayogasya
translated: The meaning is that the usage because of having smoke pervaded by fire

analyzed: darśita tvāt iti bhāvaḥ 🔽prāk eva iti
translated: has been shown.🔽Even before means

analyzed: nanu tathā api hetu mātra ākāṅkṣā śāmaka ityādi granthena iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that even so, by the passage beginning with allaying the desire for mere reason, etc.

analyzed: iti sva bhāṣya iti
translated: Thus in his own commentary means

analyzed: gotamasūtrabhāṣye
translated: in the commentary on the Gautama Sutra.

original: hetuvacana eva matubarthasya pakṣasaṃbandhasyopādānena hetuvacane matubo rāhityakathanaṃ tadviruddhamityarthaḥ/
analyzed: hetu vacane eva matup arthasya pakṣa saṃbandhasya upādānena hetu vacane matupaḥ rāhitya kathanam tat viruddham iti arthaḥ
translated: The statement that the word matup is absent in the statement of the reason, by including the relation of the subject, which is the meaning of matup, is contradictory, this is the meaning.

analyzed: maṇi ādi uktam anyat api nirāha yat ca iti  agnimān ityasya agni jñānam iti arthaḥ
translated: He also refutes another view stated by Manjusa and others, saying and what is said.🔽The meaning of he has fire is he has the knowledge of fire.

analyzed: dhūmāt ityasya ca dhūma jñānāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And the meaning of from smoke is from the knowledge of smoke.

original: paroktamityadhikam ka /ga /rā / parokta heṭa / /tvābhi saṃ ga /rā / /bdasya iti śodhitamṭa / /bdasya iti śodhitamṭa / /nala rā / /tyarthaḥ
analyzed: parā uktam iti adhikam tvā abhi sam garā bdasya iti śodhitam ṭa bdasya iti śodhitam ṭa nala rā tyarthaḥ
translated: The additional stated by others is edited as stated by others in K.G.R. The meaning of hetu is edited as hetu in G.R. The meaning of hetu is edited as hetu in N.R.

analyzed: ṭha
translated: The meaning is hetu.

analyzed: tat na dhūme vahni jñāna janaka jñāna viṣaya tva rūpa jñāpaka hetu tvasya satvāt
translated: The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava🔽That is not so. Because there is the reason of being an indicator, which is the nature of being the object of the knowledge that produces the knowledge of fire in smoke.

original: nanu tadviṣayakajñānajanakatvameva jñāpakahetutvaṃ tacca dhūmajñānasyaiva na tu dhūmasyeti cenna/
analyzed: nanu tad viṣayaka jñāna janaka tvam eva jñāpaka hetu tvam tat ca dhūma jñānasya eva na tu dhūmasya iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the reason of being an indicator is only the nature of producing the knowledge of that object, and that belongs only to the knowledge of smoke, not to smoke, it is not so.

original: dhūmajñānagataṃ hi jñāpakatvaṃ na tāvadvahniṃ prati/
analyzed: dhūma jñāna gatam hi jñāpaka tvam na tāvat vahnim prati
translated: For the indicative nature in the cognition of smoke is not, first of all, with regard to fire.

analyzed: dhūma jñānāt vahniḥ ita kadāpi aprayogāt
translated: Because the statement fire from the cognition of smoke is never used.

analyzed: nā api vahni jñānam prati
translated: Nor is it with regard to the cognition of fire.

analyzed: tatra kāraka hetu tvasya eva saṃbhavāt
translated: Because only the causal relation is possible there.

original: vyāvṛttidhīhetudhīviṣaye daṇḍādau vyāvartakaśabdasyeva vahnidhīhetudhīviṣaye dhūma eva vahnijñāpaka śabdasya prayogācca//
analyzed: vyāvṛtti dhī hetu dhī viṣaye daṇḍa ādau vyāvartaka śabdasya iva vahni dhī hetu dhī viṣaye dhūme eva vahni jñāpaka śabdasya prayogāt ca
translated: And because the word indicative is used only with regard to smoke, which is the object of the cognition that is the cause of the cognition of fire, just as the word excluding is used with regard to the stick, which is the object of the cognition that is the cause of the cognition of exclusion.

analyzed: jñāpaka hetau ca anupapatti prati sandhāna nirapekṣa pracura prayoga ādinā pañcamī mukhyā eva
translated: And in the case of the indicative cause, the fifth case ending is primary itself by the abundance of usage etc. which are independent of the connection with non-apprehension.

analyzed: anyathā sākāraka hetau eva amukhyā syāt
translated: Otherwise, it would be non-primary only in the case of the causal cause.

original: dhūmādiprātipadikena jñānalakṣaṇāyāṃ hetutvārthakapañcamī mukhyaiva saṃpadyata ityarthaḥ/
analyzed: dhūma ādi prātipadikena jñāna lakṣaṇāyām hetutva arthaka pañcamī mukhyā eva saṃpadyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when the word smoke etc. is figuratively used to denote cognition, the fifth case ending which denotes the meaning of cause becomes primary itself.

analyzed: yajñapati ādi ukta diśā nirāha dhūmaḥ iti
translated: He refutes according to the view stated by Yajnavalkya etc. with smoke etc.

analyzed: vyāvṛtti iti
translated: Exclusion etc.

analyzed: daṇḍa viśiṣṭe adaṇḍitaḥ vyāvṛtti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in what is qualified by the stick, there is exclusion from what is not struck.

original: nanu dhūme vahnijñāpakaśabdaprayogo lakṣaṇayāstvityata āha jñāpakahetau ceti//
analyzed: nanu dhūme vahni jñāpaka śabda prayogaḥ lakṣaṇayā astu iti atas āha jñāpaka hetau ca iti
translated: Now, let the use of the word indicative of fire with regard to smoke be by figurative sense. To this he says And in the case of the indicative cause etc.

analyzed: mukhya artha anupapatti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is the non-apprehension of the primary meaning.

analyzed: eva prayoge lakṣaṇā iti uktau bādhakam āha anyathā iti
translated: Even in such usage, when 'lakṣaṇa' is stated, he states the contradiction with 'anyathā'.

original: yadvā nanvanyāyaścānekārthatvamitinyāyenaikatraiva mukhyatva manyatrāmukhyatva mupeyamityata āha anyatheti//
analyzed: yat vā nanu anyāyaḥ ca aneka arthatvam iti nyāyena ekatra eva mukhya tvam anyatra amukhya tvam upeyam iti atas āha anyathā iti
translated: Or, it may be that by the principle that having multiple meanings is illogical, the primary meaning should be accepted in one place and the secondary meaning in another. Therefore, he says 'anyathā'.

analyzed: tad pra gaṭa tya nu sam kagaṭa rā sādha ka ṭa khyā artha ṭa
translated: That is to be inferred. The inherence relation is to be inferred. The means of inferring it is stated. The object to be inferred is stated.

analyzed: khyā arthaṭa
translated: The object to be inferred is stated.

analyzed: pañcau avani bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The chapter on the refutation of the five elements

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The section on the debate on division

analyzed: kāraka hetau eva mukhya tve pi pañcamyām eva lakṣaṇā astu
translated: Even when the primary meaning is only in the instrumental and causal cases, the lakshana is only in the instrumental case.

analyzed: na tu pradhāne dhūma prātipādike
translated: Not in the primary meaning of the word 'dhūma' (smoke).

original: na ca subvibhaktau na lakṣaṇeti kuladharmaḥ/
analyzed: na ca sup vibhaktau na lakṣaṇā iti kula dharmaḥ
translated: And it is not the general rule that the lakshana is not in the case endings.

analyzed: vede prayāja śeṣeṇa harvīṣi abhidhārayati ityādau
translated: In the Veda, in statements like 'One should sprinkle the barley with the remaining part of the prayāja offering',

analyzed: tvad mate caturviṃśati guṇāḥ
translated: And in your view, there are twenty-four qualities.

analyzed: ekaḥ samavāyaḥ ityādau ca tad darśanāt
translated: And in statements like 'There is only one inherence', because that is seen.

original: na hi guṇā ityādivibhaktyuktā bahutvādisaṃkhyā tvanmate guṇādāvasti/
analyzed: na hi guṇāḥ ityādi vibhakti uktā bahu tva ādi saṃkhyā tvad mate guṇa ādau asti
translated: For, the number of plurality etc. stated by case endings like 'guṇāḥ' (qualities) etc. does not exist in qualities etc. in your view.

original: astu vā tvadrītyā kārahetāveva pañcamī mukhyā/
analyzed: astu vā tvad rītyā kāra hetau eva pañcamī mukhyā
translated: Or let the instrumental case be primary only in the instrumental and causal cases according to your view.

original: tathāpyanyatra jñāpaka hetau lākṣaṇikīti syādityāha kārakahetāveveti//🔽nanu subvibhaktau lakṣaṇā na yuktetyata āha na ceti//
analyzed: tathā api anyatra hetau lākṣaṇikī iti syāt iti āha kāraka hetau eva iti  nanu sup vibhaktau lakṣaṇā na yuktā iti atas āha na ca iti
translated: Still, in other cases, where there is an inferential reason, it would be figurative. Therefore he says: only in the case of an instrumental cause.🔽But it is not proper to have a secondary signification in the case of the case-ending 'su'. Hence he says: not so.

original: kvāpyanupalambhānna subvibhaktau lakṣaṇetyata āha veda iti//
analyzed: kvāpi anupalambhāt na sup vibhaktau lakṣaṇā iti atas āha vede iti
translated: Since it is not found anywhere, there is no secondary signification in the case of the case-ending 'su'. Therefore he says: in the Veda.

analyzed: prayāja śeṣeṇa iti
translated: With the remainder of the prayāja.

analyzed: vājapeya gate prayāja śeṣeṇa iti vākye dvitīyā tṛtīyābhyām śeṣasya haviḥ saṃskāra artha tva pratītyā  prayāja nāmaka yāga sādhana ājya dravya śeṣeṇa haviḥ saṃskuryāt iti arthaḥ iti prāpte śeṣasya
translated: In the sentence 'with the remainder of the prayāja' occurring in the Vājapeya sacrifice, the second and third case-endings convey the sense that the remainder is for the purpose of consecrating the oblation-material.🔽The meaning is that one should consecrate the oblation-material with the remainder of the ghee-substance which is the means of accomplishing the sacrifice called prayāja. When this is reached, the remainder

analyzed: pratipatti mātra apekṣa tvāt tad pratipadika svārasya anurodhena prayāja nāmaka yāga sādhana ājya śeṣam

analyzed: haviḥṣu sthāpayet iti arthasya caturthasya ādya pāde abhidhāraṇe viprakarṣāt anuyājana vat pātra bhedaḥ
translated: in the oblation-materials, which is the fourth, is established in the thirteenth topic that there is a difference of vessels like the anuyāja due to remoteness in the abhidhāraṇa.

analyzed: syāt iti trayodaśe dhikaraṇe vyavasthita tvena tṛtīyā dvitīyayoḥ karmatva adhikara ārtha tva svīkāra darśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the third and second topics, the sense of the case-endings is accepted as being for the purpose of the object, as it is established in the thirteenth topic.
And in order to remove the misconception that the plural and singular are not intended to be significant, the qualifications 'twenty-four' and 'one' are used.

translated: because of the perception of number in the quality etc. by indication.🔽Vaga. Tara. Ra. Ke he tha. Kshita ta. Tha. Da.

original: kta vaga /ṭa /rā / /ke he ṭha / /kṣita ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / /dvitīyayorityārabhya nāsti ḍa / taddarśanāditi iti paryantaṃ nāsti ṭha / /taddarśanāditi
analyzed: kta vagaṭarā ke he ṭha kṣita ṭa ṭha ḍa dvitīyayoḥ iti ārabhya na asti tad darśanāt iti iti paryantam na asti tad darśanāt iti

The Nyaya-Tandava, along with the Nyaya-Dipika, Third Section

original: pratyuta hetuvacane jñānalakṣaṇāyāmudāharaṇe upanaye ca jñānasya gamakatvārthaṃ tasyaiva
analyzed: pratyuta hetu vacane jñāna lakṣaṇāyām udāharaṇe upanaye ca jñānasya gamaka tva artham tasya eva
translated: Rather, in the statement of the reason, if there is indication of the knowledge, in the example and in the conclusion, in order for the knowledge to be the conveyor, its

analyzed: vyāpti ādi viṣayaka tvam vaktavyam
translated: being related to the pervasion etc. must be stated.

analyzed: na tu liṅgasya vyāpti ādimatvam
translated: But not the mark's having the pervasion etc.

analyzed: kiñca avayavena anumiti aṅgam eva jñānam utpādayitavyam
translated: Moreover, by the part, only the knowledge which is a part of inference should be produced.

analyzed: liṅga jñānam eva ca tad aṅgam
translated: And the knowledge of the mark is a part of that.

analyzed: na tu liṅga jñāna jñānam
translated: But not the knowledge of the knowledge of the mark.

analyzed: na api vahni śabde lakṣaṇā
translated: Nor is there indication in the word 'fire'.

original: pañcamyuktajñāpakatvāntargatajñānaṃ prati viṣayatayā vā jñāpakatvaṃ pratyeva jñāpyatayā vānvayenaiva vahnerjñāpyatvasiddheḥ/
analyzed: pañcamī ukta jñāpaka tva antargata jñānam prati viṣayatayā vā jñāpaka tvam prati eva jñāpyatayā vā anvayena eva vahneḥ jñāpya tva siddheḥ
translated: Because the knowledge of the inferential mark is included in the knowledge of the object, or the inferential mark itself is known as the object of knowledge.

original: dṛśyate ca caitramātetyādau strītvaviśiṣṭajanakatvarūpamātṛtvāntargatajanakatvena saha caitrasya janyatayānvayaḥ/
analyzed: dṛśyate ca caitra mātā ityādau strī tva viśiṣṭa janakatva rūpa mātṛ tva antargata janakatvena saha caitrasya janyatayā anvayaḥ
translated: And in the sentence Caitra's mother, the relation of cause and effect between Caitra and the mother is seen through the causal nature included in the nature of motherhood, which is the capacity to produce a person qualified by femininity.

original: udāharaṇepi yoyo dhūmavānasāva gnimānita pūrvabhāgenaiva vā /
analyzed: udāharaṇe api yaḥ yaḥ dhūmavān asau agni mānita pūrva bhāgena eva vā
translated: And in the example also, the relation of cause and effect between the two is seen through the first part of the sentence Whatever is smoky is fiery.

analyzed: liṅga jñānam eva ca iti
translated: And the knowledge of the inferential mark is itself the means of inference.

analyzed: na tu liṅga jñānam
translated: But not the knowledge of the inferential mark.

analyzed: jñāna lakṣaṇā pakṣe ca liṅga jñāna jñānam eva utpādyam
translated: And in the case of the definition of knowledge as the means of inference, only the knowledge of the knowledge of the inferential mark is to be produced.

analyzed: gaṅgā padena tīra jñānam iva
translated: Like the knowledge of the bank from the word Gaṅgā.

analyzed: tat ca na anumiti aṅgam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And that is not a part of inference, this is the idea.

original: hetau jñānalakṣaṇāṃ nirasya sādhyepi tāṃ nirāha natviti//
analyzed: hetau jñāna lakṣaṇām nirasya sādhye api tām nirāha na tu iti
translated: Having rejected the definition of the reason as knowledge, he rejects the definition of the probandum also, saying not so.

analyzed: vahni jñāna janaka jñāna viṣaya tva rūpa jñāpaka tva antargata vahni jñānam prati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: with regard to the knowledge of fire, which is included in the inferential mark, which is the nature of being the object of the knowledge that produces the knowledge of fire.

analyzed: jñāpya tayā iti
translated: As the object to be known.

analyzed: jñāna janaka tva rūpa jñāpaka tvam prati eva tad janya jñāna viṣaya tva rūpa jñāpya tayā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: with regard to the inferential mark, which is the nature of being the cause of knowledge, only the nature of being the object of the knowledge produced by it.

original: nanvādyapakṣe padārthaikadeśena kathamanvaya ityata āha dṛśyateceti//
analyzed: nanu ādya pakṣe padārtha eka deśena katham anvayaḥ iti atas āha dṛśyate ca iti
translated: But in the first case, how is there connection with a part of the meaning of the word? To this he says And it is seen.

analyzed: udāharaṇa rūpa avayavam api para abhipretam nirāha udāharaṇe ipi iti
translated: He also refutes the example-like part intended by the opponent, saying In the example too🔽But not etc. is not found.

original: na tu ityādi nāstiṭa /rā / /bdenalaka /ga /rā / /hnijñāpyat ga /ṭha /rā / /sāvasāya ka /rā /
analyzed: na tu ityādi gaṭharā
translated: By the word alaka, ra, ra, ha, ni, jñāpya, ga, ṭha, ra, sā, vāsāya, ka, ra, ra.

analyzed: pañcau avani bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The fifth section on the refutation of the earth.

analyzed: vibhāga vādaḥ
translated: The section on division.

analyzed: yathā mahānase iti uttara bhāgena eva vā vyāpti upasthiteḥ anyatara vdi artham
translated: Or it is for the sake of either one, because the pervasion is presented by the latter part alone, like in a kitchen.

analyzed: atas eva dṛṣṭānta abhidhāna sāmiyakam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that for this very reason the statement of the example is unnecessary, it is not so.

analyzed: anupayuktam api abhidheyam iti samaya bandhasya eva ayogāt  yasya puṃsaḥ
translated: Because it is not proper to make an agreement that even what is not useful should be stated.

original: pūrvabhāgena na vyāptismṛti staṃ prati dṛṣṭāntasyāpyuktiriti cenna/
analyzed: pūrva bhāgena na vyāpti smṛti stam prati dṛṣṭāntasya api uktiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that if it were so, the statement of the example would be for one who does not have the recollection of the pervasion by the former part, it is not so.

analyzed: tathātve vayava aniyama siddheḥ  yat ca sakalasya api sādhanavataḥ sādhyava tva rūpa vyāpti antargata sākalya artham yad śabde
translated: Because if it were so, the restriction on the parts would not be established.

analyzed: tat na
translated: And what was said that the word ya is for the sake of the totality which is included in the pervasion which is the nature of the presence of the probandum in everything that has the means of proof, that is not so.

analyzed: gauḥ na padā spaṣṭa vyāyasya ubhayam haviḥ ārti mār chet
translated: The cow should not be struck with the foot, he should offer both oblations,

original: yo brāhmaṇāyāvagurettaṃ śatena yātayādityādāviva vīpsāṃ vināpi yo dhūmavāniti sāmānyatoktyaiva tatsiddheḥ/
analyzed: yaḥ brāhmaṇāya avaguret tam śatena yātayāt ityādau iva vīpsām vinā api yaḥ dhūmavān iti sāmānyatas uktyā eva tad siddheḥ
translated: As in the statement One who digs a pit for a Brahmin should be punished with a hundred, even without repetition, the meaning is established by the general statement itself, as in One who has smoke.

analyzed: śaṅkate atas eva iti
translated: He raises an objection - For this very reason...

analyzed: pūrva bhāga mātreṇa vyāpti upasthiteḥ jāta tvāt eva
translated: Because the pervasion is already present merely by the first part.

analyzed: sāmayikam samaya bandha kṛtam iti arthaḥ
translated: Accidental means created by an agreement.

analyzed: avayava iti
translated: In parts means

analyzed: avayava aniyamasya asmat pakṣasya siddheḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: that the restriction to parts is established in our view.

original: gauriti// yā gauḥ sā padā na spaṣṭavyetyabhiprāyaṇagaurna padā spaṣṭavyetyucyate vede /
analyzed: gauḥ iti yā gauḥ sā padā na spaṣṭavyā iti abhiprāyaṇa gauḥ na padā spaṣṭavyā iti ucyate vede
translated: Cow means that the intention is that no cow should be struck with the foot, and it is said in the Veda that no cow should be struck with the foot.

original: tathāyasyobhayaṃ sāyaṅkālīnaṃ prātaḥkālīnaṃ ca haviḥ krimikīṭādivaśenārtiṃ nāśamāpnuyāt
analyzed: tathā ayasya ubhayam sāyaṅkālīnam prātar kālīnam ca haviḥ krimi kīṭa ādi vaśena ārtim nāśam āpnuyāt
translated: Similarly, in the case of one whose oblation meant for the evening and morning is destroyed by worms, insects, etc.,

original: aindraṃ pañcaśarāvamodanaṃ nirvapedityatra yasya yasya puṃsa iti vaktavye yasyeti sakṛdevoktiryathā /
analyzed: aindram pañca śarāvam odanam nirvapet iti atra yasya yasya puṃsaḥ iti vaktavye yasya iti sakṛt eva uktiḥ yathā
translated: one should offer a cake on five potsherds to Indra. Here, although it should be said of whichever person, it is stated once as of one.

original: ata yo brāhmaṇāyāvaguret vadhodyogaṃ kuryāt taṃ śatayātanākhyanarakiṇaṃ vidyādityādau yoya iti vīpsāṃ vinā yathoktirityarthaḥ//
analyzed: yaḥ brāhmaṇāya avaguret vadha udyogam kuryāt tam śatayātana ākhya narakiṇam vidyāt ityādau yaḥ yaḥ iti vīpsām vinā yathā uktiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, in statements like One who digs a pit for a Brahmin should be known as one who will be punished with a hundred, without repetition as of whichever, it is stated as above.

original: dhīstaṃ ga /rā / /bdādau ga /rār / / chati atha yoṭa /rā /
analyzed: dhīḥ tam garā bda ādau garār  chati atha yoṭarā
translated: The intellect grasps him at the beginning of the year, and then the Yota.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyādīpa.

analyzed: idam etat abhinnam
translated: This is non-different from that.

analyzed: etat asādhāraṇa dharma adhikaraṇa tvāt etad vat iti abheda anumāne sapakṣa vyakti bheda abhāvena vīpsā artha abhāvāt ca
translated: Because it has the property of being the locus of uncommon properties, and because there is no difference in the individual instances of the similar example in the inference of non-difference, there is no meaning of repetition.

analyzed: kvacid vīpsā tu spaṣṭa tā arthā
translated: But in some cases, the repetition is clearly meaningful.

original: ata eva vimato bhinno muktatvādyaditthaṃ tattathetyādāvācāryo ktau na vīpsā//
analyzed: atas eva vimataḥ bhinnaḥ mukta tvāt yat ittham tat tathā ityādau ācāryaḥ    na vīpsā
translated: For this very reason, in statements like The disputed is different, because of being liberated, like that which is so, the teacher does not use repetition in the past tense.

analyzed: upanayaḥ api hetuvacanena gatārthaḥ
translated: The application is also redundant with the statement of the reason.

analyzed: agni vyāpta dhūmavān ca ayam iti tvad abhimate upanaye udāharaṇa siddha vyāpti anuvāda aṃśa vaiyarthyam ca
translated: And in the application accepted by you, This has smoke which is pervaded by fire, there is also the uselessness of restating the pervasion which is established in the example.

analyzed: nigamanam api pratijñayā gata artham
translated: The conclusion is also redundant with the thesis.

analyzed: na ca upasaṃhāra artham tat
translated: And it is not for the purpose of summarizing.

analyzed: vijātīya bahu prameya avyavadhānena tad anapekṣaṇāt
translated: Because it is not required when there is no interruption by many heterogeneous objects of knowledge.

analyzed: anyathā pratyekam kaṇṭaka uddhārāḥ anantaram tasmāt sarva
translated: Otherwise, after the removal of each thorn, Therefore, all

original: nanu kathaṃ tarhiyadyatpāpaṃ prati jahi jagannātha tanmeyāṃ yāṃ priyaḥ praikṣatetyādau vīpsoktirityata āha kvaciditi//
analyzed: nanu katham tarhi yat yat pāpam prati jahi jagannātha tat me yām yām priyaḥ praikṣata ityādau vīpsā uktiḥ iti atas āha kvacid iti
translated: But how then is the repetition expressed in such passages as Whatever sin there is, O Lord of the world, destroy that for me, which my dear one sees, etc.? To this he says sometimes.

analyzed: ācārya uktau iti
translated: In the statement of the teacher means

analyzed: tatvā udyote
translated: in the Tattva-dipika.

analyzed: upanaya ākhyā avayava tvam ca nirāha upanayaḥ upi iti
translated: And he denies the status of being a part called upanaya, saying The upanaya also.

analyzed: pañcama avayavam ca nirāha nigamanam api iti
translated: And he denies the fifth part, saying The nigamana also.

analyzed: upasaṃhāra artham iti  pṛthak pṛthak vākya uktānām eka buddhi āroha artham iti arthaḥ
translated: For the purpose of conclusion means🔽for the purpose of bringing together in one cognition those stated in separate sentences.

analyzed: pratyekam kaṇṭaka iti
translated: Each thorn means

analyzed: na ayam asiddhaḥ tad lakṣaṇa hīna tvāt iti uktvā tasmāt asiddha rāhityāt idam sādhakam
translated: This is not unestablished, because it lacks that definition, having said this, Therefore, this is a proof because it lacks unestablishedness.

original: nāyaṃ viruddhaḥ tallakṣaṇarāhityādityuktvā viruddharāhityādidaṃ sādhakamiti pratyekaṃ nigamanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na ayam viruddhaḥ tad lakṣaṇa rāhityāt iti uktvā viruddha rāhityāt idam sādhakam iti pratyekam nigamanam syāt
translated: This is not contradictory, because it lacks that definition, having said this, Because it lacks contradiction, this is a proof, such a nigamana would occur for each.

analyzed: tathā na ayam ābhāsaḥ tad lakṣaṇaiḥ hīna tvāt iti anantaram tasmāt sarva doṣa rāhityāt idam sādhakam iti
translated: Similarly, This is not a fallacious reason, because it lacks those definitions, after this, Therefore, this is a proof because it lacks all faults,

analyzed: namrasya iti sādhakam
translated: the word is is filled in, this is a proof is added.

analyzed: svāti anuna doṣāḥ
translated: faults of one's own

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: doṣa rāhityāt idam sādhakam ityādi api nigamanam niyatam syāt
translated: Even the conclusion that this is a proof because it is free from faults would be fixed.

analyzed: na ca bādhā ādi śaṅkā nirāsa artham tat
translated: And that is not for the purpose of refuting doubts such as contradiction.

analyzed: udāharaṇa upanaya ukta vyāpti pakṣa dharma tābhyām eva sva virodhi sarva doṣa pratikṣepāt
translated: Because the mere stated pervasion and the property of the subject in the example and application exclude all faults that contradict it.

analyzed: tasmāt pañca avayava ādi niyamaḥ na yuktaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the rule of the five-membered argument is not appropriate.
The breaking of the rule of the five-membered argument.

original: tathā idamasādhakaṃ asiddhatvāditi dūṣakatānumānepi tasmādasiddhatvādidamasādhakaṃ tasmādābhāsakatvādidamasādhakamityupasaṃhāraḥ syāt/
analyzed: tathā idam asādhakam asiddha tvāt iti dūṣakatā anumāne api tasmāt asiddha tvāt idam asādhakam tasmāt ābhāsaka tvāt idam asādhakam iti upasaṃhāraḥ syāt
translated: Similarly, in the inference of the faultiness that this is not a proof because it is unestablished, the conclusion would be that this is not a proof because it is unestablished, and this is not a proof because it is fallacious.

analyzed: nanu kadācid tatra api iṣyate eva iti atas āha niyatam iti
translated: But it is sometimes desired even there, so he says fixed.

analyzed: tat iti nigamanam iti arthaḥ
translated: That means the conclusion.

analyzed: pūrva ukta diśā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is in the manner stated earlier.
The breaking of the rule of the five-membered argument.

analyzed: atha sva abhimata anumāna doṣaḥ
translated: Now, the faults of inference according to one's own opinion.

analyzed: atha anumāna doṣaḥ ucyate
translated: Now, the faults of inference are stated.

analyzed: atha sva abhimata anumāna doṣaḥ
translated: Now, the faults of inference according to one's own opinion.

analyzed: nirdeṣa upapattiḥ anumā iti uktam
translated: It was said that inference is the establishment of what is faultless.

original: tatra doṣajñāne satyeva tadviviktatayopapattiḥ sujñānetyataḥatha nirdeṣopapattiranumānamityuktam
analyzed: tatra doṣa jñāne sati eva tad vivikta tayā upapattiḥ su jñānā iti atas atha nirdeṣa upapattiḥ anumānam iti uktam
translated: There, when there is knowledge of the fault, the proof that is free from that is well known. Therefore, it is said that inference is the proof that is free from fault.

original: ke tatropapattidoṣāityādinā paddhatyādyukteṣvanumānadoṣānniṣkṛṣya vivṛṇvāna āha atheti //
analyzed: ke tatra upapatti doṣāḥ ityādinā paddhati ādi ukteṣu anumāna doṣān niṣkṛṣya vivṛṇvānaḥ āha atha iti
translated: What are the faults of proof there? Thus, having extracted and explained the faults of inference stated in the Paddhati and elsewhere, he says athā (now).

analyzed: evam anumāna upayukta aśeṣa ukti anantaram iti avasara saṅgatim atha padena sūcayati
translated: Thus, after stating everything connected with inference, the connection with the occasion is indicated by the word athā (now).

original: nāpiṭa / /kte keṭha / /noktadau ṭa / eva manyopayuktā doṣoktyanantaraṃ itvasarasaṃgatirathapadeneti sūcayatiṭha / nopayuktadauṣoktyanantaraṃ
analyzed: eva manya upayuktāḥ doṣa ukti anantaram eva manya upayuktāḥ doṣa ukti anantaram sūcayati ṭha na upayukta dauṣa ukti anantaram
translated: Not stated before, not stated before, the connection with the occasion after stating the faults connected with inference is indicated by the word athā (now). Not after stating the faults connected with inference,

analyzed: iti avaḥ ḍa
translated: thus the occasion.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, third chapter

original: yatsadbhāve liṅgābhimataṃ pramāṃ na janayati sonumānadoṣaḥ/
analyzed: yat sadbhāve liṅga abhimatam pramām na janayati saḥ unumāna doṣaḥ
translated: The fault of inference is that which, when present, does not generate the cognition of the inferential mark.

analyzed: pramā janaka tva abhāvaḥ ca saṃśaya viparyaya janake jñāna ajanāke ca anugataḥ
translated: And the absence of generating valid cognition is common to the cognition that generates doubt and error.

analyzed: sa ca trividhaḥ  pratijñā hetu dṛṣṭānta bhedena
translated: And that is of three kinds.🔽By the difference of proposition, reason, and example.

analyzed: anumāna padena atra liṅga tvena abhimatam ucyate
translated: By the word inference here, what is intended as the inferential mark is stated.

analyzed: tathā ācārya doṣa ukteḥ evā iyam pratijñā na tu vacana doṣasya api
translated: And this is a statement of the fault of the premiss, and not of the fault of the statement.

analyzed: tasya api paramparayā artha doṣa tve pi sākṣāt artha doṣaḥ eva atra ucyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even though that (fault of the statement) is also a fault of the meaning indirectly, only the fault of the meaning is directly stated here.

analyzed: upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: This is a mere illustration.

analyzed: pratijñā dṛṣṭānta doṣaḥ ca ucyate iti api dhyeyam
translated: It should also be understood that the faults of the proposition and the example are also stated.

analyzed: yadvā anumāna doṣaḥ etāvān iti niṣkṛṣya ucyate iti arthaḥ
translated: Or the meaning is that the fault of inference is stated by extracting it as being just this much.

analyzed: pratijñā dṛṣṭānta doṣa uktiḥ agretanī anumāna doṣa viveka arthā
translated: The statement of the faults of the proposition and the example is a prelude for the purpose of distinguishing the faults of inference.

analyzed: athāvā anumāna padena atra pratijñā dṛṣṭānta rūpa parikara sahitam liṅgam ucyate
translated: Or, in this context, the term 'inference' refers to the probans along with the accessories in the form of the proposition and the example.

analyzed: tasya doṣaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is a fault of that.

analyzed: atas eva agre pratijñā ādi tritaya doṣa sādhāraṇam sāmānya lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: For this very reason, the general definition common to the three faults of the proposition etc. is stated later.

analyzed: yad sadbhāve iti
translated: What is called the existence of which.

analyzed: vyāpti ādimat liṅgasya pramiti janaka tva niyamāt asaṃbhava nirāsāya liṅgam iti an uktvā liṅga abhimatam iti uktam
translated: In order to avoid the impossibility (of the probans being a fault) because of the rule that the probans possessing pervasion etc. generates cognition, the probans is not stated as 'probans', but as 'what is considered to be the probans'.

analyzed: sva jñāna dvārā iti yojyam
translated: It should be connected as 'through one's own cognition'.
The meaning is that the making of what is considered to be the probans not generate cognition is a fault.

original: etasya jñānamātrajanake saṃśayaviparyayajanake ca bhāvāda vyāptirityāha pramājanakatvābhāvaśceti//
analyzed: etasya jñāna mātra janake saṃśaya viparyaya janake ca bhāvāt vyāptiḥ iti āha pramā janaka tva abhāvaḥ ca iti
translated: The pervasion is stated as follows: The absence of the property of being a producer of valid knowledge is the reason for the absence of the property of being a producer of knowledge and doubt.

analyzed: ca śabdena jñāna ajanaka grahaḥ
translated: The word ca (and) includes what does not produce knowledge.
In the Padarthadharmasangraha, etc., it is said that what does not produce knowledge when present,

analyzed: saṃśaya viparyayau vā karoti iti uktiḥ tu vispaṣṭa arthā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: or produces doubt and error, is a fallacy of reason. The meaning is that this is clear.

original: paroktahetvābhāsānāṃ sarveṣāṃ na hetudoṣatvaṃ kiṃ tu keṣāṃ cideveti vaktuṃ vibhāgamāha sa ceti//
analyzed: para ukta hetvābhāsānām sarveṣām na hetu doṣa tvam kim tu keṣām cit eva iti vaktum vibhāgam āha sa ca iti
translated: In order to state that not all fallacies of reason mentioned by others are faults of the reason, but only some of them, he states the division as follows: If that...

analyzed: pratijñā iti
translated: Promise means

analyzed: pratijñā hetu padābhyām tad artha grahaṇam
translated: the meaning of the promise and reason is grasped by the words promise and reason.

original: yadvār'thadoṣa eva tadbodhakavacanasyāpīti pratijñāhetvityevoktam/ 🔽kañcānu ga ga /rā / /nanvasyaṭa / /satvepi saṃśayajanake ca abhā ityasti ṭa / /vānnāvyā ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / /parigra ṭha / saṃgraṭa / /vālliṅgānumataṃḍa /
analyzed: yat vā artha doṣaḥ eva tad bodhaka vacanasya api iti pratijñā hetu iti eva uktam  saṃśaya janake ca abhā iti asti ṭa sattve pi saṃśaya janake ca abhā iti asti ṭa vān nāvyā ṭa ṭhaḍa parigra ṭha saṃgraṭa
translated: Or, if the fault is in the meaning, then the statement that conveys it is also faulty. Thus, only promise and reason are mentioned.

analyzed: svāti anuna doṣāḥ
translated: And some other faults.🔽But even when it exists, it is not a fallacy of reason if it produces doubt.

analyzed: anumāna doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The inclusion of what produces doubt is also correct.🔽The faults of one's own and others' inferences.🔽The chapter on the faults of inference.

analyzed: tatra pratijñāta arthasya pramāṇa virodhaḥ pratijñādoṣaḥ
translated: There, the contradiction of the meaning of the promise with a means of valid knowledge is a fault of the promise.

analyzed: sa dvividhaḥ  balavat pramāṇa virodhaḥ
translated: It is of two kinds.🔽[1] Contradiction with a strong means of valid knowledge,

analyzed: sama bala pramāṇa virodhaḥ ca iti
translated: [2] and contradiction with a means of valid knowledge of equal strength.

analyzed: hīna balasya akiñcitkara tvāt
translated: Because a weak [means of valid knowledge] is ineffective.

analyzed: sama bala tvam ca ābhimānikam
translated: And the equality of strength is based on [the opponent's] assumption.

analyzed: dvayam api punar trividham
translated: Moreover, both [contradictions] are of three kinds.

analyzed: pratyakṣa anumāna āgama virodha bhedāt
translated: Because they are divided into contradiction with perception, inference, and scripture.

analyzed: anumāna virodhaḥ api dvividhaḥ
translated: Contradiction with inference is also of two kinds.

analyzed: tena eva hetunā hetu antareṇa ca iti
translated: By that same reason and by another reason.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ paraiḥ prakaraṇasamaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Among them, the first is called similar to the topic by others.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ tu sat pratipakṣaḥ iti
translated: But the second is called having a counter-argument.

analyzed: tri vadhaḥ virodhaḥ pratijñā hetu dṛṣṭānta bhedena ityādi pramāṇa lakṣaṇa anurodhena ayam nirdeṣaḥ gre lakṣaṇa uktiḥ api iti jñeyam
translated: It should be known that this [contradiction] is faultless and will be explained later in the definition of a reason, in accordance with the definition of a means of valid knowledge such as contradiction is of three kinds, divided into contradiction with the thesis, reason, and example.

analyzed: sādhya dharma viśiṣṭaḥ dharmī pratijñā arthaḥ tasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of that, where the meaning of the thesis is the property-possessor qualified by the property to be proven.

original: hīnabalapramāṇavirodhasyāpi satvāstrividha iti vācyamiti āha hīnabalasyeti//
analyzed: hīna bala pramāṇa virodhasya api satvāḥ trividhaḥ iti vācyam iti āha hīna balasya iti
translated: Although there is also contradiction with a weak means of valid knowledge, it should be said to be of three kinds. Therefore he says of the weak [means of valid knowledge].

analyzed: vastunaḥ dvairūpya āpātena sama bala tvam asaṃbhāvitam iti atas āha sama iti
translated: Since the possibility of the object having two forms is not reasonable, he says equal [strength].

analyzed: punar trividham iti
translated: Moreover, of three kinds means

analyzed: sama bala pratyakṣa virodhaḥ
translated: contradiction with a means of valid knowledge of equal strength, namely perception,

analyzed: prabala pratyakṣa virodhaḥ
translated: Contradiction with strong perception.🔽Contradiction with equally strong inference.
Contradiction with strong inference.

analyzed: sama bala āgama virodhaḥ
translated: Contradiction with equally strong scripture.

original: prabalāgamavirodha iti trividha ityarthaḥ/🔽trividhamadhye dvitīyamapi vibhajyāha anumāneti//
analyzed: prabala āgama virodhaḥ iti trividhaḥ iti arthaḥ  trividham adhye dvitīyam api vibhajya āha anumāna iti
translated: Contradiction with strong scripture - this is the meaning of threefold.🔽Among the three, the second is also divided and said to be inference, etc.

original: nanu pakṣadvayepi trirūpo hetuḥ prakaraṇasama iti samabalo bhavati/
analyzed: nanu pakṣa dvaye pi trirūpaḥ hetuḥ prakaraṇasamaḥ iti sama balaḥ bhavati
translated: But in both cases, the reason with three characteristics is equally strong as the similar instance.

analyzed: sa ca na yuktaḥ
translated: And that is not proper.

analyzed: śabdaḥ nityaḥ guṇa tvāt
translated: Sound is non-eternal because of being a quality.

original: śabdo nityaḥ guṇatvādityatrānityatvavādino hi ghaṭarūpādiḥ sapakṣaḥ /
analyzed: śabdaḥ nityaḥ guṇa tvāt iti atra anitya tva vādinaḥ hi ghaṭa rūpa ādiḥ sapakṣaḥ
translated: Sound is eternal because of being a quality - here, for the proponent of non-eternality, a pot, form, etc. are the similar instances.

analyzed: nitya tva vādinaḥ saḥ eva vipakṣaḥ
translated: The same are the dissimilar instances for the proponent of eternality.

original: tathā ca sapakṣe satvaṃ tato vyāvṛttatvaṃ ca dvayamekasya na yuktam/
analyzed: tathā ca sapakṣe satvam tatas vyāvṛtta tvam ca dvayam ekasya na yuktam
translated: And thus, existence in the similar instance and exclusion from that - both are not proper for one.

original: ata ubhayanirūpitavyāptyorekatrā yuktatvāttenaiva hetunā virodho 'sambhavatītyāśaṅkya nirāha na cādya iti//
analyzed: atas ubhaya nirūpita vyāptyoḥ ekatrā yukta tvāt tena eva hetunā sambhavati iti āśaṅkya nirāha na ca ādyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, due to the impossibility of the pervasion determined by both in one, contradiction is not possible with that very reason. Suspecting this, he denies the first, etc.🔽The strong is the first.

analyzed: iti iti
translated: The one is not proper for the second.
The lamp of logic together with the Tarkatandava, third chapter.

analyzed: na ca ādyaḥ sambhavī
translated: And the first is not possible.

original: ekasmin pakṣe sādhyatadabhāvavyāpyayorivaikasmin hetau sādhyatadabhāvavyāptyorapyabhimānataḥ sambhavāt//
analyzed: ekasmin pakṣe sādhya tad abhāva vyāpyayoḥ iva ekasmin hetau sādhya tad abhāva vyāptyoḥ api abhimānataḥ sambhavāt
translated: Because, like the pervasion of the probandum and its absence in one case, the pervasion of the probandum and its absence is possible by mere assumption in one reason.

analyzed: hetoḥ sādhya pramā janana sāmarthya abhāvaḥ hetu doṣaḥ

analyzed: sa dvividhaḥ asiddhiḥ avyāptiḥ ca iti

analyzed: samucita deśe hetoḥ abhāvaḥ śru siddhiḥ

Avyāpti is the absence of pervasion.

analyzed: sā ca tredhā saṃbhavati
translated: And that is possible in three ways.

original: sādhanasya sādhyābhāveneva sādhyenāpyasambandhena satyapi sādhyasambandhe tadabhāvenāpi sambandhena sādhyābhāvenaiva sambhandhena ceti//
analyzed: sādhanasya sādhya abhāvena iva sādhyena api asambandhena sati api sādhya sambandhe tad abhāvena api sambandhena sādhya abhāvena eva sambhandhena ca iti
translated: Even though there is a connection with the probandum, like the probans with the absence of the probandum, there is also a connection with the absence of that, and a connection only with the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: vyāpyayoḥ iva iti  sat pratipakṣa hetvoḥ iva iti arthaḥ

analyzed: ekasya eva hetoḥ vādinaḥ sādhya vyāpya tva abhimānaḥ

analyzed: prativādinaḥ tad abhāva vyāpya tva abhimānaḥ iti sapakṣa sattva ādikam api abhimānaḥ eva iti dhyeyam
translated: The opponent assumes that it pervades the absence of that. Thus, the presence in similar instances, etc. are also mere assumptions. This should be understood.

analyzed: evam pratijñā doṣam nirūpya hetu doṣam āha hetoḥ iti  liṅgasya iti arthaḥ

analyzed: anyathā anupapatti rūpa vyāpti virahaḥ iti arthaḥ

analyzed: sādhanasya sādhya abhāvena iva ityādi trayam api paraiḥ kramāt asādhāraṇa anaikāntika sādhāraṇa anaikāntika viruddha śabdaiḥ gīyate    iti

analyzed: svāti anuna doṣāḥ  anumāna doṣa vādaḥ

analyzed: vyāpti grahaṇa anānukūlyam dṛṣṭānta doṣaḥ

analyzed: sa dvividhaḥ

analyzed: sādhya vaikalyam sādhana vaikalyam ca iti

analyzed: itarau tu anumāna asādhāraṇau

analyzed: uktam hi pramāṇalakṣaṇaṭīkāyām

analyzed: itarau tu asādhāraṇau iti
translated: The other two, however, are uncommon.

analyzed: na ca hetu doṣa vibhāgasya nyūna tā
translated: And there is no deficiency in the division of the faults of the reason.

analyzed: siddhasādhanasya tu mad mate svārtha anumāne doṣa tvāt

analyzed: parārtha anumāne ca asaṅgatau antarbhāvāt

analyzed: ca avyāptau antarbhāvāt

analyzed: vyartha viśeṣaṇā

analyzed: sva abhimata anumāna doṣāḥ

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ  ādye pramiti asiddhiḥ

analyzed: hetuvacana adhīna upasthitikā ca

analyzed: bādhā ādiḥ tu sākṣāt pati bandhakaḥ

analyzed: pratijñā adhīna upasthitikaḥ ca

analyzed: sama bala virodha pakṣe tu saṃśaya rūpam dhyeyam

analyzed: svārasika vyabhicāra sandehasya anukūla tve pi pramāṇa virodhāḥ

analyzed: anumiti viṣaya abhāva anavagāhinaḥ tathā eva pratibandhaka tvāt iti bhāvaḥ

analyzed: anyathā ucyamāna grāhye nigrahe labdhe pi ukta grahyaḥ pratīkṣeta

analyzed: tad viṣayakasya sādhya abhāvavati hetuḥ iti jñānasya abhāvāt
