translated: And so, even when sublation, etc. are present, the fallacy of contradiction, etc. is indeed the fault, because the contradiction, etc. are more prominent by being quickly grasped and by being more intense due to the removal of the object, even though the fallacy of contradiction is present.🔽And just as in the case of the mute speaks, even though there is a contradiction with valid cognition, the contradiction with the words of the thesis is the fault, because it is quickly grasped.

original: yathā ca mātā vandhyā prameyatvādityatra vyabhacāre satyapyutkaṭaḥ pratijñāvirodha eva doṣaḥ/
analyzed: yathā ca mātā vandhyā prameya tvāt iti atra sati api utkaṭaḥ pratijñāvirodhaḥ eva doṣaḥ
translated: And just as in the case of the mother is barren because it is an object of knowledge, even though there is a fallacy, the contradiction with the thesis is the fault, because it is more intense.

original: astu vā sādhyābhāvavati pakṣe heturiti viśiṣṭajñānam/
analyzed: astu vā sādhya abhāvavati pakṣe hetuḥ iti viśiṣṭa jñānam
translated: Or let there be the specific knowledge that the reason is present in the subject where the conclusion is absent.

original: tathāpi pakṣe sādhyaṃ neti jñānāṃśaḥ pakṣe heturiti jñānāṃśanirapekṣa eva doṣaḥ/
analyzed: tathā api pakṣe sādhyam na iti jñāna aṃśaḥ pakṣe hetuḥ iti jñāna aṃśa nirapekṣaḥ eva doṣaḥ
translated: Even so, the part of the knowledge that the conclusion is not present in the subject is the fault, which is independent of the part of the knowledge that the reason is present in the subject.

analyzed: treṇa āsya sphuraṇāt iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇa ṭīkā ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this is stated in the commentary on the definition of valid cognition.

analyzed: ucyamānā iti
translated: What is being stated means

analyzed: mūkaḥ ham ityādau sva kriyā virodhaḥ ucyamāna grāhya pramāṇa virodhaḥ ukti anantara grāhya tvāt ukta grahyaḥ
translated: in the case of I am a mute, the contradiction with one's own action is grasped after the contradiction with valid cognition is stated, so it is grasped after the statement.

original: pūrvaṃ hetoḥ sādhyābhāvasāmānādhikaraṇyarūpavyabhicāro nopasthita ityupetya pṛthagdoṣatvaṃ bādhāderuktam/
analyzed: pūrvam hetoḥ sādhya abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyabhicāraḥ na upasthitaḥ iti upetya pṛthak doṣa tvam bādhā ādeḥ uktam
translated: Previously, it was said that contradiction, etc. are separate faults, assuming that the contradiction in the form of the absence of the probandum co-occurring with the reason was not present.

original: idānīṃ vyabhicāropasthitimabhyupetyāpi pṛthagdoṣatvaṃ bādhāderāha astu veti//
analyzed: idānīm vyabhicāra upasthitim abhyupetya api pṛthak doṣa tvam bādhā ādeḥ āha astu vā iti
translated: Now, even accepting the presence of contradiction, it is said that contradiction, etc. are separate faults, saying Let it be so.

analyzed: dau siddhe taḥ ṭa rā  vā pra ro yoḥ prajñā do tva sanam
translated: The two are established.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of the reason in the Nyāyasūtra.

analyzed: viṣaya apahāri tvāt
translated: Because it takes away the object.

original: pakṣe heturiti jñānāṃśastu pakṣe sādhyaṃ neti jñānāṃśasāpekṣa eva doṣaḥ/
analyzed: pakṣe hetuḥ iti jñāna aṃśaḥ tu pakṣe sādhyam na iti jñāna aṃśa sāpekṣaḥ eva doṣaḥ
translated: The part of the knowledge that the reason is in the subject is a fault that depends on the part of the knowledge that the probandum is not in the subject.

analyzed: tad nirapekṣasya tasya guṇa tvāt
translated: Because that which does not depend on it is a virtue.

original: tathā ca yathā sādhāraṇye sapakṣavṛttitve satyapi vipakṣavṛttitvameva doṣaḥ tathā pakṣe hetujñāne satyapi prāptāprāptavivekena pakṣe sādhyābhāvapramārūpabādhādyaṃśa
analyzed: tathā ca yathā sādhāraṇye sapakṣa vṛtti tve sati api vipakṣa vṛtti tvam eva doṣaḥ tathā pakṣe hetu jñāne sati api prāpta aprāpta vivekena pakṣe sādhya abhāva pramā rūpa bādha ādi aṃśa
translated: And just as in the case of a common reason, even when it occurs in similar instances, the occurrence in dissimilar instances is a fault, similarly, even when there is the knowledge that the reason is in the subject, the part in the form of the valid knowledge of the absence of the probandum in the subject, by distinguishing what is attained and what is not attained,

analyzed: eva doṣaḥ
translated: is a fault.

analyzed: sva mate saṅkaraḥ
translated: In one's own view, the confusion of contradiction, etc. with the common reason, etc.

analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ iti
translated: The common reason.
The meaning is a reason that is inconclusive because it occurs in similar instances, dissimilar instances, and both.

analyzed: vipakṣa vṛtti tvam eva iti
translated: Only the occurrence in dissimilar instances.

original: pakṣasapakṣavṛttitvasyānumityanukūlatvena vipakṣavṛttitvamātrasyaiva pratikūlakatvena tasyaiva doṣatāyā hetvābhāsagranthe maṇyādāvukteriti
analyzed: pakṣa sapakṣa vṛtti tvasya anumiti anukūla tvena vipakṣa vṛtti tva mātrasya eva pratikūlaka tvena tasya eva doṣa tāyāḥ hetvābhāsa granthe maṇi ādau ukteḥ iti
translated: Because the presence in the similar instance and dissimilar instance is favorable to inference, and only the presence in the dissimilar instance is unfavorable, and that alone is stated as a fallacy in the text on fallacious reasons in the Nyāya-mañjarī, etc.

analyzed: prāptā aprāptā iti
translated: The word prāptāprāpta means:

original: doṣatvena prāpta sādhyābhāvapramāṃśaḥ doṣatvenāprāptaḥ hetusatvapramāṃśaḥ iti prāptāprāptavivekenetyarthaḥ//
analyzed: doṣa tvena prāpta sādhya abhāva pramā aṃśaḥ doṣa tvena aprāptaḥ hetu sattva pramā aṃśaḥ iti prāpta aprāpta vivekena iti arthaḥ
translated: The part of the valid cognition of the absence of the probandum, which is obtained as a fallacy, and the part of the valid cognition of the presence of the reason, which is not obtained as a fallacy, are distinguished by the distinction between the obtained and the not obtained.

analyzed: sva mate saṅkaraḥ
translated: In his own view, there is no confusion of contradiction with the fallacy of the thesis.

analyzed: atha bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: Now, the defense of the thesis that contradiction and defeat are fallacies of the thesis.

analyzed: kecid tu bādha pratirodhau hetu doṣau iti āhuḥ
translated: However, some say that contradiction and defeat are fallacies of the reason.

analyzed: atha bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: Now, the defense of the thesis that contradiction and defeat are fallacies of the thesis.

analyzed: nanu atha api bādha pratirodhayoḥ asiddhi avyāpti rūpa hetu doṣa tva abhāve pi bādhita viṣaya tva ādi rūpam
translated: Even so, although contradiction and defeat are not fallacies of the reason in the form of being unestablished or over-pervasive, let there be a separate fallacy of the reason in the form of having a contradicted object, etc.

original: pṛthageva hetudoṣatvamastu tathaiva maṇyādyukteḥ pratijñādoṣatvaṃ kathamityatastatsamarthayitumāha kecitviti //
analyzed: pṛthak eva hetu doṣa tvam astu tathā eva maṇi ādi ukteḥ pratijñā doṣa tvam katham iti atas tat samarthayitum āha kecitu iti
translated: Why is it a fallacy of the thesis as stated in the Nyāya-mañjarī, etc.? To defend that, he says some and so on.

analyzed: tārkika ādayaḥ
translated: The logicians and others.

analyzed: rāsam ṭarā rasa ṭhaḍa
translated: Rās is ṭ, r, ṛ, Rās is ṭ, ḍ,
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Section

analyzed: kuṭhāre kuṇṭha tva ādi doṣa abhāve pi ākāśasya chedana ayogya tvena eva cheda anutpatti vat
translated: Even when there is no defect such as bluntness in the axe, the non-production of cutting is due only to the unsuitability of the sky for being cut.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādau kāca ādi doṣa abhāve pi atidūra tva atisāmīpya samāna abhihāra sādṛśya ādi artha doṣeṇa eva
translated: Even when there is no defect such as cataract in the eye, etc., the non-production of the valid cognition of perception is due only to the defect in the object such as being too far, too near, being of the same color, similarity, etc.

analyzed: agninā siñcati ityādi śabde nirabhidheya tva nyūnatva ādi śabda doṣa abhāve pi ayogya tva rūpa artha doṣāt eva
translated: Even when there is no defect in the word such as meaninglessness, incompleteness, etc., in the word sprinkle with fire, etc., the non-production of verbal valid cognition is due only to the defect in the meaning in the form of unsuitability.

original: śābdapramānutpattivadanityo ghaṭaḥ prameyatvādityādau prameyadoṣābhāvepi hetudoṣeṇaiva duṣṭatvavacca /
analyzed: śābda pramā anutpatti vat anityaḥ ghaṭaḥ prameya tvāt ityādau prameya doṣa abhāve pi hetu doṣeṇa eva duṣṭa tva vat ca
translated: Just as in the case of a pot is impermanent because it is knowable, etc., even when there is no defect in the probandum, the faultiness is due only to the defect in the reason.

original: sarvaṃ tejo 'nuṣṇaṃ prameyatvādityādyanumāne hetudoṣābhāvepi pratijñātār thasya pramāṇāntaraviruddhatvena sādhanānarhatvarūpaprameyadoṣeṇaivānumānikapramānutpattervaktavyatvāt//
analyzed: sarvam tejaḥ nuṣṇam prameya tvāt ityādi anumāne hetu doṣa abhāve pi pratijñāta ar thasya pramāṇa antara viruddha tvena sādhana anarha tva rūpa prameya doṣeṇa eva ānumānika pramā anutpatteḥ vaktavya tvāt
translated: In the inference all fire is not hot because it is knowable, etc., even when there is no defect in the reason, the non-production of inferential valid cognition must be stated as due only to the defect in the probandum in the form of being unworthy of proof due to the proposition being contradicted by other means of knowledge.

analyzed: virodhaḥ upi tridhā eva asyāt pratijñā artha viruddha tā
translated: Even contradiction is of three kinds only: contradiction with the meaning of the proposition,

analyzed: liṅga rāhityam avyāpti
translated: The absence of a reason is non-pervasion

original: rityādiyuktipādīyānuvyākhyānasudhoktaṃ hṛdi kṛtvā karaṇasyāduṣṭatvepyarthadoṣanibandhanakāryānutpattisthale doṣasyaiva vācyatvāditi sadṛṣṭāntamāha
analyzed: r ityādi yuktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam hṛdi kṛtvā karaṇasya aduṣṭa tve pi artha doṣa nibandhana kārya anutpatti sthale doṣasya eva vācyatvāt iti sa dṛṣṭāntam āha  /
translated: Keeping in mind what is said in the Yuktidipika commentary and Sudha commentary, since even when the instrument is faultless, in a case where the effect does not arise due to the fault in the object, the fault itself should be stated, he gives an example.

analyzed: kuṭhāre ti
translated: With the axe, etc.

analyzed: samāna iti
translated: With the same, etc.

analyzed: kṣīra nīra ādau māṣa rāśi maṣi ādau sādṛśya sūkṣma tva rūpa artha doṣeṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in milk, water, etc., and in a heap of beans, etc., there is a fault in the object in the form of the subtlety of similarity.

original: vijātīyakaraṇaṃ sajātīyapratyakṣaśabdarūpakaraṇaṃ ca dṛṣṭāntīkṛtyāntaraṅgānumānarūpakaraṇaṃ ca dṛṣṭāntayati anitya iti//🔽prameyeti//
analyzed: vijātīya karaṇam sajātīya pratyakṣa śabda rūpa karaṇam ca dṛṣṭāntīkṛtya antaraṅga anumāna rūpa karaṇam ca dṛṣṭāntayati anityaḥ iti  prameya iti
translated: Taking the instrument of a different kind and the instrument of the same kind in the form of perception and word as examples, he gives an example of the internal instrument in the form of inference, saying It is non-eternal, etc.🔽With the object of knowledge, etc.

analyzed: sādhya doṣa abhāve api iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even when there is no fault in the probandum.

analyzed: hetu doṣa abhāve api iti
translated: Even when there is no fault in the reason,

original: sarvatejasaḥ pakṣatayā tadanyasya vyabhicārasthalasyābhāvena vyabhicāradoṣābhāvāt asiddhyāderanāśaṅkyatvāditi bhāvaḥ// 🔽chidā ṭa /rā / /ñcodityāṭa /rā / /jñārthaṃ ṭa /rā / /lertha ṭha / /ra iṭa /ḍa /
analyzed: sarva tejasaḥ pakṣa tayā tad anyasya vyabhicāra sthalasya abhāvena vyabhicāra doṣa abhāvāt asiddhi ādeḥ anāśaṅkya tvāt iti bhāvaḥ  chidā ṭa rāḥ ñ ca udityā ṭa rāḥ jña artham ṭa rāḥ la irtha ṭha raḥ iṭa ḍa
translated: the meaning is that since all luminous substances are the subject and there is no place for deviation, there is no fault of deviation, and since impossibility, etc., are not suspected.

analyzed: vā pra ro yoḥ prajñā do tva sanam
translated: The cutting, etc., is for the purpose of knowing the meaning.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.

analyzed: kiñca bādha pratirodhayoḥ anumiti grāhya viruddha viṣaya tvena para mukha nirīkṣaṇa nirapekṣa tayā
translated: Moreover, since contradiction and annulment have as their object what is contrary to what is to be grasped by inference, and are independent of looking at another's face,

analyzed: pratyakṣa ādau iva anumāne api sākṣāt eva anumiti rūpa phala pratibandhaka tve saṃbhavati baka bandha nyāyena
translated: when it is possible for them to directly obstruct the result in the form of inference even in inference, like in perception, it is not proper to imagine that they obstruct the result by way of producing a deficiency in the instrument,

analyzed: karaṇa vaikalya saṃpādana dvārā  phala pratibandhaka kalpanam ayuktam
translated: like the story of binding the crane.

original: anyathā sādṛśyādyarthadoṣeṇaiva dūṣite pratyakṣe kācādikaraṇadoṣaḥ kalpyeta//
analyzed: anyathā sādṛśya ādi artha doṣeṇa eva dūṣite pratyakṣe kāca ādi karaṇa doṣaḥ kalpyeta
translated: Otherwise, in perception which is already vitiated by the fault of similarity etc., the fault of the instrument like a crystal would be imagined.

original: nanu bādhasya pakṣaniṣṭhatvena pramitābhāvapratiyogisādhakatve na rūpeṇa hetudoṣatvoktāvapyā
analyzed: nanu bādhasya pakṣa niṣṭha tvena pramita abhāva pratiyogi sādhaka tve na rūpeṇa hetu doṣa tva uktau api ā
translated: Even though it is said that contradiction is a fault of the reason by virtue of its being the prover of the absence of what is ascertained as the substratum of the probandum,

original: numānikapramānutpattiryukteti vādinaṃ prati lakṣaṇaṭīkoktarītyā doṣāntaraṃ cāha kiñceti //
translated: to one who argues that the non-production of inferential valid knowledge is proper, another fault is stated in the manner stated in the Lakṣaṇakārikā, beginning with Moreover.

analyzed: pratyakṣa ādau iti
translated: In perception etc.

original: pītaḥ śaṅkha ityādipratyakṣe śvetaḥ śaṅkha iti pratyakṣasya yathā sākṣādgrāhyaviruddhaviṣayakatvena pītatvapratyakṣapratibandhakatvaṃ /
analyzed: pītaḥ śaṅkhaḥ ityādi pratyakṣe śvetaḥ śaṅkhaḥ iti pratyakṣasya yathā sākṣāt grāhya viruddha viṣayaka tvena pīta tva pratyakṣa pratibandhaka tvam
translated: Just as in the perception The conch is yellow, the perception The conch is white directly has as its object what is contrary to what is to be grasped, and thus obstructs the perception of yellowness.

analyzed: ghaṭaḥ asti
translated: The pot exists.

analyzed: ghaṭaḥ na asti iti anayoḥ śabda jñānayoḥ yathā viruddha viṣayaka tvena pratibadhya pratibandhaka bhāvaḥ tathā iti arthaḥ  baka bandha iti
translated: The binding of the crane means:

analyzed: kena cit kañcid pratibandha upāyam brūhi iti pṛṣṭe vadati
translated: When asked by someone Tell me some means of binding, he says:

original: bakasya śirasi navanīte nihite satyātapena navanīte dravībhūte cakṣuṣormadhye patite sati cakṣuṣornimīlanaṃ yadā bakasya bhavati tadā tadbandhanaṃ
analyzed: bakasya śirasi navanīte nihite sati ātapena navanīte dravībhūte cakṣuṣoḥ madhye patite sati cakṣuṣoḥ nimīlanam yadā bakasya bhavati tadā tat bandhanam
translated: When butter is placed on the head of the crane and the butter melts due to the sun's heat and falls between the eyes, if the crane closes its eyes, then that is the binding of the crane.

original: tatra navanītanidhānadaśāyāmeva bandhasaṃbhave paścādbandhanopāyo yathā vakrastathā vyāptirūpakaraṇavaikalyasaṃpānadvārā hetudoṣatvakalpanamapi
analyzed: tatra navanīta nidhāna daśāyām eva bandha saṃbhave paścāt bandhana upāyaḥ yathā vakraḥ tathā vyāpti rūpa karaṇa vaikalya saṃpāna dvārā hetu doṣa tva kalpanam api
translated: There, when the binding is possible only at the stage of placing the butter, the means of binding later is like a crooked means, by the door of accomplishing the deficiency of the instrument in the form of pervasion, the assumption of the defect of the reason is also

analyzed: yat vā parāmarśa rūpa karaṇe vyāpti viṣayaka tva vaikalya saṃpādana dvārā iti arthaḥ  pi anumāna tvāt tiryu
translated: Or the meaning is that by accomplishing the deficiency of being the object of pervasion in the instrument in the form of reflection.

original: api ca yo hi yanniṣṭhatayā jñātaḥ sannanumitipratibandhakaḥ sa tasya doṣaḥ/
analyzed: api ca yaḥ hi yad niṣṭha tayā jñātaḥ san anumiti pratibandhakaḥ sa tasya doṣaḥ
translated: Moreover, that which is known as based on something and is an impediment to inference is a defect of that.

analyzed: anyathā pratijñā hāni ādikam api hetu hāni ādikam syāt
translated: Otherwise, even the fallacy of abandoning the proposition and so on would be a fallacy of abandoning the reason and so on.

original: nityaḥ śabdaḥ anitya iti pratijñāśritāḥ svavacanavirodhādayaḥ anityo varṇa iti māmāṃsakaprayukta pratijñāśritāpasiddhāntādayaśya hetudoṣāḥ
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ anityaḥ iti pratijñā āśritāḥ sva vacana virodha ādayaḥ anityaḥ varṇaḥ iti hetu doṣāḥ
translated: The fallacies of contradiction with one's own words and so on, based on the proposition sound is eternal and sound is non-eternal, and the fallacies of the reason, such as the irrelevance based on the proposition used by the Mīmāṃsaka the letter is non-eternal.

analyzed: na ca bādhā ādiḥ hetu niṣṭhatayā jñātaḥ tad pratibandhakaḥ
translated: And contradiction and so on are not known to be related to the reason as something that obstructs it.

analyzed: pratijñā anantaram hetu upasthiteḥ prāk eva pratītena tena anumiti pratibandhāt
translated: Because they are known even before the reason is presented after the proposition, they obstruct inference.

original: yadi ca pakṣaniṣṭhatvena pramitābhāvapratiyogisādhakatvaṃ bādha iti bādhasya hetuniṣṭhatvena jñānaṃ kalpyate/
analyzed: yadi ca pakṣa niṣṭha tvena pramita abhāva pratiyogi sādhaka tvam bādhaḥ iti bādhasya hetu niṣṭha tvena jñānam kalpyate
translated: And if contradiction is imagined to be the knowledge that contradiction is known to be related to the reason as something that obstructs it,

analyzed: guru tvāt na hetu doṣa tva kalpanam yuktam iti uktam
translated: because of its heaviness, it is not proper to imagine it to be a fallacy of the reason. This has been said.

original: kalpakābhāvācca na hetudoṣatvaṃ yuktamiti sāmānyanyāyaṃ vipakṣabādhapūrvamāha api ceti//
analyzed: kalpaka abhāvāt ca na hetu doṣa tvam yuktam iti sāmānya nyāyam vipakṣa bādha pūrvam āha api ca iti
translated: And because there is no basis for imagining it, it is not proper to consider it a fallacy of the reason. The general rule is stated first, refuting the opposite, with the words Moreover, etc.

analyzed: pratijñā iti
translated: The proposition, etc.

original: yena yadyathā pratijñātaṃ tena tasya tathā parityāgaḥ pratijñāhāniḥ / ādipadena
analyzed: yena yat yathā pratijñātam tena tasya tathā parityāgaḥ pratijñāhāniḥ ādi padena
translated: The abandonment by someone of what has been proposed by him in that way is the abandonment of the proposition. By the word etc.
The admission of contradiction of a proposition by another proposition, contradiction of a proposition, abandonment of a proposition, etc.

original: pūrvaṃ śabda ityaviśiṣṭatayokte sādhyabhāge varṇātmako nitya iti viśeṣaṇaprakṣepaḥ pratijñantaram/
analyzed: pūrvam śabdaḥ iti aviśiṣṭa tayā ukte sādhya bhāge varṇa ātmakaḥ nityaḥ iti viśeṣaṇa prakṣepaḥ pratijñantaram
translated: When the probandum part is stated without specification as sound earlier, the introduction of the qualification eternal in the form of a letter is a different proposition.

analyzed: mithas vyāghātaḥ pratijñāvirodhaḥ
translated: Mutual contradiction is contradiction of a proposition.

analyzed: sva ukta apalāpaḥ pratijñā sannyāsaḥ
translated: Abandonment of a proposition is the denial of one's own statement.

analyzed: pratijñā hāni ādi nigrahasthānam api tyaktapratijñaka tva ādi rūpeṇa hetu hāni ādikam syāt iti arthaḥ  hetu doṣāḥ syuḥ iti
translated: The meaning is that the admission of defeat due to abandoning a proposition, etc. would also be a reason for abandoning a reason, etc. in the form of having abandoned a proposition, etc.

analyzed: viruddha pratijñaka tva ādi rūpeṇa hetu niṣṭhatayā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they would be faults of the reason, in the form of being contradictory to the proposition, etc.

original: vyāptiṃ samarthya pakṣe nāstītyāha na ceti//🔽bādhakabhāvācca na hetudoṣatvakalpanaṃ yuktamityāha yadi ceti//
analyzed: vyāptim samarthya pakṣe na asti iti āha na ca iti  bādhaka bhāvāt ca na hetu doṣa tva kalpanam yuktam iti āha yadi ca iti
translated: Having established the pervasion, he says that it does not exist in the subject with and it is not.🔽And because there is an objection, it is not proper to assume that it is a fault of the reason. He says if and so on.

original: yadvā bādhādirapi hetuniṣṭhatvenaiva jñāto doṣo nānyatheti vādinaṃ pratibādhakamāha yadi ceti// 🔽vāpraroyoḥprajñādotvasanam
analyzed: yat vā bādhā ādiḥ api hetu niṣṭhatvena eva jñātaḥ doṣaḥ na anyathā iti vādinam pratibādhakam āha yadi ca iti  vā pra ro yoḥ prajñā do tva sanam
translated: Or, for one who argues that an objection, etc. is known as a fault only when it is in the form of being in the reason, not otherwise, he presents an objection with if and so on.🔽The statement of the faults of the proposition and the reason.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.

original: tarhi pakṣaniṣṭhatvena pramitābhāvapratiyogisādha katvamasiddhiḥ vyāptirāhitasādhaka tvamavyāptirityasiddhyavyāptyerapi sādhyaniṣṭhatvena 🔽jñānaṃ kalpyatām//
analyzed: tarhi pakṣa niṣṭha tvena pramita abhāva pratiyogi sādha ka tvam asiddhiḥ vyāptiḥ āhita sādhaka tvam avyāptiḥ iti asiddhi avyāptyeḥ api sādhya niṣṭha tvena  jñānam kalpyatām
translated: Then let it be admitted that non-establishment is the property of being established as the counter-correlate of the absence ascertained in the subject, and over-extension is the property of being a prover lacking pervasion, both of which are properties of the probandum.

analyzed: api ca bādhā ādiḥ pratyakṣa ādi sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, contradiction etc. is common to perception etc.

analyzed: tu
translated: But in the case of fallacious reasons, being a fault not common to reasons is the determining factor.

analyzed: anyathā manaḥ navadhāna ādiḥ api hetvābhāsaḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, lack of attention of the mind etc. would also be fallacious reasons.

original: nanu sādhāraṇye 'pi jñāyamānatvenānumitipratibandhakatayā mano 'navadhānādivilakṣaṇatvādbādhāderhetvābhāsatvamiti cenna/🔽tvanmate 'numitipratibandhakasādhyasiddhiṃ prati viṣayasya sādhyasyāpi hetvābhāsatvāt//
analyzed: nanu sādhāraṇye pi jñāyamāna tvena anumiti pratibandhaka tayā manaḥ nava dhānā ādi vilakṣaṇa tvāt bādhā ādeḥ hetvābhāsa tvam iti ced na  tvad mate numiti pratibandhaka sādhyasiddhim prati viṣayasya sādhyasya api hetvābhāsa tvāt
translated: If it is argued that even though contradiction etc. is common, it is a fallacious reason because it is a hindrance to inference by being known, unlike lack of attention of the mind etc., it is not so.🔽Because according to your view, even the probandum, being the object of the establishment of the probandum which is a hindrance to inference, is a fallacious reason.

original: pratijñāvirodhaḥ sādhāraṇaḥ itarau tvasādhāraṇāviti lakṣaṇaṭīkāsūcitayuktyā ca hetudoṣatvaṃ nirāha api ca bādhādiriti//
analyzed: pratijñāvirodhaḥ sādhāraṇaḥ itarau tu asādhāraṇau iti lakṣaṇa ṭīkāsu ucita yuktyā ca hetu doṣa tvam nirāha api ca bādhā ādiḥ iti
translated: The commentary on the definition states the reason that contradiction is common, while the other two are not common, and denies that they are faults of the reason, saying Moreover, contradiction etc.
The word etc. includes opposition.

original: tāvatā kuto na hetudoṣatetyata āha hetviti//
analyzed: tāvatā kutas na hetu doṣa tā iti atas āha hetu iti
translated: To what extent does this not make them faults of the reason? To this he says Because reasons etc.

analyzed: anyathā iti
translated: 'Otherwise' means

original: pratyakṣādisādhāraṇadoṣasyāpi hetvābhāsatva ityarthaḥ vaiṣamyamāśaṅkya nirāha nanvityādinā //
analyzed: pratyakṣa ādi sādhāraṇa doṣasya api hetvābhāsa tve iti arthaḥ vaiṣamyam āśaṅkya nirāha nanu ityādinā
translated: that even the fallacies common to perception etc. are fallacies of reason. Suspecting inequality, he refutes with 'But' etc.

analyzed: sādhāyasya api iti
translated: 'Of the probandum' means

original: sādhyasiddheḥ pratibandhakatve sādhyasyāpi jñāyamānatayā pratibandhakatvāditi bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: sādhya siddheḥ pratibandhaka tve sādhyasya api jñāyamāna tayā pratibandhaka tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: that if the establishment of the probandum is an impediment, then since the probandum is also known, it would be an impediment.

original: bādhādeḥ pratyakṣādisādhāraṇyamevāsiddhaṃ yena hetudoṣatvaṃ na syāditi śaṅkate nanviti//
analyzed: bādhā ādeḥ pratyakṣa ādi sādhāraṇyam eva asiddham yena hetu doṣa tvam na syāt iti śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He suspects that the commonality of contradiction etc. with perception etc. is not established, by which it would not be a fallacy of reason, with 'But'.🔽Dhanakara.

analyzed: dhanaka rā dhanaka rā
translated: Dhanakara.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: nanu pratyakṣādāvutpannasya jñānasya bādhenāpramāṇatvameva bodhyate diṅmohādau darśanāt anumitau tūtpattireva pratibadhyate ityasādhāraṇyamiti
analyzed: nanu pratyakṣa ādau utpannasya jñānasya bādhena apramāṇa tvam eva bodhyate diś moha ādau darśanāt anumitau tu utpattiḥ eva pratibadhyate iti asādhāraṇyam iti
translated: But in perception, the fact that the knowledge that has arisen is not a valid means of knowledge due to contradiction is taught, because it is seen in cases of confusion of directions. But in inference, the arising itself is obstructed. So it is not common.

original: tathāpi śabdasyātyantāsatyapi dhīhetutvena liṅgābhāsasyāpi taddhetutvāvaśyaṃbhāvāt matsādhāraṇyaparihārāt/
analyzed: tathā api śabdasya atyanta asati api dhī hetu tvena liṅga ābhāsasya api tad hetu tva avaśyaṃbhāvāt mad sādhāraṇya parihārāt
translated: Even so, since even a completely false word is a cause of cognition, and since a fallacious reason must also be its cause, the commonality cannot be avoided.

original: viṣayabādhe 'viśiṣṭe śabdābhāsa evāsadarthabodhako na tu liṅgābhāsa ityasya ca paribhāṣāmātratvāt/
analyzed: viṣaya bādhe viśiṣṭe śabda ābhāsaḥ eva asat artha bodhakaḥ na tu liṅga ābhāsaḥ iti asya ca paribhāṣā mātra tvāt
translated: And because the definition that only verbal illusion, not inferential illusion, is the revealer of unreal objects, is merely a definition.

analyzed: dṛśyate ca bādhā avatāra anantaram api tvad anumitam asat iti anu vādaḥ
translated: And after the appearance of contradiction, the opponent's statement Your inference is unreal is seen.

original: kiṃ ca yaḥ karaṇasāmarthyarūpavyāptipakṣadharmatānyataravighaṭanarūpaḥ sa eva hetvābhāsaḥ/
analyzed: kim ca yaḥ karaṇa sāmarthya rūpa vyāpti pakṣa dharmatā anyatara vighaṭana rūpaḥ saḥ eva hetvābhāsaḥ
translated: Moreover, only that which destroys either the pervasion in the form of the capacity of the instrument or the property of the subject is a fallacious reason.

analyzed: bādhā ādiḥ tu na tathā
translated: But contradiction etc. are not like that.

analyzed: karaṇa a saṃsparśi tvāt
translated: Because they do not touch the instrument.

analyzed: bādhena viparīta jñānena iti arthaḥ  utpattiḥ eva iti
translated: By contradiction, the meaning is by contrary knowledge.🔽By the mere appearance of contradiction, the meaning is by the mere appearance of contradiction.

original: anumityutpattireva bādhena pratibadhyata ityarthaḥ/🔽utpattipratibandha evāsiddhaḥ yenāsādhāraṇyaṃ syādityāha śabdābhāsasyeti//
analyzed: anumiti utpattiḥ eva bādhena pratibadhyate iti arthaḥ  utpatti pratibandhaḥ eva asiddhaḥ yena asādhāraṇyam syāt iti āha śabda ābhāsasya iti
translated: The production itself, the meaning is that the production of inference itself is obstructed by contradiction.🔽The obstruction of production itself is not established, by which there would be uncommonsality. He says of verbal illusion etc.

analyzed: śaśa viṣāṇam asti ityādi vākyāt go viṣāṇam asti iti vākyāt iva buddhi utpatteḥ vādi vākyāt asat arthakāt prativādinaḥ bodha utpādanasya yogyatā vāde vyutpādita tvāt iti
translated: Because the production of the cognition the horn of a cow exists from the sentence the horn of a hare exists etc. is explained in the doctrine of competence of the production of cognition of the opponent from the statement of the proponent whose meaning is unreal.

original: nanu tatra bādhāvatārānantaraṃ śabdādavagatamasa devetyanubhavādastu śabdābhāsasyābodhakatvaṃ na tu liṅgābhāsasya/
analyzed: nanu tatra bādhā avatāra anantaram śabdāt avagatam asa deva iti anubhavāt astu śabda ābhāsasya abodhaka tvam na tu liṅga ābhāsasya
translated: But there, after the entry of contradiction, let there be the non-informing nature of verbal semblance due to the experience that the meaning is understood from the word, not of inferential semblance.

analyzed: tathā ananubhavāt iti atas āha dṛśyate ca iti
translated: To that, he says: and it is seen, etc.

analyzed: karaṇa saṃsparśita tvāt iti
translated: Because of the contact with the instrument.

original: parokṣāyāṃ ityadhikam ga /ṭa /rā / /tathāpi iti na ga /ṭa /rā / /bdābhāsasyāga /ṭa /rā /🔽tvadarśanenaga /ṭa /rā / /matsādhāraṇyāparihārāt iti na ga /rā / /ṣṭepi ga /ṭa /rā /
analyzed: parokṣāyām iti adhikam gaṭarā tathā api iti na gaṭarā bda ābhāsasya a gaṭarā  tvad darśanena gaṭarā mad sādhāraṇya aparihārāt iti na gaṭarā
translated: Even so, it is not so. Even so, is not in G, T, and R. Of verbal semblance, is not in G, T, and R.

analyzed: nu bhavaḥ ga ṭa rāḥ t iti anuṭa
translated: By your view, it is not so. G, T, and R. Because the commonness of mine is not avoided, it is not in G and R. Even though it is seen, G, T, and R. Experience, G, T, and R. Thus, T.

analyzed: vā pra ro yoḥ prajñā do tva sanam
translated: The growth of the two, wisdom and doubt,

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of fallacies of inference, P.

analyzed: tasmāt bādha pratirodhau sādhana a hetu arūpa premeya doṣa tvāt
translated: Therefore, contradiction and opposition are faults of the object to be known in the form of non-reason for proof,

analyzed: sākṣāt eva anumiti pratibandhaka tvāt
translated: Because of the direct obstruction of inference,

analyzed: pratijñā anantaram hetu upasthitataḥ prāk eva pratibhāsāt
translated: Because of the appearance even before the presentation of the reason after the thesis,

analyzed: pratyakṣa śabda sādhāraṇyāt
translated: Because of the commonness with the word pratyakṣa,

analyzed: karaṇa sāmarthya avighaṭa na tvāt ca na hetu doṣau
translated: And because of the non-destruction of the capacity of the instrument, they are not faults of the reason,

analyzed: kim tu pratijñā doṣau iti 🔽yā tu ṭīkākārī ityā
translated: But they are faults of the thesis.🔽But the commentary writer says,

analyzed: adṛṣṭe vyabhicāre tu sādhakam tat iti sphuṭam
translated: And when there is no seen contradiction, it is clearly established that it is a proof.

analyzed: jñāyate sākṣiṇā eva ā t vā māna bādhe na tat bhavet
translated: It is known only by the witness, not when there is contradiction of valid cognition.

original: ityanuvyākhyānas pratyakṣabādhenānumānasya vyabhicāro bhavatīti vyākhyā sā vyāptigrahaṇadaśābhiprāyā/
analyzed: iti anuvyākhyānaḥ pratyakṣa bādhena anumānasya vyabhicāraḥ bhavati iti vyākhyā sā vyāpti grahaṇa daśa abhiprāyā
translated: Thus, the commentary explains that there can be contradiction of inference by perception. That explanation is intended for the stage of grasping the pervasion.

analyzed: tadā pratijñā ādi vibhāga abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no division into thesis, etc. at that time.

original: anumitidaśāyāṃ tu bādho viṣayāpahāreṇa pratijñā doṣa eva/
analyzed: anumiti daśāyām tu bādhaḥ viṣaya apahāreṇa pratijñā doṣaḥ eva
translated: But in the stage of inference, contradiction is only a fault of the thesis by the removal of the object.

analyzed: anyathā pramāṇa viruddha artha pratijñā pratijñāvirodhaḥ iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇa virodhāt
translated: Otherwise, because of contradicting the definition of valid cognition, which states that the statement of a proposition contrary to what is established by valid means of knowledge is a contradiction of the thesis.

analyzed: yā api anuvyākhyāne
translated: Even in the Anuvṛtti (commentary),

analyzed: sādhya abhāva pramāyām karaṇa apratīteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the meaning is that when there is valid knowledge of the absence of what is to be established, there is no cognition of the means.

analyzed: tasmāt iti etat prāgukta rītyā pañcadhā vyācaṣṭe sādhana anarha tva ityādinā
translated: Therefore, he explains tasmāt (thus) in five ways, starting with asādhanāṅgavacana (statement of a part of the proof that is not a proof), following the explanation given earlier.

analyzed: āśaṅkya        nirāha
translated: Fearing contradiction with the Bhāṣya on the Bhakti Sūtras, he refutes it by stating the intention behind it, saying yā tu (but that).

analyzed: sā iti anvayaḥ
translated: Sa (that) is to be connected.

analyzed: vyāpti grahaṇa iti
translated: Vyaaptīgrahaṇe (in the grasping of the pervasion).

original: vyāptigrahaṇasamaye 'vyāpterutthāpako bādha iti pakṣastviṣyata evamānabādhe na tadbhavediti vakṣyamāṇatvāditi yuktipādīyasudhokteriti bhāvaḥ/🔽yuktipādīyānuvyākhyānoktivirodhañca nirāha yāpīti//
analyzed: vyāpti grahaṇa samaye vyāpteḥ utthāpakaḥ bādhaḥ iti pakṣaḥ tu iṣyate eva māna bādhe na tat bhavet iti vakṣyamāṇa tvāt iti yuktipādīya sudhā ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ  yuktipādīya anuvyākhyāna ukti virodhan ca nirāha yā api iti
translated: The view that at the time of grasping pervasion, contradiction that gives rise to non-pervasion is accepted, but when there is no contradiction, it would not be so, as will be stated, is the meaning stated in the Yuktipadiya commentary.

original: tatra pratijñārthavirodha ityevoktāvapi sudhāyāṃ vakṣyamāṇa 🔽ṭakatvāga /ṭa /rā / /yāḥ ka /ṭha / /rodhāyāśa ḍa /ṭha / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ
analyzed: tatra pratijñā artha virodhaḥ iti eva uktau api sudhāyām  ṭaka tvāc aṭa rāḥ yāḥ kaṭha rodhāya āśaḥ ḍaṭha
translated: And he denies the contradiction with the statement in the Yuktipadiya commentary, saying Even though it is stated as just 'contradiction with the meaning of the proposition' in the Sudha commentary, it is stated as

analyzed: virodhaḥ api tridhā eva syāt pratijñā artha viruddha tā
translated: The contradiction is also threefold only: contradiction with the meaning of the proposition,

analyzed: liṅga rāhityam avyāptiḥ
translated: lack of the reason, and over-extension.

original: iti bādhapratirodhayorasiddhyādinā saha hetudoṣatvoktiḥ sāpi bādhādinaiva dūṣite viṣaye pravartamānasya hetorapyaviṣayavṛttitvaṃ nāma doṣostītyabhipretyaiva
analyzed: iti bādha pratirodhayoḥ asiddhi ādinā saha hetu doṣa tva uktiḥ sā api bādha ādinā eva dūṣite viṣaye pravartamānasya hetoḥ api aviṣaya vṛtti tvam nāma doṣaḥ asti iti abhipretya eva
translated: Thus, the statement that contradiction and opposition are faults of the reason along with non-establishment, etc., is also with the intention that when the reason operates on a subject that has been refuted by contradiction, etc., it has the fault of operating on a non-existent subject,

analyzed: na tu  bādhā ādin viṣaya doṣaḥ iti
translated: but not🔽that contradiction, etc. are faults of the subject.

analyzed: bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: The establishment of contradiction and opposition as faults of the proposition.

analyzed: vibhāga anurodhena bādha pratirodhayoḥ iti anuvādaḥ
translated: The statement in accordance with the division, contradiction and obstruction is a restatement.

analyzed: iti abhipratyeti
translated: Thus, it is understood.

analyzed: tathā eva sudhāyām pratīteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is cognized in the same way in the world.

analyzed: bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: The establishment of contradiction and obstruction as faults of the thesis.

analyzed: atha sādhya sādhana vaikalyayoḥ dṛṣṭānta doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: Now, the establishment of the fault of the example in the absence of the probandum and the probans.

original: nanu sādhyavikalo dṛṣṭānto vipakṣa eveti tatra vartamāno hetuḥ sapakṣāntaravṛttau satyāṃ pakṣatrayavṛttitvātsādhāraṇaḥ/
analyzed: nanu sādhya vikalaḥ dṛṣṭāntaḥ vipakṣaḥ eva iti tatra vartamānaḥ hetuḥ sapakṣa antara vṛttau satyām pakṣa traya vṛtti tvāt sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: Indeed, an example lacking the probandum is only the counter-example. The reason occurring there, when it occurs in another similar instance, is common because it occurs in three instances.

analyzed: atha sādhya sādhana vaikalyayoḥ dṛṣṭānta doṣa tva samarthanam  sādhya vaikalya ādeḥ hetu doṣa tvena pārthakyam prāguktam ayuktam iti āśaṅkya nirāha nanu ityādinā
translated: Now, the establishment of the fault of the example in the absence of the probandum and the probans.🔽The previously stated distinction of the absence of the probandum, etc. as faults of the reason is unreasonable. Suspecting this, he refutes with But... and so on.

analyzed: saṃgraha saṃbhavāt dṛṣṭānta doṣa tvena iti adhikam
translated: Because of the possibility of inclusion, it is excessive to say as a fault of the example.

analyzed: sāmāna vailya yodṛnta do tvasanam
translated: The establishment of the fault of the example in the absence of the similar and dissimilar.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.

analyzed: asatyām tu sapakṣa vṛttau pakṣa vipakṣayoḥ eva vartamāna tvāt viruddhaḥ
translated: But when there is no occurrence in the similar instance, it is contradictory because it occurs only in the subject and the counter-example.

original: sādhyadharmavati dṛṣṭānte sādhanavikale heturvyāpyatvāsiddha iti dṛṣṭāntābhāso hetvābhāsāntargata eveti cenna/
analyzed: sādhya dharmavati dṛṣṭānte sādhana vikale hetuḥ vyāpya tva asiddhaḥ iti dṛṣṭānta ābhāsaḥ hetvābhāsa antargataḥ eva iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the reason, which is devoid of the probandum in the example, is inconclusive because of the non-establishment of pervasion, then it is not so.

analyzed: bādhā ādeḥ pakṣa āśrita tayā iva avyāpti ādeḥ hetu āśrita tayā iva ca sādhya vaikalya ādeḥ dṛṣṭānta āśrita tayā eva pratibhāsāt
translated: Because the fallacy of the probandum being absent is manifested only as residing in the example, just as the fallacy of the reason being absent is manifested only as residing in the reason.

analyzed: pratibhāsa anusāreṇa ca udbhāvya a tvāt
translated: And because it is to be pointed out in accordance with the manifestation.

analyzed: udbhāvyasya ca eva vyutpādya tvāt
translated: And because only what is to be pointed out is to be defined.

analyzed: kiñca upajīvya tvena anumāna aṅga dṛṣṭānta doṣeṇa eva anumāne duṣṭe katham piṣṭa peṣaka hetvābhāsa pratīkṣā
translated: Moreover, if the fallacy of the example, which is a part of inference, is to be relied upon, then how can the fallacies of the reason be expected to be groundless?

original: anyathā bādhe pakṣasyaiva vipakṣatvāt bādho vyabhicāre ' ntarbhūtaḥ syāt/🔽savya bhicāraviruddhau ca vyāptihīnatvāvdyāpyatvāsiddhe 'ntarbhūtau syātām/
analyzed: anyathā bādhe pakṣasya eva vipakṣa tvāt bādhaḥ vyabhicāre    syāt  sa vyabhicāra viruddhau ca vyāpti hīna tvau dyāpya tva asiddhe ntarbhūtau syātām
translated: Otherwise, if the fallacy of the probandum being absent is manifested as residing in the reason, then the fallacy of the probandum being absent would be included in the fallacy of contradiction, because the subject would itself be the counter-example.🔽And the fallacies of contradiction and the fallacy of the reason being inconclusive would be included in the fallacy of the reason being inconclusive.

original: asādhāraṇe ca sapakṣasya sapakṣasya sādhanavaikalyāvaśyaṃbhāvātsopi sādhanavaikalyentarbhūtaḥ syāt/
analyzed: asādhāraṇe ca sapakṣasya sapakṣasya sādhana vaikalya avaśyaṃbhāvāt saḥ api sādhana vaikalye antarbhūtaḥ syāt
translated: And in the fallacy of the reason being unique, the absence of the reason in the similar instance is necessarily included in the fallacy of the reason being absent.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana vaikalyam dṛṣṭāntasya viśeṣaṇe
translated: The fallacy of the reason being absent is a particular kind of fallacy of the example.

original: iti bhaktipādīyānuvyākhyānasudhoktarītyā dṛṣṭāntadoṣatvamupapādayati bādhāderiti//🔽nanu sādhyavaikalyādisthale vyabhicārāderapi sāmagrībalena spurasaṇasaṃbhavāt vyabhicārādirapyudbhāvya
analyzed: iti bhaktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhā ukta rītyā dṛṣṭānta doṣa tvam upapādayati  bādhā ādeḥ iti  nanu sādhya vaikalya ādi sthale vyabhicāra ādeḥ api sāmagrī balena vyabhicāra ādiḥ api udbhāvya
translated: Thus, he explains the defect of the example in the manner stated in the Anuvyaख्यानसुधा of भक्तिपाद, by saying because of contradiction, etc.

original: iti hetvābhāsatvena vyutpādanaṃ yuktamiti cettadāpyupajīvyatvāddṛṣṭāntadoṣa evetyāha kiñciti //
analyzed: iti hetvābhāsa tvena vyutpādanam yuktam iti ced tadā api upajīvya tvāt dṛṣṭānta doṣaḥ eva iti āha kiñcid iti
translated: If it is argued that in cases of incompleteness of the probandum, etc., contradiction, etc. can also be pointed out by the power of the collection of conditions, and hence it is proper to explain contradiction, etc. as fallacies of reason, then he says a little that even then, because of being sublated, it is only a defect of the example.

original: vipakṣe 'nekabādhakasatvā cca dṛṣṭāntadoṣatvameva yuktamityāha anyatheti// 🔽rānta ga /ṭa /rā / /vyabhicā ga /rā / /viruddhaucāvyāptyadhīnatvāt vyāpyatvāsiddhau antarbhū ṭa / viruddhau ca vyārā / /ityādi
analyzed: vipakṣe neka bādhaka satvāt ca dṛṣṭānta doṣa tvam eva yuktam iti āha anyathā iti  vyabhicā viruddhau ca vyāpti adhīna tvāt vyāpya tva asiddhau ityādi
translated: And because there are many contradictions in the contrary, it is proper to consider it only as a defect of the example. He says otherwise.🔽The contradiction and overextension are included in the non-establishment of the pervasion. The contradiction is also included in the fallacy of the reason. Thus, etc.

analyzed: bha ṭha sadbhāvāt ca ṭha
translated: The end. The existence of the reason is also included in the non-establishment of the pervasion.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: anupasaṃhāriṇi ca dṛṣṭāntābhāva āvaśyaka iti sopi dṛṣṭāntābhāsentarbhūtaḥ syāt//
analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇi ca dṛṣṭānta abhāvaḥ āvaśyakaḥ iti saḥ api dṛṣṭānta ābhāsena antarbhūtaḥ syāt
translated: And in the non-conclusion, the absence of an example is necessary. Therefore, that also would be included in the fallacy of the example.

original: kiñca jīvaccharīrajātaṃ sātmakaṃ prāṇādimatvāt ghaṭavadityatra śabdo 'bhidheyaḥ prameyatvāvdyatirekeṇa
analyzed: kiñca jīvat śarīra jātam sātmakam prāṇa ādima tvāt ghaṭa vat iti atra śabdaḥ bhidheyaḥ prameya tva avdi atirekeṇa
translated: Moreover, in the argument The class of living bodies is endowed with a soul, because it possesses life, etc., like a pot, the word is the object of denotation, because it is the object of knowledge, unlike sound.

original: ghaṭavadityatra ca krameṇa vyatirekavyāpteranvayavyāpteśca satvena hetudoṣābhāvepi
analyzed: ghaṭa vat iti atra ca krameṇa vyatireka vyāpteḥ anvaya vyāpteḥ ca satvena hetu doṣa abhāve api
translated: And in like a pot, there is respectively the pervasion by the negative concomitance and the pervasion by the positive concomitance, so even though there is no fault in the reason,

original: dhūmānumānepi hṛde dṛṣṭāntite hetudoṣābhāvepi dṛṣṭānto duṣṭa iti taddoṣaḥ pṛthageva /
analyzed: dhūma anumāne api hṛde dṛṣṭāntite hetu doṣa abhāve pi dṛṣṭāntaḥ duṣṭaḥ iti tad doṣaḥ pṛthak eva
translated: even in the inference of smoke, when the example is given as the heart, even though there is no fault in the reason, the example is faulty, so that fault is separate.

analyzed: tatra api anupadarśita vyāptika tvāt dyāpya tva asiddhiḥ eva iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even there, the non-demonstration of the pervasion is the non-establishment of the pervadedness, it is not so.

analyzed: tathā api atha doṣa abhāvāt
translated: Because even so, the fault of the reason is absent.

analyzed: tatra eva māhanase dṛṣṭāntite vyāpya tva asiddhiḥ nā iti tasya anitya doṣa tva āpātāt ca
translated: Because even if the example is given as the same heart, the non-establishment of the pervadedness is not so, so it would follow that that is a fault of the non-eternal.

original: hṛde dṛṣṭāntitepi yatra dhūmastatrāgniriti pūrvabhāgena vyāpterupadarśitatvācca//
analyzed: hṛde dṛṣṭānti te pi yatra dhūmaḥ tatra agniḥ iti pūrva bhāgena vyāpteḥ upadarśita tvāt ca
translated: Even when the example is given as the heart, the pervasion where there is smoke, there is fire is demonstrated by the first part.

analyzed: hetu doṣa sāṅkarya mātreṇa hetu doṣa tve iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is a fault of the reason merely by the coincidence of the faults of the reason.

analyzed: an upasaṃhāriṇi ca iti
translated: And in the non-conclusive,

analyzed: savyabhicā bheda bhinne sarvam anityam kārya tvāt ityādau iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is in the case of everything is non-eternal because it is an effect, which is different from the fallacious-in-general.

analyzed: hetu doṣa asaṃṅkīrṇa tvāt ca dṛṣṭānta doṣaḥ pṛthak iti āha kiñca jīvat śarīra iti
translated: And because it is not mixed with the faults of the reason, the fault of the example is separate. He says And in the living body...

original: sapakṣāntare vartamānasya sādhanasya dṛṣṭāntīkṛtesapakṣe vṛttau hetvābhāvasatvānupapatteśceti paddhatyuktamāha dhūmeti//
analyzed: sapakṣa antare vartamānasya sādhanasya vṛttau hetvābhāva satva anupapatteḥ ca iti paddhati uktam āha dhūma iti
translated: It is said in the Padarthadharmasangraha that when a reason occurring in another similar instance is used in the similar instance taken as the example, the presence of the reason in the absence of the probandum is not possible. He says Smoke...

analyzed: hetu doṣa sāṅkaryam āśaṅkate tatra api iti
translated: He raises the doubt of the reason being mixed with the faults of the reason with Even there...

analyzed: tatra eva iti
translated: There itself means

analyzed: dhūma anumāna
translated: in the inference of smoke itself.

analyzed: eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is itself.

analyzed: tasyāḥ vyāpya tva asiddheḥ
translated: Because of the non-established pervasion.

analyzed: upadarśita vyāptika tva daśāyām vyāpya tva asiddhi śaṅkā api na iti āha hṛdaḥ iti
translated: He says In the heart to show that even in the state of demonstrated pervasion, there is no doubt of the non-established pervasion.

original: nanvastvevaṃ sādhyavaikalyāderdṛṣṭāntadoṣatvaṃ tathāpi dṛṣṭāntadoṣo dvividha ityayuktaṃ tasyānekavidhatvādityata āha ubhayeti//
analyzed: nanu astu evam sādhya vaikalya ādeḥ dṛṣṭānta doṣa tvam tathā api dṛṣṭānta doṣaḥ dvividhaḥ iti ayuktam tasya anekavidha tvāt iti atas āha ubhaya iti
translated: But even so, it is not proper to say that the fault of the example is of two kinds, because it is of many kinds. To this he says Both...

analyzed: sudhā uktam eva āha eka vaikalyena eva iti
translated: He says what is stated in the Sudha with By the deficiency of only one...

analyzed: ricā iti ukta sa vyabhicāḥ ṭha  sāsāna vailya yohanta do tvasanam  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The over-pervasion mentioned earlier.🔽The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: ubhaya vaikalyam tu na pṛthak doṣaḥ
translated: But the deficiency of both is not a separate fault.

analyzed: eka vaikalyena eva duṣṭa tva siddheḥ
translated: Since the fault is established by the deficiency of just one, the deficiency of the other is useless.

original: saṃbhavamātreṇa pṛthagvacane anaikāntikakālātītatvaṃ asiddhakālātītatvamityādyapi hetvābhāsāntaraṃ syāt/
analyzed: saṃbhava mātreṇa pṛthak vacane anaikāntika kāla atīta tvam asiddha kāla atīta tvam ityādi api hetvābhāsa antaram syāt
translated: If it is stated separately merely on the basis of possibility, then non-uniqueness, time-transcendence, non-established time-transcendence, etc. would also be other types of fallacious reasons.

analyzed: āśraya hīna tva avyāpti abhidhāna ādi udāharaṇa ābhāsasya antarbhāvaḥ paddhati ādau dṛṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the apparent example due to the statement of the lack of basis and non-pervasion should be seen in the Paddhati and other texts.

original: yā tusādhyasya sādhanasya vānanugamo dṛṣṭāntavirodhaiti pramāṇalakṣaṇavyākhyāvasare
analyzed: yā tu sādhyasya sādhanasya vā ananugamaḥ dṛṣṭānta virodhā eti pramāṇa lakṣaṇa vyākhyā avasare
translated: But the statement by the author of the commentary on the occasion of explaining the definition of pramāṇa, that the non-concomitance of the probandum or the probans is the contradiction of the example,

original: ṭīkākārīyāubhayorveti grāhyamityuktiḥ sā yathā mano 'nityaṃ mūrtatvātparamāṇuvat
analyzed: ṭīkākārīyā ubhayoḥ vā iti grāhyam iti uktiḥ sā yathā manaḥ nityam mūrta tvāt paramāṇu vat
translated: should be accepted as referring to both. That is, just as in the argument the mind is non-eternal because of being corporeal, like an atom,

original: karmavat ityatra krameṇa sādhyavaikalyaṃ sādhanavaikalyaṃ ca doṣaḥ tathā gaganavadityādau
analyzed: karma vat iti atra krameṇa sādhya vaikalyam sādhana vaikalyam ca doṣaḥ tathā gagana vat ityādau
translated: and like an action, the defects are respectively the deficiency of the probandum and the deficiency of the probans, similarly in the case of like the sky, etc.,

analyzed: ubhaya vaikalya ākhyau doṣau staḥ iti abhipretya eva
translated: it is with the intention that there are two defects called the deficiency of both.

analyzed: na tu ubha vaikalya dūṣaṇasya pṛthak doṣa tvam iti abhipretya
translated: But it is not with the intention that the deficiency of both is a separate defect.

analyzed: anyathā eka ika vaikalyena dṛṣṭāntasya duṣṭa tve samudita kalpanā vaiyarthyāt ityādi
translated: Otherwise, if the example is faulty due to the deficiency of each, then the postulation of the combination would be useless, and so on.

original: nanvathāpi dṛṣṭāntarūpāśrayāsiddhivyāptyanabhidhanaviparītavyāptyabhidhānādīnāṃ dṛṣṭāntadoṣāṇāṃ kāṃ gatirityata āha āśrayahīnatveti//
analyzed: nanu atha api dṛṣṭānta rūpa āśraya asiddhi vyāpti anabhidhana viparīta vyāpti abhidhāna ādīnām dṛṣṭānta doṣāṇām kām gatiḥ iti atas āha āśraya hīna tva iti
translated: But even so, what is the position of the fallacies of the example, such as the unestablished basis of the example, the non-statement of pervasion, and the statement of a contrary pervasion? To this he says In the absence of a basis, etc.

original: ādipadena pramāṇalakṣaṇaṭīkā grāhyā/🔽ubhayavaikalyasyāpi doṣatvena🔽lakṣaṇaṭīkāyāmuktatvapratīteḥ tadvirodhamāśaṅkyanirāha yātviti//
analyzed: ādi padena pramāṇa lakṣaṇa ṭīkā grāhyā  ubhaya vaikalyasya api doṣa tvena  lakṣaṇa ṭīkāyām uktatva pratīteḥ tad virodham āśaṅkya nirāha yātu iti
translated: The word ādi should be taken to include the Pramāṇalakṣaṇī commentary.🔽Because the lack of both is stated as a fallacy in the Lakṣaṇakārikā commentary,🔽suspecting a contradiction with that, he denies it by saying But that, etc.

analyzed: ita lya rūpeṇa eka doṣa tvam igarāḥ ṅkyā ḍa
translated: The form of the two is one fallacy.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava.

original: sudha yobhayavaikalyaṃ na pṛthaggaṇanīyamati pramāṇapaddhatyā ca virodhāt//
translated: The Sudha says: The lack of both should not be counted separately, because it contradicts the Pramāṇapaddhati.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana vaikalyayoḥ dṛṣṭānta doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: The proof of the fallacies of the reason and the example being incomplete.

analyzed: sudhayā iti
translated: The Sudha says: The meaning is the Sudha commentary on the Bhāmatī.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana vaikalyayoḥ dṛṣṭānta doṣa tva samarthanam
translated: The proof of the fallacies of the reason and the example being incomplete.

analyzed: atha āśraya asiddheḥ deṣa tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fallacy of the unestablished basis.

analyzed: āśraya asiddhiḥ tu na doṣaḥ tathā hi
translated: But the unestablished basis is not a fallacy. Because it is like this.

analyzed: na tāvat āśraya asiddha tvam anityaḥ ghaṭaḥ kārya tvāt
translated: Non-eternality of a jar because it is an effect.

analyzed: atha āśraya asiddheḥ deṣa tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fallacy of the locus being unestablished.

analyzed: nanu yat uktam asiddhiḥ avyāptiḥ iti dvau eva hetu doṣau iti tat ayuktam
translated: But it has been said that there are only two fallacies of a reason, namely, the unestablished and the over-exclusive. That is not correct.

analyzed: āśraya asiddha tvāt prasiddha sādhyaka tva vyadhikaraṇa asiddha tva rūpa hetu doṣāṇām bhāvāt iti atas āśraya sādhya vyadhikaraṇa asiddhayoḥ
translated: Because there are fallacies of a reason such as being unestablished in the locus, proving what is already established, and being unestablished in a different subject.

analyzed: na dūṣaṇam ityādi pramāṇa lakṣaṇa tad ṭīkā ādi ukta rīti āśraya asiddha tva ādeḥ adoṣa tvam vyutpādayitu kāma
translated: In order to explain that being unestablished in the locus and so on are not fallacies, in accordance with the statement in the commentary on the definition of valid cognition,

analyzed: āśraya asiddha tva aṃśe tāvat uktam āha āśraya asiddhiḥ tu iti
translated: he says, As for being unestablished in the locus, and so on.

original: tatkimāśrayāsiddhatvaṃ siddhasādhakatvaṃ vā pakṣīkṛtākāreṇāsatvaṃ vā abhāvāśrayatvaṃ
analyzed: tat kim āśraya asiddha tvam siddha sādhaka tvam vā pakṣīkṛta ākāreṇa asatvam vā abhāva āśraya tvam
translated: Is being unestablished in the locus proving what is already established, or not existing in the form of the subject, or being the locus of a non-entity,

original: vā asadāśrayatvaṃ vā asadāśrayakatvaṃ vā ādyatrayaṃ tāvannayuktamiti nirākaroti na tāvaditi /
analyzed: vā asat āśraya tvam vā asat āśrayaka tvam vā ādya trayam tāvat na yuktam iti nirākaroti na tāvat iti
translated: or having a non-entity as the locus, or having a non-entity as the basis? The first three are not correct. He refutes this by saying Not at all.

analyzed: na api svarṇa mayaḥ iti
translated: Nor is it golden.

analyzed: na api atyanta abhāva iti ca granthena
translated: Nor is it absolute non-existence. This is stated in the text.

original: dhāyāṃ ga /ṭa /rā / /pramāṇapadaṃ na ga /ṭa /rā / /asadāśrayatvaṃ vā iti nāsti ṭha / asadāśrayakatvaṃ vā iti na ḍa /
analyzed: pramāṇa padam na gaṭarā asat āśraya tvam vā iti na asti asat āśrayaka tvam vā iti na
translated: The word dhā is not g, ṭ, rā. The word pramāṇa is not g, ṭ, rā. Or it is based on what is non-existent, so there is no ṭha. Or it is based on what is non-existent, so there is no ḍa.

analyzed: āya āddheḥ do tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The refutation of the fallacy of the reason being the same as the probandum.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the fallacies of inference.

original: ghaṭavadityādāviva siddhasādhakatvaṃ tatra sandehagarbhitapakṣatvābhāvena pakṣarūpāśrayābhāvāditi yuktam/
analyzed: ghaṭa vat ityādau iva siddhasādhaka tvam tatra sandeha garbhita pakṣa tva abhāvena pakṣa rūpa āśraya abhāvāt iti yuktam
translated: Just as in like a pot, it is proper to say that it proves what is already established there, because of the absence of the substratum in the form of the subject due to the absence of doubt,

analyzed: sandeha abhāve pi pakṣatāyāḥ ukta tvāt
translated: because even in the absence of doubt, the nature of being a subject has been stated.

analyzed: tasya mad mata ipi asaṅga ta tva antarbhāveṇa doṣa tvāt
translated: Because even according to our view, it is a fallacy included in the category of inconclusiveness.

original: nāpi svarṇamayodriragnimānityādāviva pakṣaviśeṣaṇābhāvena pakṣīkṛtākāreṇāsatvaṃ tasya manmate 'pi bādhāntarbhāveṇa doṣatvāt//
analyzed: nā api svarṇa maya udriḥ agnimān ityādau iva pakṣa viśeṣaṇa abhāvena pakṣīkṛta ākāreṇa asatvam tasya man mate pi bādhā antarbhāveṇa doṣa tvāt
translated: Nor is it the non-existence in the form of the subject due to the absence of the qualification of the subject, as in the golden mountain is fiery, because even according to our view, it is a fallacy included in the category of contradiction.

original: nāpyatyantābhāvaśraya katvam abhāvasya tucchatvena pratibandhakābhāve kāraṇatvasyevābhāve
analyzed: na api atyanta abhāva śraya katvam abhāvasya tuccha tvena pratibandhaka abhāve kāraṇa tvasya iva abhāve
translated: Nor is it the basis of absolute non-existence, because absence is void, and just as the absence of an obstruction is a cause, so too the absence of a substratum,

analyzed: āśraya tvasya api abhāvāt atyanta abhāvasya aprāmāṇika pratiyogika tvena aprāmāṇika tvāt ca iti yuktam
translated: and because absolute non-existence is not a valid cognition due to having an invalid object of negation. This is proper.

analyzed: atyanta abhāva pratiyoginaḥ eva tuccha tvena abhāvasya a tuccha tvāt
translated: But in the case of absolute non-existence, it is not so, because the non-existence of what has a counter-correlate is void, while the non-existence of what does not have a counter-correlate is not void.

analyzed: na tāvat iti asya yuktam iti anvayaḥ
translated: The word not is to be construed with proper.

analyzed: siddha sādhakasya katham āśraya asiddha tvam iti atas dūṣaṇa saukaryāya āha tatra iti
translated: In order to facilitate the criticism, he says there etc.

analyzed: ukta tvāt iti
translated: Because it has been stated means
because it has been stated at the time of stating the definition of the subject that the subject is that which is qualified by the property to be proved.

analyzed: doṣa tvāt iti
translated: Because it is a fallacy means

because it has been stated at the time of stating the fallacies of one's own inference that it is a fallacy because it is included among the refutations in the form of irrelevance in the case of an inference for the sake of another.

analyzed: bhāvaḥ pakṣa viśeṣaṇa abhāvena iti
translated: This is the idea. Due to the absence of the qualification of the subject means

analyzed: āśraya viśeṣaṇa asiddhyā ca āśraya asiddhiḥ asaṃkīrṇā iti maṇi ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the idea is that the subject-non-established is not mixed up with the non-established of the qualification of the substratum, as stated in the Mimamsa.

analyzed: bādhā antarbhāvena iti
translated: Because it is included among the contradictions means

analyzed: pakṣa tad viśeṣaṇa sādhya tad viśeṣaṇa ādi bādha bhedena bādhasya ūnakavidha tvāt pakṣa viśeṣaṇa bādhe antarbhāvaḥ iti bhāvaḥ 🔽na api iti 🔽yuktam iti anvayaḥ
translated: because contradiction is of one kind, divided into the contradiction of the subject, the qualification of that, the probandum, the qualification of that, and so on, the idea is that it is included among the contradictions of the qualification of the subject.

original: abhāvapakṣakatve āśrayāsiddhatvaṃ hetoḥ kuta ityata āha abhāvasyeti//
analyzed: abhāva pakṣaka tve āśraya asiddha tvam hetoḥ kutas iti atas āha abhāvasya iti
translated: If it is on the side of non-existence, how can the reason be unestablished as to the substratum? To this he says 'of non-existence' etc.

analyzed: aprāmāṇika tvāt ca iti
translated: And because of being unestablished by valid cognition.

analyzed: tathā ca tasya pakṣa tvena anumāna pramāṇa viṣaya tā iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus, how can it be the subject and the object of inference by valid cognition? This is the meaning.🔽The word 'api' (even) is not found in G, T, and R.🔽The word 'api' (even) is not found in K, G, T, and R.

original: apipadaṃ na ga /ṭa /rā / /ṅgatyanta ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /vena do ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /yakatvaṃ🔽ka /ga /rā / /kāraṇatvāśrayatvābhāve ka / ve āśraya ṭha / /dharmapadaṃ na ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: apipadam na kagaṭarā  āśraya dharma padam na
translated: The word 'api' (even) is not found in K, G, T, and R.

analyzed: ntarbhavati iti ṭha

analyzed: pratibandhaka abhāvasya a pi anyathāsiddhyā eva akāraṇa tvāt  aprāmāṇika tvasya prāmāṇika atyanta abhāva pratiyogi tva rūpa tvena hetoḥ viruddha tvāt ca  tasya api abhāva tva aprāmāṇika pratiyogika tva ādi dharma āśraya tvāt ca
translated: The word 'api' (even) is not found in K, G, T, and R.

original: taduktam/🔽na cātyantābhāvo 'pi sarvadharmarahitaiti//🔽kintu vandhyāsuto na vaktā acetanatvādityādāvivāsadāśrayatvāt/
analyzed: tat uktam 🔽na ca atyanta abhāvaḥ sarva dharma rahitā eti 🔽kintu vandhyāsutaḥ na vaktā acetana tvāt ityādau iva asat āśraya tvāt
translated: The word

analyzed: tasya tu doṣa tvam kim asataḥ nirdharmaka tvena
translated: But how can that be a fault, if it is non-existent and devoid of properties?

original: kathaṃ tarhi pratibandhakābhāvasya kāraṇatvaṃ netyuktaṃ dvitīyaparicchede ityatastasyāsatvādakāraṇatvaṃ na bhavatītyāha pratibandhaketi//
analyzed: katham tarhi pratibandhaka abhāvasya kāraṇa tvam na iti uktam dvitīya paricchede iti atas tasya asatvāt akāraṇa tvam na bhavati iti āha pratibandhaka iti
translated: Then how is it said in the second chapter that the absence of an obstruction is not a cause? To this he says 'the absence of an obstruction' etc.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ hetuḥ ayuktaḥ iti āha aprāmāṇika tvasya iti
translated: The second reason is improper, he says 'the non-authoritativeness' etc.

original: atyantābhāvoprāmāṇikaḥ aprāmāṇikapratiyogikatvādityuktirayuktā aprāmāṇikapratiyogikatvādityasyatu prāmāṇikātyantābhāvapratiyogī yaḥ tatpratiyogikatvādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: atyanta abhāvaḥ uprāmāṇikaḥ aprāmāṇika pratiyogika tvāt iti uktiḥ ayuktā aprāmāṇika pratiyogika tvāt iti asya tu prāmāṇika atyanta abhāva pratiyogī yaḥ tad pratiyogika tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The statement that absolute non-existence is authoritative, because its counter-correlate is non-authoritative, is improper. But the meaning of 'because its counter-correlate is non-authoritative' is: that which is the counter-correlate of the authoritative absolute non-existence.

original: tathā cātyantābhāvopāmāṇika iti yatsādhyaṃ tadabhāvena prāmāṇikatvenāprāmāṇikapratiyogikatvāditiheturvyāpta iti kathaṃ na viruddhahetvābhāsa
analyzed: tathā ca atyanta abhāva upāmāṇikaḥ iti yat sādhyam tad abhāvena prāmāṇika tvena aprāmāṇika pratiyogika tvāt iti hetuḥ vyāptaḥ iti katham na viruddha hetvābhāsa
translated: And thus, how can the reason 'because it is the counter-correlate of a non-authoritative' be contradictory, when it is pervaded by the absence of that which is to be established, namely 'absolute non-existence is authoritative'?

analyzed: tasya api iti
translated: 'Of that also' etc.

analyzed: tathāca āśraya tvasya eva abhāvāt iti vyāhatam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, the idea is that the statement 'because of the mere absence of the substratum' is contradictory.

analyzed: tat uktam iti
translated: 'That has been said' etc.

analyzed: pramāṇa lakṣaṇe
translated: In the definition of means of valid knowledge.

original: evaṃ pakṣatraye niraste paśnapūrvaṃ caturthamavaśeṣayati kintviti//
analyzed: evam pakṣa traye niraste paśna pūrvam caturtham avaśeṣayati kintu iti
translated: Having refuted the three positions in this way, he leaves the fourth, which was stated earlier, as the remainder, with 'but'.

original: apipadaṃ na ga /ṭa / /katvapra ga /rā / /aprāmāṇika ityasya prāmāṇikātyantābhāvapratiyogītyarthaḥ ṭa / /sya prā ḍa / 🔽āyāddhedotvabhaṅgaḥ
analyzed: na aprāmāṇikaḥ iti asya prāmāṇika atyanta abhāva pratiyogī iti arthaḥ sya prā  āyāt hedaḥ o tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The word 'api' (even) is not used. The word 'kṛtvā' (having done) is used. The word 'apramāṇika' (unauthoritative) means 'the counter-correlate of the absolute absence of authoritativeness'. The word 'syāt' (may be) is used.🔽The section on the refutation of the word 'a' (not) ends.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: sādhya dharma anāśraya tvena bādhāt sādhana abhāvena asiddheḥ vā pratītya viṣaya tvena vidhi niṣedha rūpa sakala vyavahāra abhājana tvāt vā
translated: Because of contradiction by being the substratum of the property to be proved, or because of being unestablished by the absence of the proof, or because of being the object of cognition, or because of not being the subject of all transactions in the form of affirmation and negation,

analyzed: aprāmāṇika tvena pramāṇa anaṅga tvāt vā tasya adoṣa tve tiprasaṅgāt ā niradhikaraṇayoḥ dharmayoḥ niyata sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyāpti abhāvāt vā
translated: or because of being unauthoritative, or because of not being a part of valid cognition, or because of over-extension if it is not a fault, or because of the absence of pervasion in the form of the necessary co-existence of two properties without a substratum,

original: nādyau/ asati tvaduktayoḥ sādhyasādhanadharmānāśrayatvarūpayoḥ sādhyayornirdhamakatvarūpasya sādhanasya cāsaṃbhavena tavāpi bādhādiprasaṅgāt/
analyzed: na ādyau asati tvad uktayoḥ sādhya sādhana dharma anāśraya tva rūpayoḥ sādhyayoḥ nirdhamaka tva rūpasya sādhanasya ca asaṃbhavena tava api bādhā ādi prasaṅgāt
translated: The first two are not correct. Because if the two properties to be proved, which are in the form of not being the substratum of the properties to be proved and the properties to be established, and the proof in the form of the nature of the refuter, are not possible, then there is the undesirable consequence of contradiction, etc. for you also.

original: tvaduktadharmāṇāmabhāvarūpatvāttatra saṃbhe ca tata eva maduktāvaktṛtvācetanatvāderapi saṃbhavāt/
analyzed: tvad ukta dharmāṇām abhāva rūpa tvāt tatra ca tatas eva mad ukta avaktṛ tva acetana tva ādeḥ api saṃbhavāt
translated: Because the properties stated by you are in the form of absence, and because they are possible there, and because of that alone, my stated properties of being a non-speaker and being insentient, etc. are also possible.

analyzed: bhāva rūpāṇām tu mayā api anaṅgīkārāt
translated: But I do not accept those which are in the form of existence.

analyzed: yadi ca sādhya dharmāḥ
translated: And if there is a fault even in the absence of the substratum of the absence of the probandum property etc.,

analyzed: doṣaḥ vyāhatiḥ evā asti nṛśṛṅga astitva sādhana
translated: there is only contradiction in the proof of the existence of a man's horns etc.

analyzed: iti ādi bhaktipādīya anuvyākhyāna avataraṇa prastāve sudhāyām vikalpi rītyā ṣoḍhā vikalpayati kim ityādinā
translated: In the context of the introduction to the Anvvyakhyana of Bhaktipada, Sudha analyzes it in six ways beginning with What is it?

analyzed: bādhāt ityādi pañcamī antānām doṣa tvam iti anena anvayaḥ
translated: The words ending in the fifth case such as contradiction are to be construed with fault.

analyzed: dharmayoḥ iti
translated: Of the two properties means

analyzed: sādhya sādhana rūpa dharmayoḥ iti arthaḥ na ādyau iti
translated: of the two properties in the form of the probandum and the probans. Not the first means

analyzed: sādhyam na asti sādhanam na asti iti kalpau iti arthaḥ
translated: the two alternatives that the probandum does not exist and the probans does not exist.

analyzed: bādhā ādi ityādi padena asiddhi grahaḥ
translated: The word etc. after contradiction includes non-establishment.

analyzed: tvad ukta dharmāṇām iti
translated: Of the properties stated by you means

analyzed: sādhya dharma anāśraya tva sādhana dharma anāśraya tva nirdharmaka tva rūpa dharmāṇām iti arthaḥ
translated: of the properties in the form of the non-substratum of the probandum property, the non-substratum of the probans property, and the property of being devoid of properties.

analyzed: tatra iti
translated: There means

analyzed: vandhyā suta ādau asati iti arthaḥ
translated: in the son of a barren woman, etc.

analyzed: etena iti uktam vyanakti
translated: He explains what is meant by by this🔽as either being not a means of valid knowledge or not being a part, or as not being established by a means of valid knowledge.

original: apramāṇatvenānāṅgatvādvā ṭa / /aprāmāṇikatvādvā rā / /vena tata ka /ga / /ādipadaṃ na ka /ga /ṭa /rā /
analyzed: a pramāṇa tvena anāṅga tvāt vā aprāmāṇika tvāt vā rā vena tata ka gaḥ ādi padam na
translated: The word etc. is not found in K, G, T, or R.
The Nyaya-Tandava with the Nyaya-Dipika, Third Chapter

original: sādhyadharmādyanāśrayatvasya satvāttava na bādhādiḥ tarhi vaktṛtvābhāvā śrayatvābhāve 'pi vaktṛtvā nāśrayatvasya satvānmamāpi na bādhādi//🔽etenāsatvādeva vaktṛtvādivadavaktṛtvādikamapi neti bādhādīti nirastam/
analyzed: sādhya dharma ādi anāśraya tvasya satvāt tava na bādhā ādiḥ tarhi vaktṛ tva abhāvā āśraya tva abhāve vaktṛ tvā nāśraya tvasya satvāt mama api na bādhā ādi  etena asatvāt eva vaktṛ tva ādi vat avaktṛ tva ādikam api nā iti bādhā ādi iti nirastam
translated: Because of the existence of the non-substantiality of the probandum, etc., there is no contradiction, etc., for you. Then, even in the absence of the non-substantiality of speech, because of the existence of the substantiality of speech, there is no contradiction, etc., for me either.🔽By this, the objection that non-existence, etc., like speech, etc., are also non-speech, etc., is refuted.

analyzed: vandhyā suta viśiṣṭasya vaktṛ tvasya abhāvam prati vandhyā suta asatvasya sādhaka tvena ābādhaka tvāt
translated: Because the non-existence of the son of a barren woman is not contradictory as a proof of the non-existence of speech, etc., which is superior to the son of a barren woman.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyayoḥ abhāve viśiṣṭa abhāva dārḍhyāt  tatas eva prāmāṇika tva vat aprāmāṇika tvasya api abhāva āpātāt ca
translated: Because the absence of the qualified is firm in the absence of the qualifier and the qualified.🔽And because of the undesirable consequence of the absence of non-authoritativeness, etc., just like authoritativeness, etc.

analyzed: nanu aprāmāṇika tva ādikam asatva anuguṇam tad abhāve prāmāṇika tvena sattva āpātāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that non-authoritativeness, etc., are in accordance with non-existence, and in its absence, there is the undesirable consequence of existence by authoritativeness,

analyzed: samam prakṛte a vaktṛ tva abhāve vaktṛ tvena sattva āpātāt
translated: it is the same in the present case also, because of the undesirable consequence of existence by speech in the absence of the absence of non-speech.

analyzed: kiñca vaktṛ tva vat aktṛ tvasya abhāve bādha vat abādhaḥ api syāt
translated: Moreover, just as there is contradiction in the absence of non-speech like speech, there would also be non-contradiction like contradiction.

analyzed: vandhyā iti katham sādhaka tvam iti atas āha viśeṣaṇa iti
translated: How is it a proof? To this he says: because of the absence of the qualifier and the qualified.

analyzed: vandhyā suta ca abhāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the son of a barren woman and the attribute of having the form of a speaker are non-existent.

analyzed: tatas eva iti
translated: From that alone means

analyzed: asattvāt eva iti arthaḥ
translated: from non-existence alone, that is the meaning.

analyzed: samam iti uktam vyanakti avaktṛ tva iti  a vaktṛ tva vat iti
translated: Having stated equal, he explains it with non-speaking etc.🔽Like non-speaking,

analyzed: avaktṛ tvasya iva iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is like non-speaking.

analyzed: vandhyā sutaḥ na vaktā acetana tvāt iti atra avaktṛ tva rūpa sādhya dharma abhāvāt bādhaḥ iti uktam tvayā mayā
translated: You have stated that in the argument The son of a barren woman is not a speaker because of being insentient, there is contradiction due to the absence of the property to be proved in the form of non-speaking.

analyzed: avaktṛ tva abhāve vaktṛ tvam syāt iti uktam ā
translated: I have stated that if there is the absence of non-speaking, there would be speaking.

original: vaktṛtvamapi na cettarhi avaktṛtvaṃ neti kṛtvā bādha iti tvayocyate tatā tadabhāvarūpavaktṛtvamapi netyabādhopi syādityarthaḥ/ 🔽di ga /rā / 'di'iti śodhitamṭa / /vādyāśra ga /rā / /tvādyanā ga /ṭa /rā / /vadaprāmāṇikateti🔽nāstika /ga /ṭa /rā / /nāsatvābhāvāpā rā / /tatvarū ṭha / /apipadaṃ adhikaṃ ga /ṭa /rā / 🔽āyāddheḥdotvabhaṅgaḥ
analyzed: vaktṛ tvam api na ced tarhi avaktṛ tvam na iti kṛtvā bādhaḥ iti tvayā ucyate tad abhāva rūpa vaktṛ tvam api na iti abādhaḥ api syāt iti arthaḥ  garā garā tu ādya nā iti  adhikam  āya āddheḥ do tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: If you say that if there is also no speaking, then there is contradiction because there is no non-speaking, then the meaning is that even the absence in the form of speaking would not be contradicted.🔽The end of the chapter on the refutation of the doctrine of momentariness.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

original: api ca tvaduktavaktṛtvāvaktṛtvobhayābhāvarūpaṃ sādhyamasatvarūpaṃ sādhanaṃ ca na syāditi tavāpi bādhādi syāt/
analyzed: api ca tvad ukta vaktṛ tva avaktṛ tva ubhaya abhāva rūpam sādhyam asatva rūpam sādhanam ca na syāt iti tava api bādhā ādi syāt
translated: Moreover, for you also, the probandum in the form of the absence of both being a speaker and not being a speaker spoken by you, and the probans in the form of non-existence would not exist, so there would be contradiction for you too.

analyzed: nanu aprāmāṇika tva ādikam prati asataḥ na āśraya tve pi aprāmāṇika tva ādike tad āśrita tvam
translated: Even though non-existence does not serve as the substratum for non-authoritativeness etc., non-authoritativeness etc. are dependent on it.

original: vā asatyeva tajjñānahetubhūtajñānaviṣayatvaviśeṣarūpaṃ nirūpakatvaṃ vā yuktam ātītādau🔽viṣayatva rūpadharmābhāvepi tajjñāne ta dviṣayakatvadarśanāt /
analyzed: vā asati eva tad jñāna hetu bhūta jñāna viṣaya tva viśeṣa rūpam nirūpaka tvam vā yuktam ātīta ādau  viṣaya tva rūpa dharma abhāve pi tad jñāne tad viṣayaka tva darśanāt
translated: Or, it is proper that non-existence should have the nature of being the qualifier, which is the object of the cognition that is the cause of the knowledge of that, even when it does not exist,🔽because even when the property in the form of being the object is absent in the past etc., its being the object is seen in the knowledge of that.

analyzed: śukti rūpya tādātmya ādau pratīta mātreṇa nirūpaka tva darśanāt ca iti ced
translated: And because being the qualifier is seen in the mere cognition of the identity of silver and mother-of-pearl etc.

original: samaṃ prakṛtepi// 🔽asadāśrayasthale bādhāsiddhyorudbhāvanaṃ svavyāhataṃ cetyāha api ca tvaduktamiti/
analyzed: samam prakṛte pi  asat āśraya sthale bādhā siddhyoḥ udbhāvanam sva vyāhatam ca iti āha api ca tvad uktam iti
translated: This is the same in the present case too.🔽And the raising of contradiction and non-establishment in the case of non-existent substrata is self-contradictory. He says: Moreover, what is spoken by you.

analyzed: vandhyā sute vaktṛ tva vat avaktṛ tvam api na asti asatvāt eva iti tvad uktam iti arthaḥ
translated: In the son of a barren woman, not being a speaker is also non-existent, because of non-existence itself. This is what is meant by what is spoken by you.

analyzed: na syāt iti
translated: It would not exist.

analyzed: asatvāt iti tvad ukta hetoḥ eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it would not exist because of the very reason spoken by you, namely non-existence.

analyzed: bādhā ādi iti
translated: By contradiction etc.

analyzed: bādhā siddhī syātām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that contradiction and non-establishment would occur.

analyzed: para mukhena samādhim vācayitvā sāmyena uttaram āha nanu ityādinā
translated: Having had the Samadhi recited through another's mouth, he replies with equality, beginning with But surely...
This knowledge means

original: aprāmāṇikatvādikaṃ prati asat āśraya iti nirūpaktavamasti/
analyzed: aprāmāṇika tva ādikam prati asat āśrayaḥ iti nirūpaktavam asti
translated: that the basis is not suitable for lack of authoritativeness, etc.

analyzed: nirūpaka tvam ca nirūpya jñāna hetu bhūta jñāna viṣaya tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: And the state of being a determiner is the state of being the object of the knowledge that is the cause of the knowledge that is the determiner.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādi vyavahāram prati nirūpaka ghaṭa ādi niṣṭha nirūpaka tva vyāvṛti artham viśeṣa rūpam iti uktam
translated: Particular form is stated in order to exclude the determinability that resides in the pot, etc. with respect to the usage of the pot, etc.

original: keṣāñcidāśrayābhāve asatvameva dṛṣṭamiti kathamāśrayābhāve dharmāṇāṃ satvamityataḥ svabhāva evāya dharmāṇāmiti bhāvena sudhoktamevāha vicitrā 🔽hītyādinā// 🔽tvapratiyogitvarū ga /ṭha /rā / /dabhāve ca viṣayitvasya tatpratiyogikatvasya cada ga /ṭa /rā / /ghaṭādivyavahāraṃ prati nirūpakaghaṭādiniṣṭhanirūpakatvavyāvṛttyarthaṃ
analyzed: keṣāñcid āśraya abhāve asatvam eva dṛṣṭam iti katham āśraya abhāve dharmāṇām satvam iti atas svabhāvaḥ dharmāṇām iti bhāvena sudhā uktam evā āha vicitrā  hi ityādinā  tva pratiyogi tva cada gaṭha rā ghaṭa ādi vyavahāram prati nirūpaka ghaṭa ādi niṣṭha nirūpaka tva vyāvṛtti artham
translated: Since non-existence is seen in some cases when the basis is absent, how can the properties exist when the basis is absent? With the thought that this is indeed the nature of the properties, he states what was said in the Sudha, beginning with Indeed, various...🔽The absence of the pot, etc. is the absence of the pot, etc. that are the counter-correlates of the cognition of the pot, etc.🔽And in the absence of the pot, etc. that are the counter-correlates of the cognition of the pot, etc., the cognition of the pot, etc. is not possible.

analyzed: viśeṣa rūpam iti api iti adhikam
translated: The particular form is stated in order to exclude the determinability that resides in the pot, etc. with respect to the usage of the pot, etc.🔽And also is additional.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: vicitrāḥ hi dharmāḥ
translated: For the properties of things are various.

analyzed: kecid āśritāḥ
translated: Some are dependent.

analyzed: yathā rūpa ādayaḥ
translated: For example, form and so on.

analyzed: anyonya parañjakāḥ
translated: Some are dependent, being mutually dependent.

analyzed: yathā jñāna ādayaḥ ghaṭa ādīnām
translated: For example, knowledge and so on of pots and so on.

analyzed: kecid anāśritāḥ
translated: Some are independent.

analyzed: yathā asat vā ādayaḥ śaśa śraṅgam asat iti abādhita pratīteḥ
translated: For example, existence and so on. Because the cognition of non-existence, like the horn of a rabbit, is not contradicted.

analyzed: anyathā tasya asatva asiddheḥ
