translated: Otherwise, its non-existence would not be established.

original: kiṃ ca tvanmate bhūtalaghaṭābhāvayorapi saṃbandho na saṃyogādiḥ nāpyūrdhvādharībhāvādiḥ/
analyzed: kim ca tvad mate bhū tala ghaṭa abhāvayoḥ api saṃbandhaḥ na saṃyoga ādiḥ na api ūrdhva adharībhāva ādiḥ
translated: Moreover, in your view, the relation between the ground and the absence of the pot is not conjunction, etc., nor is it the relation of being above and below, etc.

analyzed: kintu nirūpyasya abhāvasya svarūpam eva
translated: But rather, the very nature of the absence of the object of reference.

analyzed: na tu nirūpakasya adhikaraṇasya ubhayoḥ vā svarūpam
translated: Not the nature of the substratum that is the object of reference, or of both.

analyzed: ghaṭa tad jñānayoḥ sambandhasya nirūpya jñāna mātra svarūpa tva darśanāt
translated: Because the relation between the pot and its knowledge is seen to be the very nature of the knowledge that is the object of reference.

original: nanu vandhyāsatu vaktṛtvābhāvarūpasādhyāsaṃbandho na vandhyāsutasatvaṃ vinopapadyata
analyzed: nanu vandhyā satu vaktṛ tva abhāva rūpa sādhya asaṃbandhaḥ na vandhyā suta satvam vinā upapadyata
translated: But the absence of the probandum, in the form of the absence of the ability to speak in the son of a barren woman, does not occur without the existence of the son of a barren woman.

analyzed: iti katham tatra acetana tva hetunā sādhya sambandhaḥ sidhyet iti atas bhāva svarūpam eva
translated: How then can the relation of the probandum be established there by the reason of being insentient? Therefore, the very nature of absence

original: tatra saṃmbandha iti dṛṣṭāntapūrvamāha kiñca tvanmata iti //
analyzed: tatra saṃmbandhaḥ iti dṛṣṭānta pūrvam āha kiñca tvad mate iti
translated: is the relation there. He gives an example, saying Moreover, in your view... and so on.

analyzed: saṃyoga ādiḥ samavāyaḥ ādi padārthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word 'ādi' is conjunction etc.

analyzed: dravya tva ādi rūpa tva abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it does not have the nature of substance etc.

analyzed: na api iti
translated: Nor is it the absence of the cognition of the pot etc.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādi mūrta tva abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it does not have the form of a pot etc.

analyzed: na tu nirūpakasya iti
translated: But not of the determiner.

analyzed: tathātve bhū tala ullekhi api jñānam abhāva ullekhi syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that if it were so, then the cognition of the ground would also be expressive of absence.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ vā iti
translated: Both of them.

original: anekatvāpatteḥ bhūtaladhiyobhāvānullekhitvācceti bhāvaḥ/🔽abhāvasya svarūpamevetyatra hetumāha ghaṭasyeti//
analyzed: aneka tva āpatteḥ bhū tala dhiyaḥ bhāva anullekhi tvāt ca iti bhāvaḥ  abhāvasya svarūpam eva iti atra hetum āha ghaṭasya iti
translated: The meaning is that there would be the fault of plurality and because the cognition of the ground does not express absence.🔽As for the reason that absence is just the form itself, he says 'of the pot' etc.

original: yadvā abhāvasvarūpamevetyatra natvityādinoktasādhyadvaye ca hetumāha ghaṭasyeti//
analyzed: yat vā abhāva svarūpam eva iti atra na tu ityādinā ukta sādhya dvaye ca hetum āha ghaṭasya iti
translated: Or, as for the reason that absence is just the form itself, he says 'of the pot' etc. in the two conclusions stated by 'not' etc.

analyzed: na ayam iti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: vaktṛ tva abhāva sambandhaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is a relation of the absence of the speaker.🔽Because the relation of the pot is seen to be just the form of the absence of the cognized, the author of the Nyāyakandalī.

original: ghaṭasya svajñānasvābhāvābhyāṃ saṃbandhasya nirūpyajñānābhāvasvarūpamātratvadarśanāt ga /ṭa /rā / / divanmūrta ṭha /ḍa / 🔽āyādveḥdotvabhaṅgaḥ
analyzed: ghaṭasya sva jñāna sva abhāvābhyām saṃbandhasya nirūpya jñāna abhāva svarūpa mātra tva darśanāt  āya ā t veḥ do tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The refutation of the view that the absence of the cognition of the pot is the relation.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The criticism of fallacies of inference.

analyzed: evam vandhyā suta vaktṛ tva abhāvayoḥ api abhāva svarūpam eva saṃbandhaḥ iti na ayam adhikaraṇa satva apekṣaḥ
translated: Thus, the relation between the absence of the speaker of the son of a barren woman and the absence of the speaker is just the form of absence, so this does not depend on the existence of the locus.

original: manmate 'pi bhūtalaghaṭābhāvayoriva vandhyāsutavaktṛtvābhāvayorapi saṃyogādyanyo 'bhāvamātrāśritaḥ saṃbandho nādhikaraṇasatvāpekṣaḥ/🔽atītatajjñānayo rasattajjñānayoḥ śuktirūpyatādātmyatadabhāvayoratīte vartamānaṃ
analyzed: mad mate bhū tala ghaṭa abhāvayoḥ iva vandhyā suta vaktṛ tva abhāvayoḥ api saṃyoga ādi anyaḥ bhāva mātra āśritaḥ saṃbandhaḥ na adhikaraṇa satva apekṣaḥ  atīta tad jñānayoḥ rasa tad jñānayoḥ śukti rūpya tādātmya tad abhāvayoḥ atīte vartamānam
translated: Even according to our view, like the absence of pot on the ground, the absence of the son of a barren woman speaking also has a relation based on mere absence other than conjunction etc., not dependent on the existence of a substratum.🔽By the cognition of the past and the present, by the cognition of the past and the present, by the non-existence of the identity of silver with mother-of-pearl, by the non-existence of the past and the present,

analyzed: na asti iti abādhita pratītyā atīta vartamāna abhāvayoḥ śaśa śraṅgam asa iti abādhita pratītyā
translated: by the uncontradicted cognition that the horn of a hare does not exist, by the uncontradicted cognition of the non-existence of the horn of a hare,

analyzed: śaśa śraṅga satva abhāvayoḥ sambandhe nirūpya jñāna abhāva ādi svarūpa mātra āśrita tva darśanāt
translated: since there is no knowledge of the relation between the non-existence of the horn of a hare and the mere form of knowledge etc. based on it,

analyzed: tadvat acetana tvā
translated: similarly, non-sentience

original: nanvevamapi bhavanmate satvāpekṣaḥ syādityata āha manmatepīti//
analyzed: nanu evam api bhavat mate sattva apekṣaḥ syāt iti atas āha mad mate pi iti
translated: Even so, according to your view, it would be dependent on existence. To this he says even according to our view.

analyzed: abhāva mātra āśritaḥ iti atra hetum āha atīta iti
translated: The reason for saying that it is based on mere absence is stated by the word past etc.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhī dvivacana antānām ṣaṇṇām sambandhaḥ iti anena anvayaḥ
translated: The relation is with the six ending with the sixth case and the dual number.

original: evaṃ vandhyāsuto na vaktā acetanatvādityatra bādhadoṣaṃ nirasyāsiddhyādi nirāha tadvaditi//
analyzed: evam vandhyā sutaḥ na vaktā acetana tvāt iti atra bādha doṣam nirasya asiddhi ādi nirāha tadvat iti
translated: Similarly, in the case of the son of a barren woman not being a speaker because of being insentient, having refuted the fault of contradiction, he refutes the fallacy of being unestablished etc. by saying similarly.

analyzed: aprāmāṇika tva ādeḥ iva
translated: Like the non-authoritativeness etc.

original: tasyā yathā asadāśritatvādikamucyate tathetyarthaḥ/ 🔽ratītardhvaṃsayorasa ga /ṭa /rā / /śaśaśraṅgamasadityabādhitapratīteḥ śaśaśraṅgasatvābhāvayoḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ yathā asat āśrita tva ādikam ucyate tathā iti arthaḥ  gaṭarā śaśa śraṅgam asat iti abādhita pratīteḥ śaśa śraṅga sattva abhāvayoḥ
translated: The meaning is: just as its dependence on the non-existent, etc. is stated.🔽The non-existence of the horn of a rabbit and the non-existence of the rabbit's horn are🔽not dependent on the non-existent, because the cognition the horn of a rabbit does not exist is unobstructed. The non-existence of the past and the non-existence of the present are

analyzed: atīta kaga ṭarā na tvam ta pratīteḥ atīta vartamāna tva abhāvayoḥ
translated: not dependent on the non-existent, because the cognition the past does not exist and the present does not exist is unobstructed.

analyzed: śukti rūpya tādātmya abhāvayoḥ abhāva mātra āśrita ṭa tu adya bhā
translated: The non-existence of the identity of silver in mother-of-pearl and the non-existence of the mere absence of silver are not dependent on the non-existent, because the cognition there is no silver is unobstructed.
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: derasatvāderasadāśritatvasya vā tannirūpyasvabhāvatvarūpasvarūpasambandhasya vā abhāvamātrāśritasya sambandhāntarasya vāsiddhyādiśabdārthatvānnāsiddhyādi//
analyzed: deḥ asatva ādeḥ asat āśrita tvasya vā tad nirūpya svabhāva tva rūpa svarūpa sambandhasya vā abhāva mātra āśritasya sambandha antarasya vā asiddhi ādi śabda artha tvāt na asiddhi ādi
translated: The meaning of the words asiddhi (unproven), etc. is not the non-existence of the non-existence of silver, etc., nor the dependence on the non-existent, nor the absence of the relation of the nature of being the nature of that which is to be defined, nor the dependence on the mere absence of another relation, therefore asiddhi (unproven), etc. are not the meaning of the words asiddhi (unproven), etc.

original: na tṛtīyaḥ/ pratītyaviṣaya iti pratītiviṣayatvavam sakalavyavahārābhājanamiti vyavahāraviṣayatvavacca na vaktetyādipratītiviṣayatvavyavahārabhājanatvayorapi
analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ pratītya viṣayaḥ iti sakala vyavahāra abhājanam iti vyavahāra viṣaya tva vat ca na vaktā ityādi pratīti viṣaya tva vyavahāra bhājana tvayoḥ api
translated: The third is not so. The statement it is not the object of cognition means it is not the object of cognition, and the statement it is not the subject of all transactions means it is not the object of transactions. The object of cognition it does not speak and the subject of transactions it does not speak are also

analyzed: vistṛtam ca etat nyāyāmṛte
translated: This has been elaborated in the Nyāyāmrta.

original: kiñca sakalavyavahārābhājanatve tava maunaṃ syāt/🔽na cāprāmāṇikerthe vāvadūkatvādapi mūkatvameva varamiti vācyam/
analyzed: kiñca sakala vyavahāra abhājana tve tava maunam syāt  na ca aprāmāṇika irthe vāvadūka tvāt api mūka tvam eva varam iti vācyam
translated: Moreover, for you, there would be silence in the absence of all worldly usage.🔽And it cannot be said that in the case of an object not established by valid means of knowledge, it is better to be silent rather than talkative.

analyzed: vandhyā sutasya aprāṇika tve api tad aprāmāṇika tvasya iva tad avaktṛ tvasya api prāmāṇika tvāt
translated: Because even though the son of a barren woman is not a living being, the fact that he is not a speaker is established by valid means of knowledge, just like the fact that he is not a living being.

analyzed: abhāva mātrā iti
translated: Only the absence of.

analyzed: cetana tva abhāva mātra iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: only the absence of sentience.

analyzed: siddhi ādi padārtha tvāt iti padacchedaḥ
translated: The word is is to be supplied after the meaning of the words such as existence.

analyzed: ādi padena bādha grahaḥ
translated: The word etc. includes contradiction.

original: pratītyaviṣayatvena vidhiniṣedharūpasakalavyavahārābhājanatvādveti pakṣaṃ nirāha na tṛtīya iti//
analyzed: pratītya viṣaya tvena vidhi niṣedha rūpa sakala vyavahāra abhājana tvāt vā iti pakṣam nirāha na tṛtīyaḥ iti
translated: He rejects the view that it is not the third, because it is not the object of cognition and is not the substratum of all worldly usage in the form of injunctions and prohibitions.

analyzed: nyāyāmṛte iti
translated: Nyāyamṛta means.

original: asatopi sādhyasādhanadharmāśrayatvādikamastītyetat mithyātvaniruktibhaṅge asataḥ pratiyogitvasamarthanavāde ceti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: asataḥ api sādhya sādhana dharma āśraya tva ādikam asti iti etat mithyātva nirukti bhaṅge asataḥ pratiyogitva samarthana vāde ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even an unreal object can be the substratum of the properties of the probandum and the probans, etc. This has been discussed in the section on the definition of falsity and in the section on establishing the status of an unreal object as a counter-correlate.

analyzed: tava maunam iti
translated: Your silence.

original: vandhyāsuto na vaktā acetanatvādityādāvasmābhirukte sati tatra pratyuttaraṃ na śakyaṃ syāditibhāvaḥ//
analyzed: vandhyā sutaḥ na vaktā acetana tvāt ityādau asmābhiḥ ukte sati tatra pratyuttaram na śakyam syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when we say that the son of a barren woman is not a speaker because he is insentient, etc., there can be no reply to that.

original: satyamevamavaktṛtvasyāprāmāṇikatve mūkatvameva varamiti bhāṣaṇaṃ na caitadaprāmāṇimityāha vandhyāsutasyeti//
analyzed: satyam evam avaktṛ tvasya aprāmāṇika tve mūka tvam eva varam iti bhāṣaṇam na ca etat aprāmāṇim iti āha vandhyā sutasya iti
translated: It is true that if the non-speaking nature is not based on valid means of knowledge, then it is better to be silent. But this is not invalid, he says with the son of a barren woman.

original: aprāmāṇikasaṃbandhinaḥ kathaṃ prāmāṇikaktamityato dṛṣṭāntoktiḥ/ 🔽na pakṣadharmatādigrahani ṭa / /vācyam syā ḍa /
analyzed: aprāmāṇika saṃbandhinaḥ katham dṛṣṭānta uktiḥ  na pakṣa dharmatā ādi grahani vācyam syā
translated: How can something related to what is not based on valid means of knowledge be based on valid means of knowledge? Therefore, an example is given.🔽It should not be said that the relation of the reason with the subject, etc. is not grasped.

analyzed: āyāt vedaḥ tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: The section on the refutation of the Vedas ends here.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference ends here.

analyzed: iti uktvā punar mūka tva uktau
translated: Having said in an object that is not based on valid means of knowledge, and then again stating silence,

analyzed: mūka tva vidhau ca vyāghātāt ca
translated: and also because of contradiction in the injunction to be silent,

original: aprāmāṇikamasadāśrayakatvaṃ niṣeddhuṃ prakamya vyāghātodbhāvane 'pratibhayā madhye mūkībhāvādapi ādāveva mūkūbhāvasya varatvena maduktāsadāśrayatvanirāsāsiddheśca//
analyzed: aprāmāṇikam asat āśrayaka tvam niṣeddhum prakamya vyāghāta udbhāvane pratibhayā madhye mūkībhāvāt api ādau eva mūkūbhāvasya vara tvena mad ukta asat āśraya tva nirāsa asiddheḥ ca
translated: having begun to refute the non-based nature which is not based on valid means of knowledge, by pointing out the contradiction, and because of being speechless in the middle due to lack of reply, the superiority of being silent from the beginning is also established, and thus the refutation of the non-based nature stated by me is also established.

analyzed: na caturthaḥ
translated: The fourth is not so.

original: asanna pramāṇāṅgaṃ aprāmāṇikatvāditi pramāṇā ṅgatvāt na vaktā acetanatvāditi pramāṇāṅgatvasyāpi sambhavāt//
analyzed: asat na pramāṇa aṅgam aprāmāṇika tvāt iti pramāṇā a ṅga tvāt na vaktā acetana tvāt iti pramāṇa aṅga tvasya api sambhavāt
translated: Because it is not a means of valid knowledge, it is not a means of valid knowledge, because it is not based on valid means of knowledge. Because speaking is also possible as a means of valid knowledge, because it is not a means of valid knowledge, it is not a speaker, because it is insentient.

analyzed: sva kriyā virodham ca āha aprāmāṇika ṛthe iti
translated: He states the contradiction with his own action with in an object that is not based on valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: punar mūka tva uktau vyāghātāt iti anvayaḥ
translated: The continuation is because of contradiction in again stating silence.

analyzed: vyāhatim āha vidhi niṣedha iti
translated: He states the contradiction in another way with the words 'vidhinisedhayoḥ' etc.

analyzed: asat āśraya tvam iti
translated: 'Asadāśrayatva' means

original: asataḥ sādhanāśrayatvamiti vā sādhyasādhanayorasadāśrayatvaṃ vā aprāmāṇikamiti niṣeddhumupakramya
analyzed: asataḥ sādhana āśraya tvam iti vā sādhya sādhanayoḥ asat āśraya tvam vā aprāmāṇikam iti niṣeddhum upakramya
translated: that the means of knowledge cannot have a non-existent object, or that the means of knowledge and the object of knowledge cannot have a non-existent basis, which is not established by any means of valid knowledge. Having begun to deny this,

analyzed: vartamānasya tava pratītya viṣa śaye iti pratīti viṣaya tva vat ityādinā asmābhiḥ vyāghāta udbhāvane
translated: when we have pointed out the contradiction by saying 'like the object of cognition' etc.,

original: kṛte sati pratyuttarāparisphūrtirūpāpratibhayā kathāmadhye mūkībhāvādapi kathopakrama🔽eva mūkībhāvasya varatvenetyarthaḥ //
analyzed: kṛte sati pratyuttara aparisphūrti rūpa apratibhayā kathā madhye mūkībhāvāt api kathā upakrama  eva mūkībhāvasya vara tvena iti arthaḥ
translated: when the opponent is unable to give a reply due to lack of presence of mind, it is better to remain silent even at the beginning of the debate.🔽This is the meaning.

original: asatoprāmāṇikatvena pramāṇānaṅgatvādvāsadāśrayatvaṃ doṣa iti pakṣaṃ nirāha
analyzed: asataḥ uprāmāṇika tvena pramāṇa anaṅga tvāt vā asat āśraya tvam doṣaḥ iti pakṣam nirāha
translated: He rejects the view that the fallacy of having a non-existent basis is due to the non-existence of the object of knowledge being not established by any means of valid knowledge or being not a part of the means of knowledge,

analyzed: na caturthe iti
translated: with the words 'not the fourth'.

original: asadāśratvasyādoṣatve 'tiprasaṅgāditi pakṣaṃ nirāha na pañcama iti // 🔽ddhumupaka ka /ga /ṭa / /ṇānaṅgaga /ṭa /rā /
analyzed: asat āśra tvasya adoṣa tve tiprasaṅgāt iti pakṣam nirāha na pañcamaḥ iti  d d dhum upaka ka gaṭa ṇa an aṅga gaṭa rā
translated: He rejects the view that the fallacy of having a non-existent basis is due to the over-extension if it is not a fallacy, with the words 'not the fifth'.🔽to deny...
Nyāyadyuti along with Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: na pañcamaḥ
translated: Not the fifth.

original: bādhādihīnasya vandhyāsuto na vaktetyādeḥ saddhetutvena śaśaśraṅgamasti śṛṅgatvāt vandhyāsuto vaktā
analyzed: bādhā ādi hīnasya vandhyāsutaḥ na vaktā ityādeḥ sat hetu tvena śaśa śraṅgam asti śṛṅga tvāt vandhyāsutaḥ vaktā
translated: Because the absence of contradiction etc. is a valid reason, as in The son of a barren woman does not speak, and the horn of a rabbit exists, because it is a horn, and the son of a barren woman is a speaker,

original: satatvādityāderasaddhetośca bādhāsiddhyādinaiva duṣṭatvena cātiprasaṅgabhāvāt/🔽sutatvābhāvepi vandhyāsuto na vaktetyādau pakṣīkaraṇaṃ ca vandhyāsutaśabdena tathā pratītimātreṇa yuktam/
analyzed: satatvāt ityādeḥ asat hetoḥ ca bādhā siddhi ādinā eva duṣṭatvena ca atiprasaṅga bhāvāt  suta tva abhāve pi vandhyā sutaḥ na vaktā ityādau pakṣīkaraṇam ca vandhyā suta śabdena tathā pratīti mātreṇa yuktam
translated: because he exists, etc. are invalid reasons only due to contradiction, non-establishment, etc., there is no over-extension.🔽Even in the absence of being a son, it is proper to make the son of a barren woman the subject in statements like The son of a barren woman does not speak by the mere understanding of that through the words son of a barren woman.

original: nahi vandhyāsutosanniti niṣedhaprayojanaka prasaktyarthaṃ vandhyāsuta ityuktimātreṇa sutatvasya satvaṃ sidhyati/
analyzed: nahi vandhyā sutaḥ ūsan iti niṣedha prayojanaka prasakti artham vandhyā sutaḥ iti ukti mātreṇa suta tvasya satvam sidhyati
translated: For, by merely stating the son of a barren woman for the purpose of negating the son of a barren woman does not exist, the existence of being a son is not established.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of over-extension.

analyzed: na ṣaṣṭhaḥ sat āśraya tve pi prameya tva anitya tva ādau
translated: The sixth is not so. Even if it always has a basis, in the case of being an object of knowledge and impermanence,

analyzed: atiprasaṅgaḥ hi nṛśṛṅga astitva ādiḥ api sidhyet iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: it should be said that over-extension would lead to the establishment of the existence of a man's horns, etc.

original: sa tu na yuktaḥ/🔽doṣāntareṇaiva tatsiddhipratibandhāditi bhāvena 🔽doṣo vyāhatirevāsti nṛśṛṅgāstitva sādhane
analyzed: sa tu na yuktaḥ  doṣa antareṇa eva tad siddhi pratibandhāt iti bhāvena  doṣaḥ vyāhatiḥ eva asti nṛśṛṅga astitva sādhane
translated: But that is not proper.🔽With the thought that it is obstructed by another fault that its establishment is possible,🔽it is said that there is only the fault of contradiction in establishing the existence of a man's horns,

analyzed: ityādi anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam āha bādhā ādi iti
translated: and so on, as stated in the Anuvyaख्यानसुधा. He says contradiction etc.

original: nanu sutatvābhāvādvandhyāsuta iti pakṣīkaraṇāyogātsopyasaddheturevetyata āha sutatvābhāvepīti//
analyzed: nanu suta tva abhāvāt vandhyā sutaḥ iti pakṣīkaraṇa ayogāt saḥ api asat hetuḥ eva iti atas āha suta tva abhāve pi iti
translated: But because of the absence of sonship, the son of a barren woman is not fit to be the subject, so that too is an unreal reason. To this he says: Even in the absence of sonship.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: Because of over-extension.

analyzed: śukti rūpya tādātmyam na asti
translated: The identity of mother-of-pearl with silver does not exist.

analyzed: iha ghaṭaḥ na asti
translated: Here, the pot does not exist.

original: śaśe viṣāṇaṃ nāstītyādāvapi niṣedhyasya tatra satvāpātāditi bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: śaśe viṣāṇam na asti ityādau api niṣedhyasya tatra sattva āpātāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The horn on the rabbit does not exist, etc. The intended meaning is that even in those cases, the object of negation exists there.

original: sāmānādhikaraṇyarūpavyāptyabhāvādasadāśrayatvaṃ doṣa iti pakṣaṃ pratyāha na ṣaṣṭha iti//
analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyāpti abhāvāt asat āśraya tvam doṣaḥ iti pakṣam pratyāha na ṣaṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: In response to the view that the fault of having an unreal basis is due to the absence of pervasion in the form of co-reference, he says: The sixth is not so.

original: sādhyasādhanayorvyāptyabhāve āśrayasyāsatvaṃ na prayojakaṃ vyatirekatonvayataśca vyabhicārāt/
analyzed: sādhya sādhanayoḥ vyāpti abhāve āśrayasya asatvam na prayojakam vyatirekataḥ nvayataḥ ca vyabhicārāt
translated: When there is no pervasion between the probandum and the probans, the non-existence of the basis is not the reason, because of the fallacy of non-concomitance in the negative and positive examples.

analyzed: suta śabdena ityādiḥ etāvān pranthaḥ na asti
translated: This much text beginning with By the word son is missing in G and R.🔽Refutation of the section on the non-existence of the effect

analyzed: ā y a ddheḥ do tva bhaṅgaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: Criticism of fallacies of inference

analyzed: vyāpti adṛṣṭyā asat āśraya tve ipi aprāmāṇika tva asatvayoḥ vyāpti dṛṣṭyā ca avaktṛ tva acetana tvayoḥ api vyabhicāra adarśanena avinābhāva rūpa vyāpteḥ saṃbhavāt
translated: Even in the case of having an unreal basis due to not seeing the pervasion, and in the case of speechlessness and insentience due to seeing the pervasion of non-authoritativeness and non-existence, the pervasion in the form of invariable concomitance is possible because of not seeing the fallacy.

analyzed: tayoḥ ghaṭa ādau sāmānādhikaraṇya darśanāt ca
translated: And because of seeing the co-reference of those two in the pot, etc.

original: kiñca asadāśrayasya sādhakatvaṃ netyapi kenacilliṅgena sādhanīyam/
analyzed: kiñca asat āśrayasya sādhaka tvam na iti api kenacid liṅgena sādhanīyam
translated: Moreover, the fact that what has a non-existent substratum cannot be a probans should be established by some probans.

analyzed: tatra ca āsanna āśrayaḥ evam pakṣīkartavyaḥ
translated: And there, what has a non-existent substratum should be the probandum, like this, because of being so.

original: asadāśrayo heturna sādhyasādhakaṃ evaṃ tvādityasadāśrayo heturvā ubhayathāpi saheturasadāśraya eva/
analyzed: asat āśrayaḥ hetuḥ na sādhya sādhakam evam tvāt iti asat āśrayaḥ hetuḥ vā ubhayathā api sa hetuḥ asat āśrayaḥ eva
translated: A probans having a non-existent substratum cannot prove what is to be proved. A probans having a non-existent substratum is like this. In both ways, the probans has a non-existent substratum.

analyzed: asati saddharma anaṅgīkārāt
translated: Because of not accepting existent properties in the non-existent.

analyzed: kintu
translated: But it is only the perception of invariable concomitance, etc.

original: tadabhāve 'sadāśrayayorapi vyāptiravadhārayituṃ śakyata evetiti vyāptyabhāvosiddha ityāha asadāśrayatvepītyādinā//
analyzed: tad abhāve sat āśrayayoḥ api vyāptiḥ avadhārayitum śakyate evā iti iti vyāpti abhāvaḥ usiddhaḥ iti āha asat āśraya tve pi ityādinā
translated: In the absence of that, even in what has a non-existent substratum, invariable concomitance can be ascertained. Thus, the absence of invariable concomitance is not established. Thus he says even if it has a non-existent substratum, etc.

analyzed: nanu katham asat āśraya tve sāmānādhikaraṇya ghaṭita vyāptiḥ iti atas uktam avinābhāva iti
translated: But how can there be invariable concomitance based on co-reference if it has a non-existent substratum? To this he says in the absence of non-existence.

analyzed: tādṛśa vyāpteḥ prāk eva nirāsāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that such invariable concomitance has already been refuted.

analyzed: tādṛśa vyāptim aṅgīkṛtya api āha tayoḥ iti
translated: Even accepting such invariable concomitance, he says between those two.

analyzed: avaktṛ tva acetana tvayoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is between non-speakership and insentience.

analyzed: yat tu sudhāyām atra ukta rītyā asat āśraya tvasya doṣa tvam ṣoḍhā vikalpya atiprasaṅga kalpakam ekam
translated: But in the Sudha, having considered in six ways the faultiness of having a non-existent substratum in the way stated here, one is imagined to be an over-extension.

original: nirasyanteetena kalpitāḥ pakṣāḥ samastā api nirastāiti bhaktipādīyasudhāvākyamatra
analyzed: nirasyante etena kalpitāḥ pakṣāḥ samastāḥ api nirastāḥ iti bhaktipādīya sudhā vākyam atra
translated: The sentence of the Bhaktipradīya-sudhā here explains that all the imagined positions are refuted by this, and that even the combined ones are refuted.
It should be understood that this is explained by stating the refutation of the counter-position.

original: asadāśrayasya sādhakatve netyapi vyāptiṃ vinā kathaṃ nivāryataiti pramāṇalakṣaṇataṭṭīkayoruktaṃ vivṛṇvānaḥ asadāśrayasādhyasādhanayorvyāptyabhāve
analyzed: asat āśrayasya sādhaka tve na iti api vyāptim vinā katham nivāryate eti pramāṇalakṣaṇa taṭṭīkayoḥ uktam vivṛṇvānaḥ asat āśraya sādhya sādhanayoḥ vyāpti abhāve
translated: If the basis is non-existent, how can it be a prover? How can this be warded off without the pervasion? This is stated in the Pramāṇa-lakṣaṇa-tātparya-ṭīkā. Explaining this, he states the contradiction in the absence of pervasion between the probandum and the probans having a non-existent basis.

analyzed: bādhakam ca āha kiñca iti
translated: He says Moreover and so on.

original: nanu hetupakṣakaprayoge prāguktahetoḥ kathamasadāśrayatvaṃ yenobhayathāpi heturasadāśraya eveti syādityata āha asatīti//
analyzed: nanu hetu pakṣaka prayoge prāgukta hetoḥ katham asat āśraya tvam yena ubhayathā api hetuḥ asat āśrayaḥ eva iti syāt iti atas āha asati iti
translated: But in the argument of the reason-based position, how can the previously stated reason be having a non-existent basis, by which it would be that the reason is having a non-existent basis in both ways? To this he says If the basis is non-existent and so on.

analyzed: pūrvatra atra ca vaṃ rūpa tvāt iti asti ṭa
translated: Because it is of the same form as before and here.
The third chapter of the Tarka-tāṇḍava, along with the Nyāya-dīpikā.

original: tacca liṅgaṃ vyāptyabhāve 'sādhakatvasādhakaṃ na syāditi kathamasadāśrayadharmayorvyāptyabhāvaḥ//
analyzed: tat ca liṅgam vyāpti abhāve sādhaka tva sādhakam na syāt iti katham asat āśraya dharmayoḥ vyāpti abhāvaḥ
translated: And that probans, in the absence of pervasion, would not be a prover. So how can there be an absence of pervasion between the properties having a non-existent basis?

original: taduktaṃ bhagavatpādaiḥ/🔽asadāśrayasya sādhakatve netyapi vyāptiṃ vinā kathaṃ
analyzed: tat uktam bhagavat pādaiḥ  asat āśrayasya sādhaka tve na iti api vyāptim vinā katham
translated: This is stated by the revered teacher.

analyzed: nivāryate iti
translated: If the basis is non-existent, how can it be a prover? This too cannot be warded off without the pervasion.

original: tasmāddoṣāntarāsaṅkīrṇodāharaṇābhāvā nniṣedhaṃ prati pakṣatvasya ca pratītimātreṇopapatteḥ nāśrayāsiddhirdeṣa iti//
analyzed: tasmāt doṣa antara asaṅkīrṇa udāharaṇa abhāvāḥ niṣedham prati pakṣa tvasya ca pratīti mātreṇa upapatteḥ na āśraya asiddhiḥ deṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, in the absence of an example unmixed with other faults, the fact that the subject is established by mere cognition is sufficient, so the non-establishment of the substratum is not a fault.

analyzed: tat uktam bhagavat pādaiḥ
translated: This has been stated by the revered teacher.

analyzed: asatyā api vyāptiḥ asti eva iti
translated: Even in the absence of the pervasion, it exists.

analyzed: pakṣe asatyā api avinābhāva rūpā vyāptiḥ asti eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: even in the absence of the probandum in the subject, the pervasion in the form of invariable concomitance exists.
Refutation of the non-establishment of the substratum as a fault.

original: tathā cāsanniṣṭhatvena prayuktācetanatvādi rūpadharmopyasati nāstyeveti tatpakṣakopyasadāśraya eveti bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: tathā ca asat niṣṭhatvena prayukta acetana tva ādi rūpa dharmaḥ upi asati na asti eva iti tad pakṣakaḥ api asat āśrayaḥ eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, even a property like non-sentience, which is used as belonging to the non-existent, does not exist in the non-existent, so the argument based on that also has a non-existent substratum. This is the meaning.

analyzed: dharmayoḥ iti
translated: Of the two properties.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana rūpayoḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: of the two properties in the form of the probandum and the probans.

analyzed: tat uktam iti
translated: This has been stated.

analyzed: pramāṇa lakṣaṇe
translated: In the Nyāyasūtra on the definition of valid cognition.

original: tasmādityuktahetuṃ dvedhā vyanakti doṣāntareti//🔽niṣedhaṃ pratyavaktṛtvādirūpavaktṛtvādiniṣedhaṃ pratītyarthaḥ/
analyzed: tasmāt iti ukta hetum dvedhā vyanakti doṣa antara iti  niṣedham prati avaktṛ tva ādi rūpa vaktṛ tva ādi niṣedham prati iti arthaḥ
translated: The reason stated as therefore is explained in two ways as due to the absence of other faults.🔽The meaning is: with regard to the negation of the speaker's nature in the form of non-speaking.

analyzed: avinābhāva rūpa vyāpteḥ saṃbhavāt iti ukta arthe pramāṇa lakṣaṇa vākyam saṃvādayati tat uktam iti
translated: In the statement of the definition of valid cognition, the author agrees with the meaning stated as the pervasion in the form of invariable concomitance is possible by saying this has been stated.

analyzed: āśraya asiddheḥ deṣa tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Refutation of the non-establishment of the substratum as a fault.

original: vādasatvapratikūladharmaṃ pratipakṣatvāsaṃbhavepyaprāmāṇikatvādikaṃ pratīva asattānukūlānni ka /ga /ṭa / / dihaturū ṭa /ṭha /ḍha /
analyzed: vāda satva pratikūla dharmam pratipakṣatva asaṃbhave pi aprāmāṇika tva ādikam prati iva
translated: Even in the absence of the possibility of the counter-nature of the property adverse to the existence of the thesis, non-authoritativeness, etc., are favorable to non-existence, like the non-existence of the property to be proved.

analyzed: a praddha viśeṣasya daḥ tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The property of having an unestablished qualifier is a part.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The chapter on the faults of inference.

analyzed: atha aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvasya doṣa tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fault of having an unestablished qualifier.

original: evaṃ sādhyāprasiddhirapi na doṣaḥ tathā hi tasyā doṣatvaṃ kimatiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: evam sādhya aprasiddhiḥ api na doṣaḥ tathā hi tasyāḥ doṣa tvam kim atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Thus, the non-establishment of the probandum is also not a fault. For, what fault does it have? Because of over-extension.

analyzed: sādhyaka ūteḥ aprasiddhyā sandeha abhāvena tad ghaṭita pakṣa dharma tā vighaṭanāt vā vyāpti vighaṭanāt vā
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the probandum, there is no doubt, and because of the destruction of the property of the subject consisting of that, or because of the destruction of the pervasion, the sentence of the proposition is not known.

analyzed: atha aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvasya doṣa tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fault of having an unestablished qualifier.

analyzed: anyat sat asatoḥ viśvam iti ca vyāhateḥ amā
translated: And because of the contradiction of the statement the universe is other than existent and non-existent,

analyzed: asiddha sādhane doṣaḥ kaḥ vyāptiḥ yadi vidyate
translated: if there is pervasion, what fault is there in proving the unestablished?

analyzed: iti bhaktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sutha ukta diśā vikalpayati kim atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: In this way, he considers it according to the explanation in the Bhāṣya of the Anuvṛttyādhyāya. What fault does it have? Because of over-extension.

analyzed: vimatam sat asat vilakṣaṇam bādhya tvāt
translated: The subject is different from existent and non-existent, because it is to be refuted.

analyzed: bhūḥ śaśa śṛṅgavatī bhūtvāt ityādeḥ api
translated: Because of the over-extension of the statement the earth has the horn of a rabbit and because of being.

analyzed: pramāṇa tva āpatti rūpa atiprasaṅgāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the undesirable contingency of becoming a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: tad ghaṭita iti
translated: That which is composed of that.

analyzed: sandigdha sādhya dharmaka dharmī rūpa pakṣa niṣṭha tva rūpa tvāt pakṣa dhma tā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because being a subject is the nature of being based on a subject which has a property whose property-possessor is doubtful.

analyzed: vyāpti iti
translated: Vyaapti, etc.

analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhau tad nirūpita vyāpti graha asaṃbhavena vyāpti vighaṭanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: due to the destruction of pervasion by the impossibility of grasping the pervasion determined by that when the probandum is not known.

analyzed: a viditā iti
translated: Not known, etc.

original: bhūḥ śaśaviṣāṇollikhiteti pratijñāvākye śaśaviṣāṇapadārtho na jñātaḥ aprasiddhatvāt/
analyzed: bhūḥ śaśa viṣāṇa ullikhitā iti pratijñā vākye śaśa viṣāṇa padārthaḥ na jñātaḥ aprasiddha tvāt
translated: In the proposition The earth is scratched by a rabbit's horn, the meaning of the word rabbit's horn is not known, because it is not well-known.

original: tathā ca tasya tatra śaktigrahāsaṃbhavena tatpadārthasmṛterayogāt pratijñāvākyasya tadanvayābodhakatvaprasaṅgādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: tathā ca tasya tatra śakti graha asaṃbhavena tad padārtha smṛteḥ ayogāt pratijñā vākyasya tad anvaya ābodhaka tva prasaṅgāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus, due to the impossibility of grasping its power there, and due to the impossibility of the recollection of its meaning, there is the undesirable consequence that the propositional sentence does not convey the understanding of its connection.

original: sudhānuktaṃ koṭhyantaraṃ tārkikarītimanusṛtya tārkikarītimanusṛtya svayaṃ pakṣāntaraṃ vikalpayati kāraṇasyeti/
analyzed: sudhā anuktam koṭhī antaram tārkika rītim anusṛtya tārkika rītim anusṛtya svayam pakṣa antaram vikalpayati kāraṇasya iti
translated: Having stated the objection by Sudha, he himself, following the method of the logicians, considers another alternative, beginning with of the cause, etc.

analyzed: vyāpti vighaṭanāt vā iti na asti tadānīm iti adhikam ṭa ṭha ḍa
translated: Or due to the destruction of pervasion is not found in the T.R. At that time is extra in the T.R.
The Nyaya-Dandaka with the Nyaya-Dipika, Third Chapter

analyzed: padārthaka tvena abodhaka tva prasaṅgāt vā
translated: Or because it would lead to the undesirable consequence of being non-indicative due to being a mere word meaning.

analyzed: kāraṇasya viśeṣaṇa jñānasya abhāve kāryasya viśiṣṭa jñānasya ayogāt
translated: Because in the absence of the knowledge of the qualified cause, the knowledge of the qualified effect is not possible.

original: nādyaḥ / asādhutvena saṃmatasya vimataṃ sadasadvilakṣaṇaṃ bādhyatvādityādeḥ kḷptena
analyzed: na ādyaḥ asādhu tvena saṃmatasya vimatam sat asat vilakṣaṇam bādhya tvāt ityādeḥ kḷptena
translated: The first is not so. Of the accepted as incorrect, the disputed is different from existent and non-existent because it is to be refuted, etc., by the established

original: vyāghātādinā doṣāntareṇaiva iyaṃ bhūḥ śaśaśṛṅgavatī etadbhūtvādityāderyogyaśṛṅgasādhakatve
analyzed: vyāghāta ādinā doṣa antareṇa eva iyam bhūḥ śaśa śṛṅgavatī etad bhū tvāt ityādeḥ yogya śṛṅga sādhaka tve
translated: fault of contradiction, etc. This earth is endowed with the horn of a hare because it is this earth, etc., in establishing the fit horn,

analyzed: yogya anupalabdhi bādhā ādinā
translated: by the fault of the non-apprehension of the fit, etc.

analyzed: doṣa antareṇa eva ayogya sādhaka tve tīndriye śvara ādibhiḥ
translated: By another fault, in establishing the unfit, in the imperceptible by the horns, etc.,

analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñānasya iti
translated: of the knowledge of the qualified.

analyzed: anumiti rūpasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is of the form of inference.

analyzed: sudhā ukta diśā nirāha asādhu tvena ityādinā
translated: He refutes according to the explanation in the Sudha, beginning with by the incorrectness, etc.

analyzed: vyāghāta ādinā iti
translated: By contradiction, etc.

analyzed: sannā iti ukte a sattvam uktam syāt
translated: When existence is stated, non-existence would be stated.

analyzed: sattva pratikṣepa rūpa tvāt asattvasya punar asanna iti ukte svavacanī āghātaḥ
translated: Because non-existence is of the nature of the denial of existence, again when non-existence is stated, there is self-contradiction.

original: evamasannetyuktyādvau nañau prakṛtamarthaṃ sātiśayaṃ gamayata iti satvaṃ labdham/
analyzed: evam asanna iti uktyā dvau nañau prakṛtam artham sa atiśayam gamayataḥ iti sattvam labdham
translated: Thus, by the statement non-existent, the two negative particles convey the primary meaning with excess, so existence is obtained.

analyzed: punar sannā iti ukte sva vacana vyāghātaḥ eva
translated: Again, when existence is stated, there is self-contradiction.

analyzed: ādi padena pramāṇa bādha vyāpti abhāva ādi grahaḥ
translated: The word 'ādi' (in the original) includes the absence of the pervasion of the contradiction of the means of valid knowledge, etc.

original: nanu vyāghātādereva doṣatvamupetya tatra sādhyāprasiddhirdeṣa ityevopeyatāmityata uktam kḷpteneti//
analyzed: nanu vyāghāta ādeḥ eva doṣa tvam upetya tatra sādhya aprasiddhiḥ deṣaḥ iti eva upeyatām iti atas uktam kḷptena iti
translated: But let it be accepted that contradiction etc. itself is a fallacy, and let it be accepted that the non-establishment of the probandum is a fault in that (case). To this it is said: 'by what is well-known'.

analyzed: mātā vandhyā ityādau doṣa tvena kḷptena iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: by what is well-known as a fallacy in 'the mother of a barren woman', etc.

original: śṛṅgavatītyatra śṛṅgaśabdena mahatvasamānādhikaraṇodbhūtarūpavān śirassaṃyukto 'vayavaviśeṣobhipre yato 'tha kaścidatīndriyaḥ/ ādya āha
analyzed: śṛṅgavatī iti atra śṛṅga śabdena mahatva samāna adhikaraṇa udbhūta rūpavān śiraḥ saṃyuktaḥ vayava viśeṣaḥ abhipre kaścid atīndriyaḥ ādyaḥ āha
translated: In 'śṛṅgavati' (having horns), it is intended that the word 'śṛṅga' (horn) refers to a particular part of the body endowed with manifest form co-extensive with greatness, or to something supersensible. The first (interpretation) is stated

analyzed: yogyā iti vyāpti abhāva ādiḥ ādi padārthaḥ
translated: by saying 'yogya' (suitable). The absence of pervasion etc. is included by the word 'ādi' (etc.).

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ āha ayogya iti  śṛṅga iti nāma mātram
translated: The second (interpretation) is stated🔽by saying 'ayogya' (unsuitable).🔽'Śṛṅga' (horn) is merely a name.

analyzed: na hi atīndriyam nāma śṛṅgam asti
translated: For there is no supersensible thing called a horn.

analyzed: atas eva ādi pada prayogaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the word 'ādi' (etc.) is used.

analyzed: aprasiddhasya sādhyasya sādhaka tvam yat ā iṣyate
translated: If it is accepted that the probandum, which is not well-known, is proved🔽by those horns etc., then

original: yaiḥ śṛṅgādibhiḥ si ga /ṭa /rā / /pretaḥ atha ṭha /
analyzed: yaiḥ śṛṅga ādibhiḥ si gaṭarā pretaḥ atha ṭha
translated: the hornless one would be a cow.

analyzed: a prad dha viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ 🔽anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of fallacies in inference.

original: siddhasādhanādinā ca doṣāntareṇaiva duṣṭatvāt doṣāntararahitatvena saṃmatasya tu jīvaccharīrajātaṃ sātmakaṃ prāṇādimatvādityādeḥ sādhutvātadiprasaṅgābhāvāt//
analyzed: siddhasādhana ādinā ca doṣa antareṇa eva duṣṭa tvāt doṣa antara rahita tvena saṃmatasya tu jīvat śarīra jātam sātmakam prāṇa ādima tvāt ityādeḥ
translated: And because of another fault, such as the establishment of what is already established, it is faulty. But the collection of living bodies, accepted as free from another fault, is with a soul, because it has life, etc., is correct. Therefore, there is no such undesirable consequence.

analyzed: pratyuta aprasiddhasya ā siddhau eva atiprasaṅgaḥ  parvata agni saṃbandhasya kārya tva ādi anumāne īśvara sārvajñya ādeḥ ca aprasiddhasya eva siddheḥ
translated: On the contrary, there is an undesirable consequence if what is not well-known is established.🔽In the inference of the relation between the mountain and fire being an effect, etc., and the omniscience of God, which is not well-known, is established.

original: vahnerapi mahānasādyasambaddhasya vastugatyā apūrvasyaiva vahnitvena bhaumavahnitvena ca prakāreṇa siddheśca//
analyzed: vahneḥ api mahānasa ādi asambaddhasya vastu gatyā apūrvasya eva vahni tvena bhauma vahni tvena ca prakāreṇa siddheḥ ca
translated: And because fire, which is not related to the kitchen, etc., is in reality a new thing, is established as fire and as earthly fire.

original: nanu pakṣadharmatābalalabhyādanyasyāprasiddhasya siddhirna sādhyasya pakṣasaṃbandhādikaṃ tu pakṣadharmatābalalabhyam sārvajñyamapi tathā/
analyzed: nanu pakṣa dharmatā bala labhyāt anyasya aprasiddhasya siddhiḥ na sādhyasya pakṣa saṃbandha ādikam tu pakṣa dharmatā bala labhyam sārvajñyam api tathā
translated: If it is argued that the establishment of what is not well-known, other than what is obtained by the power of being a property of the subject, is not established, but the relation of the probandum with the subject, etc., is obtained by the power of being a property of the subject, and omniscience is also like that,

analyzed: dvyaṇuka ādi bhū golaka paryantasya anādi ananta kālīnasya kāryasya pakṣa tvāt iti ced na
translated: because the effect from beginningless and endless time, from the two atoms up to the earth-globe, is the subject. It is not so.

analyzed: kāryatva anumeṣu tad alabhyasya api kartṛ aikatva ādeḥ siddheḥ
translated: Because in the inference of being an effect, even what is not obtained by that, such as the oneness of the agent, etc., is established.

analyzed: iti anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam hṛdi kṛtvā āha pratyuta iti
translated: Having in mind what has been said in the Anuvyaख्यानसुधा, he says 'rather' etc.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgaḥ iti
translated: 'Too wide' means

analyzed: parvata agni saṃbandhasya īśvara sārvajñya ādeḥ ca asiddhi āpātāt iti arthaḥ
translated: that it would lead to the absurdity of the connection with the mountain and fire, and the omniscience of God being unestablished.

analyzed: iṣṭa āpattiḥ iti atas āha parvata iti
translated: If it be said that this is admitted, he says 'the mountain' etc.

original: sambandhasyāprasiddhasya siddhāvapi na vahneḥ sādhyabhūtasyāprasiddhsaya siddhiriti vadantaṃ pratyāha vahnerapīti//
analyzed: sambandhasya aprasiddhasya siddhau api na vahneḥ sādhya bhūtasya aprasiddh saya siddhiḥ iti vadantam pratyāha vahneḥ api iti
translated: Even if the connection, which is not well known, were established, the fire, which is not well known and is to be established, would not be established. In reply to one who says this, he says 'of the fire' etc.

original: aprasiddhasādhyakatvamātraṃ na doṣo yenoktātiprasaṅgaḥ syāditi śaṅkate nanviti//
analyzed: aprasiddha sādhyaka tva mātram na doṣaḥ yena ukta atiprasaṅgaḥ syāt iti śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: The mere fact of having an unknown probandum is not a fault, by which there would be the above mentioned too wide application. He raises this doubt in 'But' etc.

original: kṣityādikaṃ sakartṛkaṃ kāryatvādityatra sārvajñyaṃ kathaṃ pakṣadharmatābalalabhyamityato vyanakti vdyaṇukādīti//
analyzed: kṣiti ādikam sa kartṛkam kāryatvāt iti atra sārvajñyam katham pakṣa dharmatā bala labhyam iti atas vyanakti
translated: In the case of 'the earth etc. have a maker because they are effects', how is omniscience to be obtained by the force of the property of the subject? In order to explain this, he says 'from dyads' etc.

original: tādṛśapakṣadharmatvaṃ kāryahetoḥ kartuḥ sārvajñyaṃ vinā na yuktamitīti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: tādṛśa pakṣa dharma tvam kārya hetoḥ kartuḥ sārvajñyam vinā na yuktam iti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that such a property of the subject is not proper without the omniscience of the maker in the case of the effect reason.

analyzed: tad alabhyasya
translated: The meaning is that which is not obtained by that, which is not obtained by the force of the property of the subject.

original: pyasiddhāvati ga /ṭa /rā / ddhatvā devāga /rā / /nākāreṇa siddheśca ga /ṭa / na prakāreṇa rā /
analyzed: na asiddhau ati na ākāreṇa siddheḥ ca na prakāreṇa
translated: If it is not established, it is very much so. It is established by the power of pervasion, by the means of the deity, and by the form of the letter a. And by the type of ga, ta, and ra.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

original: atha vyāptibalalabhyasya sādhyatāvacchedakāvacchinnasyāprasiddhasyā siddhirna kartraikyaṃ tu na vyāptibalalabhyaṃ lāghatarkānugrahalalabhyatvāditi
analyzed: atha vyāpti bala labhyasya sādhya tā avacchedaka avacchinnasya aprasiddhasya siddhiḥ na kartṛ aikyam tu na vyāpti bala labhyam lāgha tarka anugraha labhya tvāt iti
translated: Now, the establishment of the unestablished which is delimited by the sādhya-ness obtained by the power of pervasion is not done. But the oneness of the agent is not obtained by the power of pervasion, because it is obtained by the grace of the reasoning of simplicity.

analyzed: atrā api prāṇa ādima tvasya sātmaka tva prayojya tayā vyāghāta tarka anugrahāt eva aprasiddhasya siddhi upapatteḥ
translated: Even here, the establishment of the unestablished is possible by the grace of the reasoning of contradiction itself, by the fact that the state of having life, etc. is caused by having a self.

analyzed: tvayā api ayam vahni tvena anubhavaḥ
translated: You also have this experience as being fire.
The cognition having the form of fire in the absence of fire

analyzed: na ityādi abhāva sādhyake kevala vyatirekiṇi sādhya tā avacchedaka avacchinna sādhyasya aprasiddhasya siddhi svīkārāt ca
translated: Because you accept the establishment of the unestablished sādhya which is delimited by the sādhya-ness in the mere negative inference where absence is the sādhya, such as This is not a tree because it is not a śimśapā.

analyzed: na ca tatra abhāva rūpam
translated: And in that case, the form of absence

analyzed: ādi padena jñāna nitya tva ādi grahaḥ
translated: The word etc. includes the eternality of knowledge, etc.

analyzed: ekatva ādau atiprasaṅga abhāvam āśaṅkya nirāha atha iti
translated: Fearing the absence of too much application in oneness, etc., he denies it with Now, etc.

analyzed: lāghava iti
translated: Simplicity means.

analyzed: aneka kartṛ kalpanā apekṣayā eka kartṛ kalpana mātreṇa kāryatva hetoḥ upapatti rūpa lāghava tarka iti arthaḥ  vyāghāta iti
translated: The meaning is that the reason of being an effect is established by the mere assumption of a single creator, in comparison to the assumption of multiple creators, through the reasoning of simplicity in the form of being more acceptable.

analyzed: prāṇa ādimatvam upetya sātmaka tva anaṅgīkāre prayojanya upagamena prayojaka anaṅgīkārāt kāryāt deśena kāraṇe pravṛtti rūpa sva kriyā virodha rūpa vyāghāta tarka iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is the reasoning of contradiction in the form of the contradiction of one's own action in the form of the engagement of the cause in the effect, due to not accepting the engaging factor by way of accepting the purposefulness in not accepting the inherence of self after accepting the possession of life, etc.

original: tathāca tasya doṣatvamupetya sāmānyaprasiddhyarthaṃ nakleśo 'nubhoktavya ityarthaḥ/
analyzed: tathā ca tasya doṣa tvam upetya sāmānya prasiddhi artham na kleśaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus, accepting that to be a fault, the meaning is that one should not experience the suffering for the sake of establishing the general.

analyzed: atha ityādinā vadataḥ śaṅkā asya vyāhatā iti āha tvayā api iti
translated: Beginning with atha, he says that the doubt of the one who speaks is contradicted, saying by you also.

analyzed: ityādi abhāva sādhyakaḥ iti
translated: This and other non-existence conclusions.

analyzed: aprāmāṇya abhāva ādi sādhyaka iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the conclusions are the absence of invalidity, etc.

analyzed: veṣamyam āśaṅkya pratibandya uttaram āha na ca tatra ityādinā
translated: Suspecting the similarity, he gives the answer in the form of a counter-question beginning with na ca tatra.

analyzed: sya siddhi ṭa rā  a prad dha viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The establishment of that is the cause.🔽The section on the fault of not having a well-known particular.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the criticism of inference.

original: yatsādhyaṃ tadabhāvarūpasya bhāvasyaiva vyāptigrahaḥ tatra cābhāvarūpasādhyātmakapratiyogijñānaṃ nāpekṣitamiti vyāptigrahasaṃbhavāt
analyzed: yat sādhyam tad abhāva rūpasya bhāvasya eva vyāpti grahaḥ tatra ca abhāva rūpa sādhya ātmaka pratiyogi jñānam na apekṣitam iti vyāpti graha saṃbhavāt
translated: Where what is to be established is the existence of the form of non-existence, the apprehension of pervasion is possible there, and the knowledge of the counter-correlate in the form of non-existence which is to be established is not required.

analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhiḥ adoṣaḥ iti vācyam
translated: Therefore, the non-establishment of the probandum cannot be a fault.

analyzed: bhūḥ śaśa śṛṅgatavatī ityādau api śaśa śṛṅga rāhitya abhāvaḥ sādhyaḥ
translated: Even in the case of the earth has rabbit horns, the absence of the absence of rabbit horns is to be established.

original: sātmakamityatrāpi nirātmakatvābhāva eva sādhya iti suvacatvācca//
analyzed: sātmakam iti atra api nirātmaka tva abhāvaḥ eva sādhyaḥ iti suvaca tvāt ca
translated: And in the case of it has a self, the absence of non-self alone is to be established, so it is well-said.

original: kiñca tattanmataprāptakoṭiprasiddhimūlāyāṃ jagatparamāṇūpādānakaṃ vā /🔽pradhānopādanakaṃ veti vipratipattau satyāṃ tadanusāreṇa vimataṃ paramāṇūpādānakaṃ
analyzed: kiñca tad tad mata prāpta koṭi prasiddhi mūlāyām jagat paramāṇu upādānakam vā  pradhāna upādanakam vā iti vipratipattau satyām tad anusāreṇa vimatam paramāṇu upādānakam
translated: Moreover, in the case of a dispute regarding whether the world is produced from atoms or from primordial matter, based on the establishment of the two positions accepted by different schools,🔽following that, in the inference used by the Naiyāyikas, the subject is produced from atoms

analyzed: tad anya upādānaka tve bādhaka upapanna tve sati sopādānaka tvāt iti sāmānya vyāptim āśritya
translated: because it is produced from something else which is subject to obstruction, and it is produced from something, relying on the general pervasion,

analyzed: tārkika prayukte numāne katham sādhya prasiddhiḥ  na ca atra api vipratipatti an anusāriṇī
translated: how can there be establishment of the probandum?🔽And here also, the proof that the atom etc. are produced from something else, which is not obtained by the opponent, is not accepted.

analyzed: sādhanam paramāṇu ādeḥ yat asiddhasya ca iṣyate
translated: The proof that the atom etc. are produced from something else, which is not established, is accepted.

analyzed: iti anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktim hṛdi kṛtvā āha kiñca iti
translated: Having thus reflected on the statement of the commentary on the Anuvyañjana Sūtra, he says 'Moreover' etc.

original: nanu tatra pareṇa sādhyāprasiddhāvudbhāvitāyāṃ naiyāyikena vdyaṇukasyāpratyakṣatve🔽'pi tryaṇukaṃ sopādānakaṃ kāryadravyatvāditi vdyaṇukaṃ prasādhya vdyaṇukaṃ sopādānakaṃ
analyzed: nanu tatra pareṇa sādhya aprasiddhau udbhāvitāyām naiyāyikena vdyaṇukasya apratyakṣa tve  tryaṇukam sa upādānakam kārya dravya tvāt iti vdyaṇukam prasādhya vdyaṇukam sa upādānakam
translated: Now, when the opponent has brought out the non-establishedness of the probandum there, the Naiyāyika, even though the dyad is not perceptible,

analyzed: bhāva kārya tvāt ghaṭa vat iti anumānena paramāṇu prasiddhim saṃpādya sādhya aprasiddhiḥ
translated: having established the dyad as having a material cause by the inference that the triad is a substance having a material cause because it is an effect-substance, and having accomplished the establishment of the atom by the inference that the dyad has a material cause

analyzed: parihāraṇīyā iti atas āha na ca atra api iti
translated: because it is an effect of existence like a pot, the non-establishedness of the probandum should be removed. Therefore he says 'And here also' etc.

analyzed: kevalam kāryātava ādi prayoge
translated: In the argument of the mere effect-possessor,🔽the apprehension of the vyatireka🔽is not present even for you. This much text beginning with 'this' is not found in G.T.R.

original: vyatirekagrahaḥka / /tvayāpyayaṃ ityādiretāvāngranthaḥ nāsti ga /ṭa /rā / /athetyādina vadataḥ śaṅkāsya ityārabhya etāvānpranthaḥ nāstiṭa /ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: vyatireka grahaḥ ka tvayā api ayam ityādiḥ etāvān granthaḥ na asti vadataḥ śaṅkā asya iti ārabhya etāvān pranthaḥ
translated: Then, beginning with 'says' etc., this much text starting with 'this is his doubt' is not found in T.T.D.

analyzed: ṭhau iva ḍa
translated: Like T.T.D.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: tvānyatarāpādikā tryaṇukopādānatvena vdyaṇukaṃ prasādhya tadupādanatvena paramāṇuḥ sādhyata iti kliṣṭakalpanaivāśrayaṇīyetyatra heturasti//
analyzed: tvānyatara āpādikā tryaṇuka upādāna tvena vdyaṇukam prasādhya tad upādana tvena paramāṇuḥ sādhyate iti kliṣṭa kalpanā eva āśrayaṇīyā iti atra hetuḥ asti
translated: The atom is proved to be the material cause of the dyad, and the dyad is proved to be the material cause of the triads, which are composed of two atoms and one dyad. Thus, it is necessary to resort to a troublesome assumption. This is the reason here.

analyzed: kiñca bhāṭṭaiḥ yatra guṇa guṇi ādau bheda abhedau
translated: Moreover, where the Bhattas prove difference and non-difference by the presumption of incompatibility in the form of the non-applicability of the same qualification to the quality and the qualified,

original: sādhyete tatrārthāpatteranumānatvādinā tārkiteṇānumānenaiva taddhīrvācyeti kathamanumānenāprasiddhasyāsiddhiḥ // 🔽prayogottarakālaṃ sādhane prakṛtānupayuktānvitoktirūpārthāntarāpādikā prayogātpūrvaṃ
analyzed: sādhyete tatra arthāpatteḥ anumāna tva ādinā tārkiteṇa anumānena eva tad dhīḥ vācyā iti katham anumānena aprasiddhasya asiddhiḥ  prayoga uttara kālam sādhane prakṛta anupayukta anvita ukti rūpa artha antara āpādikā prayogāt pūrvam
translated: since that presumption is an inference, the cognition of that should be stated by the inference inferred by the logician. How then can there be non-establishment of the unestablished by inference?🔽The construction is: because of the statement of a different matter in the form of a connection with what is irrelevant in the proof after the statement of the inference,

analyzed: vipratipati anantaram eva sādhane krama viparyāsa rūpa aprāpta kālatva āpādikā iti kalpanā iti anvayaḥ
translated: and because of the statement of the non-arrival of the proper time in the form of the reversal of sequence in the proof itself after the disagreement, it is an assumption.

analyzed: ubhayatra hetuḥ vipratipati ananusāriṇī iti
translated: The reason in both cases is that it does not follow from the disagreement.

original: paramāṇūpādānakaṃ pradhānopādānakaṃ veti vipratipattau paramāṇūpādānakatvarūpeṇa sādhyaprasiddhisaṃpādanasyaivānuguṇatvāditi bhāvaḥ
analyzed: paramāṇu upādānakam pradhāna upādānakam vā iti vipratipattau paramāṇu upādānaka tva rūpeṇa sādhya prasiddhi saṃpādanasya eva anuguṇa tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the case of disagreement as to whether it is the material cause of the atom or the material cause of the principal, the establishment of the proof in the form of being the material cause of the atom is only in accordance with the accomplishment.

analyzed: kliṣṭa kalpanayā eva atra sādhyam iti ati durvacaḥ
translated: It is extremely difficult to say that what is to be established here is only by a defiled imagination.

original: ityanuvyākhyānokteriti bhāvaḥ//🔽pariśeṣo mithaḥ siddhiścakrakaḥ svāśrayādayaḥ/🔽asiddhasādhakatvena pañcāvayatāṃ vinā//
analyzed: iti anuvyākhyāna ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ                 asiddha sādhaka tvena pañcāvayatām vinā
translated: This is the idea expressed in the Anuvṛttyākhyāna.

analyzed: aṅgīkāryā
translated: The five members are to be accepted without the fault of proving what is not established,🔽by the remaining, mutual establishment, the wheel, self-dependence, etc.

original: ityanuvyākhyānasudhoktaṃ hṛdi kṛtvā pariśeṣa ityupalakṣaṇaṃ matvāha kiñceti//
analyzed: iti anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam hṛdi kṛtvā pariśeṣaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam matvā āha kiñca iti
translated: Having in mind the statement in the Anuvṛttyākhyāna-sudhā, considering that the remaining is a metaphor, he says and also etc.

analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇya prayogaḥ sti
translated: There is a usage with the same subject.

original: atyantābhinne ca ghaṭaḥ karīra iti prayogosti /
analyzed: atyanta abhinne ca ghaṭaḥ karīraḥ iti
translated: And there is the usage the pot is the date in something completely different.

analyzed: tvā iti
translated: In you is T. T. D.

analyzed: a praddha viśeṣasya daḥ tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The member of having an unestablished particular

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference

analyzed: api ca yathā ātma āśraya anyonya āśraya cakraka anavasthā vyāghāta ādi āpādakeṣu tarkeṣu aprasiddhasya eva ātma āśraya ādeḥ āpādanam tathā apasiddhasya sādhanam api kim
translated: Moreover, just as in arguments that entail self-dependence, mutual dependence, circularity, and regress, the establishment of something unestablished such as self-dependence is accepted, similarly, why should not the proof of something unestablished also be

analyzed: na syāt  na hi ātma āśraya ādikam kvacid pramitam
translated: possible?🔽For self-dependence and so on are not established anywhere.

original: na cāprasiddhamāpādyaṃ na tu sādhyamityatra heturasti//
analyzed: na ca aprasiddham āpādyam na tu sādhyam iti atra hetuḥ asti
translated: And there is no reason here that what is not well-known is to be established, but not what is to be proved.

original: kiñca manmate tarkopyanumānaṃ tvanmatetvananumānarūpopi tarko vyāptisāpekṣa iti kathamanumānaṃ prasiddhisāpekṣaṃ tarkastu tannirapekṣa iti
analyzed: kiñca mad mate tarkaḥ api anumānam tvad mate tu ananumāna rūpaḥ api tarkaḥ vyāpti sāpekṣaḥ iti katham anumānam prasiddhi sāpekṣam tarkaḥ tu tad nirapekṣaḥ iti
translated: Moreover, in our view, even reasoning is inference, but in your view, even reasoning which is not of the form of inference depends on pervasion. So how can inference depend on well-known facts, while reasoning is independent of that?

original: api cāprasiddhasyā pi siddhau śaśaśṛṅgādikamapi sidhyediti tvāyā'pādyamānāsyāpyatiprasaṅgasyāprasiddhatvātkathamāpādānamiti dik//
analyzed: api ca aprasiddhasya a siddhau śaśa śṛṅga ādikam api sidhyet iti tvāya āpādyamānā asya api atiprasaṅgasya aprasiddha tvāt katham āpādānam iti diś
translated: Moreover, if even what is not well-known were established, then even the horn of a rabbit and so on would be established. So how can there be an inference of this, which is not well-known, by you? This is the direction.

original: guṇaguṇyādau tu nīlo ghaṭaḥ śuklaḥ paṭa ityasti sāmānādhikaraṇyaprayogaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa guṇi ādau tu nīlaḥ ghaṭaḥ śuklaḥ paṭaḥ iti asti sāmānādhikaraṇya prayogaḥ
translated: But in the case of quality and substance, there is the usage of co-reference, such as the blue pot and the white cloth.

original: sa ca tayorbhedābhedau vinā nopapadyata iti tadanyathānupapattirūpārthāpatyetyarthaḥ/
analyzed: sa ca tayoḥ bheda abhedau vinā na upapadyate iti tad anyathā anupapatti rūpa arthāpatyā iti arthaḥ
translated: And that is not possible without the difference and non-difference of those two. So the meaning is that it is the presumption in the form of the impossibility of that in another way.

analyzed: tad dhīḥ bheda abhada dhīḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of difference and non-difference.

analyzed: arthāpatyā eva tad dhī janma aṅgīkāra irthāpatteḥ bhāṭṭānām bheda abheda dhīḥ anumiti rūpā eva
translated: If the birth of that cognition is accepted only as the result of presumption, then for the Bhattas, the cognition of difference and non-difference is only of the form of inference.

analyzed: atha api atra arthāpatti phalatva abhimāna mātram iti naiyāyikena
translated: Even if it is said that here there is mere assumption of the result of presumption, by the Naiyāyika

analyzed: vācyam iti arthaḥ
translated: it should be said. This is the meaning.

analyzed: katham āpādanam iti diś iti
translated: How can there be an inference? This is the direction.

original: nanvaprasiddhamapyāpādayituṃ śakyate na tu sādhayitumiti cenna/
analyzed: nanu aprasiddham api āpādayitum śakyate na tu sādhayitum iti ced na
translated: If it be said that it is possible to deduce even what is not well known, but not to establish it, (we say) no.

analyzed: hetu ābhāvena nirākṛta tvāt
translated: Because it is refuted by the absence of a reason.

analyzed: vyāpti sāpekṣa tvasya apādāne sādhane ca ubhayatra tulya tvāt
translated: Because the requirement of pervasion is the same in both, in deduction and in proof.

analyzed: nanu śabda ābhāsa ādinā śaśa śṛṅga ādi jñāne sati  syasi gaṭarā
translated: If it be said that when there is knowledge of the horn of a hare etc. by means of a verbal semblance etc.,
then it is possible to deduce the existence of the horn of a hare etc.

analyzed: nā api pakṣa dharmatā vighaṭanāt iti dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second alternative also is not possible, that is, that the reason is not established because the property of being the subject is destroyed.

analyzed: pakṣa dharmatā saṃdeha anapekṣā iti ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been said that (the reason is not established) without the doubt of the property of being the subject.

original: na tṛtīyaḥ/ ukteṣu paramāṇūpādanakatvādisādhakeṣvanumāneṣvarthāpattisthale ātmāśrayādyāpādatarkarūpānumāneṣu ca sādhyāprasiddhāvapi vyāpteḥ
analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ ukteṣu paramāṇu upādanaka tva ādi sādhakeṣu anumāneṣu arthāpatti sthale ātmāśraya ādi āpāda tarka rūpa anumāneṣu ca sādhya aprasiddhau api vyāpteḥ
translated: Nor is the third (alternative possible), that is, that the pervasion is not established. Even when the conclusion is not well known in the above-mentioned inferences that establish the atom as a cause etc., and in the inferences in the form of reductio ad absurdum arguments such as the circular reasoning etc. in the case of presumption,

analyzed: kevala vyatireki mātre sādhya aprasiddhau api
translated: even when the conclusion is not well known in the mere negative inference,

analyzed: śaśaśṛṅga ādi siddhiḥ āpādayitum śakyate eva
translated: it is possible to deduce the establishment of the horn of a hare etc.

analyzed: yat api vimatam paramāṇu upādānakam ityādau sādhya aprasiddhiḥ katham iti
translated: And as for the argument that the conclusion is not well known in the case of the atom as a cause etc., how can it be?

analyzed: tat na kāraṇāt ādi vādi vākyena parasya tad jñāna saṃbhavāt
translated: That is not so. Because the other party can have the knowledge of that by the statement of the proponent of the cause etc.

original: tāvanmātreṇa tatprasiddhyā pattau pramāṇenaiva prasiddhyā bhāvyamiti nirbandhā pātāt/
analyzed: tāvat mātreṇa tad prasiddhyā pattau pramāṇena eva prasiddhyā bhāvyam iti nirbandhā pātāt
translated: Because of that alone, it is necessary that it be established by a means of valid knowledge, due to the establishment of that.

original: naiyāyikasyāpi kāraṇādādyupadeśena vā svārthānumānena vā paramāṇvādyavagatisaṃbhavena
analyzed: naiyāyikasya api kāraṇāt ādi upadeśena vā svārtha anumānena vā paramāṇu ādi avagati saṃbhavena
translated: Even for the Naiyāyika, the atom and so on can be understood through the initial teaching of the cause or through his own inference for himself,

analyzed: sādhya prasiddheḥ iti ced tarhi sātmaka tva ādi sthale pi evam vaktum śakya tvāt aprasiddha tvam
translated: and the probandum is established. If it is argued that in the case of having a soul and so on, it can be said in the same way, and the non-establishment

analyzed: na doṣāya iti evam upeyam ityādi ūhyam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: is not a fault, then it should be accepted in this way. This is the idea.

analyzed: ukta tvāt iti
translated: Because it has been stated.

analyzed: pakṣa lakṣaṇa ukti prastāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that at the time of stating the definition of the subject.

original: vyāptivighaṭanādvādoṣatvamiti pakṣaṃ nirāha na tṛtīya iti//
analyzed: vyāpti vighaṭanāt vā adoṣatvam iti pakṣam nirāha na tṛtīyaḥ iti
translated: He rejects the view that it is a fault of the thesis due to the destruction of pervasion, saying Not the third.

analyzed: kim vyāpti svarūpa vighaṭaka tvam abhipretam uta tad graha vighaṭaka tvam ādye
translated: Is it intended that it destroys the nature of pervasion, or that it destroys the understanding of that? In the first case,

original: vyāptiśca vyatirekeṇa tatrataiścāvagamyate/🔽ityanuvyākhyānasudhoktaṃ hṛdi nidhāyāha ukteṣvityādi//🔽tarkasyānumānatāyāḥ sādhitatvāttarkarūpānumāneṣvatyuktam/
analyzed: vyāptiḥ ca vyatirekeṇa tatra taiḥ ca avagamyate  iti anuvyākhyāna sudhā uktam hṛdi nidhāya āha ukteṣu ityādi  tarkasya anumāna tāyāḥ sādhita tvāt tarka rūpa anumāneṣu ati uktam
translated: and pervasion is understood there by means of the negative example.🔽Having placed in the heart what is said in the Anvvyakhyana-sudha, he says among those stated and so on.

analyzed: vyatireka mātre iti
translated: Since the nature of inference of reasoning has been established, it is said with regard to inferences in the form of reasoning.🔽In the negative example alone

analyzed: mātra śabdaḥ kārsnya paraḥ
translated: The word alone means entirety.

analyzed: sarva kevala vyatirekiṣu bhūḥ itarebhyaḥ bhidyate bhūta tvāt
translated: In all cases of the negative-only and the negative-other, earth is distinguished from the others because it is an element.

analyzed: jīvat śarīram sātmakam iti evamādiṣu iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is in cases like the living body has a soul.

analyzed: d d di upapattau ṭa ṭha ḍa ndhaḥ usti ṭa ndha abhāvāt ṭha ḍa
translated: If there is a reason, it is a reason. If there is no reason, it is not a reason.

analyzed: a praddha viśeṣasya daḥ tu aṅgaḥ  anumāna doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The part is a reason for the unseen special quality.🔽The criticism of inference.

analyzed: mama anvaya vyāpteḥ tava vyatireka vyāpteḥ satvāt ca
translated: Because there is pervasion by positive concomitance in my case, and because there is pervasion by negative concomitance in your case.

analyzed: śiṣṭam vyatireki bhaṅge uktam
translated: The rest has been stated in the section on negative-only inference.

original: nanu vyatirekiṇyaprasiddhena sādhyena sādhanasya kathamanvayavyāptiriti ce nna/
analyzed: nanu vyatirekiṇī aprasiddhena sādhyena sādhanasya katham anvaya vyāptiḥ iti ce na
translated: If it is argued that in a negative-only inference, how can there be pervasion by positive concomitance with an unestablished probandum, it is not so.

analyzed: vyatireka vyāptiḥ api katham
translated: How can there be pervasion by negative concomitance either?

analyzed: pratiyogi ajñāne vyatireka anirūpaṇāt
translated: Because negative concomitance cannot be determined without the cognition of the counter-correlate.

original: kiñca manmate sādhyaṃ vinā sādhanasyānupapattireva vyāptiḥ/
analyzed: kiñca mad mate sādhyam vinā sādhanasya anupapattiḥ eva vyāptiḥ
translated: Moreover, in our view, the pervasion is just the impossibility of the probans without the probandum.

analyzed: tatra ca vinā śabda ukta sādhya abhāva jñānāya pratiyogi bhūta sādhya dhīḥ eva apekṣitā
translated: And there, for the cognition of the absence of the probandum expressed by the word without, the cognition of the probandum itself, which is the counter-correlate, is required.

analyzed: na tu pūrvam tad pramitiḥ
translated: But not the prior cognition of that.

original: nanu bhūritarabhinnetyādau trayodaśānyonyābhāvānāṃ viśakalitatayā prasiddhatvenaikabuddhyupārūḍhānāṃ teṣāṃ vyatirekavyāptinirūpaṇaṃ suśakam/
analyzed: nanu bhūritara bhinna ityādau trayodaśa anyonya abhāvānām viśakalita tayā prasiddha tvena eka buddhi upārūḍhānām teṣām vyatireka vyāpti nirūpaṇam suśakam
translated: But in the case of different from many etc., since the thirteen mutual absences are well-known as unmixed, it is easy to determine the vyāpti of vyatireka of them subsumed under one cognition.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādau eva vā sādhya prasiddhiḥ
translated: Or, the establishment of the probandum is in the pot etc. itself.

analyzed: na ca tathātva invayi tvam tasya pakṣa eka deśa tvāt
translated: And it is not so because of being a part of the subject, since it is a part of the subject.

analyzed: na ca evam anumānam vyartham
translated: And thus the inference is not useless.

analyzed: uddeśya siddhi artha tvāt iti ced tarhi tatra hetu satva asatvābhyām anvayi tva asādhāraṇyoḥ āpāttaḥ ityādi abhiprāyeṇa āha śiṣṭam iti
translated: If it is argued that it is for the sake of accomplishing the goal, then the inclusion of the properties of being a part of the reason and being uncommon is implied by the statement the rest etc., with the intention that the presence or absence of the reason there determines the properties of being a part of the reason and being uncommon.

analyzed: nanu mama anvaya vyāpteḥ iti ayuktam
translated: But it is not proper to say that for me there is vyāpti by positive concomitance.

original: sādhyāprasiddhau tatsāmānādhikaraṇyasya hetau kvāpyagraheṇa sāmānādhikaraṇyaghaṭitānvayavyāpterasambhavāditi śaṅkate nanviti//
analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhau tad sāmānādhikaraṇyasya hetau kvāpi agraheṇa sāmānādhikaraṇya ghaṭita anvayavyāpteḥ asambhavāt iti śaṅkate  nanu iti
translated: When the probandum is not established, since the concomitance of that with the reason is not grasped anywhere, the vyāpti by positive concomitance consisting of concomitance is not possible. This is suspected in the words beginning with but.

analyzed: āha
translated: He states the counter-argument in the words in the case of vyatireka.

analyzed: nanu para pakṣe nupapati ukti mātreṇa katham sva pakṣe nupapatti parihāraḥ
translated: But how can the removal of inconsistency in one's own position be done merely by stating the inconsistency in the opponent's position?

original: na hi parāṅgaṃ dagdhamiti svāṅgadāhaḥ śāmyadītyataḥ na kevalaṃ pratibandī upapattiścāsmatpakṣe 'stītyāha kiñciti// 🔽sattubhyāṃ ṭa /ṭha /
analyzed: na hi para aṅgam dagdham iti sva aṅga dāhaḥ na kevalam pratibandī upapattiḥ ca asmad pakṣe sti iti āha kiñcid iti  sattubhyām ṭa ṭha
translated: For it is not the case that when one part is burnt, the burning of one's own part ceases. Therefore, he says a little to show that not only is there a counter-argument, but also a reason in our view.🔽The two words tu and tu are used to indicate contrast.
The Nyaya-Dipika-Yuta-Tarka-Tandava, Third Chapter

analyzed: astu vā sāmānādhikaraṇya niyamaḥ vyāptiḥ
translated: Let there be the restriction of co-reference as the pervasion.

original: tathāpi na tāvadaprasiddhena sādhyena sādhanasyānanvaya eveti yuktam/
analyzed: tathā api na tāvat aprasiddhena sādhyena sādhanasya ananvayaḥ eva iti yuktam
translated: Even so, it is not proper to say that the reason is not invariably concomitant with the probandum merely because the probandum is not well-known.

analyzed: vyatirekiṇaḥ viruddha hetvābhāsa tva āpātāt
translated: For then the negative reason would become a fallacious reason.

analyzed: sādhya prasiddheḥ vyāpti hetu tvena vyāptim prati ahetu tvāt ca
translated: And because the establishment of the probandum is the cause of pervasion, not the cause of the pervasion.

analyzed: na api satyā manvayavyāptau
translated: Nor can it be said that when the positive pervasion is true,

analyzed: tad grahaḥ na śakyaḥ iti vācyam
translated: its apprehension is not possible.

analyzed: pakṣa ādi pravibhāgāt prāk sva śīrara ādau eva pratyakṣeṇa upadeśa ādinā vā avagata sātmaka tvasya
translated: For a person who has understood the existence of the self in his own head etc. by perception or instruction etc. before the division into subject etc.,
the apprehension of the positive pervasion between life etc. and the existence of the self, like between smoke and fire, is possible in his own inference.

analyzed: na ca jīvat śarīra mātrasya pakṣīkaraṇāt anvaya dṛṣṭānta abhāvaḥ
translated: And it is not that there is no positive example because only the living body is the subject.

original: abhedasādhakānumāna ivānumityādinā pakṣasyāpi svaśarīrasya niścitasādhyakatayā dṛṣṭāntatvasyāpi sambhavāt//
analyzed: abheda sādhaka anumāne iva anumiti ādinā pakṣasya api sva śarīrasya niścita sādhyaka tayā dṛṣṭānta tvasya api sambhavāt
translated: Because, like in the inference establishing non-difference, the subject itself, one's own body, is ascertained to have the probandum, so it is possible for it to be the example.

analyzed: nanu atha api nyāya mata siddha sāmānādhikaraṇya niyama rūpa vyāptiḥ aśakyā eva iti atas tatra api upapattim āha astu vā iti
translated: Even so, the pervasion in the form of the restriction of co-presence established by the Nyāya view is indeed impossible. Hence, even there, he states the justification, saying Let it be so, etc.🔽Non-concomitance alone means

analyzed: ananvayaḥ eva iti  asāmānādhikaraṇyam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: non-co-presence alone.

original: tathātve nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtakatvāditivat viruddhahetvābhāsaḥ syādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: tathātve nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtaka tvāt iti vat viruddha hetvābhāsaḥ syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: In that case, it would be a contradictory fallacious reason, like Sound is eternal because it is produced.

original: nanvastu sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ tanniyamarūpavyāptistu sādhyāprasiddhisthale kathamityata āha sādhyeti//
analyzed: nanu astu sāmānādhikaraṇyam tad niyama rūpa vyāptiḥ tu sādhya aprasiddhi sthale katham iti atas āha sādhya iti
translated: Even so, how can there be the pervasion in the form of the restriction of the probandum in the case of the non-established probandum? To this, he says The probandum, etc.

analyzed: tathā ca sādhya aprasiddhi sthale tad nirūpita vyāpti jñapteḥ abhāve api niyata sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyāpteḥ apratibandhāt dyāpti vighaṭanāt sādhya aprasiddhiḥ
translated: And thus, even in the case of the non-established probandum, although there is no manifestation of the pervasion defined by that, because the pervasion in the form of restricted co-presence is unobstructed, the non-established probandum is not a fault.

analyzed: iti na yuktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

analyzed: dvitīyam nirāha na api iti
translated: He refutes the second view, saying Nor is it so, etc.

analyzed: sudhā uktam āha pakṣa ādi iti
translated: He states what is said in the Sudha, saying The subject, etc.

analyzed: maṇi uktam sarvam atra āha abheda iti
translated: In the statement of the other alternative, all that is said in the jewel is stated here with abheda etc.

analyzed: gaṭa teḥ ca
translated: The word mapy is added.

analyzed: a praddhaḥ viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: nā api siddha sādhanam
translated: Nor is it a futile rejoinder.

analyzed: svārtha anumāne tasya adoṣa tvāt
translated: Because in one's own inference, it is not a fault.

analyzed: uddeśyāyāḥ śarīra tva avacchedena sādhya pratīteḥ prāk asiddheḥ ca
translated: And because the body, which is the object to be inferred, is not established before the cognition of the probandum under the restriction of the body.

original: na ca pakṣasya pakṣaikadeśasya vā dṛṣṭāntatve sapakṣatvena vyatirekitvabhaṅgaprasaṅgo vyatirekavādinastaveva tadabhāvavādino mamāpyaniṣṭaḥ//
analyzed: na ca pakṣasya pakṣa eka deśasya vā dṛṣṭānta tve sapakṣa tvena vyatireki tva bhaṅga prasaṅgaḥ vyatireka vādinaḥ tava iva tad abhāva vādinaḥ mama api aniṣṭaḥ
translated: And if the subject or a part of the subject is the example, then the fallacy of the absence of the negative example does not arise, just as it does not for the proponent of the negative example. It is not undesirable for me, who advocates the absence of that.

original: nanu svena gṛhītāpi vyāptiḥ śarīramātre vipratipannaṃ prati kathaṃ darśanīyeti cenna/
analyzed: nanu svena gṛhītā api vyāptiḥ śarīra mātre vipratipannam prati katham darśanīyā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even though the pervasion is grasped by oneself, how can it be shown to one who is in doubt regarding the body alone? It is not so.

analyzed: tam prati vyāpti grahaṇa sthalasya avipratipatyā pratiruddha tvena pradarśayitum aśakya tve
translated: Because the place of grasping the pervasion is contradicted by non-doubt regarding him, and cannot be shown.

analyzed: pi jīvat śarīra jātam sa ātmakam prāṇa ādima tvāt yat kāryavat tat kāraṇavat yathā aṅkuravatī
translated: Even though it cannot be shown, the class of living bodies is with a self, because it has life etc., whatever has an effect has a cause, like that which has a sprout.

analyzed: bhūmiḥ bīja garbhā iti sāmānya vyāpti pradarśanasya vā
translated: Or, the indication of the general pervasion of the earth is pregnant with seeds

original: prāṇādimatvaṃ sātmakatvena vyāptaṃ tadabhāvavyāpakābhāvapratiyogi tattena vyāptaṃ yathā dhūmo vahnineti vyatirekavyāptyā viśeṣyānvayavyāptisādhanasya
