analyzed: prāṇa ādimatvam sātmaka tvena vyāptam tad abhāva vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tat tena vyāptam yathā dhūmaḥ vahninā iti vyatireka vyāptyā viśeṣya anvaya vyāpti sādhanasya
translated: Or, the indication of the particular pervasion by the positive pervasion through the reverse pervasion, that being possessed of life is pervaded by having a self, which is the counter-correlate of the absence that pervades its absence, just as smoke is pervaded by fire.

analyzed: anupapatti rūpa anvaya vyāpteḥ viśiṣya pradarśanasya vā saṃbhavāt
translated: Or, the indication of the particular pervasion by the positive pervasion in the form of impossibility.

original: nanu prāgvyatirekibhaṅge pakṣaikadeśasya dṛṣṭāntatve vyatirekitvabhaṅgo bhavaddhirevāpāditaḥ sa doṣastarhi syādityāśaṅkyā nirāha na ceti//
analyzed: nanu prāk vyatireki bhaṅge pakṣa eka deśasya dṛṣṭānta tve vyatireki tva bhaṅgaḥ bhavat hiḥ eva āpāditaḥ sa doṣaḥ tarhi syāt iti āśaṅkyā nirāha na ca iti
translated: Now, in the previous section on the reverse pervasion, it was indeed argued that if a part of the subject is taken as the example, the reverse pervasion would be destroyed. If that is a fault, then it would be so. Fearing this, he denies it, saying not so.

original: svārthānumādoṣatvā sambhavepi parārthaprayoge doṣa iti śaṅkate nanviti//
analyzed: svārtha anumā doṣa tvā sambhave pi para artha prayoge doṣaḥ iti śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: Although it is not possible to be a fault in one's own inference, there is a fault in the application for the sake of others. He doubts this, saying but.

analyzed: sudhā ukta diśā samādhim āha tam prati ityādinā
translated: He gives the solution in the manner stated in the Sudha commentary, beginning with to him.

analyzed: anupapatti rūpā iti
translated: In the form of impossibility.

analyzed: pakṣasya iti na gaṭarā sapakṣa tvena iti na asti garā viśiṣṭasya iti adhikam gaṭarā
translated: Of the subject. Not in G, T, or R. As a similar instance. Not in G or R. Of the qualified. Extra in G, T, or R.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa anva vyatireka vyāpti prasesā tivya atireka vyāptyā anvaya vyāpti pra
translated: The pervasion by positive and negative concomitance is superior. The pervasion by negative concomitance is superior to the pervasion by positive concomitance.🔽The means of knowledge are not possible.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽yathā ca vyabhicārasthalānuktāvapyupādhinā vyabhaicāraḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca vyabhicāra sthala anuktau api upādhinā vyabhaicāraḥ
translated: The Nyaya-Dipika-Yuta-Tarka-Tandava, Third Chapter🔽And just as, even when the place of fallacy is not stated, there is fallacy due to the limiting adjunct.

original: yathā vā dṛṣṭāntānuktāvapi dhūmo vahnivyāpya iti āptavākyena vyāptiḥ /
analyzed: yathā vā dṛṣṭānta anuktau api dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ iti āpta vākyena vyāptiḥ
translated: Or just as, even when the example is not stated, the pervasion by the statement of a reliable person that smoke is pervaded by fire.

analyzed: tathā anvaya dṛṣṭānta anuktau api anena anumānena anvayavyāptiḥ sidadhyati eva
translated: In the same way, even when the positive example is not stated, the pervasion by positive concomitance is established by this inference.

original: etena sādhyarūpratiyogyajñānāttadabhāva rūpajñānaṃ na yuktamiti sādhyābhāvasya sādhanābhāvena vyāptijñānaṃ na saṃbhavatīti nirastam/
analyzed: etena sādhya rūpa pratiyogi ajñānāt tad abhāva rūpa jñānam na yuktam iti sādhya abhāvasya sādhana abhāvena vyāpti jñānam na saṃbhavati iti nirastam
translated: By this, it is refuted that the knowledge of the absence of the probandum in the form of the counter-correlate of the probandum is not proper, and that the knowledge of the pervasion of the absence of the probans by the absence of the probandum is not possible.

analyzed: ukta rītyā pratyakṣeṇa upadeśa ādinā vā sādhya sādhana rūpa asādhāraṇa dharmau ekatra upalabdhavataḥ
translated: One who has perceived the uncommon properties in the form of the probandum and probans by perception or instruction, etc.,

original: tato 'nyatra sarvatrāpi tadabhāvaṃ ca paśyato vādinaḥ prativādinopi vādivākyāvagatapratiyoginastadabhāvagrahasaṃbhavena
analyzed: tatas nyatra sarvatra api tad abhāvam ca paśyataḥ vādinaḥ prativādinaḥ api vādi vākya avagata pratiyoginaḥ tad abhāva graha saṃbhavena
translated: and who sees the absence of that everywhere else, even for the opponent, the absence of the probandum is possible to be grasped, since the opponent has understood the counter-correlate from the statement of the proponent.

analyzed: vyatireka vyāpti grahasya sulabha tvāt
translated: Because the pervasion by the negative example is easy to grasp.

original: na ca pramāṇenaiva pratiyogī jñātavya iti nayamosti/
analyzed: na ca pramāṇena eva pratiyogī jñātavyaḥ iti
translated: And there is no rule that the counter-correlate must be known by means of a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: śaśa śraṅga ādi abhāva asiddhyā śaśa śraṅga ādeḥ asatva asiddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the non-existence of the horn of a rabbit, etc., there would be the undesirable consequence of the non-establishment of the non-existence of the horn of a rabbit, etc.

analyzed: na hi asataḥ niṣedhaḥ sva viriddha sattva apekṣaḥ
translated: For the negation of a non-existent does not depend on the existence of its contradictory.

analyzed: praṇādimatvasya sātmaka tva prayojya tayā prāṇādimatvam sātmaka tvena vinā anupapannam iti evaṃrūpeṇa anupapatti rūpa anvayavyāpteḥ viśiṣya pradarśana saṃbhavāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion by the positive example in the form of the impossibility, in the form The possession of inhalation, etc. is not possible without the possession of a soul, is possible to be shown specifically.

original: nanu pramāṇena pratiyogino 'navagatau kvacitsatvābhāvātkathaṃ tanniṣedha ityata āha na hyasata iti/ satve sati
analyzed: nanu pramāṇena pratiyoginaḥ na avagatau kvacid sattva abhāvāt katham tad niṣedhaḥ iti atas āha na hi asataḥ iti satve sati
translated: If the counter-correlate is not known by a means of valid knowledge, how can its negation be made, since there is no existence anywhere? To this he says: For the negation of a non-existent. If it exists,

analyzed: niṣedhasya eva ayogāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the negation itself is not possible, this is the idea.

analyzed: rūpa padam na ga ka ṭa rā jñānasya kagarā
translated: The word form is not in G, K, T, or R. The word knowledge is not in K, G, or R.

analyzed: a prad dha viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The section on the non-establishment of a specific property.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

original: kiṃ caivaṃ sati tattadvādināṃ parābhimatasaptama padārthapradhānaparamāṇvādiniṣedho na syāt/
analyzed: kim ca evam sati tad tad vādinām para abhimata saptama padārtha pradhāna paramāṇu ādi niṣedhaḥ na syāt
translated: Moreover, if it were so, the negation of the seventh category of reality accepted by various philosophers, such as the primary atoms, etc., would not be possible.

original: na ca tatrāpi pradhānādikaṃ neti na niṣedhaḥ/
analyzed: na ca tatra api pradhāna ādikam na iti na niṣedhaḥ
translated: And even there, it is not a negation that there is no pradhāna etc.

original: kiṃ tu jagadupādānaṃ paramāṇvā dikaṃ netyevaṃ tathāca khaṇḍaśaḥ pramitarastīti vācyam/
analyzed: kim tu jagat upādānam paramāṇvā ādikam na iti evam tathā ca khaṇḍaśas vācyam
translated: But it cannot be said that the material cause of the world is not atoms etc., and that there is partial cognition.

original: pararītyāprasaktasya svarūpeṇaiva niṣedhasaṃbhave svābhimatasya niṣedhapratiyogipramāṇikatvasya nirvāhāyānānubhāvikakḷṣṭakalpane 'nyonyāśrayāt//
analyzed: para rītyā aprasaktasya sva rūpeṇa eva niṣedha saṃbhave sva abhimatasya niṣedha pratiyogi pramāṇika tvasya nirvāhāya anānubhāvika kḷṣṭa kalpane nyonya āśrayāt
translated: If, in order to establish the authoritativeness of what is to be negated, which is one's own belief, one were to assume an unnecessary burden, there would be mutual dependence, because negation is possible by the nature of what is not connected by one's own position.

analyzed: saptama iti dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣa samavāyāḥ ṣaṭ eva bhāva padārthāḥ
translated: In the seventh, it is said that the six categories of substance, quality, action, universal, particular, and inherence are the only real entities.

original: na saptamostīti saptamapadārthasya sāṅkyābhimatapradhānasya ca niṣedho naiyāyikasya na syāt/
analyzed: na saptamaḥ asti iti saptama padārthasya sāṅkya abhimata pradhānasya ca niṣedhaḥ naiyāyikasya na syāt
translated: The Naiyāyika would not negate a seventh category or the pradhāna accepted by the Sāṃkhya.

analyzed: tathā sāṅkhya ādeḥ paramāṇu ādi niṣedhaḥ na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the Sāṃkhya and others would not negate atoms etc.

analyzed: khaṇḍaśas iti
translated: In parts, it is said.

analyzed: jagati ca pramitiḥ asti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is cognition of a thing in the world other than atoms.

analyzed: parītya aprasaktasya iti
translated: Of what is not connected by one's own position, it is said.

analyzed: tadīya vākya ābhāsa prasaktasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of what is connected by the appearance of its statement.

analyzed: anyonya āśrayāt iti
translated: From mutual dependence, it is said.

analyzed: tvad ukta rītyā eva niṣedhe siddhe niṣedhyasya prāmāṇika tva siddhiḥ
translated: When negation is established in the manner stated by you, then the negatee is established as a real entity.

analyzed: siddhe ca tasmin ukta rītyā niṣedha siddhiḥ iti anyonya āśrayāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And when that is established, then negation is established in the manner stated. Thus, it is said, there is mutual dependence.

analyzed: tvad ukta rītyā niṣedhaḥ na yuktaḥ eva
translated: Negation is not proper in the manner stated by you.

analyzed: jagat upādānam iti paramāṇu tvena upādānam sāṃkhya abhimata pradhāna tvena atha ubhaya anugata upādāna tva rūpa sāmānya dharmeṇa upādana mātram iti
translated: Is the material cause of the world intended to be the atoms, or the prakriti accepted by the Samkhya, or is it mere material cause in the form of a general property common to both?

analyzed: vikalpān krameṇa nirāha  ka ṭa ṇu atiriktam kaga ṭarā tatas ca kaga ṭa t padārthasya
translated: He refutes the alternatives in order.🔽And the object denoted by the word 'that' is🔽different from the object denoted by the word 'this'.

original: upā ṭa /ṭha / upādānabhūta ṭha / /sya ca ṭa / /ṇupadārtha syātiriktapadārthasya
analyzed: upā ṭa ṭha upādāna bhūta ṭha ca ṇu padārtha sya atirikta padārthasya
translated: And the object denoted by the word 'this' is also different from the object denoted by the word 'that'.

original: ca ṭa / /tyāpi ḍa / /na tvama ṭha / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ / paricchedaḥ
analyzed: ca ṭa tyāpi ḍa na tvama ṭha
translated: You do not accept this.🔽The Nyaya-Dipika-Yuta-Tarka-Tandava, Third Chapter

analyzed: kiñca jagat upādana śabdena paramāṇoḥ avoktau siddhasādhanam
translated: Moreover, if the atom is spoken of by the word 'material cause of the world', it is an established conclusion.

analyzed: pradhāna uktau āśraya asiddhiḥ
translated: If prakriti is spoken of, there is no basis.

analyzed: pramāṇika apramāṇika anugatam sāmānyam tu
translated: But there is no general property common to what is cognized by valid means of knowledge and what is not so cognized.

analyzed: etena sātmaka tva rūpa sādhya ghaṭita anvayavyāpti rūpa sādhya apramitā nvayavyāptyā saha vyatireka vyāpteḥ anvayavyāpti agrahāt katham vyatireka vyāptyā anvayavyāpti anumitiḥ
translated: By this, the pervasion in the form of positive concomitance consisting of the probandum in the form of having a soul is not cognized, along with the pervasion in the form of negative concomitance. How is the inference of positive concomitance from negative concomitance, due to the non-apprehension of positive concomitance?

analyzed: kiñca ityādinā
translated: By this, the pervasion in the form of positive concomitance consisting of the probandum in the form of having a self is not known, along with the pervasion in the form of negative concomitance. How is the inference of positive concomitance by negative concomitance?

original: pramāṇiketi//🔽paramāṇurhi tvanmate prāmāṇikaḥ pradhānamapramāṇikaṃ na hi śaśaviśaṣāṇayorviṣāṇatvasāmānyamiva prāmāṇikāprāmāṇikaparamāṇupradhānarūpobhayagatamupādānatva
analyzed: pramāṇikā iti  paramāṇuḥ hi tvad mate prāmāṇikaḥ pradhānam apramāṇikam na hi śaśa viśaṣāṇayoḥ viṣāṇa tva sāmānyam iva prāmāṇika aprāmāṇika paramāṇu pradhāna rūpa ubhaya gatam upādāna tva
translated: And so on.🔽What is meant is that what is established by valid means of knowledge is not a universal.

analyzed: sāmānyam asti
translated: For, in your view, an atom is established by valid means of knowledge, but primordial matter is not established by valid means of knowledge. Just as there is no universal of horn-ness common to a rabbit's horn and a real horn, similarly there is no universal of being a material cause common to both the established atom and the unestablished primordial matter.

analyzed: āśraya abhāve dharma ayogāt
translated: Because a property cannot be related to an absent substratum.

original: na hi pratiyogitvāsatvādivadupādānatvaṃ dharmisattānirapekṣam/🔽yena pratiyogitvādipratibandī syāditi bhāvaḥ//🔽nanu vyatirekavyāptyānvayavyāptyanumānaṃ prāguktamayuktam/
analyzed: na hi pratiyogi tva asatva ādi vat upādānatvam dharmi sattā nirapekṣam  yena pratiyogi tva ādi pratibandī syāt iti bhāvaḥ  nanu vyatireka vyāptyā anvaya vyāpti anumānam prāguktam ayuktam
translated: For being a material cause is not like being an object of negation or non-existence, which do not depend on the existence of the subject.🔽Otherwise, there would be a counter-argument like being an object of negation and so on. This is the meaning.🔽Now, the previously stated inference of positive concomitance by negative concomitance is incorrect.

analyzed: sādhyasya aprasiddhau tad nirūpita anu avyapteḥ api aprasiddhyā tayā saha liṅga bhūta vyatireka vyāpteḥ vyāpti graha asaṃbhavāt iti āśaṅkām anūdya nirāha
translated: Because when the probandum is not known, the positive concomitance determined by it is also not known, and the negative concomitance which is the logical mark along with that cannot be the means of knowing the pervasion.

analyzed: nanu vyatireka vyāpti rūpa liṅgena anvaya vyāpti rūpa sādhyasya anumāna sthale pi liṅga liṅgi bhūtayoḥ vyatireka vyāpti anvaya vyāptyoḥ anvaya vyāptiḥ tayoḥ vyatireka vyāptyā anumitā
translated: But even in the case of inferring the probandum in the form of positive pervasion by means of the probans in the form of negative pervasion, the positive pervasion between the probans and probandum in the form of negative pervasion and positive pervasion is inferred by the negative pervasion between them,

analyzed: satī sa ātmaka tva prāṇa ādima tva niṣṭha anvayavyāpti anumiti anukūlā astu iti atas āha tatra api iti
translated: and being favorable to the inference of positive pervasion based on the existence of life and the possession of breath etc., he says in that case also.

analyzed: tau anva kaṭarā rūpa padam adhikam ṭaḍa  a prad dha viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: Those two have positive pervasion. The word form is extra.🔽The reason is not established as a particular.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The criticism of fallacies of inference.

analyzed: tatra api vyatireka vyāpti āśrayaṇe ca anavasthā iti nirastam
translated: And the objection that there would be an infinite regress if negative pervasion were relied upon there also is refuted.

original: yadyadabhāvavyāpakābhāvapratiyogi tattena vyāptaṃ yathā dhūmognineti sāmānyavyāpteḥ/
analyzed: yat yat abhāva vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tat tena vyāptam yathā dhūmaḥ ugninā iti sāmānya vyāpteḥ
translated: Whatever is the absence of the absence that pervades the absence of another is pervaded by that, just as smoke is pervaded by fire, because of the general pervasion.

analyzed: anupapatti rūpāyāḥ viśiṣya anvayavyāpteḥ ca darśita tvāt
translated: And because the particular positive pervasion in the form of non-apprehension has been shown.

analyzed: evam śabdaḥ aṣṭa dravya atirikta dravya āśritaḥ
translated: In the same way, sound is dependent on a substance other than the eight substances.

analyzed: aṣṭa dravya āśrita tve bādhaka upapanna tve sati guṇa tvāt
translated: Because it is a quality, being dependent on the eight substances, and being subject to contradiction when dependent on the eight substances.

analyzed: gaganam itarebhyaḥ bhidyate śabdāḥ  /
translated: Even in the case of the purely negative inference that the sky is different from the others because it is the substratum of sound, etc., whatever is

original: śrayatve bādhakopapannatve sati guṇaḥ sa tadanyāśritaḥ /
analyzed: śraya tve bādhaka upapanna tve sati guṇaḥ sa tad anya āśritaḥ
translated: The quality is that which, when present, is accompanied by an obstruction, and is dependent on something else.

original: yadya dasādhāraṇadharmavat tatto bhidyata iti sāmānyavyāptirvā/
translated: If it is like a common property, then it is distinguished. This is the pervasion by the positive concomitance.

original: kaṇādopadeśādinā śabde gagane ca sādhyasādhane upalabdavataḥtadanyatra sarvatra
analyzed: kaṇāda upadeśa ādinā śabde gagane ca sādhya sādhane upalabdavataḥ tad anyatra sarvatra
translated: Having perceived the probandum and probans in sound and space through the teachings of Kanāda and others, one sees their absence everywhere else.

original: tadabhāvaṃ ca paśyataityādi pūrvoktarītyā vyatirekavyāptyā viśiṣyānvayavyāptirvā
analyzed: tad abhāvam ca paśyatā etyādi pūrva ukta rītyā vyatireka vyāptyā viśiṣya anvaya vyāptiḥ vā
translated: In this way, the pervasion by the positive concomitance is specified by the pervasion by the negative concomitance, as stated earlier.

analyzed: anupapatti rūpā viśiṣṭa anvaya vyaptiḥ vā upapādyā
translated: Or, the pervasion by the positive concomitance, which is in the form of an inconsistency, is to be established.

original: vyatirekyantareṣvapi sudhoktaṃ hṛdi kṛtvā prāguktarītyānvayavyāptiṃ tredhopapādayati evamityādinā//🔽yattu maṇyāditārkikagranthe vyatirekyanugrahārthaṃ sāmānyaprasiddhisaṃpādakaṃ sāmānyatodṛṣṭānumānaṃ niyamiti tatkathanaṃ tadāśaṅkya nirāha
analyzed: vyatireki antareṣu api sudhā uktam hṛdi kṛtvā prāgukta rītyā anvayavyāptim tredhā upapādayati evam ityādinā  yat tu maṇi ādi tārkika granthe vyatireki anugraha artham sāmānya prasiddhi saṃpādakam sāmānyatodṛṣṭa anumānam niyam iti tad kathanam tat āśaṅkya nirāha
translated: Having kept in mind what is stated in the Suddhi in other negative examples, the pervasion by the positive concomitance, as stated earlier, is established in three ways, beginning with in this way.🔽As for the inference based on general observation, which is stated in the texts of the Mīmāṃsakas and other logicians in order to support the negative example and to establish the general well-known fact, and which is called niyama, that is suspected and refuted.

original: śrayatvādityādi vyatire ka /ṭa /rā / /dāśritatve ga /ṭa / /davṛttidharmā ka /ṭa /rā / / ptyanumiteti śodhitam ṭa /
analyzed: śraya tvāt ityādi śodhitam
translated: Dependence etc. is the negative example. Dependent etc. is the positive example. The property of being an attribute etc. is the inferred conclusion, as corrected by T.
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava🔽The third chapter

original: nacā trāpi śabdaḥ kvacidāśrito guṇatvādityanumānena sādhyaṃ sāmānyataḥ prasiddhamiti vācyam/
analyzed: śabdaḥ kvacid āśritaḥ guṇa tvāt iti anumānena sādhyam sāmānyatas prasiddham iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that in the case of the other also, the probandum is well-known in general by the inference that the word is dependent on something, because of being a quality.

analyzed: ukta rītyā sādhya apramitau api tredhā vyāpti graha saṃbhavena sāmānyatodṛṣṭa anapekṣaṇāt
translated: Because, even when the probandum is not known, the apprehension of the pervasion is possible in three ways, so the general observation is not necessary.

analyzed: kiñca sāmānyatodṛṣṭasya āvaśyaka tve tat eva tarkam vinākṛtam anirdhārita āśraya viśeṣam āśrita tva
translated: Moreover, if the general observation is necessary, then that very [inference] without the reasoning, apprehending the general dependence with the particular substratum undetermined,

analyzed: sāmānyam gṛṅṇat api itara bādhaka tarka anugṛhītam punar anusandhīyamānam aṣṭa atirikta āśrita tva rūpa viśeṣam eva grahīṣyati
translated: even though it apprehends the general, when again combined with the reasoning that excludes the other, will apprehend only the particular in the form of dependence on something other than the eight.

analyzed: ekasya eva sahakāri vaicitryeṇa vicitra kārya janaka tva darśanāt
translated: Because it is seen that the same [reason] produces various effects by the variety of auxiliaries.

analyzed: sāmānyasya eka viśeṣa bādhe viśeṣa antare paryavasāna niyamāt ca iti kim vyatirekiṇā
translated: And because it is a rule that the general ends in another particular when one particular is contradicted, what is the use of the negative concomitance?

original: na cādṛṣṭadravyātiriktadravyāśritatvaprakārikā pratītirvyatirekisādhyā sā ca na sāmānyato dṛṣṭena sidhyati tataḥ prāga nupasthiteriti śaṅkyam/
analyzed: na ca adṛṣṭa dravya atirikta dravya āśrita tva prakārikā pratītiḥ vyatireki sādhyā sā ca na sāmānyatas dṛṣṭena sidhyati tatas prāk a nupasthiteḥ iti śaṅkyam
translated: And it should not be suspected that the cognition in the form of depending on a substance other than the unseen substance is to be established by the negative example, and that is not accomplished by the general perception, because it is not present before that.

analyzed: īśvara anumāne
translated: In the inference of God,

original: na ca tatrāpīti//🔽tadapekṣāyāṃ bādhakaṃ cāha kiñceti//
analyzed: na ca tatra api iti  tad apekṣāyām bādhakam ca āha kiñca iti
translated: And it is not so even there.

analyzed: itarā iti
translated: And in the expectation of that, he states the contradiction with Moreover, etc.

analyzed: itara āśrita tve
translated: Other means🔽in dependence on the other.

analyzed: yat bādhakam tādṛśa tarka anugṛhītam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is supported by such reasoning that is contradictory to that.

analyzed: ekasya eva iti
translated: Of only one means

original: kāryatvādyanumānaṃ lāghavatarkānugṛhītaṃ sat kartraikyamapi gṛhṇāti na cetkartṛmātraṃ gṛhṇāti/
analyzed: kārya tva ādi anumānam lāghava tarka anugṛhītam sat kartṛ aikyam api gṛhṇāti na ced kartṛ mātram gṛhṇāti
translated: that the inference of causality, etc., supported by the reasoning of simplicity, grasps even the oneness of the agent, and if it does not grasp only the agent.

original: saṃskārādisahakṛtaṃ cakṣurādi tattāmapi gṛhṇāti na cedidantāmevetyevaṃ darśanādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: saṃskāra ādi sahakṛtam cakṣuḥ ādi tat tām api gṛhṇāti na ced idam tām eva iti evam darśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And it grasps even that which is produced by the eye, etc., along with the impression, etc., and if it does not grasp this, it grasps only that. The meaning is that it is seen in this way.

original: vyāptibalācca sāmānyasyaiva viśeṣe paryavasānaṃ nyāyyamityāha sāmānyasyeti//
analyzed: vyāpti balāt ca sāmānyasya eva viśeṣe paryavasānam nyāyyam iti āha sāmānyasya iti
translated: And it is proper that the general itself should end in the particular by the power of pervasion. He says of the general etc.

analyzed: uddeśya siddhi artha tvena vyatireki sārthakyam āśaṅkya nirāha na ced ityādinā
translated: Suspecting the purposefulness of the negative example by the purpose of accomplishing the intended object, he denies with If not etc.

original: ca tatrāpi ka / ṭa /rā / /jñānetyadhikam ga /rā / /nanasi ga /ṭa /rā / /guktarūpasya prakārasyā /🔽anuvyavasāye ityādi nāsti ga /rā /
analyzed: ca tatra api jñāna iti adhikam  anuvyavasāye ityādi na asti
translated: In the case of the cognition of silver, the cognition of silver is the object.

analyzed: a prad dha viśe sya do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The part that does not specify the object is complete.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference is complete.

analyzed: kartrā ekatva vat anuvyavasāye rajata tva prakāraka tva vat abhāva jñāne nuyogitva pratiyogitva ādi vat ca prāk anupasthitasya api  prakāra tva upapatteḥ
translated: Even though not present before, it can be a mode, like the oneness of the agent, like the mode of being silver in the cognition of silver, like the relation of qualifier and qualified, etc.

original: nanu tathāpi kathañcitsādhyaprasiddhirāvaśyakīti tvayāpi svīkṛtatvatkathaṃ tadāvaśyakatvanirāsa iti cenna/
analyzed: nanu tathā api kathañcid sādhya prasiddhiḥ āvaśyakī iti tvayā api svīkṛta tvat katham tad āvaśyaka tva nirāsaḥ iti ced na
translated: Even so, some sort of establishment of the probandum is necessary, which you also accept. How then can you deny its necessity? This is not so.

original: mama hi parābhipretāyāḥ pakṣādanyatra sādhyatāvacchedakāvacchinnatvena prakāreṇa prativādinaṃ prati sādhyaprasiddherāvaśyakataiva nirasyā/
analyzed: mama hi para abhipretāyāḥ pakṣāt anyatra sādhya tā avacchedaka avacchinna tvena prakāreṇa prativādinam prati sādhya prasiddheḥ āvaśyaka tā eva nirasyā
translated: For me, the necessity itself of establishing the probandum for the opponent by the mode of being qualified by the differentia of the probandum elsewhere than the subject as intended by the other party is to be denied.

analyzed: na tu pratīti mātrasya
translated: Not of mere cognition.

analyzed: uktam hi ṭīkāyām
translated: For it has been said in the commentary:

analyzed: pratyakṣeṇa upadeśa ādinā vā asādhāraṇa dharmau ekatra upalabdhavataḥ ityādi
translated: By perception, by instruction, etc., of one who has perceived a unique property in one place, etc.

original: ṭīkākārīyā pareṇa vyatirekiṇi sāmānyenānvayavyāptyādike śaṅkite taṃ prati kliṣṭakalpanatvoktistu vyatirekavādinastavānvayavyāptyuktiḥ
analyzed: ṭīkākārīyā pareṇa vyatirekiṇi sāmānyena anvaya vyāpti ādike śaṅkite tam prati kliṣṭa kalpana tva uktiḥ tu vyatireka vādinaḥ tava anvaya vyāpti uktiḥ
translated: The statement by the commentator that it is a complicated assumption when the opponent raises doubts regarding the vyāpti in the vyatireka form in the general form, is to the effect that the proponent of vyatireka should state the vyāpti in the anvaya form.

analyzed: katham cit iti
translated: 'Somehow' means

analyzed: pramā prasādhāraṇyena iti arthaḥ
translated: by the commonness of valid cognition.

analyzed: svīkṛta tvāt iti
translated: 'Because it is accepted' means

analyzed: prativādinaḥ api vādi vākya avagata ityādi pūrva granthena tathā pratīteḥ api bhāvaḥ
translated: that the opponent also understands the statement of the proponent, as stated in the previous text. The idea is that it is also understood in that way.

analyzed: uktam hi iti
translated: 'It has been said' means

analyzed: bhakti pāde yathānubhavam eva etat na aṅgīkāryam kutas tadā iti etad vyākhyā avasare sudhāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: at the time of explaining 'how can that be accepted?' in the Bhakti section, it is said in the Sudha commentary. This is the meaning.

original: pūrvayatredhā vyāptyupapādanaṃ vyatirekiṇi kṛtaṃ tatra bhaktipādīyasudhāvākyavirodhamāśaṅkya tadabhiprāyoktyā nirāha ṭīkākārīyetyādinā//
analyzed: vyāpti upapādanam vyatirekiṇi kṛtam tatra bhaktipādīya sudhā vākya virodham āśaṅkya tad abhiprāya uktyā nirāha ṭīkākārīya ityādinā
translated: The vyāpti has been explained in three ways in the vyatireka form earlier. Suspecting contradiction with the statement in the Sudha commentary of the Bhakti section, he refutes it by stating the intention behind it, saying 'by the commentator' and so on.

analyzed: eva iti na asti gaṭarā
translated: 'Only' is not found in G, T, R, and A.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Section

analyzed: vyatireki tva hāni āpādaka tvāt kliṣṭā iti abhiprāyeṇa eva
translated: With the intention that it is complicated because it would entail the loss of being a vyatireka.

analyzed: na tu sva mate pi kliṣṭa iti abhiprāyeṇa
translated: But not with the intention that it is complicated even in one's own view.

analyzed: siddhānte pi sāmānya vyāpti ādeḥ satvāt eva
translated: Even in the Siddhānta (view), because of the existence of the pervasion by the universal, etc.

analyzed: tasmāt sādhya aprasiddhiḥ vyāpti vighaṭikā iti tṛtīyaḥ na yuktaḥ
translated: Therefore, the third alternative that the non-establishment of the probandum is a factor in the destruction of pervasion is not correct.

original: taduktaṃ bhagavatpādaiḥ asatyapi vyāptirastyeveti//🔽sādhyasya prasiddhatve 'satyapi sādhyaṃ vinānupapattirūpā vā /
analyzed: tat uktam bhagavat pādaiḥ asati api vyāptiḥ asti eva iti  sādhyasya prasiddha tve sati api sādhyam vinā anupapatti rūpā vā
translated: That has been stated by the revered teacher (Bhāsarvajña) that even when it is not true, there is pervasion.🔽Even when the probandum is not well-known, there is the form of non-apprehension without the probandum,

original: niyatasāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ vyāptiriti pakṣe 'pi sāmānyato 'nvayavyāptirvā vyatirekavyāptyanumitā viśiṣṭānvayavyāptirvā uktarītyāstyevetyarthaḥ//
analyzed: niyata sāmānādhikaraṇyam vyāptiḥ iti pakṣe sāmānyatas nvaya vyāptiḥ vā vyatireka vyāpti anumitā viśiṣṭa anvaya vyāptiḥ vā ukta rītyā asti eva iti arthaḥ
translated: or in the case where pervasion is the invariable concomitance of the specific property, there is the pervasion by the universal of positive concomitance or the pervasion by the universal of negative concomitance inferred, or the specific pervasion of positive concomitance as stated, it is only that.

analyzed: na api caturthaḥ
translated: Nor is the fourth (alternative) correct.

original: uktarītyā svena jñātasya sātmakamityādiśabdārthasya vādināpi prativādinaṃ prati samavāyāntyaviśeṣādiśabdārthasyeva vyutpādane 'viditapadārthakatvābhāvāt/
analyzed: ukta rītyā svena jñātasya sātmakam ityādi śabda arthasya vādinā api prativādinam prati samavāya antya viśeṣa ādi śabda arthasya iva vyutpādane vidita padārthaka tva abhāvāt
translated: Because, as stated, even when the meaning of the words having a soul etc. known by oneself is not well-known, there is no absence of knowledge of the meaning of the words due to the similarity of the meaning of the words ending with inherence etc. to be taught to the opponent by the proponent.

analyzed: tad artha jñāne tatra vivāda ayogāt ca
translated: And because when the meaning of those words is known, there is no possibility of dispute regarding that.

analyzed: tat uktam iti
translated: That has been stated means

analyzed: sādhya aprasiddhau api vyāptiḥ asti iti etat pramāṇa lakṣaṇe uktam iti arthaḥ
translated: that even when the probandum is not well-known, there is pervasion, this has been stated in the definition of a means of valid knowledge. This is the meaning.

analyzed: prāk ārtha antarasya ukta tvāt prakṛta upayogi tayātrā artham āha sādhyasya iti
translated: Since another reason has already been stated, the meaning is stated here for the purpose of the present context.

analyzed: pratijñā vākyasya avidita padārtha tvena abodhaka tva prasaṅgāt sādhya asiddheḥ deṣatvam iti pakṣam nirāha nā api caturthaḥ iti
translated: Since the propositional sentence would be meaningless due to the meaning of the words being unknown, the opponent's view that the non-establishment of the probandum is a fault is refuted by saying Nor the fourth.

analyzed: ukta rītyā iti
translated: By the stated method means

analyzed: sva śarīra ādau vā avagata sātmaka tvasya puṃsaḥ ityādinā ukta rītyā iti arthaḥ
translated: by the method stated earlier, such as for a person who has understood the existence of the self through perception or instruction in his own body, etc.

original: asti nāstīti vivādarūpakāryeṇaiva tajjñānaṃ vādiprativādinoḥ siddhamiti kathamavidipadārthakatvaṃ pratijñāvākyasyeti bhāvenāha tadarthājñāna
analyzed: asti na asti iti vivāda rūpa kāryeṇa eva tat jñānam vādi prativādinoḥ siddham iti katham avidi pada arthaka tvam pratijñā vākyasya iti bhāvena āha tad artha ajñāna
translated: The meaning is that the knowledge of that [existence of the self] is established for the proponent and the opponent by the effect itself in the form of dispute, does it exist or not?. How can the propositional sentence have unknown word meanings? With this in mind, he says the non-existence of the knowledge of the object

original: kāraṇasya viśeṣaṇajñānasyābhāve kāryasya viśiṣṭajñānasyāyogādvā sādhyāsiddherdeṣatvamiti pakṣaṃ nirāha na pañcama iti// 🔽vyakaṇāddheḥ dotvaṅgaḥ
analyzed: kāraṇasya viśeṣaṇa jñānasya abhāve kāryasya viśiṣṭa jñānasya ayogāt vā sādhya asiddheḥ deṣatvam iti pakṣam nirāha na pañcamaḥ iti  vya kaṇāt heḥ do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: Since the effect, the knowledge of the qualified, is not possible in the absence of the cause, the knowledge of the qualifier, the opponent's view that the non-establishment of the probandum is a fault is refuted by saying Nor the fifth.🔽The section on the faults of the reason.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: na pañcamaḥ
translated: Not the fifth.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa jñānam viśiṣṭa jñāna hetuḥ na iti nirvikalpaka bhaṅge ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been stated in the refutation of indeterminate cognition that the knowledge of the qualifier is not the cause of the knowledge of the qualified.

analyzed: hetu tve pi aprāmāṇya abhāva sādhyaka anumāne iva ādau sā dhya viśeṣyakā eva dhīḥ
translated: Even when it is a reason, the cognition is only about the probandum, not about the qualifier, at first,

analyzed: paścāt sādhya viśeṣaṇikā iti suvaca tvāt ca
translated: and later it becomes about the probandum qualified by the qualifier, so it is easily stated.

analyzed: tasmāt sādhya aprasiddhiḥ na doṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the non-establishment of the probandum is not a fault.
Refutation of the fault of having an unknown qualifier.

analyzed: apramāṇya ityādi  vyaktam etat prāmāṇya vāde para mate prāmāṇya anumiti asaṃbhava ukti prastāve
translated: As for non-authoritativeness, etc.,🔽this is clear in the section on the impossibility of inferring authoritativeness according to the opponent's view in the section on authoritativeness.

original: nanvevamanirvacanīyāsiddheraprasiddhaviśeṣaṇaḥ pakṣaḥiti prakaraṇādau tatratatrāprasiddhaviśeṣaṇatvasya doṣatvenodbhāvanaṃ virudhyata iti
analyzed: nanu evam anirvacanīya asiddheḥ aprasiddha viśeṣaṇaḥ pakṣaḥ iti prakaraṇa ādau tatra tatra aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvasya doṣa tvena udbhāvanam virudhyate iti
translated: But in that case, the thesis has an unknown qualifier, because the indeterminable is not established. Thus, the frequent pointing out of the fault of having an unknown qualifier there and there in the beginning of the section contradicts that.

original: tasya paramatānusāritvasya tatra ṭīkāyāmeva vyaktatvāditi bhāvaḥ//🔽aprasiddhaviśeṣaṇatvasya doṣatvabhaṅgaḥ // // /🔽vyakaṇāddheḥdotvaṅgaḥ
analyzed: tasya paramata anusāri tvasya tatra ṭīkāyām eva vyakta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ             vya kaṇāt heḥ do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: The idea is that the fact that it follows the opponent's view there is clearly stated in the commentary itself.🔽Refutation of the fault of having an unknown qualifier.🔽The section on the fault of the cognition being different.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: atha vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ deṣatva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fault of the locus being different.

original: evaṃ vyadhikaraṇāsiddhirapi na doṣaḥ/ tathā hi
analyzed: evam vyadhikaraṇa asiddhiḥ api na doṣaḥ tathā hi
translated: Thus, the locus being different is also not a fault. For instance,

analyzed: atha vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ deṣatva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the fallacy of being inconclusive when the reason and the property to be established do not belong to the same subject.

original: vyāptatve vyāśrayatvaṃ tu kathamevahi dūṣaṇam/🔽rohiṇyudaya āsannaḥ kṛttikābhyuditā yataḥ/
analyzed: vyāpta tve vyāśraya tvam tu katham eva hi dūṣaṇam  rohiṇī udaye āsannaḥ kṛttikā abhyuditā yatas
translated: If there is pervasion, how can the fact of the reason not belonging to the same locus be a fault?

original: ityukte sādhanaṃ no kiṃ na hyājñaivātra sādhikā/ 🔽pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ
analyzed: iti ukte sādhanam no kim na hi ājñā eva atra sādhikā
translated: For example, when it is said The rising of Rohini is imminent, because Krittika has risen, is this not a valid proof? Is not an order alone sufficient here?

analyzed: tasyāḥ doṣa tvam kim iti saṅgāt
translated: How can that be a fault? This is the connection.

analyzed: pakṣa dharmatā vighaṭanāt dyāpti vighaṭanāt vā
translated: Because it destroys the property of being the subject or because it destroys the pervasion.

original: nādyaḥ/ nitya ātmā kākasya kārṣṇyādityādervyāptyabhāvenaiva duṣcatvāt/🔽śabdo nityaḥ ghaṭasya kṛtakatvādityatra tu śabdasya kṛtakatvaṃ svīkṛtaṃ cedghaṭasyetyasya vaiyarthyāt/
analyzed: na ādyaḥ nityaḥ ātmā kākasya kārṣṇyāt ityādeḥ vyāpti abhāvena eva duṣcatvāt  śabdaḥ nityaḥ ghaṭasya kṛtaka tvāt iti atra tu śabdasya kṛtaka tvam svīkṛtam ced ghaṭasya ityasya vaiyarthyāt
translated: The first is not so, because the argument the soul is eternal because of the blackness of the crow is faulty only due to the absence of pervasion.🔽But in the case of sound is eternal because of the producedness of a pot, if the producedness of sound is accepted, then the phrase of a pot is meaningless.

original: asvīkṛtya ghaṭagatenaiva kṛkatvena śabdānityatvasādhane tu yatra kṛtakatvaṃ tatrānityatvamiti
analyzed: a svīkṛtya ghaṭa gatena eva śabda anitya tva sādhane tu yatra kṛtaka tvam tatra anitya tvam iti
translated: But if the producedness belonging to the pot alone is used to prove the non-eternality of sound without accepting it, then the pervasion where there is producedness, there is non-eternality

analyzed: vyāpteḥ tatra sāmānādhikaraṇya garbhita tvena anya gatasya tasya anya gatena anitya tvena vyāpteḥ eva abhāvāt
translated: is not present there, because it is contained within the same substratum, and the pervasion of what belongs to one thing by what belongs to another thing, namely non-eternality, is absent.

original: iti bhaktipādīyānuvyākhyānasudhoktarītyā vikalpān doṣāṃśca vyanakti kimityādinā//
analyzed: iti bhaktipādīya anuvyākhyāna sudhā ukta rītyā vikalpān doṣān ca vyanakti kim ityādinā
translated: In this way, he explains the alternatives and faults as stated in the Anvvyakhyanasudha of Bhaktipada, beginning with What if...

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: Due to over-extension means

analyzed: kākasya kārṣṇyāt ityādeḥ api sat hetu tva āpatti rūpa atiprasaṅgāt iti arthaḥ
translated: that there would be the over-extension in the form of the consequence that the blackness of a crow and so on would also be valid reasons.

analyzed: iti atra tu iti
translated: In this case, however,...

original: yatra kṛtakatvaṃ tatrānityatvamiti vyāptisatvena vyāptyabhāvena tatra duṣṭatāyā vaktumaśakyatve 'pi prakārāntareṇa duṣṭatvaṃ tatreti viśeṣa 🔽dyotakastu śabdaḥ/
analyzed: yatra kṛtaka tvam tatra anitya tvam iti vyāpti satvena vyāpti abhāvena tatra duṣṭatāyāḥ vaktum aśakya tve pi prakāra antareṇa duṣṭatvam tatra iti viśeṣa  dyotakaḥ tu śabdaḥ
translated: Even though the faultiness there cannot be stated due to the presence of the pervasion wherever there is being produced, there is impermanence, the faultiness in a different way is stated there.

analyzed: vaiyarthyāt iti
translated: The word however indicates this distinction.🔽Because of uselessness means

analyzed: vyartha viśeṣaṇa tvena eva duṣṭa tvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: that the faultiness is only due to being a useless qualifier.🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...

original: nanu pratiyogyasāmānādhikaraṇayatsamānādhikaraṇātyantābhāvapratiyogitāvacchedakāvacchinnaṃ🔽yanna bhavati tena samaṃ tasya sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ vyāptiriti maṇyuktasāmānyalakṣaṇapakṣe🔽mahānasīyadhūmasya parvatādiniṣṭhavahnineva vyadhikaraṇayorapi vyāptirastīti pakṣe
analyzed: nanu pratiyogya sāmānādhikaraṇa yad samāna adhikaraṇa atyanta abhāva pratiyogitā avacchedaka avacchinnam  yat na bhavati tena samam tasya sāmānādhikaraṇyam vyāptiḥ iti maṇi ukta sāmānya lakṣaṇa pakṣe  mahānasīya dhūmasya parvata ādi niṣṭha vahninā iva vyadhikaraṇayoḥ api vyāptiḥ asti iti pakṣe
translated: But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...

analyzed: doṣa antaram āha kiñca iti
translated: But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But if...🔽But

original: kimadoṣatveti ga /rā / /nācca vyāka / /'atiprasaṅgāditi' iti nāsti ṭa /ṭha / /ṣyadyo ṭa /ṭha / 🔽vyakaraṇāddheḥdotvaṅgaḥ
analyzed: kim adoṣa tva iti atiprasaṅgāt iti iti na asti ṭa ṭha ṭa ṭha  vi a karaṇāt heḥ do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: What is the fault in being faultless?

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: Not from over-extension.

original: kiñca satyāṃ vyaptau vyadhikaraṇatvasya doṣatva evātiprasaṅgaḥ/
analyzed: kiñca satyām vyaptau vyadhikaraṇa tvasya doṣa tve eva atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: If there is pervasion, the fault of having a different substratum is itself an over-extension.

original: dṛśyate hi vyadhikaraṇenāpi padmavikāsena sūryodayasya /🔽samudravṛtyā candrodayasya /
analyzed: dṛśyate hi vyadhikaraṇena api padma vikāsena sūrya udayasya  samudra vṛtyā candra udayasya
translated: For the rising of the sun is seen to be inferred by the blooming of a lotus even when they have different substrata.🔽And the rising of the moon by the swelling of the ocean.

analyzed: chāyayā meghasay  bhūmiṣṭhena ālokena upari savituḥ
translated: By shadow, of clouds.🔽By light on the ground, of the sun above.

analyzed: cakra bhrameṇa kulāla āsatteḥ
translated: By the whirling of a wheel, of the presence of a potter.

analyzed: kṛttikā udayena rohiṇī upayā satteḥ
translated: By the rising of Krittika, of the conjunction of Rohini.

analyzed: adhas deśe nadīpūreṇa ūrdhva deśa vṛṣṭeḥ
translated: By the flooding of a river in a lower region, of rain in an upper region.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhāga stha dhūmena adhobhāga stha vahneḥ ca anumitiḥ
translated: And by smoke in an upper part, of fire in a lower part, there is inference.

original: nanvatrāpyayaṃ kālaḥ sūryodayavān padmavikāsavatkālatvātsammatavat ayaṃ pradeśaḥ
analyzed: nanu atra api ayam kālaḥ sūrya udayavān padma vikāsavat kāla tvāt sammata vat ayam pradeśaḥ
translated: But here also, this time has the rising of the sun, because it is time, like accepted time. This region

original: kulālāsattimān bhramaccakrādikaraṇatvāt sammatavat iyaṃ nadīvṛṣṭimadūrdhvadeśe ayaṃ
analyzed: kulāla āsattimān bhramat cakra ādi karaṇa tvāt sammata vat iyam nadī vṛṣṭimat ūrdhva deśe ayam
translated: has the presence of a potter, because it has a whirling wheel and other implements, like an accepted region. This river has rain in an upper region, because it is a river with a swollen current, like an accepted river.

original: dhūmo mūle gnimān dhūma vatvāt sammatavaditi kālaṃ deśādikaṃ vā pakṣīkṛtya sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ saṃpādyamiti cet //
analyzed: dhūmaḥ mūle gnimān dhūma va tvāt sammata vat iti kālam deśa ādikam vā pakṣīkṛtya sāmānādhikaraṇyam saṃpādyam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that smoke is on the mountain because it has smoke, like what is accepted, and time or place etc. should be made the subject and coordination should be accomplished,

analyzed: atiprasaṅgaḥ iti
translated: [the answer is] there is over-extension.

analyzed: sat hetūnām asat hetu tva āpatti rūpa atiprasaṅgaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is over-extension in the form of the fallacy of unestablished reasons becoming established reasons.

analyzed: tat katham iti atas āha dṛśyate hi iti
translated: How is that? To this he says: For it is seen, etc.

analyzed: anumitiḥ iti anvayaḥ
translated: The continuation is: inference.

analyzed: anuvyākhyāna ukta udāharaṇam upalakṣaṇam matvā āha padma ityādi
translated: Considering the example stated in the Anvīkṣāṇī as an illustration, he says lotus etc.

original: kālaṃ deśaṃ vā'dāya sarvatra sāmānādhikaraṇyamāśaṅkate nanviti/🔽deśādikaṃ vetyāditapadena nadīmiti gṛhyate/
analyzed: kālam deśam vā ādāya sarvatra sāmānādhikaraṇyam āśaṅkate  nanu iti  deśa ādikam vā iti ādita padena nadīm iti gṛhyate
translated: He suspects that everywhere coordination is obtained by taking time or place, saying but etc.🔽By the word etc. in place etc. the river is included.🔽The coordination of the river with the mountain is like that of the mountain with the cow and the earth.

original: ptau vaiyadhikaraṇyasya ka /ga /rā / /śanadī ga /rā / /śasaṃ ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /leva ga /ṭa /rā / /matvā ṭa /
analyzed: ptau vaiyadhikaraṇyasya kagarā śanadī garā śasam kagaṭarā gaṭarā matvā ṭa
translated: The coordination of the cow and the earth with the mountain is like that of the mountain with the lotus and the earth.🔽The coordination of the lotus and the earth with the mountain is like that of the mountain with the cow and the earth.
The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Section

analyzed: kim iyam laukika pratītiḥ uta tvad abhimata sāmānādhikaraṇya niyama nirvāhāya evam 🔽prayoga vipariṇāmaḥ kalpyate
translated: Is this worldly cognition? Or is the modification of the application imagined in this way to establish the rule of coordination desired by you?

original: nādyaḥ/ tvaduktakusṛṣṭimajānatāmapi laukikānāṃ padmādau vikāsādidarśanenaiva sūryodayādau svārthānumiteḥ tadanusāriparārthānumiteśca darśanāt/
analyzed: na ādyaḥ tvad ukta kusṛṣṭim a jānatām api laukikānām padma ādau vikāsa ādi darśanena eva sūrya udaya ādau sva artha anumiteḥ tad anusāri para artha anumiteḥ ca darśanāt
translated: The first is not correct. Because even the worldly people who do not know the artificial creation mentioned by you, see the blooming etc. of the lotus etc., and infer the rising of the sun etc. for their own sake, and also the inference for the sake of others following that.

analyzed: parīkṣakaiḥ ca loka siddha rīti anusāriṇī eva prakriyā kalpyā
translated: And the investigators should devise a procedure that follows the method established in the world.

analyzed: na tu sva kalpita prakriyā sā bādhyā
translated: But their own invented procedure should not be contradicted.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the fallacy of over-extension.

analyzed: uktam ca nyāyaṭīkāyām
translated: And it is said in the Nyāyatikā:

analyzed: siddha anugama mātram tu kartum yuktam parīkṣakaiḥ
translated: But it is proper for the investigators to merely follow what is established.

analyzed: na sarva loka siddhasya lakṣaṇena nivartanam
translated: Not to set aside what is established in the world by definition.

original: dṛśyate hyadtanasya sūryodayasya śvastanena sūryodayena gamyagamakabhāva iti//
analyzed: dṛśyate hi adtanasya sūrya udayasya śvastanena sūrya udayena gamya gamaka bhāvaḥ iti
translated: For the rising of the sun today is seen to be the inferable and the rising of the sun tomorrow is seen to be the inferring.

original: lokarītyerevaṃrūpatveṣa'pi bhavadbhiriva mayāpi lokarītyanurodhenaiva paribhāṣā kāryeti kuta ityata āha parīkṣakaiśceti//
analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ iva mayā api loka rīti anurodhena eva paribhāṣā kāryā iti kutas iti atas āha parīkṣakaiḥ ca iti
translated: Even though the worldly method is of this form, the convention should be made by me also in accordance with the worldly method, just as it is done by you. Why is it so? To this he says: And by the investigators, etc.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: Because of the fallacy of over-extension.

analyzed: dhūma ādinā vahni ādi anumiti utpādana ādikam api na syāt
translated: Even the production of inference of fire etc. by smoke etc. would not be possible.

analyzed: jñānasya api icchā dvārā pravṛtti hetutva kalpanam daṇḍa ādeḥ ghaṭa hetutā vyutpādana ādikam api na syāt iti evamādi atiprasaṅgāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it would lead to the absurdity that the postulating of knowledge as the cause of activity through desire would not be possible, and that the teaching of the pot's cause as the stick, etc. would not be possible.

analyzed: yat vā samāna adhikaraṇānām api gamya gamaka bhāvaḥ na iti api vyutpādana prasaṅgāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Or the meaning is that it would lead to the absurdity of teaching that even things that are co-extensive cannot be the object of inference and the means of inference.

analyzed: kim evam laikikī gaṭarā  vya kaṇāt heḥ do tu aṅgaḥ
translated: Is this the ordinary usage?🔽The section on the refutation of the non-existence of the object of inference.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ anyonya āśraya tvāt
translated: The second is not so, because of the fallacy of mutual dependence.

analyzed: anyathā mad abhimata vaiyadhikaraṇya ādi nirvāhāya parvata adhas deśaḥ gnimān ūrdhva deśasya
translated: Otherwise, in order to establish my desired co-reference, etc., the lower region of the mountain would be fiery because the upper region is smoky.

original: dhūmavatvāt vimataḥ kālo deśo vā agnimatparvatasaṃbaddhaḥ dhūmavatparvatasaṃbaddhatvāt
analyzed: dhūmavat tvāt vimataḥ kālaḥ deśaḥ vā agnimat parvata saṃbaddhaḥ dhūmavat parvata saṃbaddha tvāt

analyzed: saṃmata vat ityādiḥ api vipariṇāmaḥ syāt
translated: like what is accepted. Such a transformation would also occur.

original: kiṃ caivaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyasya sarvatra susaṃpādatvena vyadhikaraṇāsiddhirniravakāśā syāt/
analyzed: kim ca evam sāmānādhikaraṇyasya sarvatra su saṃpāda tvena vyadhikaraṇa asiddhiḥ niravakāśā syāt

analyzed: tad asaṃpādane sā sāvakāśā iti ced tarhi asiddhiḥ ukti doṣaḥ syāt
translated: If it is argued that when it is not accomplished, it has scope, then asiddhi would be a fault of statement.

analyzed: tvad abhimata sāmānādhikaraṇya niyama nirvāhāya iti ukta kalpam nirāha na dvitīya

analyzed: iti anyonya iti

translated: When the rule of co-reference is established, the assumption of modification of the application to establish that is established. And when the modification of the application is established as explained, the establishment of the rule of co-reference is by mutual dependence. This is the meaning.

analyzed: niravakāśā iti
translated: Without a locus.

analyzed: ayam kālaḥ ātma nitya tvavān kāka kārṣṇyava tvāt ityādi rūpeṇa tvad abhimata vyadhikaraṇa asiddha hetvābhāsa sthale pi

analyzed: doṣa tvena tasya parigaṇanam ayuktam āpādyeta iti bhāvaḥ

translated: When that is not accomplished, when co-reference is not accomplished by place, time, etc., this is the meaning.

translated: The first is of the rising of the distinguished cloud etc. from rain etc., the second is of fire etc. from smoke etc., the third is to be seen from conjunction, the fourth is of form etc. from the wet etc., and the fifth is of the counter-entity etc. from destruction etc.

analyzed: para saṃmmatyā api vyadhikaraṇayoḥ liṅgi bhāvam darśayati tvad mate iti

analyzed: yāvat  patana daśāyām avayava apacaya abhāve pi patite sati abhighāta śena avayava apacaya avaśyam bhāvāt
translated: It means one who has the present action of falling and one who has the past action of falling.🔽Even though there is no decrease of parts in the state of falling, when it has fallen, the decrease of parts is necessarily due to the force of impact.

analyzed: phalasya iva patita tva daśāyām anya tvāt tatra ca patitam phalam idam guru tva vat patana kriyāvat tvāt sammata vat iti anumāna darśanāt
translated: Because in the state of the fruit having fallen, it is different, and there, the fallen fruit is accepted as heavy, because of having the quality of falling, like a weight. Because of seeing inference.

analyzed: patana guru tvayoḥ ca liṅga liṅgi bhāva āpannayoḥ deśataḥ kālataḥ ca vyadhikaraṇa tvāt katham
translated: And because of the relation of the inferred and the inferential mark between falling and heaviness, they are not co-extensive in space and time, how then

analyzed: ṣ ṭhenapa ka garā tam idam phalam tva va tvāt ṭha
translated: is this fruit heavy because of having the quality of falling?

original: madiṣṭasādhanatvāt madbhojanavat ityatra siddhapākaniṣṭhatayā jñātena hetunāsiddhapākarūpapakṣaniṣṭhatayā sādhyapramiteruktavācca//
analyzed: mad iṣṭa sādhana tvāt mad bhojana vat iti atra siddha pāka niṣṭhatayā jñātena hetunā asiddha pāka rūpa pakṣa niṣṭhatayā sādhya pramiteḥ uktavāt ca
translated: In the case of 'because it is an instrument of my desired object, like my cooking', the cognition of the probandum in the form of uncooked rice, which is the subject, is stated by the reason known as cooked rice.

original: kiñca tvanmate pramātvameva vā niṣkarṣajñānatvameva vā prameyatvaṃ evaṃ kṛtitvecchātvadveṣatvādikameva
analyzed: kiñca tvad mate pramā tvam eva vā niṣkarṣa jñāna tvam eva vā prameya tvam evam kṛti tva icchā tva dveṣa tva ādikam eva
translated: Moreover, according to your view, either the nature of being a valid cognition or the nature of being a cognition of what is to be known is the nature of being an object of knowledge. Similarly, the nature of being an action, the nature of being desired, the nature of being hated, etc.

original: kāryatveṣṭatvadviṣṭatvādikaṃ tathā ca śabdobhidheyaḥ prameyatvādityādau kathaṃ pakṣadharmatā /
analyzed: kāryatva iṣṭa tva dviṣṭa tva ādikam tathā ca śabdaḥ abhidheyaḥ prameya tvāt ityādau katham pakṣa dharma tā
translated: are the nature of being an effect, the nature of being desired, the nature of being hated, etc. Thus, in the case of 'sound is expressible because of being an object of knowledge', etc., how is there the property of the subject?

analyzed: pramā tvasya śabdena paramparā saṃbandhaḥ sti iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the nature of being a valid cognition has a relation of succession with sound, it is not so.

analyzed: vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ deṣatvam iti arthaḥ

analyzed: asiddha pāke hetoḥ abhāvena tad niṣṭa tvena tava ajñānāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the reason is absent in what is not yet cooked, and you do not know it to be based on that.

analyzed: ukta tvāt ca iti
translated: And because it has been stated.

analyzed: vidhi vāde
translated: In the section on injunctions.

original: ato na pakṣadharmatāvighaṭakatvena doṣatvaṃ vyadhikaraṇāsiddheriti bhāvaḥ/

translated: Therefore, the meaning is that being unascertainable with different substrata is not a fault by way of obstructing the property of the subject.

original: sthalāntarepi vyadhikaraṇasya gamakatvaṃ paramate darśayati kiṃ ca tvanmata iti//
analyzed: sthala antare api vyadhikaraṇasya gamaka tvam para mate darśayati kim ca tvad mate iti

analyzed: pramā tvasya api artha sattva aupādhika tvena ajāti rūpatvāt tadvati tad prakāraka jñāna tva rūpa pramā tve jñāna tvasya praveśam āha aniṣkarṣaḥ iti
translated: Since the nature of being a valid cognition is also of the nature of a universal, not being a real entity, he says that the nature of being a valid cognition, which is the nature of being a cognition that is of the form of that with regard to that which has that, includes the nature of being a cognition, in If it is not extracted.

The meaning is that when there is reflection on the universal that is not a real entity, by way of distinguishing the property that is a component of the body of the nature of being a valid cognition.

original: astu kiṃ tata ityata āha tathā ceti//
analyzed: astu kim tatas iti atas āha tathā ca iti

analyzed: ityādau iti  idam sara kartṛkam kārya tvāt

analyzed: idam saṅgrāhyam iṣṭa tvāt
