analyzed: idam heyam dviṣṭa tvāt iti ādiḥ ādi padārthaḥ
translated: This is to be abandoned because it is hated. This is the meaning of the word etc.

analyzed: katham iti
translated: How?
The idea is that the nature of being a valid cognition, etc. belongs to the person who has valid cognition, and not to sound, etc.

analyzed: paramparā iti
translated: By the word 'paramparyeṇa' (by a series of relations),

original: śabdasya pramāyāḥ svarūpasaṃbandhaḥ pramayā pramātvasya samavāya iti paramparetyarthaḥ/🔽pratītibalāddhi yenakenacitsaṃbandhenakṛṣṇaṃ vastraṃ
analyzed: śabdasya pramāyāḥ svarūpa saṃbandhaḥ pramayā pramā tvasya samavāyaḥ iti paramparā iti arthaḥ  pratīti balāt hi yena kenacid saṃbandhena kṛṣṇam vastram
translated: the relation of the form of valid cognition with sound, and the inherence of the nature of being a valid cognition in valid cognition, is meant.

original: lohitaḥsphaṭikaityādāviva paramparāsaṃbandhenāpi taddharmatvaṃ kalpyaṃ na hi tathā dhīrityāha śabda iti//
analyzed: lohitaḥ sphaṭikaḥ etyādau iva paramparā saṃbandhena api tad dharma tvam kalpyam na hi tathā dhīḥ iti āha śabdaḥ iti
translated: Because of the force of cognition, the quality of being a valid cognition is imagined to belong to sound by some kind of relation, even by a series of relations, like the relation of the black cloth and the red crystal, etc. But it is not cognized in that way. This is stated by the word 'śabda' (sound).

original: pramāsvarūpatvāditi// 🔽vātiniṣkarṣe jñā ka /ga / /vātiniṣkarṣajñā ṭa / /prameva vā ityadhikam ka /
analyzed: pramā svarūpa tvāt iti  vā ati niṣkarṣe jñā ka ga vā ati niṣkarṣa jñā ṭa pramā iva vā iti adhikam ka
translated: Because of being the form of valid cognition, etc.🔽The word 'vā' (or) is redundant.

analyzed: vyākaṇāt dheḥ do tu aṅgaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ  śabde pramā tvam iti kadāpi apratīteḥ
translated: The section on the fallacy of inference.🔽Because the nature of being a valid cognition in sound is never cognized.

analyzed: pratyuta pramā tvam na iti eva pratīteḥ
translated: On the contrary, it is cognized that it does not have the nature of being a valid cognition.

analyzed: tasya tad dharma tva ayogāt
translated: Because it cannot be related to that.

original: na ca pramājātīyaviṣayatvaṃ vā īśvarapramāviṣayatvaṃ vā prameyatvaṃ tacca śabde 'stīti vācyam//
analyzed: na ca pramā jātīya viṣayatvam vā īśvara pramā viṣayatvam vā prameya tvam tat ca śabde sti iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the nature of being an object of valid cognition of the kind of valid cognition, or the nature of being an object of God's valid cognition, is the nature of being an object of valid cognition, and that exists in sound.

analyzed: viṣaya tva rūpa saṃbandhasya api tvad mate pramā svarūpa tvāt
translated: Because even the relation in the form of being the object is, according to your view, of the nature of valid knowledge.

analyzed: śabda a niṣṭha tvāt
translated: Because valid knowledge is not dependent on words.

original: kiñca vyatirakevyāptiḥ sākṣādaṅgamiti tvanmate vyāptipakṣadharmatayorvaiyadhikaraṇyepi gamatvavat sādhyasādhanayorapi vayaidhikaraṇye 'pi gamyagamakatāstu/
analyzed: kiñca vyatirake vyāptiḥ sākṣāt aṅgam iti tvad mate vyāpti pakṣa dharmatayoḥ vaiyadhikaraṇye pi gama tva vat sādhya sādhanayoḥ api gamya gamaka tā astu
translated: Moreover, according to your view, the pervasion in the vyatireka is directly a part. Therefore, even when there is no co-reference between the pervasion and the property of the subject, and even when there is no co-reference between the conclusion and the reason, let there be the relation of the known and the unknown.

analyzed: tatra pratiyogi anuyogi bhāvaḥ atra api vṛṣṭa pūra āśrayoḥ daśayoḥ ūrdhvādharībhāvaḥ
translated: There, let the relation of the counter-correlate and the correlate be the determiner, just as here also the relation of the higher and the lower between the two based on the past and the future is the determiner.

original: api ca dhūmajātīyasya vahnijātīyaṃ prativyāpyatvātparvatīyo dhūmo mahānasīvayavahniṃ pratyapi vyāpya ititvanmate kathaṃ vyāpyavyāpakayoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam//
analyzed: api ca dhūma jātīyasya vahni jātīyam prati vyāpya tvāt parvatīyaḥ dhūmaḥ mahānasī vaya vahnim prati api vyāpyaḥ iti tvad mate katham vyāpya vyāpakayoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam
translated: Moreover, since the class of smoke is pervaded by the class of fire, according to your view, the smoky mountain is pervaded even with respect to the fire in the great kitchen. How then is there co-reference between the pervaded and the pervader?

analyzed: anyathā atīta ādau prameya tva abhāva āpātāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that otherwise, the absence of the property of being an object of knowledge in the past etc. would follow.

original: pratibandyāpi vaiyadhikaraṇyaṃ na doṣāyetyā ha kiñca vyatireketi//
analyzed: pratibandya api vaiyadhikaraṇyam na doṣāya iti ā ha kiñca vyatireka iti
translated: Even by way of a counter-argument, non-co-reference is not a fault. Therefore, it is said: Moreover, in the vyatireka...

analyzed: maṇi ukta vyāpti sāmānādhikaraṇa pakṣe vyadhikaraṇayoḥ api vyāpti svīkārāt tat anusṛtya āha api ca iti
translated: In the case where the pervasion stated in the probans is co-extensive with the subject, even though the pervasion is accepted as being between two different subjects, following that, he says 'Moreover'.

analyzed: tya taḥ ā ṭaḍa
translated: Therefore, it is not so.
Nyāyadyuti-Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: aitena sāmānādhikaraṇya vyatireka niścaya ādinā anumiti pratibandhāt tad niśrayaḥ numiti hetuḥ iti nirastam
translated: By this, the view that the basis of the ascertainment of co-extensiveness and the absence of the vyatireka is the cause of the inference is refuted.

analyzed: vṛṣṭi pūrayoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇya vyatireka niścaye pi anumiti darśanāt
translated: Because even when there is ascertainment of the co-extensiveness and the absence of the vyatireka of rain and the filling of the river, inference is seen.

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ vaiyadhikaraṇye api vyāpteḥ ūpapādita tvāt
translated: The third is not so, because the pervasion is established even when the two are different subjects.

analyzed: vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ deṣatva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: Refutation of the view that the asiddhi of different subjects is a fallacy.

original: vyāptivighaṭanādvā doṣatvamiti pakṣaṃ nirāha na tṛtīya iti//🔽vyadhikaraṇāsiddherdeṣatvabhaṅgaḥ // //
analyzed: vyāpti vighaṭanāt vā doṣa tvam iti pakṣam nirāha na tṛtīyaḥ iti  vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ deṣatva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: He refutes the view that the fallacy lies in the destruction of the pervasion by saying 'The third is not so'.🔽Refutation of the view that the asiddhi of different subjects is a fallacy.

analyzed: bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā artha pramāṇa virodha tvena aikyam
translated: The identity of contradiction and annulment as being the contradiction of the proposition with valid knowledge.

analyzed: kecid tu
translated: Some people

analyzed: savyabhicāra viruddha sat pratipakṣa asiddha bādhitāḥ pañca hetvābhāsāḥ
translated: say that there are five fallacies of hetu: svavyabhicāra, viruddha, satpratipakṣa, asiddha, and bādhita.

analyzed: bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā artha pramāṇa virodha tvena aikyam
translated: The identity of contradiction and opposition by being contradictions of the proposition and the means of valid knowledge, respectively.

analyzed: nanu evam āśraya asiddha sādhya asiddhi vyadhikaraṇa asiddhīnām adoṣa tve pi vyabhicāra ādīnām
translated: If in this way, the fallacies of the unestablished locus, the unestablished probandum, and the different loci are not faults, then there are

analyzed: hetu doṣāṇām bhāvāt asiddhiḥ avyāptiḥ iti dvau eva hetu doṣau iti ayuktam iti ākṣipati kecitu ityādinā
translated: faults of the reason such as fallacy. Therefore, it is not correct that there are only two faults of the reason, namely, unestablished and over-pervasion. He raises this objection with the words Some say and so on.

analyzed: dvau eva hetu doṣau iti ayuktam iti āhuḥ ityantena
translated: Up to the end with say that it is not correct that there are only two faults of the reason.

analyzed: kecid tārkikāḥ
translated: Some logicians.

analyzed: prācām rītyā saptavidha anuvāde pi anadhyavasita tvasya anaikāntike ntarbhāvam prakaraṇasya asaṃbhavanayā
translated: In the Pramana-lakshana-tika and other texts, after enumerating seven kinds of fallacies according to the ancient method, such as unestablished, contradictory, inconclusive, not ascertained, untimely, irrelevant, and similar to the proposition,

analyzed: parigaṇana ayogya tvam upetya maṇi ādi ukta diśā pāñcavidhyam anuvadati sa vyabhicāra iti
translated: even though they are mentioned, considering that not being ascertained is included in inconclusive, and that irrelevant is not suitable to be enumerated due to its impossibility, he follows the fivefold classification stated by Manjusa and others, saying In the inconclusive and so on.

analyzed: atas eva naiyāyikāḥ iti an uktvā kecid iti uktiḥ  bā pra yo pra artha pra ṇavinā aikyam
translated: For this very reason, instead of saying the Naiyayikas, he says some.🔽The identity of contradiction and opposition.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on fallacies of inference.

analyzed: tat uktam gautama iva savyabhicāra vuruddha prakaraṇasama sādhyasama atīta kālāḥ hetvābhāsāḥ iti
translated: That has been stated by Gautama: The fallacies of reason are: the contradictory, the unestablished, the superfluous, the inconclusive, and the untimely.

analyzed: tatra sādhya tad abhāva koṭi dvaya upasthāpaka rūpa
translated: There, the form that presents both the class of the probandum and its absence

original: evaṃ nirdeśo pañcatvaparigaṇane ca mūlamāha taduktamiti//
analyzed: evam pañcatva parigaṇane ca mūlam āha tat uktam iti
translated: Thus, the statement of the five is the root. It is said: That has been stated.

analyzed: maṇeḥ api idam eva mūlam iti api sūcitam
translated: It is also indicated that this is the root even for the jewel.

analyzed: prakaraṇasama śabdena sat pratipakṣaḥ ucyate
translated: By the word prakaraṇa-sama, the counter-instance is stated.

original: sādhyasamapadena cāsiddhiḥ atī kālapadena bādha ityuktārthasaṃvāditvaṃ dhyeyam/
analyzed: sādhya sama padena ca asiddhiḥ kāla padena bādhaḥ iti ukta artha saṃvādi tvam dhyeyam
translated: And by the word sādhya-sama, the unestablished, and by the word atīta-kāla, the contradicted, the agreement with the stated meaning should be contemplated.

original: maṇyādyuktadiśā teṣāṃ lakṣaṇānyanuvadati tatra teṣumadhya ityādinā//
analyzed: maṇi ādi ukta diśā teṣām lakṣaṇāni anuvadati tatra teṣu madhye ityādinā
translated: In accordance with the statement of the jewel etc., he repeats their definitions beginning with tatra teṣām madhye etc.

original: upasthāpaketi//🔽tadubhayopasthitijanakaṃ yadrūpaṃ sādhāraṇe sapakṣavipakṣavṛttitvena sādhyatadabhāvasāhacaryaṃ asādhāraṇe tadubhayavyāvṛttatvaṃ /
analyzed: upasthāpaka iti  tad ubhaya upasthiti janakam yat rūpam sādhāraṇe sapakṣa vipakṣa vṛtti tvena sādhya tad abhāva sāhacaryam asādhāraṇe tad ubhaya vyāvṛtta tvam
translated: Upasthāpaka means🔽The form that generates the presence of both, which is common in the case of the sapakṣa and vipakṣa as the concomitance of the probandum and its absence, in the case of the uncommon, it is the exclusion of both.

original: anupasaṃhāriṇi ca tadubhayaśūnyatvena pakṣa eva sādhyatadabhāvasāhacaryamityagre vyaktam/
analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇi ca tad ubhaya śūnya tvena pakṣe eva sādhya tad abhāva sāhacaryam iti agre vyaktam
translated: And in the case of the non-pervasion, it is the concomitance of the probandum and its absence in the pakṣa itself as the absence of both. This will be clear later.

analyzed: tādṛśa dharma tvam sādhāraṇa ādi trita ga sādhāraṇam lakṣaṇam
translated: The character of being such a property is the common definition of the three, the general, etc.

analyzed: yadi api maṇau ubhaya koṭi ityādi eva uktam
translated: Although in the Mīmāṃsā it is stated only as having both ends,

analyzed: tathā api tena asādhāraṇasya sādhya tad abhāva upasthāpaka tayā dūṣa tva pakṣe
translated: nevertheless, by that, in the case of the uncommon being a fallacy by way of indicating the probandum and its absence,

analyzed: na avyāptiḥ iti uttara grantha paryālocanayā ubhaya koci padasya evam eva arthaḥ abhimataḥ iti ittham anuvādaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: there is no over-extension. Thus, after examining the subsequent text, the meaning of the word having both ends is intended to be like this. Thus, the restatement is made in this way.

analyzed: yat tu pakṣadharau ubhaya koṭi upasthiti padena vyāpti niścaya virodhi saṃdeha janaka koṭi upasthitiḥ vivakṣitā
translated: However, Pakṣadhara (Viśvanātha) intends by the word having both ends the presence of an end that generates doubt which is contrary to the ascertainment of pervasion.

original: anyathā sarvasamabhidheyaṃ vsatutvādityādau kevalānvayisādhyakānupasaṃhāriṇi sādhyābhāvakoṭeraprasiddhera vyāptiḥ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā sarva samabhidheyam v satu tvāt ityādau kevala anvayi sādhyaka anupasaṃhāriṇi sādhya abhāva koṭeḥ aprasiddheḥ a vyāptiḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, in the case of a non-conclusion where the probandum is only universal, such as this is to be denoted because of being a word, there would be over-extension due to the non-establishment of the end of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: ukta vivakṣāyām tu na avyāptiḥ
translated: But in the intended statement, there is no over-extension.

original: kevalānvayisādhyake idamabhidheyaṃ na vetyevaṃ sandehā yoge 'pi abhidheyatvaṃ pakṣavṛttina vetyevaṃ saṃśayasaṃbhavāt/
analyzed: kevala anvayi sādhyake idam abhidheyam na vā iti evam sandehāḥ yoge pi abhidheya tvam pakṣa vṛtti na vā iti evam saṃśaya saṃbhavāt
translated: Even though there is no doubt as to whether this is to be denoted or not in the case of a probandum that is only universal, there is a possibility of doubt as to whether denotability occurs in the subject or not.

original: vyāptiniścayavirodhisaṃśayaśca sādhyatadabhāvasaṃśayaḥ sādhye pakṣavṛttitvasaṃśayaśca bhavatīti kathanaṃ tattu maṇivākyaviruddham/
analyzed: vyāpti niścaya virodhi saṃśayaḥ ca sādhya tad abhāva saṃśayaḥ sādhye pakṣa vṛtti tva saṃśayaḥ ca bhavati iti kathanam tat tu maṇi vākya viruddham
translated: And the doubt that is opposed to the ascertainment of pervasion is the doubt regarding the probandum and its absence, and the doubt regarding the probandum being present in the subject. But that statement is contradicted by the statement about the jewel.

analyzed: tayoḥ api idam eva ṭha ha abhāve pi
translated: Even in the case of those two, this is the reason for non-pervasion, even in the absence of pervasion.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽vatvaṃ savyabhicāratvaṃ vipratipattivākye satpratipakṣe ca dvayoḥ koṭidvayopasthāpa'katvepi
analyzed: savyabhicāra tvam vipratipatti vākye sat pratipakṣe ca dvayoḥ koṭi dvaya upasthāpaka tve pi
translated: The Lamp of Logic together with the Tarkatandava, Third Chapter🔽Even though in a contradictory statement and in a counter-argument, there is the property of making both sides appear, it is not over-pervasion.

analyzed: na ca evam kevala anvayi sādhyaka anupasaṃhāriṇī a vyāptiḥ
translated: And thus, in a non-conclusion where the probandum is only affirmative, there is no pervasion.

analyzed: tasya atra asaṃgrāhya tvāt iti āhuḥ
translated: They say that it is not to be included here.

analyzed: nanu atha anityaḥ śabdaḥ śabda tvāt iti atra āpta vākya ādinā vyāpti graha daśāyām sat hetu tvāt
translated: But in the case of Sound is non-eternal because of being sound, in the stage of grasping pervasion by authoritative statements etc., it is a valid reason.

analyzed: tatra sarva sapakṣa vipakṣa vyāvṛtta tvasya ubhaya koṭi upasthāpaka rūpasya satvāt ativyāptiḥ iti vācyam
translated: There, because of the existence of the property of making both sides appear, which is the exclusion of all similar and dissimilar instances, it is said to be over-pervasion.

analyzed: tatra vyāpti sapakṣa vyāvṛtta tva aṃśasya tatra abhāvāt
translated: But there, because of the absence of the part of the pervasion which is the exclusion of the similar instance,

analyzed: atra liṅga niṣṭha tayā yat jñānam ubhaya koṭi upasthāpakam prāmāṇya aprāmāṇya ubhaya koṭi upasthāpaka rūpa jñāna tvavati sat hetau na ativyāptiḥ
translated: Here, with regard to the inferential mark, the cognition that presents both aspects, being a valid cognition presenting both the aspects of validity and invalidity, does not overextend to a good reason having the nature of a cognition presenting both aspects by the property of being a cognition.

analyzed: jñāna tvasya prāmāṇya saṃśaya viṣaya anumiti vṛttitayā jñāna tvena eva ubhaya koṭi upasthāpaka tvāt iti
translated: Because the property of being a cognition presents both aspects only by the property of being a cognition, which is the object of doubt regarding validity.

analyzed: nanu evam api parvataḥ gnimān parvataḥ gnimān na bhavati iti viruddha artha pratipādaka vākya dvaye
translated: Even so, in the case of two statements expressing contradictory meanings, such as The mountain has fire and The mountain does not have fire,

original: śabdo 'nityaḥ kṛtakatvāt nityaḥ śabdaḥ śrāvaṇatvāditi satpratipakṣe cātivyāptirevetyata
analyzed: śabdaḥ nityaḥ kṛtaka tvāt nityaḥ śabdaḥ śrāvaṇa tvāt iti satpratipakṣe ca ativyāptiḥ eva iti atas
translated: and in the case of a counter-argument, such as Sound is impermanent because it is produced and Sound is permanent because it is audible, there is still overextension. To this he says

analyzed: āha vipratipatti iti
translated: vipratipatti etc.

original: vipratipattistu pratyekaṃ na tatheti pūrvapakṣa maṇyukteḥ/🔽tathāsādhāraṇagranthe satpratikṣeddhau atra tveka eveti cokteriti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: vipratipattiḥ tu pratyekam na tathā iti pūrvapakṣa maṇi ukteḥ  tathā asādhāraṇa granthe sat pratikṣeddhau atra tu ekaḥ evā iti ca ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Vipratipatti is a dispute. Tu but. Pratyekam individually. Na tathā is not so. This is the prima facie view stated in the Mīmāṃsā.

original: yadyapi vimataṃ mithyā dṛśyatvāt śuktirajatavat vimataṃ satyaṃ dṛśyatvādbrahmavadityādiprakaraṇasamepyekasyaivobhayopasthāpakatvamasti /
analyzed: yadi api vimatam mithyā dṛśya tvāt śukti rajata vat vimatam satyam dṛśya tvāt brahma vat ityādi prakaraṇa same pi ekasya eva ubhaya upasthāpaka tvam asti
translated: Tathā in that way. Sādhāraṇa common. Grantha text. Vipratipatti dispute. Tu but. Ekasyaiva of only one. Ubhayopasthāpaka presenting both. Asty exists. Adi etc. Vimatam the object of dispute. Mithyā false. Dṛśyatvāt because it is seen. Śuktirājatavat like a mother-of-pearl. Vimatam the object of dispute. Satyaṃ true. Dṛśyatvāt because it is seen. Brahmavat like Brahman. Ādi etc. Prati towards. Karaṇa instrument. Samena by equality. Asty exists. Ekasyaiva of only one. Ubhayopasthāpaka presenting both.

analyzed: tathā api tasya etad mate saṃbhāvita tvena asaṅgrahāt na ativyāpti śaṅkā avakāśaḥ
translated: Still, because it is not possible according to his view, there is no scope for doubt of over-extension due to its not being included.

original: tasyāpi savyabhicāratvena saṅgra hyatvādadoṣa iti kecit// 🔽ṇyativyā ṭa / /syasaṃgrāhya ṭha / /ṇyādyukte ṭa / / ṇāvu ṭha /ḍa / /saṃgrāhyatvā ḍa / /ṅgrahā ṭha /
analyzed: tasya api savyabhicāra tvena saṅgra hya tvāt adoṣaḥ iti kecid  sya saṃgrāhya ṭha ṇi ādi ukte ṭha saṃgrāhya tvā ḍa
translated: Some say that there is no fault because it is to be included as having fallacy.🔽The fallacy of over-extension of the definition of fallacy is not possible because it is not a fallacy.

analyzed: vā pra yo pra rtha pra ṇaḥ vinā aikyam
translated: The unity of the two is stated in the Pramana-viniścaya.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ  savyabhicāra vat ekasya tad upasthāpaka tva abhāvāt na sa vyabhicāra lakṣaṇasya ativyāptiḥ
translated: The section on fallacies of inference.🔽Because it is not a fallacy, it is not a fallacy.🔽Being present only in the dissimilar instances is contradiction.

analyzed: pratiruddha tvam sat prati
translated: Being contradicted by a valid cognition of equal strength is the fallacy of being contradicted.
In the direction stated in the commentary on the definition of valid cognition, he says being present only in the dissimilar instances.

original: mātrapadena sapakṣavṛttitvaṃ vyāvartyete na tu pakṣavṛttitvamapi/
analyzed: mātra padena sapakṣa vṛtti tvam vyāvartyete na tu pakṣa vṛtti tvam api
translated: By the word only, the presence in similar instances is excluded, but not the presence in the subject either.

analyzed: tathātve siddhi sāṅkarya āpatteḥ
translated: If it were so, then there would be the fault of confusion with the unestablished.

analyzed: pakṣa vipakṣayoḥ eva vartamānaḥ hetuḥ viruddhaḥ iti lakṣaṇa ṭīkā virodhāt ca
translated: And because it contradicts the commentary on the definition that a reason present only in the subject and dissimilar instances is contradictory.

original: vṛkṣaḥ saṃyogavān dravyatvādityatra dravyatvahetoḥ sādhyābhāvavadvṛttitve 'pi niścitasaṃyogarūpasādhyavalatyapi vṛtterna tatrātivyāptiḥ/
analyzed: vṛkṣaḥ saṃyogavān dravya tvāt iti atra dravya tva hetoḥ sādhya abhāvavat vṛtti tve pi niścita saṃyoga rūpa sādhya valati api vṛtteḥ na tatra ativyāptiḥ
translated: In the case of the inference The tree is in conjunction, because it is a substance, although the reason substance-hood occurs in what is contrary to the probandum, and also occurs in what has the probandum in the form of ascertained conjunction, there is no over-extension in that case.

analyzed: pratiyogi asamāna adhikaraṇa sādhya abhāva nmātra vṛtti tvam tad arthaḥ iti eke
translated: Some say that the meaning is occurrence only in what is contrary to the probandum, which is not co-extensive with its counter-correlate.

original: yattu maṇau sādhyavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvaṃ vā vṛttimataḥ sādhyavadavṛttitvaṃ vā viruddhatvamityādi/
analyzed: yat tu maṇau sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvam vā vṛttimataḥ sādhyavat avṛtti tvam vā viruddha tvam ityādi
translated: But in the Mimamsa philosophy, it is said that being the counter-correlate of the absence of what is pervaded by the probandum, or being absent where the probandum occurs, is contradictory.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: hetvabhāvasya sādhyavyāpakatvajñānasya grāhyābhāvasaṃsparśitayā grāhyabhūtavyāptijñānāpratibandhakatvāt/🔽niścitasādhyavadavṛttitve sati tadabhāvavadvṛttitvasya cāvyabhicaritasahacārarūpavyāptyabhāvarūpatayā tajjñānas vyāptijñānapratibandhadvārānumitipratibandhya
analyzed: hetu abhāvasya sādhya vyāpaka tva jñānasya grāhya abhāva saṃsparśi tayā grāhya bhūta vyāpti jñāna apratibandhaka tvāt  niścita sādhyavat avṛtti tve sati tad abhāvavat vṛtti tvasya ca avyabhicarita sahacāra rūpa vyāpti abhāva rūpa tayā tad jñānaḥ vyāpti jñāna pratibandha dvārā anumiti pratibandhya
translated: Because the knowledge of the absence of the reason being pervaded by the probandum is in contact with the apprehended absence, it is not a hindrance to the knowledge of the pervasion which is the apprehended.

analyzed: sambhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Because it is possible that the knowledge of the absence of the pervasion in the form of invariable concomitance, which consists in being absent where the probandum is ascertained to be present, and being present where its absence is, is a hindrance to inference by way of being a hindrance to the knowledge of pervasion. This is the idea.
The word only is used to avoid over-extension in what is common to the three positions.

analyzed: sama bala iti
translated: Of equal strength.

analyzed: sama bala tvam ca ābhimānikam dhyeyam
translated: And the equality of strength should be understood to be based on the assumption.

analyzed: anyathā vastunaḥ dvi rūpa tā āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of a thing having two forms.

analyzed: sama bala tayā abhimata pramāṇa viruddhaḥ sat pratipakṣaḥ iti lakṣaṇa ṭīkā ukteḥ ca
translated: And because it is said in the Lakṣaṇakārikā that a counter-instance is a case where there is a counter-instance to the conclusion, which is opposed by a valid cognition that is considered to be of equal strength.

analyzed: viruddha tvam pratiruddha kāryaka tvam ā
translated: Opposition means being obstructed in producing the effect.

analyzed: bodha iti vyāpti nirāsāya samā iti uktiḥ
translated: The word 'same' is used to rule out pervasion.

analyzed: sādhya virodhi upasthāpana samartha samāna bala upasthityā pratiruddha kārya liṅga tvam sat pratipakṣa tvam iti maṇi uktiḥ vyāptasya
translated: The statement in the Mīmāṃsā that being a counter-instance to the conclusion is being obstructed in producing the effect by the presence of a cognition of equal strength that is capable of presenting the contradictory of the conclusion is a statement of pervasion.🔽The author of the Nyāyakośa says that the presence of the reason in the contrary is the counter-instance.🔽The Nyāyakośa is a treatise on logic.

original: ṇaviru ga /rā / /śānirāha ṭha / 🔽pu / nyāyadīpuyatatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽pakṣatvam/ parāmarśaviṣayābhāvavatvaṃ asiddhatvam/
analyzed: ṇa vi ru ga rā śā ni rāha ṭha
translated: The third chapter.🔽The absence of the object of the judgment in the subject is the fallacy of the unestablished reason.

analyzed: prabala pramāṇa viruddha tvam bādhaḥ
translated: The contradiction by a strong means of valid knowledge is the fallacy of contradiction.

analyzed: tatra savyabhicāraḥ trividhaḥ
translated: There are three kinds of fallacious reasons:

analyzed: sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa anupasaṃhāri bhedāt
translated: common, uncommon, and inconclusive.

analyzed: tatra pakṣa vṛtti tvam sādhāraṇa tvam
translated: Among them, being present in the subject is commonness.

analyzed: sarva sapakṣa vipakṣa vyāvṛtta tvam asādhāraṇa tvam
translated: Being excluded from all similar instances and dissimilar instances is uncommonness.

original: pakṣadharmatāpramitiḥ siddhiḥ tadrahitosiddha iti prācāṃ rītimāśritya lakṣaṇaṭīkoktaṃ niṣkṛṣyāha parāmarśeti//
analyzed: pakṣa dharmatā pramitiḥ siddhiḥ tad rahitaḥ asiddhaḥ iti prācām rītim āśritya lakṣaṇa ṭīkā uktam niṣkṛṣya āha parāmarśa iti
translated: The ascertainment of the property of the subject is the establishment. The absence of that is the non-establishment. Relying on the method of the ancients, he extracts and says in the inference etc., as stated in the Lakṣaṇatīkā.

original: parāmarśaviṣayo vyāptiḥ pakṣadharmatā ca tadubhayarāhityamityarthaḥ//🔽yattu maṇau parāmarśaviṣayābhāvo nāsiddhaḥ vyarthaviśaṣaṇatvāt kiṃ tu āśrayāsiddhiḥ svarūpāsiddhiḥ vyāpyatvāsiddhiriti pratyekameva doṣa ityuktam/
analyzed: yat tu maṇau parāmarśa viṣaya abhāvaḥ na asiddhaḥ vyartha viśaṣaṇa tvāt kim tu āśraya asiddhiḥ svarūpa asiddhiḥ vyāpya tva asiddhiḥ iti pratyekam eva doṣaḥ iti uktam
translated: The pervasion that is the object of the inference and the property of the subject, the absence of both of those, is the meaning.🔽But in the Mīmāṃsā, the absence of the object of the inference is not non-established, because the distinguishing feature is useless, but rather the non-establishment of the substratum, the non-establishment of the nature, and the non-establishment of being pervaded, are each individually faults, it is said.

analyzed: tat tu itara vyabhicāra ādi tvad ukta lakṣaṇe api tulyam iti agre vyaktam
translated: That is the same even in the definition stated by you, due to the fallacy of the other, it will be clear later.

analyzed: saṅgrāhaka mātra tva isya api tathātvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this is also so because it is merely a collector.

analyzed: pramāṇa bādhita viṣayaḥ kāla atyaya apadiṣṭā iti lakṣaṇa ṭīkā ādi ukteḥ āha prabala iti
translated: He says strong etc., because the object contradicted by valid knowledge is stated in the Lakṣaṇatīkā etc. as contradicted by the passage of time.

original: prābalyamatra vāstavaṃ vābhimānikaṃ vā dhyeyam/🔽satpratipakṣe 'tivyāptinirāsāya prabaleti/
analyzed: prābalyam atra vāstavam vā ābhimānikam vā dhyeyam
translated: Here, the strength should be understood as real or assumed.🔽In order to remove the over-extension in the case of a counter-argument, he says strong.
The meaning is that the contradiction is the state of having as a probandum the counter-positive determined by a strong valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa antarbhāva su bodhāya maṇi ādi ukta diśā avāntara vibhāgam āha tatra
translated: For the easy understanding of the inclusion to be mentioned later, he states the internal division according to the view expressed by Man etc., in the words Among them.

analyzed: teṣu madhye iti
translated: Among them means.

analyzed: pakṣa traya iti
translated: In the three pakṣas means.
The meaning is: being present in pakṣa, sapakṣa and vipakṣa.

analyzed: yathā śabdaḥ nityaḥ prameya tvāt iti
translated: For example, Sound is non-eternal because it is knowable.

analyzed: sarvā iti
translated: All means.

analyzed: yathā bhūḥ nityā gandhava tvāt iti
translated: For example, The earth is eternal because it has smell.

analyzed: kevala anvayi dharma avacchinna pakṣakaḥ vā iti maṇi ukta rītyā āha kevala anvayī iti
translated: Following the view expressed by Man, he says Kevala-anvayi etc.

original: prameyatvāditi lakṣaṇaṃ tu sarvasapakṣavyāvṛttatvamiti maṇyukterāha sarveti /ḍa /
analyzed: prameya tvāt iti lakṣaṇam tu sarva sapakṣa vyāvṛtta tvam iti maṇi ukteḥ āha
translated: The definition because it is knowable is said to be being excluded from all sapakṣas by Man, so he says all.

analyzed: bā praya upa artha praṇavinā aikyam
translated: The unity of the meaning of the Vedas

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on faults in inference
Being characterized by a property that is only concomitant is being universal.

analyzed: asiddhiḥ api āśraya pakṣa dharma tva vyāpya tva asiddhi bhedena trividhā
translated: Asiddhi (unproven) is also of three types: asiddhi of the substratum, asiddhi of the property of the pakṣa, and asiddhi of the vyāpti (pervasion).

analyzed: tad pramiti asidhyā saha caturvidhā vā
translated: Or it is of four types along with the asiddhi of its cognition.

analyzed: eṃ viruddha ādeḥ api bhedaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The divisions of viruddha (contradictory) etc. should also be seen.

original: tanna śabdo nityo meyatvāditi sādhāraṇasya sarvamanityaṃ prameyatvādityanupasaṃhāriṇaśca sādhyatadabhāvasāhacaryaṃ koṭidvayopasthāpakaṃ rūpam/
analyzed: tat na śabdaḥ nityaḥ meya tvāt iti sādhāraṇasya sarvam anityam prameya tvāt iti anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ ca sādhya tad abhāva sāhacaryam koṭi dvaya upasthāpakam rūpam
translated: The co-existence of the probandum and its absence is the form that presents both the extremes in the case of a common reason like Sound is eternal because it is an object of cognition, and in the case of a non-converging reason like Everything is non-eternal because it is an object of cognition.

original: iyāṃstu bhedaḥ sādhāraṇasya pakṣādanyatra tatsāhacaryaṃ anupasaṃhāriṇastu pakṣa eveti/
analyzed: iyān tu bhedaḥ sādhāraṇasya pakṣāt anyatra tad sāhacaryam anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ tu pakṣe eva iti
translated: The difference is that the co-existence of the common reason is elsewhere than the subject, while that of the non-converging reason is only in the subject.

original: anityaḥ śabdaḥ śabdatvāditya sādhāraṇasya tu sādhyavataḥ tadabhāvavataśca vyāvṛttatvaṃ tadupasthāpakamiti savyabhicāralakṣaṇasya nātivyāptiḥ/
analyzed: anityaḥ śabdaḥ śabda tvāt iti a sādhāraṇasya tu sādhyavataḥ tad abhāvavataḥ ca vyāvṛtta tvam tad upasthāpakam iti savyabhicāra lakṣaṇasya na ativyāptiḥ
translated: But in the case of the reason because it is sound, the exclusion of what has the probandum and what does not have it is the presenter of that, so the definition of the fallacious does not over-extend.

analyzed: āśraya hetu vyāptīnām liṅga parāmarśa viṣaya tvāt tad abhāva vatva rūpam āśraya asiddhi ādi asiddhi traya anugatam
translated: Because the substratum, reason, and pervasion are the objects of the inferential cognition, the form of non-existence in what does not have it is common to the three types of unestablished reasons, such as the unestablished substratum.

analyzed: kevala anvayī iti
translated: Only universal means

original: yathā sarvamanityaṃ meyatvādityādiprācīnamatāvaṣṭambhena paddhatyādyuktadiśā'ha bhedo draṣṭavya iti//
analyzed: yathā sarvam anityam meya tvāt ityādi prācīna mata avaṣṭambhena paddhati ādi ukta diśā āha bhedaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ iti
translated: as stated in the Padarthadharmasangraha and elsewhere, based on the ancient view, that Everything is non-eternal because it is an object of cognition, etc. The difference should be seen.

analyzed: sa ca paddhati lakṣaṇa ṭīkayoḥ vyaktaḥ
translated: And that is clear in the Padarthadharmasangraha and its commentary.

original: granthagauravabhayāt prakṛte vakṣyamāṇāntarbhāvānuprayogācca nāsmābhirapi likhyate savyabhicārādilakṣaṇaṃ sādhāraṇāditraye 'siddhitraye ca
analyzed: grantha gaurava bhayāt prakṛte vakṣyamāṇa antarbhāva anuprayogāt ca na asmābhiḥ api likhyate savyabhicāra ādi lakṣaṇam sādhāraṇa ādi traye siddhi traye ca
translated: Fearing the bulkiness of the text and because it will be included in what is to be stated later, we also do not write the definitions of fallacious hetu, etc. in the three types of common fallacies and the three types of unestablished fallacies.

analyzed: vyanakti tatra śabdaḥ ityādinā
translated: He explains it with There, the word, etc.

analyzed: atra kaṭa tvadyasā kaṭarā syāvyā kagarā
translated: Here, the K.T. is K.T.R.A., the S.Y. is K.G.R.A., and the V.R. is K.G.T.R.A.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

analyzed: atra asādhāraṇa anupasaṃhāri sat pati pakṣāḥ anitya doṣāḥ
translated: Here, the non-common and non-concluding fallacies are the faults of the non-eternal.

analyzed: anukūla tarka avatāra śāyām anumiti apratibandhaka tvāt
translated: Because they are not obstacles to inference when the favorable reasoning is introduced.

analyzed: itare tu nitya doṣāḥ
translated: But the others are the faults of the eternal.

analyzed: tatra api bādha pratirodhau sākṣāt anumiti pratibandhakau
translated: Even there, contradiction and opposition are direct obstacles to inference.

analyzed: na tu karaṇi ghaṭana dvārā
translated: But not through the arrangement of the means.

analyzed: tatra api bādhaḥ dhī tvena
translated: Even there, contradiction is by the cognition having as its content the absence that is grasped by inference.

analyzed: pratirodhaḥ tu anumiti grāhya abhāva viṣaya dhī sāmagrī tvena
translated: But opposition is by the collection of means having as its content the absence that is grasped by inference.

analyzed: itare trayaḥ karaṇa vighaṭanena
translated: The other three are by the destruction of the means.

analyzed: asiddhiḥ parāmarśa
translated: Non-establishment is by the destruction of the reflection

analyzed: ṣi vaya vighaṭanena
translated: by the destruction of the means.

analyzed: tatra api āśraya asiddhi svarūpa asiddhī pakṣa dharma tā vighaṭanena
translated: Even there, by the destruction of the subject's non-establishment, the form's non-establishment, and the property of the subject's destruction.

analyzed: vyāpya tva asiddhiḥ tu vyāpti vighaṭanena
translated: But the non-establishment of the pervaded is by the destruction of the pervasion.

analyzed: tat māt vau eva hetu doṣau iti ayuktam iti āhuḥ
translated: Therefore, these two alone are faults of the reason, it is not proper, they say.

analyzed: vyanakti
translated: He explains the fault of being non-eternal with Anukūle etc.

analyzed: na tu karaṇa iti
translated: But not in the instrument.

analyzed: parāmarśa rūpa karaṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in the instrument in the form of reflection.

analyzed: anumiti iti
translated: Anumiti means
the cognition having the absence as its object, which is to be grasped by the inference produced by the previously employed reason.

analyzed: itaraḥ iti
translated: The other means

analyzed: savyabhicāra viruddha asiddhāḥ trayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the three: the contradictory, the contrary, and the unestablished.

analyzed: dvāra iti anantaram anumiti pratibandhaka tā iti anukarṣaḥ
translated: After door, the state of being an impediment to inference is continued.

original: tvaduktarītyā pāñcavidhyasambhavepi tena rūpeṇa jñātānāṃ teṣāmanumityapratibandhakatayā
analyzed: tvad ukta rītyā pāñcavidhya sambhave pi tena rūpeṇa jñātānām teṣām anumiti apratibandhaka tayā
translated: Even though the fivefoldness is not possible according to your method, those known in that form are not impediments to inference.

analyzed: tathā anudbhāvya tvena evam vyutpādanam api tu asmad ukta rītyā eva tena rūpeṇa jñātānām anumiti pratibandhaka tvāt udbhāvanīya tvāt ca iti
translated: Therefore, this explanation is most improper because they are not to be brought forward in that way. But according to our method, they are to be brought forward because they are impediments to inference when known in that form.

analyzed: bhāvena ukta rītyā jñātānām pratibandhaka tvam iti etat asādhaka tā liṅga tvam ca ityādinā vaktum
translated: To state that the hindrance of what is known in the stated manner by the mode of existence is the reason for being inconclusive, etc.,

analyzed: sāmānya nyāyam āha yad rūpeṇa iti
translated: he states the general principle thus: By the form of which, etc.

analyzed: yad dharma prakāreṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: by the mode of which property.🔽How? Even in that case, the cognition is an inference.

original: rā kathamapi bodhonumiti ka / rātatrāpyanu ṭa / /yapramātvena ga /ṭa /rā / / viṣayeti nāsti ka /ṭa /
analyzed: katham api bodhaḥ num iti ka viṣaya iti na asti
translated: The object is not mentioned in some manuscripts.

analyzed: bra pra yaḥ pra artha pra ṇavinā aikyam
translated: The unity of the author, the proponent, and the proponent of the treatise

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of faults in inference

original: tadasat yadrūpeṇa hi jñānamanumitipratibandhakaṃ tadrūpeṇaiva doṣaḥ paraṃ pratyudbhāvanīyaḥ/
analyzed: tat asat yad rūpeṇa hi jñānam anumiti pratibandhakam tad rūpeṇa eva doṣaḥ param pratyudbhāvanīyaḥ
translated: That is not so. For, by the form in which the cognition is a hindrance to inference, that form alone should be stated as a fault to the opponent.

analyzed: yad rūpeṇa ca udbhāvanam tad rūpeṇa evā asādhaka tā sādhanīyā
translated: And by the form in which it is stated, that form alone should be established as inconclusive.

original: yadrūpeṇa ca tatsādhanaṃ tadrūpeṇaiva hetvābhāsādidoṣo vibhajanīyaḥ/
analyzed: yad rūpeṇa ca tat sādhanam tad rūpeṇa eva hetvābhāsa ādi doṣaḥ vibhajanīyaḥ
translated: And by the form in which that is established, that form alone should be distinguished as the fault of fallacious reason, etc.

analyzed: anyathā anyaḥ śastrī
translated: Otherwise, one would be the plaintiff,

analyzed: anyaḥ yat ha
translated: another the defendant,

analyzed: anyaḥ jayī anyaḥ tu ślāghyaḥ iti dvairūpya āpātāt
translated: and another the victor, and still another the praiseworthy, leading to the absurdity of diversity.

analyzed: asādhaka tā sādhakasya hetvābhāva sasya aprayojaka tva āpātāt ca
translated: And because it would lead to the absurdity that the fallacious reason, which establishes the inconclusiveness, is not a reason.

analyzed: saṃbhavataḥ upi asādhaka tā sādhana ādi vyavahāra anupayoginaḥ niṣprayojanasya vibhāgasya api prasaṅgi tvāt ca
translated: And because even a division which is not useful for the purpose of the usage of proving non-establishment, etc., and is purposeless, is implied, although possible.

analyzed: sambhavanti hi hetvābhāsena antāḥ prakārāḥ
translated: For there are many kinds of fallacious reasons.

analyzed: uktam hi nyāyasāre
translated: For it is said in the Essence of Logic:

original: yadyapi caiṣāṃ sūkṣmo bhadonantatvādvaktuṃ na śakyateiti//
analyzed: yadi api ca eṣām sūkṣmaḥ bhadaḥ ūna anta tvāt vaktum na śakyate iti
translated: Although their subtle nature is endless, it cannot be stated.

analyzed: asādhaka tā iti
translated: Non-establishment means

analyzed: idam asādhakam evantvāt iti
translated: this is not a proof because of such and such a reason.

analyzed: kutas evam iti atas āha anyathā iti  vairūpyā iti
translated: How is this so? To this he says otherwise.🔽Inconsistency means

original: anyajñānaṃ pratibandhakamanyadudbhāvyaṃ tatonyadasādhakatāsādhākaṃ tadanyasya vibhāga iti vairūpyāpātādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: anya jñānam pratibandhakam anyat udbhāvyam tatonyat asādhakatā sādhākam tad anyasya vibhāgaḥ iti vairūpya āpātāt iti arthaḥ
translated: that knowledge of something else is an obstruction, something else is to be brought up, and something else proves non-establishment, and there would be inconsistency in dividing it from that. This is the meaning.

analyzed: aprayojaka tva iti
translated: Not being a reason means

analyzed: anyathā iti atra anuṣaṅgaḥ
translated: otherwise is to be supplied here.

analyzed: tad rūpeṇa jñānasya anumiti apratibandhaka tve iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that knowledge in that form is not an obstruction to inference.

original: nanvasādhakatāyāmanupayoginopi sambhavamātreṇa vibhagasyoktau ko doṣa ityata āha saṃbhavatopīti//
analyzed: nanu asādhakatāyām anupayoginaḥ api sambhava mātreṇa vibhagasya uktau kaḥ doṣaḥ iti atas āha saṃbhavataḥ api iti
translated: If it is asked what is wrong with stating a division that is not useful even in non-establishment, merely because it is possible, he says even though possible.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgi tvāt ca iti uktam vyanakti sambhavanti hi iti
translated: And because of the absurdity, it is said. He explains it by saying they are possible.

original: tathā ca teṣāmapi parigaṇanāpātena pañcaivetyuktirayukteti bhāvaḥ/ 🔽repi ga /ṭa /rā /
analyzed: tathā ca teṣām api parigaṇana āpātena pañca eva iti uktiḥ ayuktā iti bhāvaḥ  re pi gaṭarā
translated: Even so, the reason is not inconclusive.
The Nyāyakośa, with the commentary Tarka-tāṇḍava, by Viśvanātha.

analyzed: asādhaka tā aliṅga tvam ca bādha pratirodhayoḥ ubhaya anugatena
translated: And the reason of being non-establishe is only by the contradiction of the proposition and the evidence, which is common to both contradiction and obstruction.

original: na tu bādhatvādinā bādhitatvātprati ruddhatvādityasya hi prabalasamabalapramāṇaviruddhatvādityarthaḥ/
analyzed: na tu bādha tva ādinā bādhita tvāt prati ruddha tvāt iti asya hi prabala sama bala pramāṇa viruddha tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But not by the fact of being contradicted and obstructed by the word contradiction etc. For this means being contradicted by strong and equal evidence.

analyzed: te ca prakārāḥ pramāṇalakṣaṇaṭīkāyām vyaktāḥ
translated: And those modes are clearly stated in the commentary on the Lakṣaṇakārikā.

original: astvevaṃ yena rūpeṇa jñānamityādinoktaṃ prakṛte kiyityataḥ
analyzed: astu evam yena rūpeṇa jñānam ityādinā uktam prakṛte kiyiti atas
translated: Let it be so. What is the relevance of what is stated beginning with by what form is it known etc.?

analyzed: virodhaḥ upi trividhā eva syāt pratijñā artha viruddha tā
translated: Obstruction also would be of three kinds: contradiction with the meaning of the proposition,

analyzed: liṅga rāhityam avyāptiḥ  iti yuktipādīya anuvyākhyāna vyākhyā avasare sudhā ukta rītim anusṛtya āha asādhaka tā liṅga tvam ca iti
translated: deficiency of the reason, and over-pervasion.🔽At the time of explaining the commentary on the Anuvṛttyāṭika of Nyāyapraveśa, following the method stated in the Sudha, it is said: And the reason of being non-establisher is only by the contradiction of the proposition and the evidence, which is common to both contradiction and obstruction.

original: kuta ityataḥ vahniranuṣṇaḥ padārthatvādityādau vādinokte prativādinā padārthatvāditi hetuḥ asādhakaḥ
analyzed: kutas iti atas vahniḥ anuṣṇaḥ padārtha tvāt ityādau vādinā ukte prativādinā padārtha tvāt iti hetuḥ asādhakaḥ
translated: Why? Because when the opponent states in the debate that fire is not hot because it is a substance, the counter-opponent says that the reason because it is a substance is not a proof.

original: bādhitatvātsatpratipakṣatvādityucyate sati vādinā vyarthaviśeṣaṇatvadūṣaṇaṃ vaktumāpādyata ityāha bādhitatvā pratiruddhatvādityasya hīti//🔽nanu viruddhatvādijñānādeva svārthānumiteriva parārthānumiterapipratibandhakātkimasādhakatānumānena🔽yadvākye prativādyuktadūṣaṇāvagatiḥ sa nigṛhīta iti samayabandhena kathāpravṛttau🔽dūṣaṇamātramudbhāvyam anyathārthāntaratvam/
analyzed: bādhita tvāt sat pratipakṣa tvāt iti ucyate sati vādinā vyartha viśeṣaṇa tva dūṣaṇam vaktum āpādyate iti āha bādhita tvā pratiruddha tvāt iti asya hi iti  nanu viruddha tva ādi jñānāt eva sva artha anumiteḥ iva para artha anumiteḥ api pratibandhakāt kim asādhakatā anumānena  yad vākye prativādi ukta dūṣaṇa avagatiḥ sa nigṛhītaḥ iti samaya bandhena kathā pravṛttau  dūṣaṇa mātram udbhāvyam anyathā artha antara tvam
translated: It is said to be contradicted because it has a counter-argument. When the proponent states the fault of useless qualification, it is deduced. He says because it is contradicted, because it is refuted, because it is contradicted, because it is refuted.🔽But from the knowledge of contradiction etc., like one's own inferred meaning, the other's inferred meaning is also obstructed. What is the use of inferring non-establishment?🔽Or, when a debate proceeds by the rule that one is defeated when one understands the fault stated by the opponent,🔽only the fault should be stated, otherwise it would be a different matter.🔽

original: evaṃ cāsādhakatānumānasyaivānāvaśyakatvādvyarthaviśeṣaṇatvānavakāśa iti cenna/🔽dvayaṃ hyuddeśyam/🔽tatrādyaṃ dūṣaṇamātrajñānādeva ddvītīyaṃ tu 🔽tārthapraṭa /rā / / tipakṣatvādiga /rā / /ta āha bādhitatvāditi ityadhikamṭa / /tvādityasyahīti ityevāsti ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / 🔽bāprayoprarthapraṇavinaikyam🔽anumādoṣavādaḥ pu /
analyzed: evam ca asādhakatā anumānasya eva anāvaśyaka tvāt vyartha viśeṣaṇa tva anavakāśaḥ iti ced na 🔽dvayam hi uddeśyam 🔽tatra ādyam dūṣaṇa mātra jñānāt eva tu 🔽te āha bādhita tvāt iti iti adhikam tvāt iti iti eva asti 🔽bā pra yo pra artha pra ṇavinā aikyam 🔽anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: Because it is contradicted, because it has a counter-argument, it is said. When the disputant is present, the fault of having a useless qualifier is to be stated by the opponent, it is said because it is contradicted, because it is refuted, because it is contradicted,
