translated: And when the favorable reasoning has arrived, even if the uncommonness has been overcome, and in the state of ignorance of non-pervasion, there is no obstruction to inference even when there is knowledge of being excluded from all similar instances.

analyzed: tasmāt asādhāraṇaḥ vyāptau antarbhūtaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, the uncommon [reason] is included only within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason].

analyzed: etat eva abhipretya paddhatau asādhāraṇa prastāve sarvathāvyāptau antarbhūtaḥ iti uktam
translated: With this very intention, in the Padarthadharmasangraha, in the section on the uncommon [reason], it is said that it is entirely included within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason].

analyzed: kecid tu asādhāraṇaḥ sarva sapakṣa vyāvṛtta tvāt sādhya abhāvasya
translated: However, some say that the uncommon [reason] is included within the contradictory [reason], because it excludes all similar instances where the probandum is absent,

analyzed: sarva vipakṣa vyāvṛtta tvāt sādhyasya ca sādhakaḥ iti sat pratipakṣa antarbhūtaḥ
translated: and because it establishes the probandum by excluding all dissimilar instances.

analyzed: na hi virodhe sva bhinna tvam tantram
translated: For in contradiction, being different from itself is not the criterion.

analyzed: gauravāt iti āhuḥ
translated: They say it is because of the burden [of the reason].

analyzed: asādhāraṇasya avyāpta antarbhāvaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the uncommon [reason] within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason] is explained.

analyzed: m iti āha anukūla tarkaḥ iti
translated: He says a favorable argument [means]

analyzed: avyāpti ajñāna daśāyām iti
translated: in the state of not knowing over-exclusiveness.

analyzed: tathā ca anvaya vyatirekābhyām avyāptiḥ eva doṣaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And the idea is that over-exclusiveness itself is a fault by the methods of agreement and difference.

analyzed: kecid iti
translated: Some [means]

analyzed: tārkika ekadeśinaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that they are some logicians.

original: tadā tu pratijñāvirodhentarbhāva spaṣṭa iti bhāvaḥ//🔽asādhāraṇasyāptāvantarbhāvaḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā tu spaṣṭaḥ iti bhāvaḥ  asādhāraṇasya āptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Then the inclusion within the contradiction with the thesis is clear, that is the idea.🔽The inclusion of the uncommon [reason] within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason] is explained.

analyzed: apa saṃ naḥ avi antarvaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the non-pervasion [reason] within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason] is explained.🔽The statement on the faults of inference is finished.

analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ vyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the non-pervasion [reason] within the over-exclusive [fallacious reason] is explained.

original: anupasaṃhāritvamapi na tāvavdyāptigrahānukūlaikadharmyupasaṃhārābhāvaḥ/🔽vyāptyabhāva vatvādityetāvatai va pūrṇatvena śeṣavaiyarthyāt/
analyzed: anupasaṃhāri tvam api na tāvat dyāpti graha anukūla eka dharmi upasaṃhāra abhāvaḥ  vyāpti abhāva va tvāt iti etāvatā e pūrṇa tvena śeṣa vaiyarthyāt
translated: Nor is the non-inclusion of the two [types of fallacious reasons] simply the absence of the inclusion of a single subject favourable to the apprehension of the pervasion.🔽Because it is complete with just that much [i.e. the absence of the pervasion], the remainder is useless.

analyzed: sādhāraṇa ādi vyāvṛtti artham iti tu nirastam
translated: But the [view] that [the two types of fallacious reasons] are stated in order to exclude [reasons] that are common to both [similar and dissimilar instances] and so on, has been refuted.

analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ vyāptau antarbhāvaḥ  maṇau hi vyāpti graha anukūla eka dharmi upasaṃhāra abhāvaḥ yatra sa hetu abhimataḥ nupasaṃhārī
translated: The non-inclusion [of the two types of fallacious reasons] is included in the [fallacious reason] that is not pervaded [by the property to be established].🔽For in the [Tattva]mañjarī, the absence of the inclusion of a single subject favourable to the apprehension of the pervasion, where that is, is said to be the non-inclusion [of the two types of fallacious reasons] that is accepted as a reason.

analyzed: kevala anvayi dharma avacchinna pakṣakaḥ vā iti lakṣaṇa dvayam uktam
translated: And two definitions have been stated: [either] a reason that is restricted to a property that is only positive [i.e. a reason that is present in all similar instances but absent in all dissimilar instances], or [a reason] that has a subject that is restricted to a property that is only positive [i.e. a reason that is present in all similar instances but absent in all dissimilar instances].

analyzed: tatra ādyam tāvat apākaroti na tāvat iti
translated: Among them, he first refutes the first [definition] with [the words] Not only...

original: vyāptigrahasyānukūlo ya ekasmin dharmiṇyupasaṃhāraḥ sahacāragrahaḥ tadabhāva ityarthaḥ/
analyzed: vyāpti grahasya anukūlaḥ yaḥ ekasmin dharmiṇi upasaṃhāraḥ sahacāra grahaḥ tad abhāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the absence of the inclusion, which is favourable to the apprehension of the pervasion, of a single subject, which is the apprehension of co-occurrence.

analyzed: pakṣe sandeha rūpa sahacāra graha satvena tad abhāvaḥ usaṃbhavati iti atas vyāpti graha anukūlā iti uktam
translated: Because the apprehension of co-occurrence in the form of doubt exists in the subject, the absence of that is not possible. Therefore, [the words] favourable to the apprehension of the pervasion are stated.

analyzed: tādṛśaḥ tu sahacāra niścayaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that such is the ascertainment of co-occurrence.

analyzed: vyāpti abhāvāt iti
translated: [The words] because of the absence of the pervasion [are stated].

original: vyāptyabhāvo yatra sonupasaṃhārītyetāvatā pūrṇatve vyāptigrahānukūlaikadharmisahacāragrahābhāva ityetāvanna vācyamityarthaḥ/🔽sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇaviruddhabādhādāvapi vyāptyabhāvostītyativyāptinirāsāyaivaṃ vinyāsa ityata āha sādhāraṇeti//
analyzed: vyāpti abhāvaḥ yatra saḥ unupasaṃhārī iti etāvatā pūrṇa tve vyāpti graha anukūla eka dharmi sahacāra graha abhāvaḥ iti etāvat na vācyam iti arthaḥ  sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa viruddha bādha ādau api vyāpti abhāvaḥ usti iti ativyāpti nirāsāya evam vinyāsaḥ iti atas āha sādhāraṇa iti
translated: The meaning is that when it is complete by just saying that where there is absence of pervasion, that is not a reason, it should not be said that there is absence of the cognition of concomitance with just one similar instance favorable to the cognition of pervasion.🔽In order to remove over-extension even in the case of common, uncommon, contradictory, and contradicted [reasons], the arrangement is made in this way. Therefore, he says common etc.
The meaning is that it has been refuted because it has been said that when there is the same seed of fault, its exclusion is not possible.🔽existence etc. existence etc.

original: bhāvādityetā ka / bhāva itye ga /ṭa /🔽rā / / tā pūrṇatve śeṣa ga /ṭa / rā / /tānupaṭha / /idaṃ pratīkagrahaṇaṃ nāsti ṭha / /kyeti vyāvṛ ṭha /
analyzed: bhāvāt ityetā ka bhāvaḥ itye gaṭa  rā tā pūrṇa tve idam pratīka grahaṇam na asti idam pratīka grahaṇam na asti
translated: when it is complete, the rest.🔽in the exclusion of that.
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

original: kiñcopasaṃhāraśabdena sahacārajñānavivakṣāyāṃ sahacārajñānasya svarūpasata evanumitipratibandhakatayā tvanmate hetvābhāvasatvameva na /
analyzed: kiñca upasaṃhāra śabdena sahacāra jñāna vivakṣāyām sahacāra jñānasya svarūpa sataḥ eva anumiti pratibandhaka tayā tvad mate hetvābhāva satvam eva na
translated: Moreover, if the knowledge of concomitance is meant by the word 'upasaṃhāra', then according to your view, the presence of the reason is not due to the mere existence of the knowledge of concomitance being a hindrance to inference.

analyzed: mad mate tu vyāpti pramiti asiddhau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: But according to our view, it is included in the non-establishment of the cognition of pervasion.

analyzed: uktam hi sudhāyām
translated: For it has been said in Sudhā:

analyzed: asiddhiḥ ca dvividhā
translated: And non-establishment is of two kinds.

analyzed: svarūpa sataḥ jñānataḥ ca iti
translated: From the point of view of its own nature and ignorance.

analyzed: sahacāra vivakṣāyām tu viruddha upādhi sāṅkaryam
translated: But when co-occurrence is intended, there is a mixture of contradictory conditions.

analyzed: tvad mate viruddhe pi asahacārasya eva upādhi tvāt
translated: Because even in a contradiction, according to your view, non-co-occurrence alone is a condition.

original: nanu vyāptyabhāvasya dūṣakatābījatve syādevaṃ na caivaṃ kintūktarūpopādhirevetyataḥ evamapi viruddhasāṅkaryameveti vaktumāha kiñceti//
analyzed: nanu vyāpti abhāvasya dūṣakatā bīja tve syāt evam na ca evam kintu ukta rūpa upādhiḥ eva iti atas evam api viruddha sāṅkaryam eva iti vaktum āha kiñca iti
translated: But if the absence of pervasion is the seed of fault, it would be so, but it is not so. Rather, it is a condition in the stated form. Therefore, even in this way, there is only a mixture of contradictions. To say this, he says and moreover.

analyzed: upasaṃhāra śabdena sahacāra jñāna grahe tad abhāvasya sahacāra jñāna abhāva rūpa tvāt sahācāra jñānasya iti uktam
translated: By the word conclusion, the absence of that is of the form of the absence of the knowledge of co-occurrence, because it is the apprehension of the knowledge of co-occurrence.

analyzed: pakṣadhara ādi uktam eva āha hetvābhāsa tvam eva na iti
translated: He states what is said by Pakṣadhara and others, that it is not even the nature of a fallacious reason.

original: anumitikāraṇībhūtābhāvapratiyogiyathārthajñānaviṣayatvaṃ vā jñāyamānaṃ sat yadanumitipratibandhakaṃ tatvaṃ vā hetvābhāsatvamityukteriti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: anumiti kāraṇībhūta abhāva pratiyogi yathārtha jñāna viṣaya tvam vā jñāyamānam sat yat anumiti pratibandhakam vā hetvābhāsa tvam iti ukteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that being the object of correct knowledge which is the absence that is the counter-correlate of the cause of inference, or being the obstruction to that inference, is the nature of a fallacious reason. This is stated.

analyzed: viruddhā iti
translated: Contradictory etc.

analyzed: yatva jñāyamāna daśāyām sat hetau ativyāpti nirāsāya sādhya sahacāra niścaya virodhi hetvābhāsa tā upādhi tvam
translated: In order to remove the over-extension when it is not known, the nature of a fallacious reason as a condition that is contradictory to the ascertainment of co-occurrence with the probandum,

analyzed: vivakṣitam ced api viruddha itivyāptam iti atas sva sādhyasiddhi anukūla vyāpti graha anukūla sahacāra tva avacchanni niścaya virodhi hetvābhāsa tā upādhi tvasya  vivakṣita tvāt
translated: Even if what is intended is contradictory, there is over-extension, because the intended [definition] is: being a property-possessor that is the opposite of the certainty of co-existence qualified by being conducive to the ascertainment of the pervasion that is conducive to establishing one's own conclusion,🔽being a property-possessor that is the opposite of the certainty of co-existence qualified by being conducive to the ascertainment of the pervasion that is conducive to establishing one's own conclusion,

analyzed: viruddhasya vyatireka sahacāra niścaya avirodhi tvāt na tatra ativyāptiḥ iti tat na
translated: because the contradictory [reason] is not opposed to the ascertainment of co-existence in the negative, so there is no over-extension there. That is not so.

analyzed: etad ajñāne pi vyāpti abhāva jñāna mātreṇa anumiti pratibandhāt
translated: Even without knowing this, the inference is obstructed merely by the knowledge of the absence of pervasion.

analyzed: dūṣaka tā bīja aikye viruddha vyāvṛtteḥ eva ayogāt iti  apa saṃ naḥ avi antarvaḥ
translated: Because when the seed of fault is the same, it is impossible to exclude the contradictory [reason].

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference is over.

original: kiṃ ca yo niścitaḥ yatra sādhyaṃ tatra heturiti sahācārasyābhāvaḥ sa tu na
analyzed: kim ca yaḥ niścitaḥ yatra sādhyam tatra hetuḥ iti sahācārasya abhāvaḥ sa tu na
translated: Moreover, the co-existence of the ascertained [reason] and the probandum is absent where the reason is, but that is not

analyzed: sākṣāt doṣaḥ
translated: a fault directly.

analyzed: yatra hetuḥ tatra sādhyam iti vyāpti abhāva rūpa tva abhāvāt
translated: Because it is not the absence of pervasion in the form where there is the reason, there is the probandum.

analyzed: vyāpti abhāva vyāpya tayā doṣa tve ca upādhi vat avyāpti unnāyakaḥ eva syāt iti uktam
translated: And if it were a fault by being pervaded by the absence of pervasion, it would be just a suggester of the absence of pervasion, like a property-possessor. This has been stated.

original: yaśca doṣaḥ yatra hetustatra sādhyamiti sahacārasyābhāvaḥ sa tu hetumati sādhyābhāvātmakatvādavyāptireva/
analyzed: yaḥ ca doṣaḥ yatra hetuḥ tatra sādhyam iti sahacārasya abhāvaḥ sa tu hetumati sādhya abhāva ātmaka tvāt avyāptiḥ eva
translated: And the fallacy that where there is a reason, there is the probandum, is the absence of concomitance. But that is just non-pervasion, because it has the nature of the absence of the probandum where there is the reason.

analyzed: nahi sādhyā
translated: For the probandum is not

original: yadvā astvevaṃ kleśena tathāpi na pṛthagdoṣatvamityāha kiñciti/
analyzed: yat vā astu evam kleśena tathā api na pṛthak doṣa tvam iti āha kiñcid iti
translated: Or let it be so, even then it is not a separate fallacy. To this he says 'a little'.

original: vyāptigrahānukūlasahacārābhāvo 'nupasaṃhāritvamityatra yatra sādhyaṃ tatra heturityevaṃrūpasahacārasyābhāvo abhimataḥ uta yatra hetustatra
analyzed: vyāpti graha anukūla sahacāra abhāvaḥ nupasaṃhāri tvam iti atra yatra sādhyam tatra hetuḥ iti evaṃrūpa sahacārasya abhāvaḥ abhimataḥ uta yatra hetuḥ tatra
translated: Non-concomitance is non-observation of the concomitance favourable to the apprehension of pervasion. Here, is it intended that the absence of concomitance is in the form 'where there is the probandum, there is the reason', or where there is the reason, there is the probandum'?

analyzed: ādyaḥ āha yaḥ iti
translated: He says 'that' with regard to the first.

analyzed: yaḥ niścitaḥ bhāvaḥ iti anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning is 'that which is ascertained'.

analyzed: kasya iti atas yatra ityādi  yadi api vyāpti graha anukūlā iti uktatvāt asya ca a tādṛśa tvāt na asya kalpasya avatāraḥ
translated: Whose? To this he says 'where'.🔽Although this is not an occasion for this assumption, because it is said to be favourable to the apprehension of pervasion and this is not like that,

original: tathāpi saṃbhavamātreṇa vā kṛtakatvānityatvayorevamapi sahacāro vyāptigrahānukūla eveti vadantaṃ prati vāsyāvatāra ityadoṣaḥ/🔽iti vyāptyabhāvarūpatvābhāvāditi//
analyzed: tathā api saṃbhava mātreṇa vā kṛtaka tva anitya tvayoḥ evam api sahacāraḥ vyāpti graha anukūlaḥ evā iti vadantam prati vā asya avatāraḥ iti adoṣaḥ  iti vyāpti abhāva rūpa tva abhāvāt iti
translated: nevertheless, there is no fault, because this is an occasion for one who says that even in this way, the concomitance of being produced and being non-eternal is only favourable to the apprehension of pervasion, even though it is merely possible.🔽Thus, because it is not the absence of pervasion.

original: tathā ca parāmarśaviṣayābhāvatvābhāvāddoṣatvameva na syāditi bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: tathā ca parāmarśa viṣaya abhāva tva abhāvāt doṣa tvam eva na syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And the meaning is that because it is not the absence of the object of the judgment, it cannot be a fallacy.

analyzed: uktam iti
translated: 'It has been said' -

analyzed: pūrva bhaṅga ante iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is in the previous section.🔽And the fault - this qualifies 'absence'.

original: yaśca doṣa iti abhāva ityasya viśeṣaṇam/🔽avyāptireveti//
analyzed: yaḥ ca doṣaḥ iti abhāvaḥ iti asya viśeṣaṇam  avyāptiḥ eva iti
translated: 'It is only the over-extension' -

analyzed: avinābhāvaḥ hi vyāptiḥ
translated: for non-concomitance is pervasion.

analyzed: sādhyena vinā eva satve katham na avyāptiḥ
translated: How is there no over-extension when it exists even without the probandum?

analyzed: bhavati eva avyāptiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is indeed over-extension.

analyzed: nanu sādhya abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇyasya vyabhicāra tayā sā eva avyāptiḥ sādhya abhāvasya
translated: But is not the over-extension itself, since the co-existence of the absence of the probandum is a fallacy?

analyzed: hetu sāmānādhikaraṇyasya katham vyabhicāra tā
translated: How can the co-existence of the absence of the probandum with the reason be a fallacy,

analyzed: yena avyāptiḥ syāt iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: by which there would be over-extension? To this he says 'No' -

analyzed: iti avyāptiḥ
translated: thus ends the over-extension.
The Lamp of Logic along with the Tarkatandava, Third Chapter

analyzed: bhāvavati hetu satvam eva vyabhicāraḥ
translated: The mere presence of the reason in what possesses the probandum is a fallacy.

original: na tu hetumati sādhyābhāva iti yuktam/
analyzed: na tu hetumati sādhya abhāve iti yuktam
translated: But it is not proper to say that the absence of the probandum is in what possesses the reason.

analyzed: dvayoḥ api hetu sādhya abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa vyabhicāra ātmaka tva aviśeṣāt
translated: Because both are not distinguished by the nature of the fallacy of co-existence, which is the co-existence of the reason and the absence of the probandum.

original: nāpi kevalānvayidharmāvacchinnapakṣatākatvamanusaṃhāritvam anityo ghaṭaḥ ghaṭākāśobhayavṛttidvitvāśrayatvādityādi tu viruddhameveti vācyam/
analyzed: nā api kevala anvayi dharma avacchinna pakṣatāka tvam anusaṃhāri tvam anityaḥ ghaṭaḥ ghaṭa ākāśa ubhaya vṛtti dvi tva āśraya tvāt ityādi tu viruddham eva iti vācyam
translated: Nor can it be said that the property of being restricted to the subject which is delimited by a purely positive property is the property of being a conclusion, as in 'The pot is non-eternal, because it is the substratum of duality which inheres in both the pot and the sky', etc., is contradictory.

analyzed: sarvam abhidheyam prameya tvāt iti sat anumāne
translated: In the valid inference All objects are knowable because they are objects of knowledge,

analyzed: tad pratisandhāne ipi anumiti apratibandhāt
translated: even when that is remembered, there is no obstruction to inference.

analyzed: dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣa samavāya abhāvāḥ anityāḥ vastu tvāt ityādi asat anumāne tad apratisandhāne pi anumiti pratibandhāt ca
translated: And in the invalid inference Substances, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and inherence are non-eternal because they are entities, even when that is not remembered, there is also no obstruction to inference.

analyzed: maṇi uktam dvitīya lakṣaṇam api nirāha nā api iti
translated: He also refutes the second definition stated in the Mīmāṃsā, saying Nor is it...

original: anupasaṃhāraviśeṣe lakṣaṇamidamavyāptamityato maṇyuktadiśā lakṣyabahirbhāvena nirāha anityo ghaṭa iti//
analyzed: anupasaṃhāra viśeṣe lakṣaṇam idam avyāptam iti atas maṇi ukta diśā lakṣya bahirbhāvena nirāha anityaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti
translated: This definition is too narrow for non-universal cases. Therefore, he refutes it by showing that it is outside the scope of the definition, as stated in the Mīmāṃsā, saying A pot is non-eternal...

analyzed: anvaya vyatireka vyabhicāreṇa etad jñānasya anumiti apratibandhaka tayā jñāyamāne sati anumiti pratibandhaka tva
translated: By the contradiction of positive and negative concomitance, this knowledge is not an obstruction to inference. Even when known, it is an obstruction to inference.

analyzed: rūpa ukta hetvābhāsa tā upādhi tva abhāvāt hetvābhāva satvam eva na iti bhāvena vyabhicārā
translated: Because it does not have the nature of being a fallacy of a reason or a superimposition as stated, it is the absence of a fallacy of a reason itself. The idea is that it does not exist. Contradiction is

analyzed: vā āha uttīrṇā iti
translated: stated as Uttīrṇa...

analyzed: bahuvrīhiḥ
translated: It is a bahuvrīhi compound.

analyzed: vipakṣa vyāghāta ādi tarka balena iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is by the power of reasoning such as contradiction with the vipakṣa.

analyzed: tad a pratibandhāne pi iti atra
translated: Even when that is not remembered means here

analyzed: pakṣa tā avacchedakasya akevala anvayi tvena kevala anvayi dharma avacchinna pakṣatāka tva pratisandhānasya atra anudayāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the recollection of the probandum being qualified by the property which is only concomitant with the pervader of the property which is the differentiator of the locus of the probans does not occur here, because the differentiator of the locus of the probans is not only concomitant.

analyzed: yathāśruta mūlasya lakṣaṇam ukta doṣa parihārāya śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: The meaning of the original text as it stands is stated by the commentator to be the definition intended by the author of the Nyaya-mañjarī, in order to avoid the faults mentioned, he raises the objection But is it not so?

original: nesatpra rā / /tvāduktahe ṭa /ḍa / /tvadyuktahe ṭha / /raṃ cā ṭha /
analyzed: rā tvādukta he tvad yukta he tvad yukta he ṭha raṃ cā ṭha
translated: Because of the non-existence of the probandum, the stated reason is not established. The stated reason is not correct.

analyzed: apa saṃ naḥ avi antarvaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The end of the chapter on the fallacy of inconclusive reason.
Is it not that the property of being present only in what has the doubtful probandum is non-conclusion?

analyzed: asyām daśāyām asādhāraṇaḥ upi anupasaṃhāri ced
translated: If the uncommon reason is also a non-conclusion in this state,

analyzed: tathā api asādhāraṇa prastāva ukta rītyā tarka anavatāra daśāyām tarka abhāvāt eva sandigdha avyāpteḥ
translated: then also, in accordance with the method stated in the section on the uncommon reason, due to the absence of reasoning in the state where reasoning does not enter, there is doubtful over-pervasion.

analyzed: tad avatāra daśāyām tu na doṣaḥ
translated: But in the state where it does enter, there is no fault.

original: uttīrṇavasthe 'numāne sandehābhāvena sandigdhāsādhyavṛttitvaṃ nāstīti tatra tadanusandhānasyaivāyogena nānvayavyabhicāraḥ/
analyzed: uttīrṇa avasthe numāne sandeha abhāvena sandigdha asādhya vṛtti tvam nā asti iti tatra tad anusandhānasya eva ayogena nā anvaya vyabhicāraḥ
translated: In the inference in the state of transcendence, there is no presence in what has the doubtful probandum due to the absence of doubt. Therefore, due to the impossibility of recollecting that there, there is no positive vyabhicāra.

original: dravyaguṇetyādau ca sandigdhasādhyavanmātre pakṣe hetor vṛttimatvena tatra tadanusandhānasambhavena tenaivānumitipratibandhānna vyatirekavyabhicāro
analyzed: dravya guṇa ityādau ca sandigdha sādhyavat mātre pakṣe hetoḥ vṛttimatvena tatra tad anusandhāna sambhavena tena eva anumiti pratibandhāt na vyatireka vyabhicāraḥ
translated: And in the case of 'substance' and 'quality', etc., where the reason occurs in a subject where only the probandum is doubtful, since the remembrance of that is possible there, the inference is prevented by that alone, so there is no vyatireka-vyabhicāra (inconsistency in the vyatireka relation).

analyzed: pi iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

analyzed: nanu evam api sarvam abhidheyam meya tvāt ityādau anuttīrṇa anupasaṃhāri tva daśāyām avyāptiḥ  tatra sādhya abhāva aprasiddhyā sādhya sandeha abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: Even so, in the case of 'all that is denoted is measurable because it is measurable', etc., there is over-extension in the stage of non-conclusion that has not been overcome.🔽If it is argued that this is because the absence of the probandum is not well-known there, and hence there is no doubt about the probandum, it is not so.

original: idamabhidheyaṃ na vetyevaṃ sandehābhāvepyanabhidheyatvamatrāsti na vetyevaṃ sandehasya tatrāpi saṃbhavāditi bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: idam abhidheyam na vā iti evam sandeha abhāve pi anabhidheya tvam atra asti na vā iti evam sandehasya tatra api saṃbhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that even in the absence of doubt as to whether this is denoted or not, there is doubt as to whether non-denotation exists there or not.

analyzed: nanu idam pakṣa mātra vṛtya sādhāraṇe tivyāptam iti atas āha asyām iti
translated: It is argued that this is over-extended in the common (reason) that occurs only in the subject, to which he replies 'in this'.

analyzed: sandigdha sādhyavat mātra vṛtti tvam anupasaṃhāri tvam iti daśāyām sandigdha sādhyavat mātra vṛtti tva anusandhāna daśāyām vā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it occurs only in what is doubtful as having the probandum, or in the stage of remembering that it occurs only in what is doubtful as having the probandum.

analyzed: na doṣaḥ iti
translated: There is no fault.

analyzed: hetvābhāsa tvam eva na iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not even a fallacious reason.

original: rucidattādau tu sandigdhasādhyavanmātravṛttitvajñāne satyapi śabdāvdyāptigrahasaṃbhave tasya na vyāptidhīpratibandhadvārānumitipratibandhakatvam/
analyzed: rucidatta ādau tu sandigdha sādhyavat mātra vṛtti tva jñāne sati api tasya na vyāpti dhī pratibandha dvārā anumiti pratibandhaka tvam
translated: But in the case of Ruci, Datta, etc., even when there is knowledge of the mere presence of the probandum in doubt, the apprehension of the pervasion by the word is possible. That does not have the nature of obstructing the inference by the door of obstructing the cognition of pervasion.

original: sādhyasāmānādhikaraṇya sandehasya yogyatāsaṃśayaparyavasannatayā tatrāpratibandhakatvena tatsāmagryāḥ sutarāmapratibandhakatvāditi dūṣaṇamuktam/🔽pūrvaṃ sandigdhāvyā
analyzed: sādhya sāmānādhikaraṇya sandehasya yogyatā saṃśaya paryavasanna tayā tatra apratibandhaka tvena tad sāmagryāḥ sutarām apratibandhaka tvāt iti dūṣaṇam uktam  pūrvam sandigdhā avyā
translated: The fault has been stated that the doubt of co-existence with the probandum, ending in the doubt of fitness, does not have the nature of obstructing there, and hence the collection of that certainly does not have the nature of obstructing.

original: tumatvena na tatra ṭa /ḍa / /ttisādhāraṇe ṭa /ḍa / /tu iti na ṭa /ṭha / /saṃśayajñānasya ṭha / sandehayogyatā ḍa /
analyzed: tuma tvena na tatra tti sādhāraṇe tu iti na saṃśaya jñānasya sandeha yogya tā
translated: Previously, due to doubtful non-pervasion, there is no common locus there. Due to the doubt being in the probandum alone, the knowledge of doubt is not in the probandum. Due to the doubt being in the probandum alone, the knowledge of doubt is not in the probandum.

analyzed: yadvā anupasaṃhāriṇi sarvasya api pakṣa tvena anvaya vyāpteḥ vyatireka vyāpteḥ vā grahaṇa asaṃbhavāt vyāpti pramiti asiddhau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter🔽Or, in the case of a non-conclusion, when everything is taken as the subject, the apprehension of the pervasion by positive concomitance or the pervasion by negative concomitance is impossible. Therefore, it is included in the non-establishment of the cognition of pervasion.

original: yadvāsādhāraṇe uktarītyā mitrātanayatvādiriva pakṣa eva sādhyasandehātsandigdhāvyāptaḥ//
analyzed: yat vā asādhāraṇe ukta rītyā mitrātanaya tva ādiḥ iva pakṣaḥ eva sādhya sandehāt sandigdha avyāptaḥ
translated: Or, in the case of a unique reason, like the son of a barren woman, etc., due to the doubt regarding the probandum in the subject itself, it has doubtful pervasion.

analyzed: etat eva abhipretya uktam paddhatau
translated: With this very thing in mind it is said in the Paddhati:

analyzed: sarvam kṣaṇikam satvāt iti ayam api ubhaya saṃbandha abhāvāt avyāptau antarbhūtaḥ iti
translated: This [reason] 'because of being an existent' is also included in over-extension, because of the absence of a relation to both [the property to be proved and the property to be negated].

original: kecittu sarvaṃ kṣaṇikaṃ satvādityatra pakṣa eva sādhyābhāvenaiva saṃbandhāvagamāt/
analyzed: kecid tu sarvam kṣaṇikam satvāt iti atra pakṣe eva sādhya abhāvena eva saṃbandha avagamāt
translated: But some [say] that in the case of 'everything is momentary because of being an existent', the relation of the probandum with the probandum itself is understood in the subject.

original: sarvamanityaṃ satvādityādau tu pakṣa eva sādhyābhāvenāpi
analyzed: sarvam anityam satvāt ityādau tu pakṣe eva sādhya abhāvena api
translated: But in the case of 'everything is impermanent because of being an existent', etc., the relation of the probandum with the probandum itself is also understood in the subject.

analyzed: idānīm vyāpti pramiti asiddhau antarbhāvam āha yat vā iti
translated: Now, in the case of the non-establishment of the ascertainment of pervasion, he says that it is included in [the fallacy of] doubtful pervasion, beginning with 'or'.

original: pūrvaṃ tarkānavatāre hetoraprayojakatvāhitasādhyasāmānādhikaraṇyamādāyāvyāptāvantarbhāva🔽uktaḥ adhunānyatra sādhyena tadabhāvena vā sahācāradarśanāhitasādhyasāmānādhikaraṇyasaṃśayamādāya🔽sandigdhāvyāptatvamāha yadvāsādhāraṇa iti anumānamātrocchedaprasaṅganirāsāyo
analyzed: pūrvam tarka anavatāre hetoḥ aprayojaka tva āhita sādhya sāmānādhikaraṇyam ādāya avyāptau antarbhāva  uktaḥ adhunā anyatra sādhyena tad abhāvena vā saha ācāra darśana āhita sādhya sāmānādhikaraṇya saṃśayam ādāya  sandigdha avyāpta tvam āha yadvā asādhāraṇaḥ iti
translated: Previously, when there was no entry of reasoning, the non-concomitance of the reason with the probandum was taken and included in over-extension,🔽because it was said to be the cause of the non-establishment of the probandum. Now, taking the doubt of non-concomitance of the probandum with the probandum itself or with its absence, which is caused by the observation of the occurrence elsewhere with the probandum or with its absence,🔽he says that it is included in doubtful pervasion, beginning with 'or'. In order to avoid the consequence of the destruction of inference itself,

analyzed: ktarītyā iti mitrātanaya tvadeḥ iva iti ca uktam
translated: he says 'according to the stated method' and 'like being the son of a friend, etc.'.

analyzed: śākapākaja tva ādi rūpa upādhi sandeha āhita sādhya sandeha vat vṛtti tvena mitrātanaya tva ādeḥ yathā
translated: As in the case of being a friend's son, where the pervasion is doubtful due to the doubt about the conclusion caused by the doubt about the limiting conditions such as being cooked with vegetables,

analyzed: sandigdhā vyāpta tvam tathā sādhya tad abhāvābhyām sahacāra darśana āhita sādhya sandeha prayukta sandigdha avyāpta tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: similarly, the doubtful pervasion is due to the doubt about the conclusion caused by the observation of concomitance with the conclusion and its absence.

analyzed: prakāra antareṇa avyāpti antarbhāvam para mukhena āha kecid iti  pakṣaḥ eva iti
translated: In another way, he shows the inclusion of over-extension from the perspective of others, saying some etc.🔽Only in the subject means

analyzed: pratyabhijñayā ghaṭa ādeḥ sarvasya sthāyi tva niścayāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the idea is that by recognition, the permanence of everything like a pot is ascertained.

analyzed: sādhya abhāvena api iti
translated: Even by the absence of the conclusion means

analyzed: kvacid nitya tvasya api niścayāt iti bhāvaḥ  atra arici bījam
translated: the idea is that in some cases, permanence is also ascertained.🔽Here is the seed of the argument

analyzed: prasaṅga nirāsāya āha ukta digdhavyā kagarā
translated: the reason is not stated. To remove the objection, he says as stated etc.

analyzed: apa saṃ naḥ avi antarvaḥ
translated: The inclusion of over-extension is removed.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.

analyzed: saṃbandha avagamāt avyāptaḥ
translated: It is over-extensive because the relation is understood.

analyzed: sarvam abhidheyam prameya tvāt iti tu sat anumānam eva iti āhuḥ
translated: But they say that everything that is expressible is an object of knowledge is a valid inference.

original: etenāvyāptiṃ pratyupajīvyatvādanumapasaṃhāritvameva doṣa ityavyāptyajñānadaśāyāmanupasaṃhāritvamapi doṣa iti ca nirastam/
analyzed: etena avyāptim pratyupajīvya tvāt anumapasaṃhāri tvam eva doṣaḥ iti avyāpti ajñāna daśāyām anupasaṃhāri tvam api doṣaḥ iti ca nirastam
translated: By this (argument) it is refuted that the fault is only non-conclusion with regard to over-extension, because it is subordinate to it, and that non-conclusion is also a fault in the state of ignorance of over-extension.

analyzed: tvad ukta lakṣaṇa traye ādyasya niṣkarṣe svayam eva avyāpti rūpa tvāt
translated: Because the first (of the three characteristics stated by you) is itself over-extension in its essence.

analyzed: dvitīyasya svatas doṣa tva abhāvāt
translated: Because the second (characteristic) is not a fault in itself.

analyzed: tṛtīyasya ca svayam eva sandigdha avyāpya tvāt
translated: And because the third (characteristic) itself has doubtful pervasion.

analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ vyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Inclusion of non-concluding reasons in over-extension.

original: tu sādhyasandehavānpakṣa iti mate sarvasya sādhyasandehavatvena tadabhāvāniścayātsādhyābhāvenaiveti🔽pakṣasya sādhyābhāvenāpīti pakṣasya coyāgāt pakṣe sandigdhasādhyābhāvasaṃbandhena
analyzed: tu sādhya sandehavān pakṣaḥ iti mate sarvasya sādhya sandehava tvena tad abhāva aniścayāt sādhya abhāvena eva iti  pakṣasya sādhya abhāvena api iti pakṣasya coyāgāt pakṣe sandigdha sādhya abhāva saṃbandhena
translated: But according to the view that the subject is one who has doubt about the probandum, since everything has doubt about the probandum, the absence of that (doubt) is not ascertained. Therefore, it is said to be only by the absence of the probandum.🔽And because the subject is stated to be by the absence of the probandum in the subject, and because of the possibility of doubtful relation between the absence of the probandum and the subject in over-extension,

analyzed: ca avyāpta tve pi prasaṅgāt asmad ukta diśā sandigdha avyāpta tvasya eva āpanna tvāt ca iti
translated: it is also established as doubtful over-extension in our way.

analyzed: maṇi uktam eva pṛthak doṣa tva prakāram anūdya nirāha etena iti
translated: He states the way of being a separate fault stated in the jewel and refutes it with By this (argument).

original: sarvasapakṣavyāvṛttatvādyajñāne vyapterajñānāttatpratisandhāna eva jñāyamānatvāttasyopajīvyatvamiti bhāvaḥ/🔽tatra hetumāha tvadukteti//
analyzed: sarva sapakṣa vyāvṛtta tva ādi ajñāne vyapteḥ ajñānāt tad pratisandhāne eva jñāyamāna tvāt tasya upajīvya tvam iti bhāvaḥ  tatra hetum āha tvad ukta iti
translated: The idea is that because it is excluded from all similar instances, and because the pervasion is not known when the reason is not known, it is known only when that [reason] is remembered, and therefore it is the basis of the other.

analyzed: ādyasya iti
translated: There, he states the reason with what you have said.🔽Of the first means

analyzed: vyāpti graha anukūla eka dharmi upasaṃhāra abhāvaḥ iti asya
translated: of the absence of the restriction of a single substratum favorable to the apprehension of the pervasion.

analyzed: avyāpti rūpa tvāt iti
translated: Because of the form of non-pervasion means

analyzed: kiñca ityādinā prāk upapādanāt tathā ca abhede katham upajīvya upajīvaka bhāvaḥ
translated: And moreover, because it has been previously established, and thus how can there be the relation of the based and the basis in the case of non-difference?

analyzed: dvitīye kevala anvayi ityādinā ukta lakṣaṇe nu ayabhicāra ekābhyām tad jñānasya anumiti pratibandhaka tva vyabhicārasya ukta tvāt tathā
translated: In the second, it has been stated that the knowledge of the contradiction of concomitance in the definition stated earlier as only universal etc. is an obstruction to inference, and the contradiction of that has been stated. Thus

original: ca svasyaivādoṣatve kathaṃ doṣāntaraṃ prati svayamupajīvyaṃ syāditi bhāvaḥ //
analyzed: ca svasya eva adoṣa tve katham doṣa antaram prati svayam upajīvyam syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: and how can it be the basis of another fault when it is itself faultless? This is the idea.

analyzed: tṛtīyasya iti
translated: Of the third means

analyzed: sandigdha sādhyavat mātra vṛtti tva lakṣaṇasya
translated: of the definition of being present only in what has the doubtful probandum.

analyzed: tathā ca abhedāt na upajīvya upajīvaka bhāvaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, because of non-difference, there is no relation of the based and the basis. This is the idea.

analyzed: anupasaṃhāriṇaḥ vyāptau antarbhāvaḥ  sya āyo ṭa ṭha
translated: The non-universally negative is included in the non-pervasive.
The Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter

analyzed: atha viruddhasya api avyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Now, the inclusion of contradictory [reason] in over-extension.

analyzed: viruddha tvam api vipakṣa mātra vṛtti tvam ced
translated: If contradiction also means occurring only in the dissimilar class,

analyzed: tad tyāge ca sādhāraṇa sāṅkaryeṇa avyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: the word only is meaningless.🔽And when it is abandoned, it is included in over-extension by being mixed with the common [reason].

analyzed: sādhāraṇa vyāvṛtti artham mātra padam iti tu nirastam
translated: But it has been refuted that the word only is for the exclusion of the common [reason].

analyzed: sādhya abhāva vyāpta tvam ced sādhya abhāva saṃbandhena eva alam
translated: If it means being pervaded by the absence of the probandum, it is sufficient just by the relation of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: kim vyāpti śarīra antargatena niyamena
translated: What is the use of a rule within the body of the pervasion?

analyzed: niyama aṃśa tyāge ca sādhāraṇya sāṅkaryam
translated: And when the part of the rule is abandoned, there is a mixture with the common [reason].

analyzed: atha viruddhasya api avyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: Now, the inclusion of the contradictory [reason] in over-extension.

analyzed: viruddha hetvābhāsa tva rūpa doṣasya api avyāptau antarbhāvam sudhā ādi ukta diśā
translated: Desiring to explain the inclusion of the fault in the form of being a fallacious contradictory reason in over-extension in the manner stated in the Sudha commentary,

original: kiṃ vipakṣamātravṛttitvaṃ viruddhatvaṃ vipakṣavṛttitvameva vā sādhyābhāvavyāptatvaṃ
analyzed: kim vipakṣa mātra vṛtti tvam viruddha tvam vipakṣa vṛtti tvam eva vā sādhya abhāva vyāpta tvam
translated: he considers the alternatives in his mind: Is contradiction the occurrence only in the dissimilar class, or the occurrence in the dissimilar class, or🔽being pervaded by the absence of the probandum, or

analyzed: vā sādhya abhāva saṃbandha tva mātram vā maṇi ukta rītyā sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvam
translated: merely having the relation of the absence of the probandum, or according to the view stated in the Mimamsa, being the counter-correlate of the absence of what pervades the probandum,

original: veti vikalpān hṛdi kṛtvā'dyaṃ nirāha viruddhatvamapīti //
analyzed: vā iti vikalpān hṛdi kṛtvā ādyam nirāha viruddha tvam api iti
translated: and rejects the first by saying Contradiction also means...

analyzed: mātra pada iti
translated: By the word 'only'

original: vipakṣavṛttitvamātrasyaiva sādhāraṇa iva dūṣakatvasaṃbhave sapakṣāvṛttitve satītyarthakamātrapadasya vyarthatvādityarthaḥ /
analyzed: vipakṣa vṛtti tva mātrasya eva sādhāraṇe iva dūṣaka tva saṃbhave sapakṣa avṛtti tve sati iti arthaka mātra padasya vyartha tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when the mere occurrence in the dissimilar class is sufficient to be the fallacy, the word 'only' which conveys the meaning of 'being absent in the similar class' is useless.

analyzed: dvitīye doṣam āha tad tyāge ca iti
translated: In the second, he states the fault by saying 'if that is abandoned'.

analyzed: sādhāraṇasya avyāpi antarbhāva ukteḥ sādhāraṇa sāṅkaryeṇa hetunā avyāptau antarbhāva
translated: Because the inclusion of the common in the non-pervasive is stated, the non-pervasion is included by the fallacy of the common being mixed.

analyzed: iti uktam nirastam iti  dūṣaka tā bīja sāmye tad vyāvṛtteḥ eva ayogāt iti ukta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: It is said. The refuted one.🔽The meaning is that when the seed of fallacy is the same, the exclusion of that is not possible.

analyzed: tṛtīyam anūdya nirāha sādhyā iti
translated: He raises the third and refutes it by saying 'the probandum' etc.

analyzed: caturtham nirāha niyama aṃśa iti  vi ru sya api avi antarvaḥ
translated: He refutes the fourth by saying 'in the part of the rule' etc.🔽Even the contradictory is included in the non-pervasive.

original: anumādoṣavādaḥ pu / 🔽nanu sādhyavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvaṃ viruddhatvam/ evaṃ ca na
analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ                    ca
translated: The statement of the fallacy of inference.🔽But the contradictory is the property of being the counter-correlate of the absence which is pervaded by the probandum. Thus,
there is no uselessness of the qualifier.

analyzed: nā api sādhāraṇa sāṅkaryam iti ced na
translated: Nor is there a mixture of the common. If this is said, it is not so.

original: asya hi yatra sādhyaṃ tatra sādhanābhāva iti vyāptirviruddhatvamityarthaḥ//
analyzed: asya hi yatra sādhyam tatra sādhana abhāvaḥ iti vyāptiḥ viruddha tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: For this, the pervasion that where there is the probandum, there is the absence of the prover, is the meaning of 'contradictory'.

analyzed: pañcamam āśaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He raises the fifth by saying 'but' etc.

analyzed: sādhya vyāpakībhūtaḥ yaḥ bhavaḥ tad pratiyogitvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: being the counter-correlate of that which is pervaded by the probandum.

original: nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtakatvādityatra hetvabhāvaḥ sādhyavyāpako bhavati yatra nityatvaṃ gaganādau tatra kṛtakatvābhāva iti vyāpteḥ/
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtaka tvāt iti atra hetvabhāvaḥ sādhya vyāpakaḥ bhavati yatra nitya tvam gagana ādau tatra kṛtaka tva abhāvaḥ iti vyāpteḥ
translated: In the argument Sound is eternal because it is produced, the absence of the reason is pervaded by the probandum, because wherever there is eternality, such as in the sky, there is the absence of being produced.

analyzed: na viśeṣaṇa vaiyarthyam iti
translated: There is no uselessness of the qualifier.

analyzed: yadi api atra api niyama aṃśaḥ dhikaḥ nupraviṣṭaḥ
translated: Even though here also the part of the rule is further included,

original: tathāpi sādhyasamānādhikaraṇābhāvapratiyogitvasya viṣamavyāptike saddhetau dhūmādāvapyastīti saddhetuvyāvartakatvānniyamāṃśaḥ saphala iti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: tathā api sādhya samāna adhikaraṇa abhāva pratiyogi tvasya viṣama vyāptike saddhetau dhūma ādau api asti iti saddhetu vyāvartaka tvāt niyama aṃśaḥ saphalaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: nevertheless, the property of being the counter-correlate of the absence which has the same substratum as the probandum exists even in the correct reason such as smoke which has a dissimilar pervasion. Therefore, the part of the rule which distinguishes the correct reason is fruitful.

analyzed: na api iti
translated: Nor is it a common reason.

original: sādhāraṇasya sapakṣavṛttitayā sādhyenāpi sambandhena sādhya vyāpakābhāva pratiyogitvāditi bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: sādhāraṇasya sapakṣa vṛtti tayā sādhyena api sambandhena sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because a common reason occurs in similar instances and has a relation with the probandum, it is the counter-correlate of the absence which pervades the probandum.

original: asmin lakṣaṇe 'pi viruddhasyāvyāptāva ntarbhāvaṃ vaktuṃ tasyārthaniṣkarṣaṃ tāvatkaroti asya hīti//
analyzed: asmin lakṣaṇe viruddhasya avyāptau antarbhāvam vaktum tasya artha niṣkarṣam tāvat karoti asya hi iti
translated: In this definition also, in order to state the inclusion of the contradictory in the over-pervasion, he first extracts the meaning of it. He says: This.

original: astu kiṃ tata ityata etajjñānaṃ ca na sākṣādanumitipratibandhakam anumitiviṣayābhāvānavagāhitvāt bādhapratipakṣayoreva tathātvāt kintu tatkāraṇavighaṭakatvena/
analyzed: astu kim tatas iti atas etat jñānam ca na sākṣāt anumiti pratibandhakam anumiti viṣaya abhāva anavagāhi tvāt bādha pratipakṣayoḥ eva tathātvāt kintu tad kāraṇa vighaṭaka tvena
translated: What then? This knowledge is not directly an impediment to inference, because it does not comprehend the absence of the object of inference, since only contradiction and counter-evidence have that nature. But rather it is by way of destroying its cause.

analyzed: tat ca parāmarśa viṣaya abhāva avagāhi tvena eva parāmarśa rūpa kāraṇa vighaṭana dvārā tad janya anumiti pratibandhaka tvam iti vācyam
translated: And that must be said to be the impediment to the inference produced by it by way of destroying the cause in the form of reflection itself by comprehending the absence of the object of that reflection.

original: parāmarśaviṣayaśca pakṣadharmatā vyāptiśceti dvayam/🔽tatraṃ kiṃ pakṣadharmatājñānavighaṭanadvārā vyāptijñānapratibandhanadvārā vānumitiprati
analyzed: parāmarśa viṣayaḥ ca pakṣa dharma tā vyāptiḥ ca iti dvayam  tatra kim pakṣa dharma tā jñāna vighaṭana dvārā vyāpti jñāna pratibandhana dvārā vā anumiti prati
translated: And the object of reflection is twofold: the property of the subject and pervasion.🔽There, is it by way of destroying the knowledge of the property of the subject or by way of destroying the knowledge of pervasion that it is an impediment to inference?

analyzed: sādhya avyā
translated: Or is it by way of destroying the knowledge of the absence of the property of the subject in the object of inference?🔽Or is it by way of destroying the knowledge of the absence of pervasion between the property of the subject and the probandum?

analyzed: ukta vyāpti jñānam ca na tāvat dṛṣyānumānīya pakṣa dharma tā jñāna vighaṭakam
translated: The knowledge of the stated pervasion is not, first of all, a destroyer of the knowledge of the property of the subject in the object of inference.

analyzed: viruddhe pi tad jñānasya sa tvāt
translated: Because that knowledge exists even in a contradiction.

original: kiṃ tu yatra sādhanaṃ tatra sādhyamityudāharaṇadarśitā yā dūṣyānumānīyā vyāptiḥ tajjñānapratibandhakamityeva vācyam/
analyzed: kim tu yatra sādhanam tatra sādhyam iti udāharaṇa darśi tā yā dūṣyānumānīyā vyāptiḥ tad jñāna pratibandhakam iti eva vācyam
translated: But it should be said that it is an impediment to the knowledge of that pervasion which is to be inferred from the faulty [reasoning] and which is shown in the example, where there is the means of knowledge, there is the object of knowledge.

original: tatpratibandhakatvaṃ ca kiṃ tadgrāhyā yā dūṣyānumānīyā vyāptiḥ tadabhāvaviṣayatvena kiṃ vā tadgrāhya yā vyāptistadabhāvavyāpyaviṣayatvena vā/
analyzed: tad pratibandhaka tvam ca kim tad grāhyā yā dūṣyānumānīyā vyāptiḥ tad abhāva viṣaya tvena kim vā tad grāhya yā vyāptiḥ tad abhāva vyāpya viṣaya tvena vā
translated: And what is that impediment? Is it by the absence of that pervasion which is to be inferred from the faulty [reasoning] and which is the object of that [knowledge], or is it by the absence of that pervasion which is the object of that [knowledge] and which is pervaded by that [absence]?

original: nādyaḥ/🔽dūṣikāyāḥ yatra sādhyaṃ tatra sādhanābhāva iti vyāpteḥ yatra sādhanaṃ tatra sādhyamiti
analyzed: na ādyaḥ  dūṣikāyāḥ yatra sādhyam tatra sādhana abhāvaḥ iti vyāpteḥ yatra sādhanam tatra sādhyam iti
translated: Not the first.

Because the pervasion of the faulty [reasoning], where there is the object of knowledge, there is the absence of the means of knowledge, does not have the form of the absence of pervasion which is to be inferred from the faulty [reasoning].

original: bhāve vā madabhipretasyāvyāptyantarbhāvasya siddheḥ/🔽antye 'pi kiṃ dūṣikāyā vyāpteḥ svarūpeṇa jñānaṃ dūṣyānumānīyavyāptijñānapratibandhakam kiṃ vā dūṣyānu
analyzed: bhāve vā mad abhipretasya avyāpti antarbhāvasya siddheḥ  antye pi kim dūṣikāyāḥ vyāpteḥ sva rūpeṇa jñānam dūṣya anumānīya vyāpti jñāna pratibandhakam kim vā
translated: Or if it does exist, then what I intend, namely, the inclusion of over-extension, is established.

analyzed: bandhaka tvam
translated: Even in the latter case, is the knowledge of the form of the pervasion of the faulty [reasoning] an impediment to the knowledge of the pervasion which is to be inferred from the faulty [reasoning], or is it by the absence of that pervasion which is the object of the knowledge of the faulty [reasoning]?

analyzed: ādyam nirāha na tāvat iti
translated: He rejects the first by saying not that.

analyzed: dvitīyam eva praśna pūrvam viśeṣayati kintu ityādinā
translated: He specifically asks about the second, beginning with but.

analyzed: udāharaṇa pradarśitā iti vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division is which is shown in the example.

analyzed: tatra api vikalpayati  tad pratibandhaka tvam ca iti
translated: Even there, he doubts, saying If it is the cause of obstruction.

analyzed: tad grāhya iti padacchedaḥ
translated: The word tadgrāhya is to be divided as tad and grāhya.

analyzed: pratibadhya tvena abhimata jñāna grāhya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that which is to be grasped by the cognition that is intended to be obstructed.

analyzed: dūṣikāyāḥ iti
translated: Dūṣikāyāḥ means

analyzed: sva jñāna dvārā pratibandhakībhūtāyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that which becomes an obstruction through its own cognition.

analyzed: vyāptta bhāva rūpa tva abhāvāt iti
translated: Because of the absence of the form of pervasion means
the absence of the reason is pervaded by the probandum, which is the opposite of the absolute absence based on the probandum.

original: atra ca sādhyasāmānādhikaraṇyāṃśasya sādhyābhāvasaṃbandharūpavyabhicārāṃśasya vā praveśābhāvādityarthaḥ/🔽abhyupetyāpi doṣamāha bhāveveti//
analyzed: atra ca sādhya sāmānādhikaraṇya aṃśasya sādhya abhāva saṃbandha rūpa vyabhicāra aṃśasya vā praveśa abhāvāt iti arthaḥ  abhyupetya api doṣam āha bhāva iva iti
translated: And here, the meaning is that there is no inclusion of the part of the concomitance with the probandum or the part of the deviation in the form of the relation with the absence of the probandum.🔽Even accepting [the opponent's view], he points out the fault, saying In the presence and so on.

original: vaṃ vā ga /rā / /'yatra sādhyaṃ tatra sādhanaṃ' ityanantaraṃ dūṣyānumānīyetyarabhyetāvāngranthaḥ luptaḥka /ga /rā /
analyzed: vā garāḥ yatra sādhyam tatra sādhanam iti anantaram dūṣya anumānīyā iti arabhya etāvān granthaḥ
translated: The text beginning with where there is the probandum, there is the probans up to the fallacious inference is omitted.

analyzed: ḍa  vi ru sya api avi antarvaḥ
translated: He concludes.🔽Even if contradictory, it is not internal.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on fallacious inference.
The knowledge that the absence of pervasion is pervaded by the probandum.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of overextension.

analyzed: na antyaḥ
translated: Not the last.

analyzed: vyāpti abhāva jñāne tad vyāpya tva jñāna saṃbhavena āvaśyakasya vyāpti abhāvasya eva doṣa tva siddheḥ
translated: Because the absence of pervasion, which is necessary when there is knowledge of what is pervaded by that, is established as a fault itself.

original: kiṃ ca viruddhasyopādhitavadvyāptyabhāvavyāpyatayā doṣatve svato hetvābhāsatvaṃ na syāt//
analyzed: kim ca viruddhasya upādhita vat vyāpti abhāva vyāpya tayā doṣa tve svatas hetvābhāsa tvam na syāt
translated: Moreover, if contradiction were a fallacy by being pervaded by the absence of pervasion, like a limiting condition, it would not be a fallacy of a reason by itself.

original: kiñcāntaraṅgaṃ laghutaraṃ kḷptamānubhāvikaṃ ca sādhyābhāvasaṃbandhajñānaṃ tyaktvā svakalpitaprakriyā
analyzed: kiñca antaraṅgam laghutaram kḷptam ānubhāvikam ca sādhya abhāva saṃbandha jñānam tyaktvā sva kalpita prakriyā
translated: And further, abandoning the knowledge of the relation of the absence of the probandum, which is more internal, lighter, and established by experience, the procedure invented by oneself

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: is too far-fetched.

analyzed: tad nirvikalpakena vā prameya tva ādi prakāraka tad jñānena api vā pratibandha āpātāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there would be an obstruction either by that non-conceptual cognition or by the cognition of that qualified by the property of being an object of knowledge, etc.

original: asminpakṣe viruddhasya hetvābhāvasatvameva durghaṭamiti kathaṃ pañceti vibhāga iti bhāvenāha kiṃ ceti//🔽upādhivat upādheriva/
analyzed: asmin pakṣe viruddhasya hetvābhāva satvam eva durghaṭam iti katham pañca iti vibhāgaḥ iti bhāvena āha kim ca iti  upādhi vat upādheḥ iva
translated: In this view, the fact that contradiction is a fallacy of a reason is itself difficult to establish. How then is there a division into five? With this in mind, he says Moreover, etc.🔽Like a limiting condition.

analyzed: upādheḥ yathā  vyabhicāra unnāyaka tvena svatas doṣa tva abhāvāt na hetvābhāsa tvam tathā iti arthaḥ
translated: Just as a limiting condition🔽is not a fault by itself by leading to error, so it is not a fallacy of a reason. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nanu upādheḥ vyabhicāra vyāpya tvena tad anumiti dvārā vyapti abhāva gamaka tvam na sākṣāt
translated: But a limiting condition is not a cause of the cognition of the absence of pervasion by directly indicating it, but by the cognition of the pervasion of the absence of the probandum by the absence of the probans.

analyzed: na hi vyabhicāraḥ eva vyāpti abhāvaḥ
translated: For non-deviation itself is not the absence of pervasion.

analyzed: avyabhicarita sahacāra rūpa tvāt vyāpteḥ sādhya hetu abhāvayoḥ vyāpteḥ sādhya hetu vyāpti vyāpya tvam
translated: Because pervasion consists of invariable concomitance, the pervasion of the absence of the probandum and the probans is the pervasion of the probandum and the probans.

original: tu sākṣādeva vyāptyabhāvāvagama iti nopādhisāmyamiti vadantaṃ pratyāha kiṃ cāntaraṅgamiti //
analyzed: tu sākṣāt eva vyāpti abhāva avagamaḥ iti na upādhi sāmyam iti vadantam pratyāha kim ca antaraṅgam iti
translated: But the direct cognition of the absence of pervasion is said to be the absence of the pervasion of the probandum and the probans. Therefore, there is no similarity of the padas. In response to this, it is said: What is more essential?

analyzed: sādhya hetu abhāva vyāpteḥ sādhya hetu vyāpti abhāvam prati vyāpya tva viṣayaka tva apekṣayā sādhya abhāva sambandha jñānasya alpa viṣayaka tvāt antaraṅga tvam
translated: Compared to the pervasion of the absence of the probandum and the probans, the absence of the pervasion of the probandum and the probans is the pervasion of the knowledge of the relation with the absence of the probandum, which has a smaller scope. The essential nature

analyzed: laghutara tvam ca vyaktam eva
translated: and lightness are clearly evident.

analyzed: kṛptam iti  sādhāraṇe pratibandhaka tvasya nirṇīta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: It is established.🔽The meaning is that the obstruction of the common [reason] has been determined.

original: sādhyābhāvavyāpto viruddha iti prasiddhalakṣaṇānurodhenoktaṃ sādhyābhāvasaṃbandhajñānaṃ tyaktveti//
analyzed: sādhya abhāva vyāptaḥ viruddhaḥ iti prasiddha lakṣaṇa anurodhena uktam sādhya abhāva saṃbandha jñānam tyaktvā iti
translated: In accordance with the well-known definition that the contradictory [reason] pervades the absence of the probandum, it is said: having abandoned the knowledge of the relation with the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: prakriyā iti
translated: The procedure.

analyzed: sa vyabhicāra ādi bhedena pañca eva hetvābhāsāḥ iti prakriyā nirvāhayā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the procedure should be carried out by distinguishing the five fallacious reasons such as the fallacious due to the absence of the property to be established, etc.

analyzed: cāri tvena ṭaḍa
translated: By the practice of the two.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyavāpā.

original: nirvāhāya bahiraṅgasya gurutarasyākḷptasyānānubhāvikasya ca sādhyahetvabhāvavyāpterhetusādhyavyāptyabhāvena saha vyāptijñānasya pratibandhakatvakalpanamatyantāyuktam/
analyzed: nirvāhāya bahiraṅgasya gurutarasya akḷptasya anānubhāvikasya ca sādhya hetu abhāva vyāpteḥ hetu sādhya vyāpti abhāvena saha vyāpti jñānasya pratibandhaka tva kalpanam atyanta ayuktam
translated: It is utterly unreasonable to assume that the knowledge of the pervasion of the absence of the reason by the absence of the probandum, which is external, heavier, not presupposed, and not a consequence, is an impediment along with the absence of the pervasion of the reason by the probandum.

analyzed: na hi atra hiṃsā tva mitrā tanaya tva ādau iva sādhya abhāva sambandhaḥ na sphuṭaḥ
translated: For here, unlike in the case of being an injury, being a son of a friend, etc., the relation of the absence of the probandum is not clear.

original: yena tatropādhinevātra tvaduktena viruddhatvena sa unnīya te//🔽ki cedaṃ jñānaṃ kiṃ pratyakṣas dūṣyānumānīyavyāptijñānasya virodhi/
analyzed: yena tatra upādhinā iva atra tvad uktena viruddha tvena saḥ unnīya te  ki ca idam jñānam kim pratyakṣaḥ dūṣya anumānīya vyāpti jñānasya virodhi
translated: By which it is inferred here by you as a limiting adjunct, as by contradiction.🔽Moreover, is this knowledge contradictory to the perception or to the knowledge of the pervasion inferred by the opponent?

analyzed: kim vā ānumānikasya
translated: Or is it to the inferential knowledge?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: śaṅkhe pīta tva abhāva vyāpya śaṅkha tva grahe pi pīta tva sākṣātkāra darśanāt
translated: Because even when apprehending the pervasion of the absence of yellowness by conches, the perception of yellowness is seen.

analyzed: antye
translated: In the latter, the pervasion inferred by the opponent

original: nanvevaṃ sa śyāmo mitrātanayatvādityādāvapi sādhyābhāsaṃbandhatvameva doṣaḥ/
analyzed: nanu evam sa śyāmaḥ mitrā tanaya tvāt ityādau api sādhya ābhā saṃbandha tvam eva doṣaḥ
translated: If so, then in the case of He is dark because he is a son of a friend, etc., the fault is only the relation of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: tad jñānam eva ca pratibandhakam
translated: And that knowledge alone is the impediment.

original: tadeva codbhāvyaṃ syāt na tu śākapākajatvopādhirityata āha na hīti//
analyzed: tat eva ca udbhāvyam syāt na tu śāka pāka ja tva upādhiḥ iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: And that alone would be stated, not the qualification of being produced from vegetables and cooking. To this he says: For, etc.

analyzed: yat vā mitrātanaya tva ādau sādhya abhāva sambandha dyotanāya upādhi ukti vat iha api
translated: Or, just as the qualification is stated in the case of being the son of a friend, etc. to indicate the connection with the absence of the probandum,

analyzed: tad ukti artham eva ukta rūpa viruddhatvam astu iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: so too here, the stated form of contradiction exists for the purpose of stating that. To this he says: For, etc.

analyzed: nanu sādhya abhāva saṃbandha ajñāne kadācid sāmagrī vaśena āpta vākyena ca ukta rūpa jñāne
translated: But even when the connection with the absence of the probandum is not known, sometimes by the power of the totality and by the statement of a reliable person, when the stated form is known,

original: sati vyāptijñānapratibandhadarśanādayamapi pṛthagdoṣo vācya iti vādinaṃ pratyāha
analyzed: sati vyāpti jñāna pratibandha darśanāt ayam api pṛthak doṣaḥ vācyaḥ iti vādinam pratyāha
translated: since the obstruction to the knowledge of the pervasion is seen, this too should be stated as a separate fault. In reply to one who argues thus,

analyzed: kim ca idam jñānam iti
translated: he says: What is this knowledge?

original: sādhyahetvabhāvavyāpterhetusādhyavyāpti bhāvena saha vyāptijñānamityarthaḥ/ antya iti//
analyzed: sādhya hetu abhāva vyāpteḥ hetu sādhya vyāpti bhāvena saha vyāpti jñānam iti arthaḥ antyaḥ iti
translated: The meaning is: the knowledge of the pervasion by the absence of the probandum and the reason, along with the absence of the pervasion by the reason and the probandum. The last one, etc.

analyzed: ya ita rā pti abhāve ṭha  vi ru sya avi āntarvaḥ
translated: In the absence of the reliable person, etc.🔽The contradictory is included within the inconclusive.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of faults in inference.

original: jñānasyānumānikatve dūṣyānumānīyahetau vyāptivyāpyasya tvaduktarītyā vyāptyabhāvavyāpyasya ca jñātatvena satpratipakṣāntarbhāvaḥ syāt/
analyzed: jñānasya ānumānika tve dūṣya anumānīya hetau vyāpti vyāpyasya tvad ukta rītyā vyāpti abhāva vyāpyasya ca jñāta tvena sat pratipakṣa antarbhāvaḥ syāt
translated: If the knowledge is inferential, then in the faulty reason of an inference, the pervasion and the pervaded are known in the manner stated by you, and the absence of pervasion and the pervaded are known, so it would be included within the counter-example.

original: na hi satpratipakṣa evodāharaṇabhedamātreṇa viruddho bhavati//
analyzed: na hi sat pratipakṣaḥ evā udāharaṇa bheda mātreṇa viruddhaḥ bhavati
translated: For a reason is not contradictory merely by being a different instance of a counter-reason.

original: kiñcāvyaptyantarbhāvācchādanāya sādhyavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvaṃ viruddhatvamityuktau vṛttimataḥ sādhyavadavṛttitvaṃ vā sādhyāsāmānādhikaraṇadharmatvaṃ
analyzed: kiñca avyapti antarbhāva ācchādanāya sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvam viruddha tvam iti uktau vṛttimataḥ sādhyavat avṛtti tvam vā sādhya asāmānādhikaraṇa dharma tvam
translated: Moreover, to cover the fault of over-extension, it is said that contradiction means being the counter-correlate of the absence that pervades the probandum. But for a reason that is present, being absent where the probandum is present, or being a property not co-extensive with the probandum,

original: nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtakatvādityādiviruddhahetau sādhyanirūpitavyāptijñānasyānumānikasyaivoktarūpavyāpyatvajñānaṃ pratibandhakamiti pakṣa ityarthaḥ/🔽asmin pakṣe viruddhahetau sādhyena saha vyāptijñānamānumānikamityeva vācyamanyathā tasya pratibandhāyogāditi bhāvenoktaṃ dūṣyetyādi/🔽anumānaṃ ca viruddhahetau kṛtakatvādau nityatvādirūpasādhyanirūpitavyāptiṃ prati vyāpyasya kasya cijjñānameveti vācyamiti bhāvenoktaṃ dūṣyānumānīya
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtaka tvāt ityādi viruddha hetau sādhya nirūpita vyāpti jñānasya ānumānikasya eva ukta rūpa vyāpya tva jñānam pratibandhakam iti pakṣe iti arthaḥ  asmin pakṣe viruddha hetau sādhyena saha vyāpti jñānam ānumānikam iti eva vācyam anyathā tasya pratibandha ayogāt iti bhāvena uktam dūṣya ityādi  anumānam ca viruddha hetau kṛtaka tva ādau nitya tva ādi rūpa sādhya nirūpita vyāptim prati vyāpyasya kasya cit jñānam eva iti vācyam iti bhāvena uktam dūṣya anumānīya
translated: The view is that in a contradictory reason like Sound is eternal because it is produced, the knowledge of pervasion determined by the probandum is only inferential, and the knowledge of being pervaded in the stated way is an obstruction.🔽In this view, it is said that the knowledge of pervasion with the probandum in a contradictory reason must be only inferential, otherwise it could not be an obstruction. With this in mind, it is said the fallacious inference, etc.

analyzed: hetau vyāpti vyāpyasya iti
translated: And the inference in a contradictory reason like produced is said to be only the knowledge of something pervaded by the pervasion determined by the probandum like eternality, etc. With this in mind, it is said in the fallacious reason, the pervaded by the pervasion.

analyzed: tvad ukta rītyā iti
translated: In the manner stated by you means...

analyzed: sādhya hetu abhāvayoḥ vyāpti rūpasya hetu sādhya vyāpti abhāvam prati vyāpyasya ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the pervasion of the absence of the probandum and the probans, and the pervaded of the absence of the pervasion of the probans and the probandum.

analyzed: nanu anityaḥ śabdaḥ kṛtaka tvāt
translated: Sound is non-eternal because it is produced.

original: nityaḥ śabdaḥ śrāvaṇatvādityādireva satpratipakṣodāharaṇaṃ naitādṛśamityata āha na hīti//
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ śrāvaṇa tvāt ityādiḥ eva sat pratipakṣa udāharaṇam na etādṛśam iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: Sound is eternal because it is audible - such an example is the real counter-instance, not like this. Therefore it is said: this is not so.

original: anityatvasādha kakṛtakatvahetuḥ sādhyavyāptaḥ pakṣe sādhyasamānādhikaraṇatvāt kṛtakatvahetuḥ
analyzed: anitya tva sādha ka kṛtaka tva hetuḥ sādhya vyāptaḥ pakṣe sādhya samāna adhikaraṇa tvāt kṛtaka tva hetuḥ
translated: The reason of being produced, which proves non-eternality, is pervaded by the probandum, because it is co-extensive with the probandum in the subject. The reason of being produced

analyzed: na prakṛta sādhya vyāptaḥ sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tvāt iti udāharaṇa bheda mātreṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: is not pervaded by the present probandum, because it is the counter-correlate of the absence which is pervaded by the probandum. The meaning is: by the mere difference in the example.

original: vyāptitadabhāvānumityanyasthala eva pratipakṣateti manvānaṃ pratyāha kiñceti//
analyzed: vyāpti tad abhāva anumiti anya sthale eva pratipakṣa tā iti manvānam pratyāha kiñca iti
translated: Thinking that the counter-instance is only in the case of the inference of pervasion and its absence, it is said: and also because...

analyzed: iti uktau iti asya viruddha tvam nānā āsyāt iti anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning of thus stated is to be construed as would not be contradictory.

analyzed: katham iti atas maṇi uktāni eva āha vṛttimataḥ iti  dhya kṛ ṭaḍa
translated: How? Therefore, the reasons stated in the Mīmāṃsā are stated as of the active.🔽The author of the Nyāyakośa.
The Nyāyataṇḍa with the Nyāyadyot. Third chapter.

original: vā sādhyavaddṛttibhinnadharmatvaṃ vā viruddhatvamityapi suvacatvādviruddhatvaṃ nānā syāt/
analyzed: vā sādhyavat dṛtti bhinna dharma tvam vā viruddha tvam iti api suvaca tvāt viruddha tvam nānā syāt
translated: Or, the presence of a property different from the cognition of the probandum, or the contradiction - since this can be easily stated, contradiction should not be different.

original: tatra ca bādhaprastāvoktarītyā sarveṣāṃ pratyekaṃ hetvābhāsatvasya vaktavyatvena hetvābhāsādhikyaṃ syāt//
analyzed: tatra ca bādha prastāva ukta rītyā sarveṣām pratyekam hetvābhāsa tvasya vaktavya tvena hetvābhāsa ādhikyam syāt
translated: And in that case, since it should be stated that all of them individually are fallacious reasons in the manner stated in the context of contradiction, there would be an excess of fallacious reasons.

analyzed: yat tu vyāpti jñāna kāraṇībhūta sahacāra jñāna virodhi jñāna viṣaya tvena ekīkaraṇāt na ādhikyam iti kaścid āha
translated: But someone says that there is no excess because they are combined by the object of knowledge that contradicts the knowledge of invariable concomitance that is the cause of the knowledge of pervasion.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: tvad ukta viṣaya tva ajñāne pi sādhya abhāva sambandha jñānena eva anumiti pratibandhāt
translated: Even without knowing the object stated by you, the inference is obstructed by the knowledge of the relation with the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: kiñca vyāpti jñāna karaṇībhūtam yatra hetaḥ tatra
translated: Moreover, where the reason is the cause of the knowledge of pervasion,

analyzed: parvataḥ gnimān gaganava tvāt ityādau ativyāpti nirāsāya vṛttimataḥ iti uktiḥ
translated: in the case of the mountain has fire because of being the sky, in order to remove over-extension, the statement of what occurs is made.

analyzed: na ca tat lakṣya koṭi praviṣṭam eva iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that it is itself included in the class of the definition.

original: sādhyavadavṛttitvarūpaviruddhatvasya tatra jñāne 'pi vyatirekavyāptigrahāpratibandhena tena tatrānumityudayākṣateriti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sādhyavat avṛtti tva rūpa viruddha tvasya tatra jñāne pi vyatireka vyāpti graha apratibandhena tena tatra anumiti udaya akṣateḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that even when there is knowledge of contradiction in the form of non-occurrence in the similar instance, there is no obstruction to the apprehension of the negative pervasion, and hence the inference arises there without being obstructed by that.

original: astu ko doṣa ityata āha tatra ceti//
analyzed: astu kaḥ doṣaḥ iti atas āha tatra ca iti
translated: What is the harm in that? To this he says: and in that case.

analyzed: bādha iti
translated: By 'contradiction'

analyzed: bādha pratirodhayoḥ pratijñā artha pramāṇa virodha tvena aikya ukti prastāve ekam eva sādhakatā liṅgam sarvam vā
translated: the identity of contradiction and preclusion by being contradictions of the proposition and the means of knowledge is stated. Either a single mark of the probans is all, or everything.

analyzed: ādye anya jñānena anumiti pratibdhaḥ na syāt
translated: In the first case, there would be no obstruction of inference by the knowledge of another.

analyzed: anya anumitinā ekena āmiti pratibandhaḥ iti tu na anubhava anusārī
translated: But the obstruction of inference by a single other inference does not accord with experience.

analyzed: dvitīye militam liṅgam pratyekam vā
translated: In the second case, is the probans combined or individual?

analyzed: ādye ekanā eva pūrṇa tvāt śeṣa vaiyarthyam  antye hetvābhāsa ādhikyam iti ukta rītyā iti arthaḥ
translated: In the first case, since it is complete by one alone, the rest is useless.

analyzed: yad jñānena anumiti pratibandhaḥ bhavati tat hi saṃgrāhaka tayā nirvaktavyam
translated: In the second case, there is an excess of fallacious reasons. This is the meaning of the statement of the method. That by the knowledge of which there is obstruction of inference should be stated by including it.

analyzed: na hi idam tathā
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: tathā ca pañcabhyaḥ dhikam avarjanīyam iti bhāvena āha tvad ukta iti
translated: And thus, it is inevitable that there should be more than five. With this in mind he says 'what you have said'.

analyzed: tvad ukta vivakṣā ekīkaraṇa pakṣe pi hetoḥ sādhya abhāva sambandha jñānam āvaśyakam
translated: Even in the case of accepting your view that the probans is the same as the probandum, the knowledge of the relation of the absence of the probandum to the probans is necessary.

original: evaṃ ca tenaivālaṃ kimaneneti bhāvenāha kiñca vyāptijñāneti//
analyzed: evam ca tena eva alam kim anena iti bhāvena āha kiñca vyāpti jñāna iti
translated: And thus, what is the use of this when that alone is sufficient? With this in mind he says 'Moreover, in the knowledge of pervasion'.

original: mita su ka /ṭa / /tvaduktaviṣaya ityadhikamga /rā / /vāsādha ḍa / /itaḥ nanvityavidhiko granthaḥ nāsti ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / 🔽virusyavyāvantarvaḥ
analyzed: tvad ukta viṣayaḥ iti adhikam garā vāsa adha ḍa itas nanu iti avidhikaḥ granthaḥ na asti ṭa ṭha ḍa  viru syavyau antarvaḥ
translated: The text beginning with but is not a rule.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the faults of inference.

original: sādhyamita sahacārajñānaṃ prati yatra sādhyaṃ tatra hetvabhāva ityevaṃrūpasya sādhyavyāpakābhāvapratiyogitvarūpa
analyzed: sādhyamita sahacāra jñānam prati yatra sādhyam tatra hetu abhāvaḥ iti evaṃrūpasya sādhya vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi tva rūpa
translated: The knowledge of the concomitance of the probandum with the absence of the probans where the probandum is present, which is in the form of the probandum's being the counter-correlate of the absence of the pervader of the probandum,

analyzed: viruddha upādhi jñānasya sākṣāt avirodhi tvena virodha artham yāvat hetu adhikaraṇa vṛtti sādhya abhāva kalpam
translated: is directly non-contradictory. Therefore, in order to convey the meaning of contradiction, the definition of contradiction should be stated as the supposition of the absence of the probandum occurring in the locus of the probans to the extent of the knowledge contradicting the knowledge of pervasion.

analyzed: viruddha tvam iti nirvaktavya tvena sādhya abhāva vyāpya tvasya eva viruddha tva siddhiḥ
translated: Thus, the establishment of contradiction is only by the pervasion of the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: tatra ca niyama aṃśaḥ vyarthaḥ iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that the restrictive part is useless there.

original: kiñca sahacāraśabdena vyāptiśarīrānupraviṣṭasya sahacārasyaiva vivakṣaṇīyatvena lāghavādvyāptijñānavirodhijñānaviṣaya bhūtāyāṃ avyāptāvevāntarbhāvasiddheḥ//
analyzed: kiñca sahacāra śabdena vyāpti śarīra anupraviṣṭasya sahacārasya eva vivakṣaṇīya tvena lāghavāt vyāpti jñāna virodhi jñāna viṣaya bhūtāyām avyāptau eva antarbhāva siddheḥ
translated: Moreover, since only the concomitance that is included in the body of pervasion should be intended by the word concomitance, and since the inclusion in the non-pervasion which is the content of the knowledge contradicting the knowledge of pervasion is established due to the lightness,

original: etena virodhasya vyāptyabhāvaṃ pratyupajīvyatvādvirodha eva doṣa iti /
analyzed: etena virodhasya vyāpti abhāvam pratyupajīvya tvāt virodhaḥ eva doṣaḥ iti
translated: By this (verse) (the author) shows that contradiction is a fallacy because it is sublated by perception, and that there is no pervasion of contradiction.

analyzed: avyāpti ajñāna daśāyām
translated: In the state of ignorance of non-pervasion, contradiction is not a fallacy.

original: nanu kadācitsādhyābhāvasambandhājñānepyuktarūpaviṣayatvajñāne 'pyanumiti pratibandho 'stīti vādinaṃ pratyāha kiñceti//🔽vyāptiśarīreti//🔽anyādṛśasya prakṛtavyāptidhīkāraṇatvābhāvātsamavāyavṛtyā sahacārajñānavirodhajñānaviṣayatvasya
analyzed: nanu kadācid sādhya abhāva sambandha ajñāne pi ukta rūpa viṣaya tva jñāne pi anumiti pratibandhaḥ u sti iti vādinam pratyāha kiñca iti  vyāpti śarīra iti  anyādṛśasya prakṛta vyāpti dhī kāraṇa tva abhāvāt samavāya vṛtyā sahacāra jñāna virodha jñāna viṣaya tvasya
translated: But when there is ignorance of the relation of the absence of the probandum, even when there is knowledge of the object in the form stated, there is obstruction to inference, to one who maintains this, (the author) says Moreover, etc.

analyzed: dhūma vahni sāmānādhikaraṇye pi satvena atiprasaṅgāt ca evam vivakṣāyāḥ āvaśyaka tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The body of pervasion means that the relation of inherence is not the cause of the cognition of pervasion in the present case, because the knowledge of co-existence and the knowledge of the object of contradiction exist even in the case of the co-presence of smoke and fire, and because there is over-extension (of the definition) if such (relation of inherence) is intended. The idea is that it is necessary to have such an intention because of the absence of such (relation of inherence) in the present case.

original: maṇyuktadiśā prakārāntareṇa viruddhasya pṛthagdoṣatvamanūdya nirāha eteneti//
analyzed: maṇi ukta diśā prakāra antareṇa viruddhasya pṛthak doṣa tvam anūdya nirāha etena iti
translated: In the manner stated by the Mīmāṃsā view, contradiction is a fallacy separately, this is stated by (the author) by saying By this (verse), etc.

analyzed: prahatam prasiddham
translated: The word prahataṃ means well-known.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva vyāptaḥ viruddhaḥ iti sarvaiḥ upagamāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that because it is accepted by all that contradiction is pervaded by the absence of the probandum.

analyzed: upajīvya tvam
translated: Sublation means
