original: yattu pratibandhakaṃ vyāptyabhāvavyāpyatayā jñānaṃ tadvyāptyabhāvajñānādhīnameveti kathaṃ vyāptyabhāvo nopajīvyaḥ//
analyzed: yat tu pratibandhakam vyāpti abhāva vyāpya tayā jñānam tad vyāpti abhāva jñāna adhīnam eva iti katham vyāpti abhāvaḥ na upajīvyaḥ
translated: But that which is a counter-instance by being pervaded by the absence of pervasion, that is dependent only on the knowledge of the absence of pervasion. How then can the absence of pervasion not be presupposed?

analyzed: etena eva upadheya saṅkare pi upādheḥ asaṅkaraḥ iti ca nirastam
translated: By this alone is refuted the view that even when there is a mixture of what is to be predicated, there is no mixture of the counter-instance.

analyzed: viruddhe pi sādhāraṇa vat vipakṣa vṛttitvasya eva upādhi tva ukteḥ
translated: For even in the case of a contradictory [reason], only the property of occurring in what is contrary to the subject is said to be the counter-instance.

analyzed: tasmāt sādhāraṇa sāṅkarya parihārāya tvad kalpitam
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid the mixture of the common and the mixed, what is postulated by you🔽is stated.

analyzed: vyanakti na hi iti
translated: He says not so and so on.

original: nanu maṇyuktaviruddhatvalakṣaṇe vyāptyabhāvasyopajīvyatvaṃ nāstītyata āha tvaditi//
analyzed: nanu maṇi ukta viruddha tva lakṣaṇe vyāpti abhāvasya upajīvya tvam na asti iti atas āha tvat iti
translated: Now, in the definition of contradiction stated in the jewel [treatise], there is no presupposition of the absence of pervasion. Therefore, he says by you and so on.

analyzed: maṇikṛt kalpita iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is postulated by the author of the jewel [treatise].

analyzed: ādi padena vṛttimataḥ sādhyavat avṛtti tva ādeḥ grahaḥ
translated: By the word and so on is included the property of not occurring in what is similar to the subject, which is possessed by what is contradictory to the reason.

analyzed: vyāpti abhāva jñāna adhīnam iti
translated: Dependent on the knowledge of the absence of pervasion.

analyzed: tad jñāne tad nirūpita vyāpya tvasya durjñāna tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when that [knowledge] exists, the property of being pervaded by that is difficult to know.

original: maṇyuktaṃ prakārāntareṇa viruddhasya pṛthaktvaṃ nirāha eteneti//
analyzed: maṇi uktam prakāra antareṇa viruddhasya pṛthaktvam nirāha etena iti
translated: By this [argument], he refutes in another way the separateness of the contradictory [reason] stated in the jewel [treatise].

analyzed: ukteḥ iti  asmābhiḥ pratipādita tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: By the word statement🔽the meaning is that it has been taught by us.

analyzed: tvad kalpitam iti
translated: By the word postulated by you

analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the absence of pervasion is in the form of the absence of pervasion by the two.

analyzed: viru syāvyau antarvaḥ
translated: The contradictory is partially pervading.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.

analyzed: yat viruddha tvam tad vyāpti ādi abhāva anātmaka tvāt upādhi pratikūla tarka ādi vat avyāpti unnāyakam eva
translated: That which is contradictory is of the nature of the absence of pervasion, etc., and is only the instigator of non-pervasion, like the counter-argument opposed to the limiting adjunct.

analyzed: na tu svayam hetvābhāsaḥ
translated: But it is not itself a fallacious reason.

original: yattu prahataṃ vipakṣamātravṛttitvaṃ rūpaṃ viruddhatvaṃ tatsādhāraṇopādhisaṅkīrṇatvenāvyāptyantarbhūtameva//🔽etenāvyabhicāritasāmānādhikaraṇyarūpavyāptiśīrapraviṣṭasyāvyabhicārarūpaviśeṣaṇāṃśasya virahaḥ sādhāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: yat tu prahatam vipakṣa mātra vṛtti tvam rūpam viruddha tvam tat sādhāraṇa upādhi saṅkīrṇa tvena avyāpti antarbhūtam eva
translated: But the form that is present only in the dissimilar instance, which is said to be contradictory, is included within non-pervasion itself, due to being mixed with the common limiting adjunct.🔽By this, the common [fault] is the absence of the qualifier part, which is the form of invariable concomitance consisting of the invariable co-existence, which is included within pervasion.

analyzed: tad prativiṣṭasya sāmānādhikaraṇya rūpa viśeṣya aṃśasya
translated: The contradictory [fault] is the absence of the qualified part, which is the form of co-existence,

original: viruddhaḥ / viśiṣṭo viraho vyāpyatvāsi ddhaḥ iti bheda iti nirastam/
analyzed: viruddhaḥ viśiṣṭaḥ virahaḥ iti bhedaḥ iti nirastam
translated: which is included within pervasion. The distinguished absence is the contradictory, which is the absence of the pervaded. Thus, the distinction is refuted.

original: hetvābhāsaviśeṣabhūtā yā asiddhiḥ tadviśeṣabhūtā yā vyāpyatvāsiddhiḥ tadavāntarabhedamādāya hetvābhāsasāmānyavibhāge hetvābhāsaviśeṣabhūtā
analyzed: hetvābhāsa viśeṣa bhūtā yā asiddhiḥ tad viśeṣa bhūtā yā vyāpya tva asiddhiḥ tad avāntarabhedam ādāya hetvābhāsa sāmānya vibhāge hetvābhāsa viśeṣa bhūtā
translated: The non-establishment which is a particular of the fallacious reason, the non-establishment of the pervasion which is a particular of that, taking that as a sub-division, in the division of the general fallacious reason, the non-establishment which is a particular of the fallacious reason,

analyzed: yā asiddhiḥ
translated: that non-establishment,
the nature of which is the absence of the probandum and the presence of the counter-correlate, as stated by Manikantha.

analyzed: upādhiḥ iti
translated: The upādhi (i.e. the counter-correlate of the probandum)

analyzed: upādhiḥ ca pratikūla tarkaḥ ca ādi pada ukta anukūla tarka abhāvaḥ ca tadvat iti arthaḥ
translated: and the counter-argument, and the absence of the favorable argument mentioned by the word 'ādi', that is like that.

analyzed: prahatam prasiddham sarvaiḥ ucmānam iti arthaḥ
translated: Well-known, well-established by all, means well-known.

analyzed: prakāra antareṇa sādhāraṇa ādi trayasya bhedam anūdya nirāha etena iti
translated: Having mentioned the difference of the three, sādhāraṇa (common), etc. in another way, he denies it with the words 'by this' (i.e. by the above explanation).
The particular of the fallacious reason,

original: jñāyamānatve satyanumitipratibandhakā dirūpaṃ hetvābhāvasatvaṃ hi sāmānyam/
analyzed: jñāyamāna tve sati anumiti pratibandhaka ā di rūpam hetvābhāva satvam hi sāmānyam
translated: the general form of the fallacious reason is that which, being known, is an obstacle to inference, etc.

analyzed: tad viśeṣāḥ
translated: The particulars

original: tvādirū ga /ṭa /rā / /'viruddhasya vyāptāvantarbhāvaḥ' iti prakaraṇa vibhāgo 'sti
analyzed: tva ādi rū viruddhasya vyāptau antarbhāvaḥ iti prakaraṇa vibhāgaḥ sti
translated: are of the form beginning with 'viruddha' (contradictory). There is a division of the topic called 'the inclusion of the contradictory in the pervasion'.🔽The contradictory is included in the pervasion.🔽The contradictory is included in the pervasion.🔽The contradictory is included in the pervasion.

analyzed: ka ṣṭavira ga ṭarā ddhiḥ iti ṭarā ṣa bhūta iti ṭa ṭha tva isyāḥ ṭaḍa ka tva ādi
translated: The contradictory is included in the pervasion.
The third chapter of the Tarkatandava, along with the Nyāyavāpā.

original: tadviśeṣabhūtāyāḥ svarūpāsiddheḥ śabdo 'nityaḥ cākṣuṣatve sati dravyatvādityādau viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyaviśiṣṭābhāvamādāya hetvābhāsasāmānyavibhāgāpatteḥ/
analyzed: tad viśeṣa bhūtāyāḥ svarūpa asiddheḥ śabdaḥ nityaḥ cākṣuṣa tve sati dravya tvāt ityādau viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya viśiṣṭa abhāvam ādāya hetvābhāsa sāmānya vibhāga āpatteḥ
translated: Because in the case of the particular, which is a part of it, there is the possibility of the division of the general fallacy of the reason by taking the absence of the qualified, the qualifier and the qualified, in the case of the reason sound is non-eternal because it is audible and a substance, etc.

original: hetvābhāsaviśeṣasya bādhasya hṛdo dhūmavatve satyagnimānityādau viśiṣṭasādhyābhāvāntargataviśeṣaṇābhāvādibhedamādāya hetvābhāsasāmānyavibhāgaprasaṅgācca//
analyzed: hetvābhāsa viśeṣasya bādhasya hṛdaḥ dhūmavat tve sati agnimān ityādau viśiṣṭa sādhya abhāva antargata viśeṣaṇa abhāva ādi bhedam ādāya hetvābhāsa sāmānya vibhāga prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because there is the possibility of the division of the general fallacy of the reason by taking the difference of the absence of the qualifier, etc., which are included in the absence of the qualified in the case of the particular fallacy of the reason, such as where there is smoke there is fire, etc.

analyzed: tatra kḷpta tvāt anugata tvāt ca viśiṣṭa abhāva rūpa hetvābhāsa
translated: There, because of the established nature and the all-pervading nature, the particular fallacy of the reason is of the nature of the absence of the qualified.

analyzed: savyabhicāra ādayaḥ iti asiddhiḥ api hetvābhāsa viśeṣaḥ
translated: The fallacies of the reason such as the contradictory, etc. are also a particular fallacy of the reason.

analyzed: tad viśeṣāḥ vyāpya tva asiddhi āśraya svarūpa asiddhyaḥ ityādi bhedena asiddheḥ trividha tvasya prāgukteḥ
translated: Because it has been said earlier that the fallacy of the reason is of three kinds, such as the fallacy of the reason due to the non-establishment of the substratum, the fallacy of the reason due to the non-establishment of the property-possessor, etc.

analyzed: vyāpya tva asiddhi anavāntarabhedaḥ hi vyāpti viśeṣaṇa asiddhi vyāpti viśeṣya asiddhī
translated: The sub-divisions of the non-establishment of the pervasion are the non-establishment of the qualifier of the pervasion and the non-establishment of the property-possessor of the pervasion.

analyzed: tathā ca tādṛśa avāntarabhedam ādāya hetvābhāsa sāmānyasya savyabhicāra viruddha ādi rūpeṇa
translated: And in the same way, taking up such a particular difference, the general fallacy of the reason in the form of the uncertain, contradictory, etc.,

analyzed: pañca iti vibhāga karaṇe sa
translated: when dividing it into five, that particular difference of the fallacy of the reason which is a particular kind of unestablished, namely, the unestablished property-possessor of the reason, the unestablished reason, and the unestablished specific reason, even taking them up,

analyzed: hetvābhāsa vibhāga prasaṅgaḥ syāt
translated: there would be the consequence of dividing the fallacies of the reason.

original: tathā ca pañceti vibhāgabhaṅgaḥ syādityarthaḥ//🔽atiprasaṅgāntaraṃ cāha hetvābhāsaviśeṣasyeti//
analyzed: tathā ca pañca iti vibhāga bhaṅgaḥ syāt iti arthaḥ  atiprasaṅga antaram ca āha hetvābhāsa viśeṣasya iti
translated: And in that case, the division into five would be broken, is the meaning.🔽He states another absurdity, saying of a particular fallacy of the reason.

analyzed: para mukhena samādhim vācayitvā samam iti āha tatra iti
translated: Having made the opponent state the answer, he says in that case etc.

analyzed: svarūpa asiddhi bādha sthale iti arthaḥ  nanu viśeṣaṇa ādi abhāva sthale pi anumiti pratibandyaḥ dṛśyate iti atas
translated: The meaning is: in the case of the unestablished and the contradicted.🔽But even in the case of the absence of the qualifier etc., the obstruction to inference is seen, so

original: śiṣṭābhāva eva doka /ṭa /rā / /ddhibhede ṭha / dvyādibhede ṭa /ḍa / /tiye asiddhyādi siddhiviśeṣa ṭha / /ddhīrādāyāpi ṭha / 🔽virusyāvyāntarvaḥ
analyzed: śiṣṭa abhāvaḥ asiddhi ādi siddhi viśeṣaḥ  vi ru sya avi āntarvaḥ
translated: the absence of the remainder is indeed a difference in the unestablished etc. Even taking up the unestablished etc. as a difference in the established,🔽the contradictory is internal to the uncertain.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of fallacies of inference.

original: eva doṣo viśeṣaṇādyabhāvo 'pi viśiṣṭābhāvonnayanadvāraiva doṣa iti cet samaṃ prakṛte 'pi //
analyzed: eva doṣaḥ viśeṣaṇa ādi abhāvaḥ viśiṣṭa abhāva unnayana dvārā eva doṣaḥ iti ced samam prakṛte pi
translated: If it be said that the defect of the absence of the qualification, etc. also is a defect only through the implication of the absence of the qualified, the same is the case in the present instance also.

analyzed: kiñca vyadhikaraṇa asiddheḥ adoṣa tva prastāva ukta rītyā anyathā anupapatti rūpa avyabhicāraḥ eva vyāptiḥ na tu
translated: Moreover, in accordance with the statement of the non-defect of the asiddhi of different substrata, the vyapti is nothing but the non-deviation in the form of the impossibility of any other way. It is not

analyzed: tad viśiṣṭa sāmānādhikaraṇyam iti
translated: the co-subsistence of that with the qualified. So where is the difference of parts?

analyzed: tasmāt sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa anupasaṃhāri viruddhānām sādhya abhāva saṃbandha rūpāyām
translated: Therefore, the common, uncommon, non-converging and contradictory [reasons] are included in the non-pervasion itself, in the relation in the form of the absence of the probandum,

analyzed: anyathā upapatti rūpāyām vā  avyāptau eva antarbhāvaḥ
translated: or in the form of the possibility of any other way.

original: tatrāpi sādhāraṇaviruddhayorvyāptyabhāvo niścitaḥ asādhāraṇānupasaṃhāriṇostu sandigdha iti jñeyam //
analyzed: tatra api sādhāraṇa viruddhayoḥ vyāpti abhāvaḥ niścitaḥ asādhāraṇa anupasaṃhāriṇoḥ tu sandigdhaḥ iti jñeyam  /
translated: There also, it should be known that the absence of vyapti is certain in the case of the common and contradictory [reasons], but is doubtful in the case of the uncommon and non-converging [reasons].

analyzed: āha viśeṣaṇa ādi iti
translated: He says: etc.

analyzed: viśeṣya abhāvaḥ ādipādarthaḥ
translated: The absence of the substratum is the meaning of the word ādi.

analyzed: prakṛte api iti  viruddha hetau api iti arthaḥ
translated: In the present instance also🔽means also in the case of a contradictory reason.

analyzed: tathā ca avyāptiḥ iva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And the sense is that it is like the non-pervasion.

original: nanu vyabhicārājñāne 'pi sahacāravirahajñānenāpyanumitipratibandho 'stīti vadantaṃ pratyavyabhicārasāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ vyāptirityaṅgīkṛtyoktam/
analyzed: nanu vyabhicāra ajñāne sahacāra viraha jñānena api anumiti pratibandhaḥ sti iti vadantam prati avyabhicāra sāmānādhikaraṇyam vyāptiḥ iti aṅgīkṛtya uktam
translated: But when it is said by accepting that the pervasion is the co-reference of non-deviation, to one who says that even the knowledge of the absence of co-occurrence is an obstruction to inference, even without the knowledge of deviation,

analyzed: vastutas tu tat eva na asti
translated: in reality that itself does not exist.

original: yena sāmānādhikaraṇyavirahasya jñānaṃ pratibandhakamiti so 'pi pṛthagdoṣaḥ syāditi bhāvenāha kiñceti//
analyzed: yena sāmānādhikaraṇya virahasya jñānam pratibandhakam iti saḥ api pṛthak doṣaḥ syāt iti bhāvena āha kiñca iti
translated: With the idea that the knowledge of the absence of co-reference would be a separate fault, since it is an obstruction, it is said Moreover, etc.

analyzed: tad viśiṣṭam avyabhicāra viśiṣṭam
translated: That qualified by it means qualified by non-deviation.

analyzed: paddhati virodham āśaṅkya
translated: Fearing contradiction with the manual,

original: samaṃ iti naṭa /rā / /kḷptatvādanugatatvasya viśeṣaṇāṃśaviraharūpavyabhicāra eva doṣo 'stu na tu svatantra sāmānādhikaraṇyavirahaḥ kevalavyatirekiṇya
analyzed: iti kḷpta tvāt anugata tvasya viśeṣaṇa aṃśa viraha rūpa vyabhicāraḥ eva doṣaḥ stu na tu svatantra sāmānādhikaraṇya virahaḥ
translated: it is said equally by Nata.Ra. Let the fault be only the deviation in the form of absence of the qualifier, which is established and pervasive, and not the independent absence of co-reference in the negative-only inference.

analyzed: sa tvāt
translated: Because it exists.

original: ṭa / ṇyapi sa ga /rā / ityadhikam / hasya prakṛtepi bhāvenāha kiñceti ityasti ṭa /ḍa /
analyzed: ṭa sa garāḥ iti adhikam hasya prakṛte api bhāvena āha kiñca iti iti asti
translated: Even in the case of the negative-only inference, that is additional. The idea is that even in the present case, it is said Moreover, etc. This is found in the T.D.
The Lamp of Logic together with the Tarkatandava, Third Chapter

original: yattu paddhatau viruddhaḥ sādhyasaṃbaddhābhāve sati tadabhāvasaṃbandhitvādavyāptaḥ/
analyzed: yat tu paddhatau viruddhaḥ sādhya saṃbaddha abhāve sati tad abhāva saṃbandhi tvāt avyāptaḥ
translated: But in the manual, it is said to be contradictory because it is related to the absence of what is related to the probandum, and being non-pervasive, it is related to the absence of that.

analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ pi sādhya tad abhāva saṃbandhi tvāt avyāptaḥ
translated: Even the common one is over-pervasive, because it is related to the probandum and its absence.

analyzed: anadhyavasita bhedau asādhāraṇa anupasaṃhāriṇau ubhaya saṃbandha abhāvāt avyāptau antarbhavataḥ iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the two, where the difference is not ascertained, the non-common, and the non-concluding, are included in over-pervasion because of the absence of relation to both.

original: tatra svamate triprakārā vyāptiḥ pratyekaṃ hetvābhāsa iti nābhiprāyaḥ/
analyzed: tatra sva mate tri prakārā vyāptiḥ pratyekam hetvābhāsaḥ iti na abhiprāyaḥ
translated: There, it is not the intention that each of the three kinds of pervasion in one's own view is a fallacy of a reason.

original: kiṃ tu vastugatyā vidyamānāyāṃ paraiḥ pratyekaṃ hetvābhāsatvena svīkṛtāyāṃ triprakārāyāmavyāptāvanugatā /
analyzed: kim tu vastu gatyā vidyamānāyām paraiḥ pratyekam hetvābhāsa tvena svīkṛtāyām tri prakārāyām avyāptau anugatā
translated: Rather, when pervasion, which exists in reality and is accepted by others as each a fallacy of a reason, is of three kinds, it is followed.

analyzed: sva abhimatā
translated: It is accepted by oneself.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva saṃbandha ādi rūpā
translated: It is of the form of the relation of the absence of the probandum and so on.

analyzed: avyāptiḥ ekā eva hetvābhāsaḥ viśeṣaṇa vaiyarthya ādi doṣa abhāva ādi iti eva abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that over-pervasion is only one fallacy of a reason, because there is no fault such as the uselessness of the qualifier and so on.

analyzed: paddhatau api sādhya saṃbandha abhāve sati tad abhāva saṃbandhi tva āde
translated: Even in the Padarthadharmasangraha, when there is the absence of the relation with the probandum, the relation with its absence and so on,

analyzed: tad abhiprāya uktyā nirāha yatu iti
translated: he refutes with the statement of that intention, saying because of that.

original: tatra hi pūrvaṃ svābhimatadoṣoktiprastāve hetuvirodho dvividhaḥ asiddhiravyāptiśceti /
analyzed: tatra hi pūrvam sva abhimata doṣa ukti prastāve hetu virodhaḥ dvividhaḥ asiddhiḥ avyāptiḥ ca iti
translated: For there, first, in the context of stating one's own accepted faults, the contradiction of a reason is of two kinds: unestablished and over-pervasive.

analyzed: avyāptiḥ api trividhā
translated: And over-pervasion is also of three kinds.

analyzed: liṅgasya sādhyena tad abhāvena ca saṃbandhaḥ
translated: The relation of the reason with the probandum and with its absence.

analyzed: sādhya saṃbandha abhāve sati tad abhāvena eva sambandhaḥ
translated: When there is no relation with the probandum, there is a relation only with its absence.

analyzed: ubha sambandha abhāvaḥ ca iti uktvā para ukta doṣa prapañcanena antarbhāva ukti prastāve dvitīya pariccheda ante uktam iti arthaḥ
translated: And when there is no relation with both, it is said that it is included by elaborating on the faults stated by others in the context of stating the inclusion at the end of the second chapter. This is the meaning.

original: tathāca tatra sādhyatadabhāvasaṃbandhavatvādirūpeṇa pratyekahetvābhāsatvapratītestadvirodha iti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: tathāca tatra sādhya tad abhāva saṃbandhavatva ādi rūpeṇa pratyeka hetvābhāsa tva pratīteḥ tad virodhaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, since the individual fallacies of reason are understood in the form of having a relation with the probandum and its absence, there is a contradiction with that. This is the idea.

original: kuta eṣobhiprāya ityato jñāpakaṃ vipakṣe bādhakaṃ cāha paddhatāvapīti//
analyzed: kutas eṣa ubhiprāyaḥ iti atas jñāpakam vipakṣe bādhakam ca āha paddhatau api iti
translated: From where does this intention come? Therefore, in the Padarthadharmasangraha, a reason that refutes the opposite is stated.

analyzed: tathā ca avyāptiḥ ekā eva doṣaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And thus, over-extension is the only fault. This is the idea.🔽The other is not included.

analyzed: tya vyabhicārāya  viru syāvyau antarvaḥ
translated: For the sake of invariable concomitance, G.R.🔽The contradictory is not included.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of fallacies in inference.

analyzed: ra vyāptim prati hetu tvasya eva ukteḥ
translated: Because only the reason's being the cause of over-extension is stated.

original: anyathā hi bhaṅgyantareṇa paroktaprakriyaiva svīkṛtā syāt//🔽sudhāyāmanaikāntikatvādityasya hi sapakṣavṛttitve sati
analyzed: anyathā hi bhaṅgī antareṇa para ukta prakriyā eva svīkṛtā syāt  sudhāyām anaikāntika tvāt iti asya hi sapakṣa vṛtti tve sati
translated: Otherwise, the same procedure stated by others would be accepted in different words.🔽In the Sudha commentary, the meaning of because of being inconclusive is because of occurring in similar instances

analyzed: vipakṣa vṛtti tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: and occurring in dissimilar instances.

analyzed: evam viruddha tvāt ityasya sapakṣa vṛtti tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, the meaning of because of being contradictory is because of occurring in similar instances.

analyzed: na ca atra viśeṣaṇa vyavacchedyam asti iti ukta tvena tad virodhaḥ ca syāt
translated: And there would be a contradiction with the statement that there is nothing to be excluded by the qualification here.

analyzed: tri prakārā ayāma
translated: In the threefold

analyzed: anyathā iti pṛthak doṣa tva abhiprāyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Otherwise, the meaning is that the intention is to be a separate fault.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva saṃbandha tvena eva anaikāntika tva ādeḥ eka doṣatvam eva na pṛthak doṣatvam
translated: The fact that the fallacies of inconclusive and contradictory are only one fault by being related to the absence of the probandum, not by being separate faults.

original: anyathā paroktaprakriyāṅgīkārāpattiritye kaṃ bādhakamuktvā bādhakāntaraṃ cāha sudhāyāmiti//
analyzed: anyathā para ukta prakriyā aṅgīkāra āpattiḥ iti e kam bādhakam uktvā bādhaka antaram ca āha sudhāyām iti
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one accepts the procedure stated by the opponent. Having stated this counter-argument, he states another counter-argument in the Sudha.

original: na cātra viśeṣaṇavyavacchedyamastītyukta bhedena tadvirodhaśca syādityanvayaḥ/
analyzed: na ca atra viśeṣaṇa vyavacchedyam asti iti ukta bhedena tad virodhaḥ ca syāt iti anvayaḥ
translated: And there is no connection with the qualification here, so there would be a contradiction with the statement that there is nothing to be excluded by the qualification.

original: atretyanena parāmṛśyamānaṃ darśayitumuktaṃ anaikāntikatvādviruddhatvāditi/🔽tayoryadi vipakṣavṛttitvamevārthastadā nacātretyuttaravākyāsāṅgatyamāśaṅkya tayorarthoktirityasyetyartha iti/
analyzed: atra iti anena parāmṛśyamānam darśayitum uktam anaikāntika tvāt viruddha tvāt iti  tayoḥ yadi vipakṣa vṛtti tvam eva arthaḥ tadā na ca atra iti uttara vākya asāṅgatyam āśaṅkya tayoḥ artha uktiḥ iti asya iti arthaḥ iti
translated: By the word here, he shows what is referred to, saying because of the fallacies of inconclusive and contradictory.🔽If the meaning of those two is only occurrence in the dissimilar instance, then there is the apprehension that the subsequent statement and there is no connection with the qualification here is unconnected. The meaning is that the statement the meaning of those two is stated is for that reason.

analyzed: yuktipādīya masudhāyām hi avyāpti rūpa hetu doṣaḥ naikāntika tva deḥ antarbhāva tayā avyāpti tvena eva
translated: For in the Sudha commentary on the Nyaya-makaranda, the fallacy of the reason in the form of non-pervasion is included within the fallacies of inconclusive and contradictory, and so is stated as non-pervasion itself.

original: doṣatvaṃ vaktupupakramya pṛthagdoṣatvaṃ dūṣaṇamucyate idamasādhakaṃ anaikāntikatvādviruddhatvāditi tvayā vācyam /
analyzed: doṣa tvam pṛthak doṣa tvam dūṣaṇam ucyate idam asādhakam anaikāntika tvāt viruddha tvāt iti tvayā vācyam
translated: Having stated the fault, it is said that the fault is stated separately as You should say that this is not a proof because of being inconclusive or contradictory.

analyzed: na ca atra viśeṣaṇa vyavacchedyam asti iti ucyate pṛthak doṣa tve tad ukti virodhaḥ
translated: And it is said that there is no distinction to be excluded here. If there were a separate fault, it would contradict stating that.

analyzed: anyonyasya vyavacchedya tva sambhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is possible for each to be the object of exclusion of the other.

analyzed: nanu avyāpteḥ ukta tri prakāra anugatam avyāpti tva rūpa sāmānyam kutas upeyam
translated: But how can the common property of incompleteness, which is included in the three types mentioned, be accepted?

analyzed: trirūpā eva astu avyāptiḥ iti atas āha tri prakārā iti
translated: Let incompleteness be of three types only. To this he says of three types.
In all three, the connection with the probandum and its absence is

analyzed: tra api garā tyatra ekam ḍa kta tvena ta ṭa ḍa
translated: stated as one. Here one is stated as ka and the other as ta.

original: pu / nyāyadīpayutatarkatāṇḍavam tṛ /paricchedaḥ 🔽vyāptāvanugataikarūpyā bhāve hetvābhāsādhikyaṃ ca syāt/
analyzed: vyāptau anugata ekarūpyā bhāve hetvābhāsa ādhikyam ca syāt
translated: The Nyāyadyuti along with the Tarkatāṇḍava, Third Chapter🔽If there is no uniform nature that is common to all cases of pervasion, then there would be an excess of fallacious reasons.

original: satve cānugatena laghunā sākṣādvyāptidhī virodhidhīviṣayeṇa ca tenaivāsādhakatā sādhyatām/
analyzed: sattve ca anugatena laghunā sākṣāt vyāpti dhī virodhi dhī viṣayeṇa ca tena evā asādhaka tā sādhyatām
translated: And if there is, then let the non-proof be established by that very uniform and simple means of knowing pervasion, which is opposed to the cognition of the contrary.

analyzed: kim vastutas satā api anugati ādi rahitena itareṇa aṃśena
translated: What is the use of another part which is really existent but devoid of uniformity etc.?

analyzed: viruddhasya avyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: The contradictory is included in the over-exclusive.

analyzed: tva ādi tri prakāra iti arthaḥ  anugata eka rūpasya iti
translated: The meaning is of the three kinds beginning with that.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva sambandhi tva rūpasya vā anyathā upapatti rūpasya vā prāguktasya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of the form of the invariable concomitance of the probandum or of the form of the possibility of another explanation as stated earlier.

analyzed: atas eva pūrvam sva abhimata doṣa ukti prastāve
translated: For this very reason, earlier, in the context of stating the faults accepted by oneself,

analyzed: vyāpti virahaḥ vyāptiḥ iti vyāpti viraha tvam anugata eka rūpam uktam
translated: the absence of invariable concomitance is over-exclusiveness, and the absence of invariable concomitance is said to be the single form that pervades.

analyzed: ādhikyam iti
translated: The meaning is that there is excess.

original: hetuvirodho dvividhaḥ asiddhiravyāptiriti pramāṇalakṣaṇādau yadvaividhyaṃ hetudoṣasyoktam/
analyzed: hetu virodhaḥ dvividhaḥ asiddhiḥ avyāptiḥ iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇa ādau yat vaividhyam hetu doṣasya uktam
translated: The contradiction of the reason is of two kinds: unestablished and over-exclusive, as the twofoldness of the fault of the reason is stated in the definition of valid cognition and so on.

analyzed: tat na syāt
translated: That should not be.

analyzed: kintu cāturvidhya rūpa ādhikyam ca syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But there would be the excess in the form of a fourfold division. This is the meaning.

analyzed: sattve ca iti  anugata eka rūpasya iti anukarṣaḥ  prāk ukta sādhya abhāva sambandhavat tva ādi rūpasya iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And if there is,🔽the continuation is of the form of the invariable concomitance of the probandum as stated earlier. This is the meaning.

analyzed: itareṇa sādhya sambandha abhāva ādinā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is by the other, by the absence of the invariable concomitance of the probandum and so on.

analyzed: viruddhasya avyāptau antarbhāvaḥ
translated: The contradictory is included in the over-exclusive.

original: syāsatve ka /ṭa /rā / /virodhapadaṃ na ka /rā / /maṇyuktahetvābhāsasaṅkarabhaṅgaḥ ityastu ka / 🔽patevāsyavyacārasaṃraḥ
analyzed: kaṭarāḥ virodha padam na karāḥ maṇi ukta hetvābhāsa saṅkara bhaṅgaḥ iti astu ka  pate vāsya vya cāra saṃraḥ
translated: Or let there be a mixture of contradiction and uncertainty.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The section on the criticism of fallacies of inference.

analyzed: atha para mate bādhasya vyabhicāra saṅkaraḥ
translated: Now, in the opponent's view, there is a mixture of contradiction and uncertainty.

original: yaccoktaṃ maṇau bādhasyādoṣatve vastuto māhānasīyaḥ prasiddhau vahniḥ parvate vahnitvena sidhyet/
analyzed: yat ca uktam maṇau bādhasya adoṣa tve vastutas māhānasīyaḥ prasiddhau vahniḥ parvate vahni tvena sidhyet
translated: And what is said in the jewel, if contradiction is not a fallacy, then in reality, the fire in the great forest would be established as fire on the mountain.

analyzed: parvate vahni jātīyasya satvena vyabhicāra abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no fallacy due to the existence of the class of fire on the mountain.

original: parvate mahānasīyo vahnirnāstīti pratyakṣabādhāttu na sidhyatīti bādhasya vyabhicārāsaṅkara iti/
analyzed: parvate mahānasīyaḥ vahniḥ na asti iti pratyakṣa bādhāt tu na sidhyati iti bādhasya vyabhicāra asaṅkaraḥ iti
translated: But it is not established due to the contradiction by perception that the fire in the great forest does not exist on the mountain. Thus, contradiction is not mixed with fallacy.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: varvate mahānasīyaḥ vahniḥ nā
translated: The fire in the great forest on the mountain does not exist.

analyzed: atha para mate bādhasya vyabhicāra saṅkaraḥ
translated: Now, in the opponent's view, there is a mixture of contradiction and uncertainty.

original: svamate bādhasya vyabhicārāsāṅkaryaṃ tadrītyanusaraṇe tatsāṅkaryameva prāpnoti/
analyzed: sva mate bādhasya vyabhicāra asāṅkaryam tad rīti anusaraṇe tad sāṅkaryam eva prāpnoti
translated: If one follows that method, the mixture of contradiction and uncertainty is obtained in one's own view.

original: tathā ca bādhasya pṛthagdoṣatvahāneḥ pañceti hetvābhāsavibhāgabhaṅga iti bhāvenāha yacceti//
analyzed: tathā ca bādhasya pṛthak doṣa tva hāneḥ pañca iti hetvābhāsa vibhāga bhaṅgaḥ iti bhāvena āha yat ca iti
translated: And thus, because contradiction is not a separate fallacy, the division of fallacious reasons into five is refuted. With this idea, he says what is said, etc.

original: nanu parvatīyadhūmasya mahānasīyavahnyabhāvasāmānādhikaraṇyena vyabhācirānna tena mahānasīyavahniḥ sidhyatītyata āha parvata iti//
analyzed: nanu parvatīya dhūmasya mahānasīya vahni abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇyena na tena mahānasīya vahniḥ sidhyati iti atas āha parvate iti
translated: But since the mountain smoke is co-existent with the absence of the great-oven fire, the great-oven fire is not established by that. To this he says on the mountain etc.

analyzed: vyāpaka tā avacchedaka tā avacchinna vyāpaka abhāva sāmānādhikaraṇyasya eva vyabhicāra tvāt vahni tvasya vyāpaka tā avacchedaka tvena tad avacchedena atra tasya
translated: Because only the co-existence with the absence of the pervader restricted by the qualifier of pervasion is the reason for non-establishment, and since fire-ness is the qualifier of pervasion, by that restricted here, that

original: tarhi kuto na sidhyatītyata āha parvata iti//
analyzed: tarhi kutas na sidhyati iti atas āha parvataḥ iti
translated: Then why is it not established? To this he says on the mountain etc.

analyzed: tvad ukta pratyakṣasya parvatīya vahni anumitim prati bādhaka tvam eva nā asti
translated: Indeed, the perception stated by you is not a hindrance at all to the inference of the mountain fire.

original: kathaṃ tasya bādhatvena pārthakyamiti bhāvena nirāha tannetyādinā//
analyzed: katham tasya bādha tvena pārthakyam iti bhāvena nirāha tat na ityādinā
translated: With the idea that how can it be different as a hindrance, he refutes it with That is not so etc.

original: tyananu ṭa /ṭha / /nena paṭa /ḍa / /tatreti na ṭha /ḍa / /prati pratibandhakatva ṭha /ḍa /
analyzed: nena tatra iti na
translated: by that, cloth. by that, there. not. by that, hindrance. by that,
Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava, third chapter

original: stīti pratyakṣasya parvate vahnirastīti pratyakṣaśābdabodhau pratīva parvate vahnirityanumitiṃ pratyapi bhinnaviṣayakatvenābādhakatvāt /
analyzed: sti iti pratyakṣasya parvate vahniḥ asti iti pratyakṣa śābda bodhau prati iva parvate vahniḥ iti anumitim prati api bhinna viṣayaka tvena ābādhaka tvāt
translated: As in the case of the perception of fire on the mountain, and the verbal cognition arising from perception, so also in the case of inference of fire on the mountain, the difference in the objects does not invalidate.

analyzed: yathā hi indriyam sva sannikṛṣṭa viṣayaka jñāna janana svabhāvam
translated: Just as the sense organ has the nature of producing knowledge of an object with which it is in contact,

analyzed: tathā liṅgam api sva samāna adhikaraṇa liṅgi viṣayaka jñāna janana svabhāvam  samāna adhikaraṇayoḥ liṅga liṅginaḥ r hi
translated: so also the inferential mark has the nature of producing knowledge of the inferential object with which it is in the same locus.🔽For the inferential mark and the inferential object are in the same locus.

original: vyāptiḥ// 🔽evaṃ tarhi mahānasīyavahniviṣayānumitiḥ kuto na jāyate parvatīyavahniviṣayaiva kuto
analyzed: vyāptiḥ  evam tarhi mahānasīya vahni viṣayā anumitiḥ kutas na jāyate parvatīya vahni viṣayā eva kutas
translated: The pervasion is between the inferential mark and the inferential object in the same locus.

original: jāyata ityato na tvaduktabādhadoṣabalāt kiṃ tu liṅgasya vyāptiprakāramapekṣya liṅgijñānajanakatvaṃ
analyzed: jāyate iti atas na tvad ukta bādha doṣa balāt kim tu liṅgasya vyāpti prakāram apekṣya liṅgi jñāna janaka tvam
translated: If that is so, then why does inference not arise regarding the fire in the great kitchen? Why does it arise only regarding the fire on the mountain? Therefore, it is not due to the force of the contradiction stated by you, but rather because the nature of the inferential mark is to produce knowledge of the inferential object in relation to the mode of pervasion of the inferential mark.

original: svabhāva iti svabhāvabalādeveti bhāvena dṛṣṭāntapūrvamāha yathā hīti //
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ iti svabhāva balāt eva iti bhāvena dṛṣṭānta pūrvam āha yathā hi iti
translated: The meaning is that it is by the force of the nature itself. With this in mind, he gives an example, saying Just as...

analyzed: yat vā bhinna viṣaya ka tvena iti uktam
translated: Or, it is said that the difference in the objects is not a valid reason.

analyzed: tat asiddham
translated: That is not established.

analyzed: bādhasya adoṣa tve eva pratyakṣa anumityoḥ bādhaka bādhya tva abhimatayoḥ syāt iti atas svabhāva kṛtam eva bhinna viṣayatvam iti āha
translated: If contradiction were not a fault, then the very fact of having the same object would be the reason for the contradiction of perception and inference, which are considered to be the contradictor and the contradicted. Therefore, he says that the difference in objects is natural.

original: tathā ca sāmagryabhāvādeva mahānasīyavahnyasiddhyupapattau kiṃ bādhavaśena tadasiddhikalpanayā/
analyzed: tathā ca sāmagrī abhāvāt eva mahānasīya vahni asiddhi upapattau kim bādha vaśena tad asiddhi kalpanayā
translated: And thus, since the non-establishment of the fire in the great kitchen can be explained by the absence of the assemblage itself, what is the use of assuming its non-establishment due to contradiction?

original: ata eva paddhatauparvate dhūmaṃ dṛṣṭānto 'pi kathamanyatrā numityanudbhavaḥ/
analyzed: atas eva katham anyatra
translated: For this very reason, in the Paddhati, even the example of seeing smoke on the mountain, how is there no arising of inference elsewhere?

analyzed: vyāpti prakāram apekṣya liṅgasya liṅgi jñāna janaka tva niyamāt
translated: Because the reason has the rule of producing the knowledge of the thing to be inferred in dependence on the mode of the pervasion.

analyzed: tathā hi kayoḥ cit samāna deśa tve pi bhinna kālīnayoḥ vyāptiḥ
translated: Thus, even when two things have the same place, they may be of different times, and there may be pervasion between them.

analyzed: yathā dhūmasya agninā ityādi uktam
translated: For example, between smoke and fire, as stated earlier.

analyzed: tatra anyatra anudbhavaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: There, the non-arising elsewhere is an indication.

analyzed: katham anyadīya agni pramān udbhavaḥ iti api dhyeyam iti bhāvaḥ 🔽raṇa janana sva bhāga rā na urvī ākagaṭa
translated: The meaning is that it should be thought how the knowledge of fire belonging to another does not arise.🔽The non-arising of the knowledge of fire belonging to another is due to the difference in the mode of the reason.

analyzed: paddhatau katham anyatra agni pramān udbhavaḥ paddhatau
translated: How can there be the arising of fire-cognition elsewhere in the Paddhati? How can there be the arising of fire-cognition elsewhere in the Paddhati?

analyzed: tatra anyatra agnimā  pate i bāsya vya cāra saṃraḥ
translated: There, elsewhere, fire is cognized.🔽The one who has the doubt of the non-existence of fire.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The criticism of fallacies of inference.

original: astu vā pratyakṣānumityoḥ samānaviṣayakatvaṃ tathāpi na tanmātraṃ bādhatve tantram/
analyzed: astu vā pratyakṣa anumityoḥ samāna viṣayaka tvam tathā api na tat mātram bādha tve tantram
translated: Or let there be the same object of perception and inference, even so, that alone is not the criterion for sublation.

original: kintu samānaprakārakatvamapi /🔽ghaṭavatyeva gehe ghaṭo nāstīti bhrāmyato 'pi gehe prameyamastīti pramayā tatra sato ghaṭasyāpi prameyatvena grahaṇadarśanāt/
analyzed: kintu samāna prakāraka tvam api  ghaṭavati eva gehe ghaṭaḥ na asti iti gehe prameyam asti iti pramayā tatra sataḥ ghaṭasya api prameya tvena grahaṇa darśanāt
translated: But the similarity of form is also [a criterion].🔽Even one who is deluded that there is no pot in the house which has a pot, sees by the cognition that there is an object of cognition in the house, the pot which exists there is also grasped as an object of cognition.

original: parvatetaravṛttirvahniḥ parvate nāstīti pramāvato 'pi parvato vahnimāniti bhrāntirūpānumitidarśanācca/
analyzed: parvata itara vṛttiḥ vahniḥ parvate na asti iti pramāvataḥ pi parvataḥ vahnimān iti bhrānti rūpa anumiti darśanāt ca
translated: And because of the perception of the inference in the form of delusion that the mountain has fire, even by one who has the cognition that the fire which occurs in other than the mountain does not exist in the mountain.

analyzed: nanu pratiyogi asamāna adhikaraṇa yad samāna adhikaraṇa ityādi maṇi ukta sāmānya vyāpti lakṣaṇa pakṣe
translated: Now, in the case of the general pervasion defined by the Ratnākara as that which is co-extensive with what is not co-extensive with the counter-correlate, etc.,

original: vyadhikaraṇadhūmavahnyorapi vyāpti rastyeveti parvatīyadhūmo mahānasīyavahnijñānajananasvabhāva eveti bhinnaviṣayatvasvabhāvo neti cenna/
analyzed: vyadhikaraṇa dhūma vahnyoḥ api vyāptiḥ rasti eva iti parvatīya dhūmaḥ mahānasīya vahni jñāna janana svabhāvaḥ eva iti bhinna viṣaya tva svabhāvaḥ na iti ced na
translated: Even between smoke and fire, which are in different substrata, there is pervasion. Therefore, the smoke on the mountain is of the nature of generating the knowledge of the fire in the great kitchen. Thus, the nature of having different objects is not accepted. This is not so.

analyzed: tasya lakṣaṇasya nirasta tvāt
translated: Because that definition has been refuted.

analyzed: atas eva samāna adhikaraṇa liṅga iti uktam
translated: For this very reason, it is said to be a reason in the same substratum.

original: tuṣyatu durjana ityabhyupetyāpi bādhyabādhakabhāvo na yukta ityāha astu veti//
analyzed: tuṣyatu durjanaḥ iti abhyupetya api bādhya bādhaka bhāvaḥ na yuktaḥ iti āha astu vā iti
translated: Even if it is accepted, the relation of the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge is not proper. Therefore, it is said that it may be so.

original: mahānasīyavahniḥ parvate nāstīti pratyakṣasya parvato vahnimānityanumite rityarthaḥ/
analyzed: mahānasīya vahniḥ parvate na asti iti pratyakṣasya parvataḥ vahnimān iti anumiteḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the perception that the fire in the great kitchen does not exist on the mountain contradicts the inference that the mountain has fire.

original: kuta ityarthaḥ samānaviṣayatvaṃ jñānasya bhramarūpajñānasya vā pramārūpajñānasya vā jñānāntarabādhakatve tantram/
analyzed: kutas iti arthaḥ samāna viṣaya tvam jñānasya bhrama rūpa jñānasya vā pramā rūpa jñānasya vā jñāna antara bādhaka tve tantram
translated: The meaning is why? The factor of having the same object is essential for the contradiction of knowledge, whether it is in the form of error or in the form of valid knowledge.

analyzed: ādye doṣam āha ghaṭavatī iti
translated: In the first case, he states the fault by saying that which contains a pot.

analyzed: antyaḥ āha parvata iti
translated: In the latter case, he says that which is on the mountain.🔽Or, is the factor of having the same object essential for the contradiction of such valid knowledge?

original: yadvā samānaviṣayakatvaṃ jñānasya kiṃ tādṛśapramābādhane tantram/🔽uta bhrāntibādhane/🔽ādya āha ghaṭavatīti//
analyzed: yat vā samāna viṣayaka tvam jñānasya kim tādṛśa pramā bādhane tantram  uta bhrānti bādhane  ādyaḥ āha ghaṭavatī iti
translated: Or, is it essential for the contradiction of error?🔽In the first case, he says that which contains a pot.

analyzed: antyaḥ āha parvata iti
translated: In the latter case, he says that which is on the mountain.

original: atyantāsadeva bhrāntāsadeva bhrāntāvaropyata iti siddhānte samānaviṣayaka tyābhāve 'pi maṇikṛnmate tadastītyāha
analyzed: atyanta asat eva bhrānta asat eva bhrāntā avaropyate iti siddhānte maṇikṛt mate tat asti iti āha
translated: In the Siddhānta (conclusion), it is established that what is absolutely non-existent is superimposed as the object of error, which is non-existent. Even in the absence of the same object, there is such in the opinion of the author of the Mīmāṃsā.

analyzed: rasti iti ḍaḥ śca iti arthaḥ yatvā
translated: The meaning is that it exists.
The Nyāyakośa, along with the Nyāyadarpaṇa, Third Section

original: deśāntare sanneva bhrāntiviṣaya iti tvanmate parvatetaravṛttivahnereva bhrāntirūpānumitau parvatavṛttivahnitvena bhānāt//
analyzed: deśa antare san eva bhrānti viṣayaḥ iti tvad mate parvata itara vṛtti vahneḥ eva bhrānti rūpa anumitau parvata vṛtti vahni tvena bhānāt
translated: In your view, what exists in another place is the object of error. Because in the inference in the form of error, only the fire occurring in the mountain is manifested as the fire occurring in the mountain.

analyzed: kim ca asti
translated: Moreover, if there is contradiction here, then there is also pervasion.

analyzed: bādhita sādhyake hetu vṛtteḥ eva vyabhicāra tvāt
translated: Because the occurrence of the reason in what is contradicted by the conclusion is itself pervasion.

analyzed: api ca yadi bādhāt eva mahānasīya vahneḥ asiddhiḥ
translated: Moreover, if the fire in the great forest is not established because of contradiction,

analyzed: tarhi bādhā anavatāra daśāyām sa sidhyet
translated: then it would be established in the stage when there is no occurrence of contradiction.

analyzed: deśa antare iti
translated: In another place.

analyzed: samāna prakāraka tva abhāvāt na tvad ukta pratyakṣasya bādhaka tā iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the perception stated by you is not contradictory because it does not have the same form.

original: kḷptavyabhicārarūpadoṣādeva mahānasīyavahnyasiddhyupapattau na tadarthaṃ bādhasya doṣatetyāha kiñceti//
analyzed: kḷpta vyabhicāra rūpa doṣāt eva mahānasīya vahni asiddhi upapattau na tad artham bādhasya doṣa tā iti āha kiñca iti
translated: He says Moreover etc. that the fire in the great forest is not established because of the fault in the form of pervasion that is established, and that contradiction is not a fault for that purpose.

analyzed: yadi anya niṣṭha liṅgasya sva samāna adhikaraṇa sādhya viṣaya anumiti janane iva anya niṣṭha sādhya gocara anumiti janane
translated: If the inferential cognition of the probandum pertaining to another is produced by the inferential mark belonging to another, just as the inferential cognition having the same substratum as the probandum is produced,🔽🔽

original: 'pi śaktimupetya bādharūpadoṣādeva tadabhāvaṃ manyase tadā doṣāntaraṃ cāha api ceti //
analyzed: api śaktim upetya bādha rūpa doṣāt eva tad abhāvam manyase tadā doṣa antaram ca āha api ca iti
translated: If, accepting the potency of the inferential mark belonging to another in producing an inference pertaining to the probandum belonging to another, just as in producing an inference having itself as the subject, you consider its absence to be due to the fault in the form of contradiction, then he states another fault with the words 'and moreover'.

analyzed: saḥ iti
translated: 'That' means

analyzed: mahānasīya vahniḥ
translated: the fire in the great forest.

analyzed: sāmagrī sadbhāvāt pratibandha abhāvāt
translated: Because of the presence of the assemblage and the absence of obstruction.

analyzed: anyathā parvatīya ca vahni siddhiḥ api na syāt
translated: Otherwise, the establishment of the fire in the mountain would also not be possible.

analyzed: sāmagryāḥ pratibandha abhāvasya ca ubhayatra tulya tvāt
translated: Because the assemblage and the absence of obstruction are equal in both cases.

original: tasmāttadaṃśe vyadhikaraṇadhūmādeḥ śaktireva neti bhinnaviṣayatvena prāguktapratyakṣānumityoḥ na bādhyabādhakābhāva ityeva yuktaḥ panthā iti
analyzed: tasmāt tad aṃśe vyadhikaraṇa dhūma ādeḥ śaktiḥ eva nā iti bhinna viṣaya tvena prāc ukta pratyakṣa anumityoḥ na bādhya bādhaka abhāvaḥ iti eva yuktaḥ panthāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the potency of smoke etc. belonging to a different subject is itself absent in that part. Thus, the previously stated perception and inference having different objects, the absence of the relation of the negator and the negated is the proper path.

analyzed: para abhimatam bādhasya asaṅkīrṇam udāharaṇa antaram api anūdya nirāha
translated: Having stated another example of contradiction not mixed with others accepted by others, he refutes it.🔽And here, the reading is 'asti' (is).🔽The reading is 'yatra' (where).🔽The reading is 'gre' (in the forest).🔽The reading is 'pratibandha' (obstruction).

analyzed: ca atra kagaṭarā stikagaṭarā iti adhikam kagaṭarā  pate i bāsya vya cāra saṃraḥ
translated: The reading is 'patet' (would fall).🔽The reading is 'vyakhyāta' (explained).🔽The reading is 'anu' (after).🔽The reading is 'mā' (not).🔽The reading is 'doṣa' (fault).

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The reading is 'vāda' (doctrine).

analyzed: etena iti nirastam iti anvayaḥ
translated: By this, it is to be connected with 'is refuted'.

analyzed: gandhaḥ sidhyet iti
translated: It is said that 'smell would be established'.

analyzed: liṅgam api sva samāna adhikaraṇa liṅgi viṣayaka jñāna janana svabhāvam ityādi prāgukta sāgryāḥ satvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The probans also has the nature of generating cognition that has the probandum as its substratum, etc., as stated earlier. This is the meaning.

original: nanu sāmagrīsatve 'pi vyabhicārarūpakḷptadoṣādeva tatra gandhāsiddhirityata āha gandheti//
analyzed: nanu sāmagrī satve pi vyabhicāra rūpa kḷpta doṣāt eva tatra gandha asiddhiḥ iti atas āha gandha iti
translated: Even when the assemblage exists, the non-establishment of smell there is only due to the recognized fault in the form of deviation. To this, it is said 'smell'.

analyzed: sādhya prāgabhāvavat gāmi tvam na vyabhicāraḥ
translated: The state of being confined to the prior absence of the probandum is not deviation.

analyzed: kim tu ukta rūpaḥ eva
translated: But it is of the nature stated.

analyzed: sa ca tatra na asti
translated: And that does not exist there.

analyzed: prāgabhāvena virodhāt
translated: Because of contradiction with prior absence.

analyzed: agre gandha anudaya āpātāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And because of the consequence of the non-appearance of smell later. This is the meaning.

original: kathaṃ tarhi tatra bādha ityata āha prāgabhāveti//
analyzed: katham tarhi tatra bādhaḥ iti atas āha prāgabhāva iti
translated: Then how is there contradiction there? To this, it is said 'prior absence'.

analyzed: sādhya saṃsarga abhāva pramāyāḥ eva
translated: Only of the valid cognition of the absence of the connection with the probandum.

analyzed: bādha śabda artha tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the meaning of the word 'contradiction'.

analyzed: asti iti iti
translated: It is said 'exists'.

original: iti iti ca doṣadvayasyetyanvayaḥ/🔽bādhitasādhyake hetuvṛttereva vyabhicārātvāt/
analyzed: iti iti ca doṣa dvayasya iti anvayaḥ  bādhita sādhyake hetu vṛtteḥ eva
translated: The word 'iti' is to be connected with the two faults.🔽Because the occurrence of the reason in what has a contradicted probandum is itself deviation.

analyzed: tathā samāna adhikaraṇa sādhya gocara pramā janana svabhāva tvāt ca
translated: And because of the nature of generating valid cognition that has the probandum as its substratum.

analyzed: bādhasya ca anavatārāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And because contradiction does not occur. This is the meaning.

analyzed: katham tarhi tatra gandha siddhi abhāvaḥ
translated: How then is there no establishment of smell there?

original: bādhasya ca tvayā tatra doṣatvānaṅgīkārāditi cet gandhaprāgabhāvavati gandhāpādakasāmagryā abhāvā
analyzed: bādhasya ca tvayā tatra doṣa tva anaṅgīkārāt iti ced gandha prāgabhāvavati gandha āpādaka sāmagryāḥ
translated: And because you do not accept obstruction as a fault there. If it is argued that it is because of the absence of the assemblage that produces smell in what has the prior absence of smell,

original: api padaṃ naka /ga /ṭa /rā / /apipadaṃ na ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /pi samā ṭha /ḍa / /ekaṃ iti padaṃ na ṭa /ṭha /
analyzed: api padam na kagaṭarā api padam na kagaṭarā pi samā ekam iti padam na
translated: the word api is not in K, G, T, or R. The word api is not in S, T, or D. Api is not in T or D. The word ekam is not in T or D.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

original: kiṃ ca prāgabhāvavati kāle gandhāpādanaṃ na tāva tsiṣādhayiṣāmātreṇa/🔽śabdasya tātparpāratantryavadanumānasya siṣādhayiṣāpāratantryābhāvāt//
analyzed: kim ca prāgabhāvavati kāle gandha āpādanam na tāvat tsiṣādhayiṣā mātreṇa  śabdasya tātpar pāratantrya vat anumānasya siṣādhayiṣā pāratantrya abhāvāt
translated: Moreover, the production of smell in time which has prior absence is not just by the mere desire to prove.🔽Because inference does not depend on the desire to prove, unlike word which depends on intention.

analyzed: na api gandha prāgabhāva avacchinna tvasya pakṣatā avacchedaka tva mātreṇa tad apādānam
translated: Nor is the production of that by the mere fact of the restriction of the subject by the property of having the prior absence of smell.

original: pakṣatāvacchedakasya hi yatra pṛthivītvaṃ tatra gandha iti daiśikavyāptibalena sādhyasya samānadeśatvākṣepa eva sāmarthyam/
analyzed: pakṣa tā avacchedakasya hi yatra pṛthivī tvam tatra gandhaḥ iti daiśika vyāpti balena sādhyasya samāna deśa tva ākṣepaḥ eva sāmarthyam
translated: For the restricting property has the capacity only to imply the presence of the probandum in the same place by the power of the pervasion which is in the form where there is earthness, there is smell.

analyzed: na tu sva samāna kālīna tva apekṣe pi
translated: But not even in relation to its own simultaneous time.

original: nāpi yadā pṛthivītvaṃ tadā gandha iti vyāptibalāttatāpādanam/
analyzed: nā api yadā pṛthivī tvam tadā gandhaḥ iti vyāpti balāt tad tā āpādanam
translated: Nor is it possible to infer that when there is earthness, there is smell, by the power of the pervasion.
Because even when earthness exists in the state of the prior absence and destruction of smell, there is no smell.

analyzed: nanu tathā api hetuḥ sva avacchinna deśa kālīna sādhyatā avaccheda svabhāvaḥ
translated: But even so, the reason has the nature of the invariable concomitance that is restricted to the place and time specified by itself.

original: na hi dhūmena vahniḥ sidhyannarvāgbhāge kāle ca sidhyati/
analyzed: na hi dhūmena vahniḥ sidhyan arvāgbhāge kāle ca sidhyati
translated: For when fire is inferred from smoke, it is not inferred to the west or at an earlier time.

original: deveti bhāvena kā tatra tava sāmagrī abhimatā/
analyzed: deva iti bhāvena kā tatra tava sāmagrī abhimatā
translated: What is your intended means of knowledge there, thinking that it is so?

analyzed: gandha prāgabhāva kāle pi gandha sādhana icchā mātram vā gandha prāgabhāvasya pakṣa tā avacchedaka mātram
translated: Is it merely the desire to establish smell even at the time of the prior absence of smell, or is the prior absence of smell merely the characteristic of the subject,

original: vā yadā pṛthivītvaṃ tadā gandha iti vyāptirvā svāvacchinnadeśakālīnasādhyabodhakasvabhāvo
analyzed: vā yadā pṛthivī tvam tadā gandhaḥ iti vyāptiḥ vā sva avacchinna deśa kālīna sādhya bodhaka svabhāvaḥ
translated: or is it the pervasion that when there is earthness, there is smell, or is it the nature of the invariable concomitance that is restricted to the place and time specified by itself,

original: vā yadā pṛthivītvaṃ tadā gandhaprāgabhāvakālīnagandhavāniti vyāptirvā /
analyzed: vā yadā pṛthivī tvam tadā gandha prāgabhāva kālīna gandhavān iti vyāptiḥ vā
translated: or is it the pervasion that when there is earthness, there is the possessor of smell at the time of the prior absence of smell?

analyzed: ādyam tāvat nirāha na tāvat ityādinā
translated: First of all, he refutes the first with Not only that... etc.

analyzed: vyāpti pakṣa dharma tā mātra pāratantryāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is dependent only on the pervasion and the property of being a subject.

analyzed: dvitīyam nirāha na api iti
translated: He refutes the second with Nor is it... etc.

analyzed: sva samāna deśa tva ākṣepaḥ eva iti
translated: The objection is only that it has the same place as itself.

original: sa tu prakṛte na bādhita iti bhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sa tu prakṛte na bādhitaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But that is not contradicted in the present case, this is the idea.

analyzed: tṛtīyam nirāha   na api yadā iti
translated: He refutes the third by saying Nor is it that which...

analyzed: caturtham āśaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He suspects the fourth by saying But is it not so...🔽Tathā ca is extra. K.G.T.R.🔽And at a later time K.G.T.R.🔽Nor is it is not there. T.Ṭ.Ḍ.

original: tathetyadhikam ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /kālāntare ca ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /nāpīti nāsti ṭa /ṭha /ḍa / 🔽patevāsyavyacāra /saṅkaraḥ
analyzed: tathā iti adhikam kagaṭarā kāla antare ca kagaṭarā na api iti na asti  patevāsya vyacāra saṅkaraḥ
translated: The confusion of the falling and the non-falling is a fallacy of inference.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: The statement of fallacies of inference is P.

original: tathā ca pṛthivītvamapi svāvacchinne gandhaprāgabhāvakāle gandhaṃ bodhayedeva/
analyzed: tathā ca pṛthivī tvam api sva avacchinne gandha prāgabhāva kāle gandham bodhayet eva
translated: And thus earthness would also make one understand smell at the time of the prior absence of smell restricted by itself.

analyzed: bādhāt tu na bodhayati iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it does not make one understand due to contradiction, it is not so.

original: yatra yadā yadavacchedena dhūmastatra tadā tadavacchedena vahniriti vyāptireva hi tatrāsti/
analyzed: yatra yadā yad avacchedena dhūmaḥ tatra tadā tad avacchedena vahniḥ iti vyāptiḥ eva hi tatra asti
translated: For there is indeed the pervasion that wherever there is smoke at a certain time restricted by a certain thing, there is fire at that time restricted by that same thing.

original: prakṛte tu yatra yadā yadavacchedena pṛthivītvaṃ tatra tadā tadavacchedena gandha iti vyāptirnāstītyuktam//
analyzed: prakṛte tu yatra yadā yad avacchedena pṛthivī tvam tatra tadā tad avacchedena gandhaḥ iti vyāptiḥ na asti iti uktam
translated: But in the present case, it has been said that there is no pervasion that wherever there is earthness at a certain time restricted by a certain thing, there is smell at that time restricted by that same thing.

analyzed: atha prāgabhāva avacchinna tvam na pakṣa viśeṣaṇam
translated: Now, if being restricted by the prior absence is not a qualification of the subject,

original: kiṃ tu ghaṭaḥ gandhapragabhāvakālīnagandhavāniti sādhyaviśeṣaṇamiti cenna/
analyzed: kim tu ghaṭaḥ gandha pragabhāva kālīna gandhavān iti sādhya viśeṣaṇam iti ced na
translated: but rather the probandum is qualified by the pot is endowed with smell at the time of the prior absence of smell, then it is not so.

analyzed: yadā pṛthivī tvam tadā
translated: When there is earthness,

analyzed: gandha prāgabhāva samāna kālīna gandhaḥ iti vyāpteḥ abhāvāt
translated: then there is the absence of the prior non-existence of smell at the same time as smell, because there is no pervasion.

original: etena dhūmānumāne daivānupanītakāñcanapayatvasya vahniviśeṣaṇatvena bhāne 'numiterapramātvā dapramātvasya ca doṣādhīnatvādanyasya ca doṣasyābhāvādbādha
analyzed: etena dhūma anumāne daiva anupanīta kāñcana paya tvasya vahni viśeṣaṇa tvena bhāne numiteḥ apramā tvāt apramā tvasya ca doṣa adhīna tvāt anyasya ca doṣasya abhāvāt bādha
translated: By this, in the inference of smoke, when the golden water brought by fate appears as a qualifier of fire, because the inference is not a valid cognition, and because the invalidity depends on a fault, and because there is no other fault, the contradiction

analyzed: eva
translated: is🔽stated.

analyzed: uktam iti gandha prāgabhāva dhvaṃsa daśāyām iti pūrva granthena iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is by the previous text in the state of the destruction of the prior non-existence of smell.

analyzed: pañcamam api nirasitum aśaṅkate atha iti
translated: In order to refute the fifth [objection], he raises the doubt with If it is argued.

analyzed: vyāpteḥ abhāvāt iti
translated: Because there is no pervasion

original: yadā pṛthivītvaṃ tadā ghaṭīyagandhaprāgabhāvasamānakālīno gandhaḥ ghaṭīya iti vyāpteḥ satve 'pi samānādhikaraṇatādṛśagandhena vyāpterabhimatatvāt/
analyzed: yadā pṛthivī tvam tadā ghaṭīya gandha prāgabhāva samāna kālīnaḥ gandhaḥ ghaṭīyaḥ iti vyāpteḥ satve pi samāna adhikaraṇa tādṛśa gandhena vyāptyāḥ abhimata tvāt
translated: means that even though there is the pervasion when there is earthness, then the smell at the same time as the prior non-existence of the smell in the pot is the smell in the pot, because what is intended is the pervasion by the smell of that kind which is co-extensive,

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca abhāvāt  anyathā chala vāda āpātāt iti bhāvaḥ anyat api
translated: and because that [pervasion] does not exist.

analyzed: para abhimata saṅkīrṇa udāharaṇam anūdya nirāha etena iti
translated: The meaning is that otherwise there would be the fault of quibbling. He mentions another example accepted by the opponent and refutes it with By this.

analyzed: doṣa adhīna tvāt iti
translated: Because it depends on a fault🔽means that the invalidity of the inference depends on a fault.

original: yatra iti na ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /tatra iti na ka /ga /ṭa /rā / /gandha ityadhikam ṭa / /tvāttadapra rā /
analyzed: yatra iti na kagaṭarā tatra iti na kagaṭarā gandhaḥ iti adhikam ṭa tvāt tad a pra
translated: Where there is no ka, ga, ṭa, or ra, there is no ka, ga, ṭa, or ra. The word gandha has an extra ṭa. Because of that, the ra is not.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

analyzed: doṣaḥ vaktavyaḥ iti nirastam
translated: That a fault should be stated is refuted.

analyzed: bodhaḥ sti ced vyabhicāraḥ pi asti ityādinā doṣa dvayasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because the two faults have been stated by If there is cognition, there is also contradiction, etc.

analyzed: kim ca vyāpti pakṣa dharma tā jñāna aviṣayasya api upanītasya anumitau bhāne yathārtha anumitiḥ
translated: Moreover, even if what is presented is not the object of the knowledge of the pervasion and the property of the subject, if it appears in the inference, it is a correct inference.

analyzed: jaya parājaya ādi vyavasthā
translated: There is a determination of victory, defeat, etc.

analyzed: anumitau vyāpti jñāna apekṣā ca ucchidyeta
translated: And the dependence of inference on the knowledge of pervasion would cease.

analyzed: na ca vahni upanaya artham eva vyāpti jñāna apekṣā  prāyika sahacāra darśana mātreṇa api upanaya siddheḥ
translated: And it is not that there is a dependence on the knowledge of pervasion just for the presentation of fire.🔽Because the presentation is established even by the mere observation of general concomitance.

original: nanvathāpi liṅgaparāmarśaniṣpattyanantaraṃ pratyakṣādibādhenānumiterapramātvaṃ dṛśyate/🔽tatra ca doṣāntarābhāvādbādha eva doṣa iti cenna/
analyzed: nanu atha api liṅga parāmarśa niṣpatti anantaram pratyakṣa ādi bādhena anumiteḥ apramā tvam dṛśyate  tatra ca doṣa antara abhāvāt bādhaḥ eva doṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: Even so, after the completion of the reflection on the reason, the non-authoritativeness of the inference is seen due to contradiction by perception, etc.🔽And there, because there is no other fault, contradiction itself is the fault. If this is said, it is not so.

analyzed: aprāmāṇyasya paratas tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that authoritativeness is extrinsic.

analyzed: anyasya vā abhāvāt iti asiddham iti bhāvena āha bādhaḥ sti ced iti
translated: The meaning is that it is not established because there is no other.

analyzed: bādhita sādhyake hetuḥ iti eva vyabhicāra tvāt ityādinā ukta tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is stated as a fallacy because it is a reason in which the conclusion is contradicted, as stated by the phrase because it is a fallacy, etc.

original: nanu satyapi tatra vyabhicāre tadapratisandhānadaśāyāṃ kāñcanamayo na bhavati vahniriti
analyzed: nanu sati api tatra vyabhicāre tad apratisandhāna daśāyām kāñcana mayaḥ na bhavati vahniḥ iti
translated: If it is argued that even though there is a fallacy there, in the state of non-recollection of that, the cognition it is not gold

analyzed: bādha pratisandhāne pi tādṛśa anumiteḥ apramā tva avagamāt saḥ u pi pṛthak doṣaḥ evā iti ced bhāsaka sāmagrī abhāvena
translated: and even in the recollection of the contradiction fire is not gold, the understanding of the non-validity of such an inference is because of the absence of the capacity to illuminate,

analyzed: tathā anumitiḥ etava ayuktā iti etat vipakṣe bādha mukhena āha kiñca iti
translated: that also is a separate fault. To this, the author replies by way of contradiction in the opposite case, saying Moreover, etc.

analyzed: jñāna viṣayasya api tādṛśa jñāna bala ālabhyasya api iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even though it is the object of knowledge, it is to be obtained by the power of such knowledge.

analyzed: yathārthā iti
translated: The meaning of true is

analyzed: sarvatra api anumitau yat kiñcid avidyamānasya sādhya viśeṣaṇasya bhāna saṃbhavāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the meaning is that in every case, because it is possible for something that does not exist in any inference to appear as a qualifier of the conclusion.

analyzed: jaya iti
translated: Victory means

analyzed: sarvatra anumitau ayāthārtha prāptau ayam anumāna prayoktā sat anumāna vādī iti jayī
translated: in every case, when there is attainment of the untrue in inference, this user of inference is one who speaks of valid inference.

analyzed: ayam ca asat anumāna prayoktṛ tvāt apajayī iti na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And this one would not be one who uses invalid inference, thus the meaning is that he would not be defeated.

original: ananyagatyā bādhasya doṣatvaṃ vācyamiti śaṅkate nanviti//
analyzed: ananyagatyā bādhasya doṣa tvam vācyam iti śaṅkate  nanu iti
translated: He raises the doubt that since there is no other way, the fault of contradiction must be stated.

analyzed: prāpaka gaṭa  pate ibāsya vyacāraḥ saṅkaraḥ
translated: The means of knowing.🔽The confusion of the consideration of what is to be refuted.

analyzed: anumā doṣa vādaḥ  niṣpanne api artha niścaye tad aprāmāṇya niścayena punar api artha niścaya vighaṭana vat niṣpanne
translated: The statement of the faults of inference.🔽Just as even when the ascertainment of the object is complete, the ascertainment of its invalidity again obstructs the ascertainment of the object,

original: 'pi parāmarśe bādhena punarapi parāmarśavighaṭanasyāvaśyakatvenāsiddhi vyabhicārayonanyatarasya satvāt //
analyzed: parāmarśe bādhena punar api parāmarśa vighaṭanasya āvaśyaka tvena asiddhi vyabhicārayoḥ anyatarasya satvāt
translated: so too, even when the reflection is complete, the obstruction by contradiction necessarily again obstructs the reflection, because either non-establishment or contradiction must be present.

analyzed: nanu tathā api vyabhicāra śarīra praviṣṭa sādhya abhāva niścayaḥ sva pramātva niścaya adhīnaḥ iti upajīvyaḥ
translated: Even so, the ascertainment of the absence of the probandum included in the body of contradiction is dependent on the ascertainment of its own validity, and is to be relied upon.

analyzed: bādhaḥ ced na
translated: The contradiction in the form of the ascertainment of validity is different, it is said. This is not so.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva rūpa artha sattva ghaṭita prāmāṇya niścayasya artha sattva
translated: The ascertainment of validity, which consists of the presence of the object in the form of the absence of the probandum, is dependent on the ascertainment of the presence of the object.

analyzed: doṣa antara asatva upapādanāya uktam parāmarśa niṣpatti anantaram iti
translated: In order to explain the absence of other faults, it is said after the completion of the reflection.

analyzed: tad aniṣpattau asiddhi ādiḥ eva doṣaḥ tatra bhaviṣyati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that if it is not complete, the fault of non-establishment etc. will be there.

original: doṣāntarasatvānna bādhasya ttara doṣatvaṃ kalpyamiti pariharati niṣpanne 'pīti//
analyzed: doṣa antara satvāt na bādhasya doṣa tvam kalpyam iti pariharati niṣpanne pi iti
translated: In order to avoid the necessity of assuming the defect of contradiction to be a defect only when the conclusion is established, he says: even when the conclusion is established, etc.

analyzed: bādhena sādhya abhāva pramā rūpa bādhena iti arthaḥ  parāmarśa iti
translated: The meaning is: by the contradiction in the form of the cognition of the absence of the probandum.🔽Pramāṇa means

analyzed: sādhya vyāpya hetumān ayam iti parāmarśa iti arthaḥ
translated: the ascertainment that this has the reason which is pervaded by the probandum.

analyzed: asiddhi vyabhicārayoḥ iti
translated: Asiddhi and vyabhicāra are

analyzed: vyāptasya pakṣa dharma tā pratītiḥ siddhiḥ
translated: the non-apprehension of the pervasion and the property of being the subject of the thesis.

analyzed: siddhiḥ iti ukteḥ  bādhita sādhyake tu avṛtti rūpa tva vdyabhicārasya iti bhāvaḥ
translated: When it is said that the absence of that is asiddhi,🔽the meaning is that in the case of the probandum being contradicted, there is vyabhicāra in the form of non-occurrence.

analyzed: para abhimatam prakāra antareṇa bādhasya doṣa tvam āśaṅkate nanu iti
translated: He raises the objection that contradiction is a defect in another way, saying: But is it not so, etc.

analyzed: tathā api iti
translated: Even so,

analyzed: doṣa antara sāṅkarye pi iti arthaḥ  pramātvā iti  sādhya abhāva jñānasya pramā tva niścaya rūpaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is: even when there is confusion with another defect.🔽The cognition of the probandum being absent is a pramāṇa,🔽the meaning is: in the form of the ascertainment that it is a pramāṇa.

analyzed: sādhya abhāva rūpa artha niścayam prati tad pramātva niścasya
translated: As for the ascertainment of the object in the form of the absence of the probandum, the ascertainment of its being a pramāṇa

analyzed: na upajīvya tā
translated: is not the basis.

analyzed: yena sādhya abhāva niścaya dvārā niścita sādhya abhāvavat vṛtti tva rūpa vyabhicāre api upajīvya tā syāt
translated: By which there would be the basis even in vyabhicāra in the form of having the property of occurring in what is ascertained to be the absence of the probandum through the ascertainment of the absence of the probandum.

original: kiṃ tu arthaniścayyaiva svapramātvaniścaye upajīvyateti vaiparītyameveti nirāha sādhyābhāveti//🔽arthaniścakatvasya pramātvaniśca
analyzed: kim tu artha niścayyā eva sva pramā tva niścaye upajīvya tā iti vaiparītyam eva iti nirāha sādhya abhāva iti  artha niścaka tvasya
translated: But the ascertainment of the object alone is relied upon in the ascertainment of one's own cognition as valid. Therefore, there is only the reverse. This is denied by saying in the absence of the probandum.🔽The ascertainment of being a valid cognition is dependent on the ascertainment of the object.

analyzed: bhāvena iti adhikam ṭa ṭha ḍaḥ idam pratīka grahaṇam na asti ṭa ṭha ḍa
translated: The word bhāvena (by the existence) is redundant. The phrase idamprati (this) is missing in some manuscripts.
The third chapter of the Nyāyadyuti-yuta-tarkatāṇḍava.

analyzed: ścaya adhīna tvena artha niścayasya eva upajīvya tvāt
translated: Because the ascertainment of the object is to be relied upon due to its dependence on the ascertainment of the object.

analyzed: tvad mate prāmāṇya śaṅkā rahita jñānasya eva artha niścayaka tvena apasiddhāntāt ca
translated: And because of the fallacy of the probandum not being established in your view, since a cognition devoid of doubt about validity is the ascertainer of the object.

analyzed: paratas pakṣe anavasthānāt caḥ
translated: And because of infinite regress in the case of the opponent.

analyzed: tasmāt para mate bādhasya vyabhicāra asaṅkare na yuktaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the opponent's view, the contradiction of the contradictory is not proper.

original: asmanmate tu bādhasya pratijñādoṣatvena vyabhicāra śaṅkaiva nāstīti prāgevoktam/
analyzed: asmad mate tu bādhasya pratijñā doṣa tvena vyabhicāra śaṅkā eva na asti iti prāk eva uktam
translated: But in our view, there is no doubt of contradiction due to the fallacy of the proposition being contradicted by the contradictory. This has been stated earlier.

analyzed: vyāpya tva asiddheḥ vyabhicāra asaṅkīrṇam udāharaṇam nīla dhūmāt iti ādikam iti tu īśvara vāde nirastam
translated: The example from blue smoke etc. is not mixed with the contradiction of the non-establishment of the pervaded. This has been refuted in the argument for the existence of God.

analyzed: āśraya asiddheḥ svarṇa maya udriḥ agnimān ityādikam udāharaṇam api āśraya asiddheḥ adoṣa tva prastāve nirastam
translated: The example the golden mountain possesses fire is also refuted in the context of showing that it is not a fallacy due to the subject being unestablished.
In the opponent's view, there is a mixture of contradiction with deviation.

analyzed: ya āyatta tve doṣa antaram āha tvad mate iti
translated: In the case of dependence, he states another fault, saying in your view.

original: arthaniścayasya prāmāṇyaniścayāyattatva ityatra doṣāntaramāha parata iti//
analyzed: artha niścayasya prāmāṇya niścaya āyatta tve iti atra doṣa antaram āha paratas iti
translated: In the case of the certainty of the object being dependent on the certainty of validity, he states another fault, saying from another.

original: sādhyābhāvarūpārthaniścayastatprāmāṇyaniścayādhīnaḥ prāmāṇyaniścayasya prāmāṇyagrāhakasya prāmāṇyaniścayādhīna ityevaṃ rūpeṇānavastheti bhāvaḥ//
analyzed: sādhya abhāva rūpa artha niścayaḥ tad prāmāṇya niścaya adhīnaḥ prāmāṇya niścayasya prāmāṇya grāhakasya prāmāṇya niścaya adhīnaḥ iti evam rūpeṇa anavasthā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The certainty of the object, which is in the form of the absence of the probandum, is dependent on the certainty of its validity. The certainty of validity, which is dependent on the certainty of the validity of the valid cognition that grasps validity, is in this form, it is an infinite regress. This is the idea.
In the opponent's view, there is a mixture of contradiction with deviation.

analyzed: saṅkara iti adhikam kagarā  una ukta hesā saṃraṅgaḥ  anumā doṣa vādaḥ
translated: Mixture is redundant. K. G. R. A.🔽The non-combination of the fallacies stated by Udayana.🔽The chapter on fallacies of inference.
The refutation of the non-combination of fallacious reasons stated by Udayana.

original: udayanena tu nibandhe savyabhicārasya koṭidvayopasthāpakatayā sādhyatadabhāvasaṃśayaḥ phalam /

analyzed: viruddhe sādhya abhāva asiddhiḥ

analyzed: bādhe tu pakṣa dharma hetau vyāpti bādhaḥ

analyzed: sat pratipakṣa tve kim atra tatvam iti jijñāsā

original: maṇyādyuktarītyā pañcānāṃ hetvābhāsānāmasāṅkaryaṃ netyupapādyodayanamate 'pyāpātatosāṅkaryapratītāvapi tadayuktamiti bhāvena taduktamanūdya
analyzed: maṇi ādi ukta rītyā pañcānām hetvābhāsānām asāṅkaryam na iti upapādya udayana mate tat ayuktam iti bhāvena tat uktam anūdya
